text: Half of this book is a new Discworld story involving Rincewnd and the characters of the Unseen University, including Hex, a computer involving insects ("anthill inside"). They're working to save Roundworld, which is our own earth. The problem is that Darwin has written a book called "The Theology of Species" rather than "The Origin of Species," thus erasing the remarkable advancements of the Victorian Era, which simply didn't happen when Roundworld went down the wrong leg of the Trousers of Time.If you don't know Discworld at all and found that explanation completely mystifying, you might want to begin with one or more of the Discworld novels.The other half of the book is a clear and sensible discussion of evolution and intelligent design. The two parts alternate, so that you get a dose of Discworld along with each dose of science.The whole book is beautifully written, thought-provoking, and informative. It's a pleasure to read, no matter how much you currently know about evolution, because it includes fascinating historical information that you may not have heard before, even it you're completely up on the science. If you're super well-informed about the history and philosophy of the science of evolution, you'll still enjoy it because of the Discworld story and the wit and insight with which the scientific sections have been written.The book is not kind to intelligent design theorists, but it is thorough in its discussion, and should be enjoyable even for those who become uncomfortable as they read it. Terry Pratchett fans should not miss this book even if they don't want to read the scientific bits -- you can easily skip them and just read the story. You could of course also skip the story by reading alternate chapters but just the science. This would be an error, though.You want to know what happens to Roundworld, don't you?

It's wonderful to see this classic knitting book back in print! The book consists of three sections.The third section has 17 patterns for beautiful sweaters, caps, and wraps. Like all Starmore designs, they're traditionally styled, beautifully designed, and meticulously written out.The second section has a compendium of traditional Aran designs, with interesting notes on construction and use that will inspire many knitters to create their own variations. All the stitches are charted out, which is good or bad depending how you feel about chartede stitch patterns.The first section is an odd introduction to the history of Aran knitting, from the viewpoint of the question, "Did Starmore succeed in proving that she was right in her theories about Aran knitting?" I think this question is probably of more interest to Starmore than to readers, and the whole section comes across as a bit bad-tempered and arrogant. Starmore believes that one star knitter came up with the entire Aran style, and it is hard not to conclude that she relates to this hypothetical knitter... perhaps enough to be swayed more by her image of herself than by historical evidence.That first section is still an interesting read, and if anyone deserves to be a bit arrogant about her knitting, it is Alice Starmore. The book belongs on every knitter's bookshelf.

Add instant Halloween decor with this sturdy (for lace) lace table runner. It's a fetching design on cobwebs and spiders, and will allow your tablecloth to show through, so use it over an ordinary white cloth for subtle Halloween flair, or layer it over orange or poison green for a complete lack of subtlety.This is the right length for a buffet table or a long dinner table, or let the ends hang down.It's easy care and easy to pack away with other Halloween decorations.

I recently lost my phone charging cable while traveling and had to buy a new one at a local shop. I can therefore make a direct comparison between this one and Brand X.The Belkin is longer than the Brand X -- four feet, which means I can talk while it charges without having to lean over. Sure, I could probably have fixed this problem in some other way, but Belkin fixed it for me with this perfect 4-foot length.The Belkin is also suppler than Brand X, which is determinedly set in kinks from the packaging. Belkin's cable is also flat rather than round, which may work better with your personal cable wrangling arrangements. It gives you that extra centimeter of space if you have to fit it into a tight space, which so often is true for cables. And I think it looks a little more refined.The Belkin is purple, which is much snazzier than the Brand X's plain black.Naturally, it charges the phone, and presumably other Apple devices, just as well as any other cable. So why not enjoy its special details?

Dan Shapiro has written a fun, practical book on being the CEO of a startup. It has five sections:* Founding* Funding* Leadership* Management* EndgameIn these sections, you'll find some interesting stories, instructions on how to create a Powerpoint that will make people want to give you money, and some clear distinctions between the startup and a profitable business. The section on running a business is very brief, and the best part is the age where you learn that "Real company cultures are made of four things: Polarizing decisions, Excesses, Quirks, and Dysfunctions."So this is not so much about how to be a CEO for a functioning company as it is about how to raise money and then sell your business. Nothing wrong with that, but you should know it going in. If that's your vision, this will be a useful book. If not, it'll still be a fun read.

I wouldn't drink this for the taste; there's a bit of a cough syrup edge, as with energy drinks in general. However, as the liquid in a smoothie, half a bottle of this will provide 6 grams of protein and an impressive range of vitamins and minerals, with less sugar than an equivalent measure of orange juice.Whirl it up with frozen fruit and maybe some yogurt, and it can make a good start to your day. It's the equivalent of adding a raw egg or some protein powder, without the unpleasant texture.It also compares well for nutritional value with other sports drinks. A full bottle gives 20% of most of the vitamins and minerals you need. There's no caffeine, no HFC, and of course no cholesterol, gluten or fat.

This is not really a shampoo, and it doesn't clean your dogs, but rather encases them in a sort of slippery coating. It's intended to be used along with "your usual cleaning products." We tried it right after washing our dog, and also between shampoos. The dog wasn't crazy about it, and we haven't noticed any significant deodorizing benefits. We also haven't noticed any change in our allergy symptoms.On the other hand, we don't have serious pet dander allergies. This might truly be a miracle product for someone who loves dogs but can't handle pet dander. For the rest of us, an ordinary dog shampoo that leaves the dog clean and fluffy might be a better choice.

Have you started to get ready the morning after a late night and faced bruise-like under-eye circles. In order to avoid scaring people, you reach for the concealer. But perhaps you used a liquid concealer and found that you had to build up layers, work around fine lines, and still go back with a swab to correct your work and try to get a convincingly refreshed look. Or you've gone with a powder and spent far too long dabbing away at the circles, stuck between dark shadows and a powdery look?This Concealer Kit has a thick, silky cream with natural-looking full coverage. Compared with liquids and powders, it provides better coverage with much less effort. It's light, though, so once you've made your corrections, you won't feel it.The special sponge applicator has a handle, so it's comfortable and gives greater precision. The sponge on the handle has a teardrop shape that allows accurate application in small spaces.Apply it in the morning and expect to touch it up for evening.

A minute of assembly, a moment to put the light in place, and you have an economical source of light for your pathway or garden.The light is bright enough to make a walkway safe for visitors. My husband leaves for work at 3:00 a.m., and the light is gone by the time he gets out there, but in the evening, the light is strong and steady, even after a rainy or cloudy day.This is perfect for spotlighting special features in your garden so you can enjoy them after dark, too

We've been using this light for weeks, through storms and cloudy weather,  and it does just what it should: provides hours of bright light every night from the solar power it soaks up during the day.We have a solar lantern on the patio, but it produces a sort of decorative glow. This lamp really puts out a useful amount of light.It's also definitely waterproof, and attractive as well.

These are predictably well-made, with a metal zipper, traditional jeans-style construction, and a fabric that is both soft and tough. The fabric has a good deal of stretch and a soft, almost brushed feel. It's lighter weight than denim, and the construction of these pants means that you can have blue jean comfort with a traditional trouser look -- in fact, you can probably get away with these in a "no jeans" office. They'll be great for travel, too, since you can climb and hike in them all day (or stay comfortable in them while you're stuck in a car all day if it's that kind of trip) and still go out to dinner in them.The "relaxed it" for me means that I should have ordered a smaller size, but I'm more apple than pear. Pear-shaped women will probably find these comfortable and flattering.

This is an excellent solar lamp for your garden, patio, or pathway.First things first: the instructions are hard to read and you should find the video in the reviews on the product page if you have any trouble figuring out how to turn it on.With that said, once you figure that out, you can just put this streamlined lamp outside and trust it to provide reliable light through rain, heat, fog, and storms. We've been using it for several weeks now, and it is still bright and strong every night, even after cloudy days.The lights are in an attractive grid pattern, and it flashes brightly when something moves within five feet of it. For us, that movement tends to be a bird or a branch, so I can't speak to the security aspect. For a welcoming light, it's perfect.

This set arrived just as I returned from a four-day business trip, giving me the chance to test them perfectly against my usual packing method. Sure enough, I was able to pack all the clothes, toiletries, chargers, and stuff in my travel bag into these cubes, fit them neatly back into my bag, and still have one third of the bag empty. So yes, it is certainly true that these cubes save space.Everyone I know tells me that they also keep clothes from getting wrinkled. They also will obviously make it easier to find things, and each one has its own little handle so you can grab just the right one and take it where you want it to go.Each one has its own mesh vented sections, too, so your toothbrush will air and so will your gym clothes if that's an issue. They're sturdy, zippered to open completely for efficient packing, and attractive in a unisex, minimalist way.I can tell that travel will be more civilized from now on.

This is a fascinating and thought-provoking book for people interested in technology, business, economics, and current events.The book starts with a discussion of four global forces that are leading to change -- and they might include some surprises for you. I wouldn't have guessed all of these:1. Global urbanization leads to a change in the economic center of the world.2. The pace of technological change is still accelerating.3. The global population is aging.4. Globalization is unstoppable.The second section of the book looks at ways that businesses must make "intuition resets" in terms of customers, resources, capital, workers, and competitors. This is followed by an intriguing chapter on policy issues, from income inequality to tech standards to the optimum size of government for the future.The last quarter of the book is notes and recommended resources.All through, the book is well-written, practical yet challenging, and business-minded. Graphics help make complex concepts clear, and there are plenty of real-world examples. A great choice for a workplace book club read.

This is a traditional English black tea in a traditional tea bag with a string. The flavor is rich and smooth, with no bitterness even if you make a really strong cup.From the scent when you open the box to the last sip in the cup, it's clear that Yorkshire tea relies on quality tea, with no dyes or flavorings. This is what tea is supposed to taste like.It's also good to know that the company is Rainforest Alliance certified and working with tea growers to develop and maintain ethical, sustainable trade relationships. They're working to reforest a rainforest area the size of Yorkshire. I figure that means we can drink this tea with confidence that we're not making a trade-off. It's exceptional tea and an ethical choice.

Microfiber cleaning cloths are terrific for dusting -- like dust magnets. They're also wonderfully absorbent for every kind of cleaning. These are in a very sensible size,and the quality is excellent. You'll find them soft and thick.These have two great advantages, in addition to the quality:1. There's a dozen in a package, so you can grab a clean one whenever you need it and still not run out during a cleaning spree.2. They're very cute, which adds to the sensual pleasure of cleaning and makes it more likely that you'll make it through your cleaning spree cheerfully.

Kristina Hancock's father is a mystery writer, so when her best friend Vicki and she go into business together, it seems natural to name the bookstore/ coffee shop they open "Death by Coffee."When one of their first patrons dies shortly after drinking a cup of Death by Coffee's special coffee, the name seems like a bad idea. Vicki and Krissy are both single girls, each living with a cat (I could have used less information about Krissy's cat's digestive system). It's a complete mystery what Vicky does with her free time, but Krissy throws herself into an investigation of her customer's death.In the course of her investigation -- which is largely a matter of asking complete strangers very private questions -- Krissy meets and becomes infatuated with a policeman. She also worries a lot about her business, which seems to be on the verge of failure after one week.There are quirky and likable characters in the book, but there's a real problem with plausibility. No convincing reason is ever offered for Krissy's incredible persistence in grilling perfect strangers about their sex lives when she should be at work.She's not convincing as a business owner, either. She and Vicky do a lot of fretting over their business, but no marketing, and they clean tables repeatedly while lamenting their lack of customers, instead of restocking or baking more cookies or working on social media.I like Vicky and Krissy and I'd like to know more about the interesting people in the town, but I couldn't get past the lack of realism.

When you use flour or cornstarch to bread fish, thicken a sauce, or prepare pudding, you're using an ingredient with little or no nutritional value. Use chia seeds instead, and you've got a nutritional powerhouse. Just an ounce gives you 11 grams of fiber, 4 grams of protein, and impressive amounts of vitamins, minerals, and other micronutrients.There's essentially no taste to chia seeds, so you can not only use them in situations where their similarity to less nutritious grains is a benefit, you can also add them to smoothies and casseroles and baked goods and vegetables as an attractive nutritional supplement.I like the fact that Viva Labs chia seeds are organic and fair trade. I can feel confident about buying them.

This is a wonderful book, filled with intriguing details about shirts. Did you know that shirts used to be underwear, and that in those days the Duke of Windsor wore a sort of all-in-one bodysuit under his evening suits? On a more practical note, you might want to know just where a ducal crest should be embroidered on a shirt, or just how to get the fit you like in a polar exploration jacket.The universe of shirts, as the author puts it, is divided in this book into five basic types, or blocks: dress, sport, knit, folk, and shirt-jacket. Each block has a chapter showing lots of example and details, and discussing how to change one detail for another. Better yet, you will find explanations of how to draft the collars, cuffs, pockets, and plackets that will make those differences, and access to online patterns you can print out for many.This means that you can, if you have a well-fiting shirt pattern for each of those blocks, make yourself a Cuban Guayabera or a camp shirt or a perfect vintage Turnbull & Asser shirt or a traditional peasant smock. It also means that you will know not only how to draft and use the pattern, but the very specific details of construction that will make your shirt authentic and super snazzy.This is first and foremost a design book, sharing the details of shirts from many times and places, for both men and women. You can enjoy this book for no other reason than, as the author says of one of the resources he recommends, "information and inspiration."You'll also learn enough about shirt construction to be a very good shirt shopper, a money-saving skill.For a home sewer, there is a lot to savor. This is not a book on how to make shirts; the author has already written that book and I plan to order it. This book is about fully understanding the details of a shirt. For many home sewers, that understanding will be enough to solve frustrations with collars or cuffs. It can also help with choosing the right patterns, or with using a collar from one pattern on another pattern.There are lots of additional resources listed, too, from books to blogs and notions to tutorials. What's more, you will get access with this book to online content -- enough that it's like getting a second book free.

This dog food contains high quality protein, botanical oils, onega-3 fatty acids, and glucosamine. Our 15 year old dog, given both his regular food and this one, chooses to eat this one.Has it made him smarter? Frankly, he wasn't very bright to begin with. However, he does seem to move more easily and spends less time grumbling. We're watching for the evidence of a brighter mind, but I'm glad to be giving him something that might help him feel more comfortable at his advanced age.

Goji berries,the fruit of a plant in the same family as tomatoes and potatoes, has lots of vitamin A and way more protein than your average fruit. An ounce gives you 3 grams of protein and a couple of grams of fiber plus antioxidants, iron, and vitamins. There are claims online that these little berries also help with weight loss, aging, and vision.As I was looking for recipes and ideas for using these pretty dried fruits, I saw people claiming that they were brittle and bitter. This is not the case with Viva Labs goji berries. They are about the texture of a raisin and sweet.A goji berry is not as sweet as a raisin, though, especially when cooked. In fact, they're traditionally used in soups. I tried a lot of different recipes, but for me the perfect use is in salads and vegetable dishes. Delicious! It adds just a bit of sweet-tart chewiness to veggies. I particularly like them with almonds in salads. Give them a try -- it's a great new flavor.

It's tuna, so we all know that it's good. And it's Bumblebee, which most of us know is a good brand. So I'm not really reviewing the fish so much as the packaging.Flexible pouches like these are much better environmentally than cans filled with liquid -- less fuel is required to make or to transport them. This pouch gives you just enough tuna for a sandwich or salad for one or two, and no liquid to drain.I work from home, but I think these would be just as handy if you sometimes eat in the office on a busy day. With a dozen of these pouches in the pantry, I am always prepared for a protein filled no-cook lunch. If you like to make tuna casserole for a crowd, just open a couple of pouches... it'll still be faster than opening a can.I also think the flavor is fresher than canned tuna, but it could just be the speed and convenience getting me to the table faster and in a better mood.

Whether you yearn for foreign travel and can't fit it in or you want to jazz up your American road trips, Abroad at Home will help you find the perfect place to visit for foreign flavor in American towns. This is a book from National Geographic, so of course it is filled with gorgeous photos and evocative descriptions of exciting destinations. Beyond that expected quality, I was also impressed by the way the book is organized.There are six chapters: five regions in the U.S. plus Canada. For each region, there is a nice mix of small towns with special features, like Sacred Harp singing in Henagar, Alabama, and "Around the World" adventures in larger cities like Chicago and San Francisco. Each chapter has a two-page photographic spread saying, "You could be in..." another country when you enjoy the scenery (urban or rural) of a particular location. There are also "Insights" on special topics such as cocktails or murals, spotlights on the best of class from pierogis to meditation centers, and lots of lists for folks who want to hit all the creameries or some other specialized passion.Each location has specific sections, for efficient info-gathering:* introduction* What to See with a list of cool stuff* Joining In for events* Essentials with addresses, web addresses, and phone numbersThere is an index by heritage for those who want to tour the country with a German or Chinese focus, and a good general index as well. You'll also find online references so you can dig deeper into the things that you find most fascinating.Read the book through -- you will learn things you didn't know before and enjoy it. Then you might want to just store it in your car or your travel bag. When you find with an hour to kill between meetings in St. Paul, you'll know that a trip to Frogtown is in order. This would also be a nice gift for friends who enjoy road trips.

This is the traditional "brown sauce" you know from Chinese restaurants: a bit sweet, a bit tangy, a bit spicy. Cut chicken or meat and vegetables and cook in a wok or skillet, add some of this sauce, and you have a nice stir-fry dish. Used in the recommended amount, 2 T per serving, the sauce is not cloying or too thick.This also makes a nice glaze for grilled meats. The product website recommends it for salad dressings and soups as well. It contains no fat, though it does have sugar, plus soy and wheat in small quantities. For me, having a jug of this sauce in the fridge means that I can make a tasty meal with lean meat and vegetables on a busy day instead of being rushed into carryout, so it definitely comes down on the healthy side.Personally, I add a little more chili pepper, but try it first. It contains ginger and garlic and a little hot pepper, so it might be spicy enough for you as-is.

I'm glad I got this book as an audiobook. If I had bought the physical book, I think I would have skimmed through it, thinking that I knew all the information already.Knowing what you should do doesn't make you do it.Listening to Hardy's enthusiastic delivery of common sense information on my way to and from business meetings where I could put the advice into action really made a difference. The central point of the book is that it isn't the bold goal setting or th occasional bold step that lead to success. It's the daily small changes and steps toward our goals that actually get us there And it's the daily bad decisions that move us further away from our goals.If you know that but you're not doing it, listening to this book might make the difference.

This is a book for beginners... but aren't we all beginners at something? For example, I have never used self-striping yarn and hadn't planned to, but now I see its charm.I wouldn't have thought of including self-striping yarn in a book on colorwork, but I am glad that this author did. She compares it with knitting stripes in what I would have thought of as the usual way, and uses this section of the book to bring the new knitter into the wonders of colorwork.. There are great stripey socks and a beret, but also a pair of gloves, which use the self-striping yarn to create a completely different effect, and a really interesting sweater with an unusual construction.The section on self-striping yarn is followed by knitting stripes, and this section includes both vertical and horizontal stripes, plus combinations of striping and texture.Next comes a section with slip stitch patterns. I absolutely agree with the author that this kind of knitting is not as well known as it should be. It's the easiest way to get complex color patterns into your knitting. While the author sticks with simple ones, once you've tried a couple of these patterns, you'll be ready for the most complex slip stitch patterns. I'm knitting the Boxy Socks from this section, and finding the pattern very clear and accurately written.Each chapter builds on the previous one, so we now come to stranded knitting, the point where I would have expected to start. The patterns here are unintimidating but still very snazzy: socks patterned with tiny hearts, a sweater with a yoke composed of gradually growing geometric patterns, a cowl with traditional folk knitting designs, and a bold pair of checkerboard mittens.Intarsia finishes up the techniques, and again the patterns are accessible and fun. A hat with a simple argyle-style pattern is now on my list to knit for my son, and there are also bright polka dot socks and a scarf with giant stars.Each section contains projects that build from small and easy accessories to a sweater. There are also plenty of technical tips and explanation, with large photos showing specific actions to take while knitting. Each section has a list of pros and cons for its particular technique, so that you could decide which technique to try first based on how you feel about weaving in ends or using charts.There are suggestions for ways to customize the designs, and friendly storytelling along the way. The patterns are generally given in traditional knitting but there are quick explanations when they're needed. There's also a thoroughly illustrated (with photos) technical section at the back  -- but it doesn't take up a third of the book, which can be frustrating for experienced knitters.There's also a handy grid showing all the projects at the back. There are 25 different projects and they're all bold, bright, and quirky. Most are in fairly large gauges, too.  If you glance at the pictures on the cover, you might feel that these patterns are all for teens, and this certainly would be a great choice if you're a young knitter or knitting for one. However, there's more to the designs than meets the eye.You'll find classic socks with several different heel options, and a useful page on getting the sizes right. There are sweaters in sizes from 32"  to 46", though not every sweater is given in every size, and they are interesting and unusual sweaters. There's a wide variety of scarves and handwear, plus hats in several different classic shapes. These are classic, flexible patterns with options. My Boxy Socks, in stockinette stitch with fine teal and gray wool,  are turning out subdued and elegant, and you can make up these patterns in your own way.The perfect way to use this book might be as a self-study course from start to finish, making every project from the bulky scarf to the vest with giant flower designs and ending up a confident colorwork knitter and ready to take on Fair Isle or argyle patterns. However, this is also a great choice for gift knitting and it probably has all the colorful sock, hat, and glove/mitt/mitten patterns you'll need.

This book has step by step instructions for make up and hairstyles from the '40s as well as for those who want to shop for vintage clothing or reproductions. If you want a '40s style for a play or a party or just for fun, this book will help you recreate the look. There are plenty of photos and I enjoyed seeing both the 1940s shots of the author's relatives and the retro style makeovers of modern women.But the part I enjoyed most was the history of wartime fashion. More than the fashions themselves, the books focuses on the lives of women in the U.S. and Europe, how they managed to dress stylishly in spite of the strictures on their shopping, and what their governments had to say about it. From the propaganda that tried to guide the clothing choices of women in Nazi Germany to the contrast between the rationing and austerity schemes in England and among the chic mademoiselles of Paris, there is just enough historical detail. You'll end up understanding how history influenced clothing design, without getting bogged down.Lingerie, swimsuits, hats, jewelry, and shoes are all included. There is a lengthy section at the back of the book with resources, including blogs.

Spray this on, go make your bed or relax for five minutes, and take a shower. Your legs will be smooth and soft.The depilatory chemical is recognizable by its smell, but bliss has done a good job of making it as quiet as possible, and there is a fresh scent over it. I felt some tingling, but no irritation. Also no dripping or smearing or cuts, and it's way faster than an Epilady..The package makes it clear that this not a substitute for your Brazilian wax, but for everyday smoothness, I'm completely convinced that this is the best option.

Google Analytics is the gold standard for web analytics, and arguably the best source of data on website performance.This book is not for people who are new to analytics, but it begins with an excellent discussion of how -- and why -- to start with business goals, build key performance indicators, and plan how to collect and analyze data, as well as some thoughts about testing and getting buy-in from others in your organization. This plan is much better than merely poking around in your analytics and responding to the up and down arrows.The first chapter has a number of other useful discussions on matters like tagging traffic, setting up your interface, and implementing tracking code. None of this is extensive, but it's enough for people who are fairly comfortable with Google Analytics and able to Google up the details.The main part of the book tells yo how to integrate Google Analytics code with other things. It takes you through the official integrations, including Adwords, AdSense, mobile apps, Webmaster Tools, and YouTube. While all this information is available online, there is a lot to be said for having step by step instructions right in front of you as you work. The instructions are thorough and written in a generally non-technical manner, though you do need to be familiar with cncepts like destination URLs, paid search, etc.Having covered the integrations which are available in Google Analytics, the book goes on to discuss how to do custom data integration. This section frequently refers readers to Google's own documentation, and you shouldn't expect to be able to follow the instructions if you don't know HTML. However, this is again more detailed and accessible than what you'll find in Google's instructions, which are directed to professional developers.This is entirely a how-to book, not a book to enjoy reading on your porch. If you've had some frustrations with GA integrations, or wished you could do them yourself but didn't want to take a chance, this is exactly the book you need.

Full disclosure: I have minimal cake decorating skills and had never used fondant before trying this brand. However, I can tell you that it is very easy to work with. It rolls out very smoothly and can be rolled very thin and I had no trouble with cracking, breaking, tearing, or uneven texture.This fondant is white, but you can color it by putting some in a plastic bag with food color and kneading it. I tried using fruit juice, too, but that was not successful.This fondant is also excellent for modeling: very malleable and it stays smooth without cracking. Check out Pinterest for lots of fun ideas.Fondant is mostly about looks, not taste, but this one tastes mild and sweet, with no chemical overtones.Can a rank beginner make a gorgeous wedding cake with this product at the first attempt? No. Get yourself an extra package to practice with. In fact, get a couple of extra packages, because it's a lot of fun to work with and you will want to try lots of different ideas.

AMAZON... I'm extremely disappointed that you would publish anything from a serial rapist and serial killer. I know the Son of Sam law both in Canada and the USA prohibits killers to profit from their crime if they write about it. This book is fiction and not about his crimes, but, from what I've read in the news, this book is packed with violence. Nevertheless, I for one will not be buying this book and will hit the media today. I ask that you remove this book.DONATE to Victims of Violent Crimes instead please.

I love this series and can't wait for the next book.  This story takes Reardon, Pax and company into Russian territory. Teamed up with the CIA and their new toys, they are contracted to rescue the daughter of a NATO General. Another shoot 'em up fast-paced story.

Not very often I re-read a book just after finishing it, but I did with this one. Fantastic suspense, loads of action and a few chuckles too. Jackie has three martial arts belts and there's several fight scenes that lures the reader in with excitement. Excellent story and characters. Would love to see a second book :)

I loved this book. It has all the ingredients for an enjoyable cozy read - likeable Characters, good plot, murder and mystery, and humor.  The book description explains the story so I won't re-write the synopsis.  I'm hooked tho and can't wait for the next book in this series.

Andrew Peterson delivers another winner with Contract to Kill.  It begins with a prologue in which the antagonist, Tanner Mason - a private military contractor, is conducting a raid against a Taliban insurgent who’s responsible for countless IED and RPG attacks against coalition forces. Even though the scene was masterfully written, I was a little worried the entire book was going to have a military theme.It didn’t.It immediately switches to modern day and Peterson keeps his foot on the gas pedal, and never lets up. Some familiar characters from First to Kill make appearances and I like they way he’s incorporated them into the story. Nothing is forced.Nathan McBride answers the call to help a friend and from there on, it’s a non stop thrill ride from scene to scene. I loved how the tension built as Nathan and Tanner Mason, both capable and tough, find themselves on a collision course. Coupled with twists and turns, the plot is loaded with high quality action. Again, nothing is forced. It just flows! It’s the exact kind of book I love to read. Honestly, it was hard to put this book and down and get some sleep.My hat’s off to Andrew Peterson, Contract to Kill is his best book yet. Well done!!-- RJ Parker, True Crime Author

Wtf happened to Reacher in this novel? It's not the same character we all came to love and enjoy reading about.  We have to wait a year to read another installment and this was plain disappointing.Reacher doesn't hitchhike, or hook up with a woman, or test his skills, or do anything we are use to reading. That's for damn sure. It's based in Paris and London and boring as hell. Then it ends abruptly.  Very disappointed Mr. Child. Stick with Jack on home soil please.

I've bought several of these units to gift out to my reading fans. I gave three in my household and my daughter's and I love them. They're slim, light and powerful. Easy to carry and they charge our phones fairly quick. Highly recommended for the quality and price.

With 3 iPones and 2 iPads in our home, we use to run through a lot of charge cables that were basically cheap quality. I only used the Baxia cable one week when I ordered more. Very sturdy, durable and RAPID charge. Best cables by far.

Congratulations AL on your 25th book in this wonderful series. I have enjoyed each and every one. It seems like I know the characters and can't wait for the next installment to see what's happening in their lives. There's been many changes since Clearwater Journals.  You have to write faster Bubba.  I just finished this one and I need more Joe and cast, eh.If I had the time, I'd write a poem about the series and characters.  If anyone would like to try writing one, I'd love to read them. I'd even gift some prizes. So there's a challenge. ... and Bob's your uncle :)-- RJ Parker, author of 18 true crime books and publisher of RJ Parker Publishing, Inc

“A compelling depiction of a murdered young girl, but no body, a perp who won’t talk, and an overzealous CSI commander. A memorable true story.”– RJ Parker, bestselling true crime author and publisher at RJ Parker Publishing Inc.
A riveting depiction of a murderous woman and a not so innocent daughter. A long but very detailed book by Olsen. A must read for true crime enthusiasts.

A well-written,  well-researched account of a young woman who was brutally violated and that was before she was mutilated and murdered.  Carolina and Diana writes this true story with compassion and dedication to Debbie. If you enjoy a true tale without the gore and grime, you'll like this book. It's a sad book so keep the tissues handy.-- RJ Parker is the author of 18 true crime books including bestsellers,  Parents Who Killed Their Children : Filicide and Serial Killers Encyclopedia

I really enjoy the characters of Jack and Replacement and look forward to each book. The author doesn't disappoint in DATA JACK either. A well-written,  captivating plot with lots of suspense. The action comes more toward the end but it's riveting.  Really looking forward to the next book. Thanks for another fine read.

One of the best true crime writers in the business tells the stories of three cases, a company called Necrosearch who using Forensic Science literally leaves 'No Stone Unturned' to solve cases. If you enjoy CSI, and remember the old TV show Quincy,  you'll love this book. A good history lesson of Forensic Science as well.-- RJ Parker,  True Crime Author and Publisher

The identity of a woman buried for over 25 years was presumed by some family members to be that of Leoma Patterson, but other people weren't convinced.  It took acclaimed Forensic anthropologist Bill Bass a great deal of time, multiple DNA testing, and a strand of hair in an old file to determine who this woman really was. A short but well-written documentation of another Bass scientific mystery.-- RJ Parker,  True Crime Author of 18 books

No wonder VENGEANCE IS MINE won the 2014 GOLD Readers' Favorite for Mystery/Murder. This book is packed with intricate detail and overflows with action, suspense and humor. The author created great characters and a horrific serial killer. There were times I was holding my breath and other times I had to pause reading as I was laughing so much. Ben is quite the character.A wonderful, captivating storyline, and well-written. I look forward to reading more books in the Ben Tucker series.RJ Parker - bestselling true crime author
I've been reading this series from day one. Bubba, you have to write faster. Love these books. This is my all-time favorite series.
This is the first book I've read by this author and glad I did. From start to finish it was most captivating.  Fantastic action scenes. I really look forward to another book with Levon Cade.

Well told criminal cases. The producer, Mr. Pierce is one of the best in the business.  Two hours of listening enjoyment for the price of a coffee. Highly recommended.RJ Parker,  True Crime Author and Publisher

This is a fantastic and captivating book. I lost two nights sleep as I couldn't put it down. From the first page to the last, it's one well-crafted story with a great plot. Loads of action and of course I enjoy the banter and added humor. Well done Sir.
Very durable, easy to adjust and perfect for my Beretta Storm. Love it.

Almost 500 pages for $5.99. I've read every book in this series so far and have enjoyed the endless action scenes and added humor. Troy and Amber are two of my favorite fictional characters. They are like action heroes; black belts, quick draws and deadly.This is a well-written and researched book. Adams is one of the best storytellers in the business. 5 stars. A+

I stumbled across this book and gave it a read. I was captivated from the first page.  The author is a good storyteller, and the plot/characters were great. The only thing wrong was from time to time he'd write in first person. But it's still a very good book and I just downloaded book 2.

A must have for any true crime book collector... 18 cases of Cold Blooded Killers written by one of the most well-known and respected authors in the genre. Gripping and captivating.  I certainly recommend this book.RJ Parker,  True Crime Author

"Dixie's Last Stand" is a well-written, and gripping depiction of 'battered wife syndrome'. Scott Shanahan was a vile man that no one liked. He abused his wife Dixie for 19 years (many women will stay and sustain the beatings, and there's many reasons for that, some of which are included in this book). Dixie was dragged by her hair; had guns pointed at her in rage, beaten black and blue, tied up and left for days in the basement, and basically lived a life of hell....until one day she killed her tormentor, batterer, her husband.This fascinating story will leave you asking yourself one question, was the punishment that Dixie received in her case justified?  Highly recommended for all true crime readers.-- RJ Parker,  Bestselling True Crime Author of 16 books

Female Serial Killers is a very detail oriented account of some of several women throughout history dubbed as "serial killers." Vronsky takes an interesting in depth perspective into the case files of what makes women commit these hedious crimes, and why people like Karla Homolka would submit to aiding her husband in rape and murder. Notoriously, Serial Homicide has been attributed to men, but in fact,  1 in 6 SK's is female.As I read through the pages, I was happily met with intelligence, sound facts, and a contemporary stylish prose to pull it all together. This is a fascinating detailed book on female serial killers who have plagued society. Highly recommended.-- RJ Parker,  author of 16 true crime books including Women Who Kill

I've read all 22 books in this series and patiently wait for the next installment.  Love the characters.I missed seeing Max and Jimmy et al in this book. Geez Bubba,  Doc is richer than God... he needs to hire more help especially for Mrs. F. A couple good action scenes and Joe is back to offing the bad guys which was nice to see again.Great job as always AL.  ... RJ

I've been reading the Troy and Amber ATF series "Down" for the past few years and always look forward to the next installment.  The author don't disappoint in this book either.  You've read the book description so there's no need for me to re-write the synopsis, only to say, this book is well-written and loaded with action. I lost an entire night sleep as I couldn't put it down.  Grab a copy, you won't regret it.--- RJ Parker,  true crime author

Congratulations Ms. Perrini on another fascinating book on the topic of familial homicide and the causes of breakdown within the homes. As a true crime reader, I thoroughly enjoyed this book, yet the subject is hard to digest. I highly recommend this book to any true crime enthusiasts.-- RJ Parker,  True crime author of Parents Who Killed Their Children : Filicide

"The Richard Chase Murders by veteran true crime writer and historian Kevin Sullivan is fraught with emotion and detail. I always admire an author who dedicates their project to the victims, and tells about who they were and not just the crime against them. This is a well-written book that was researched in person and facts gleaned from key players during and after the Chase murders. A must have book for all true crime enthusiasts or collectors."-- RJ Parker, award-winning true crime author and publisher
The author created two horrific serial killer characters. The action and suspense was none stop. Really enjoyed this book and will continue reading the serious.RJ Parker

I really enjoyed this book. It has all the ingredients of a good suspense, mystery story, and it's well written. The character of Red I liked and would like to see him in future books. Highly recommended.
A fun collection of short stories which are about 40 pages each. Sam is a retired NYPD detective now small town southern police chief. Lots of humour and always "who-done-it" suspense
Fascinating read from start to finish. I enjoyed the storyline as well as the writer's style. I'm glad someone recommended this book to me
Love the writing style of Ms. Perrini and her indept knowledge on female serial killers. To me she's the queen of this genre.

I do not like this author. He caused me to miss an entire night sleep. This story will grab you by the throat and pull you in to the tension-packed action and remarkable characters. Well-written and great plot. I highly recommend it. The horrible shortcoming of this book is that it ends.- RJ Parker
Another great book Al. A bit different with Fred retired and the ending.... Didn't see that coming. Look forward to the next Doc and Mia book

I've read every book so far and got one more to read. Al Rennie is one of the funniest guys I have never met. We are both Canadian authors but his igloo is way across town from mine. Love this series. Geez what's going to happen with Coop leaving? Will Max finally star in Hockey Night in Canada? So many unanswered questions.Great job Al. Thanks again for another exciting adventure in Joe's world. Catch ya on Facebook. RJ

I have all the Reacher books which I have read many times. I usually have fun tallying up the body count. In this book, two small fights and zero bodies. The worse book I've read thus far by this author. Very disappointed.

LAWLESS is the second book in the Aspen Series. I haven't read the first yet and don't know if I will.First of all, I'm not going to re-write the synopsis as a lot of reviewers do...it's all in the book description which is very enticing. I always enjoy a book with a Witsec character and a Deputy or Marshall having to keep the witness protected. I was at 83% finished and still waiting for something to happen besides flirting. The characters are great and likeable. The story line itself is very good but it just lacked suspense, mystery and action. Oh there is action toward the end but that's all.It's a good story and had a lot of potential but the author missed the mark by not adding any meat to the story.Of course, this is just my opinion which is what a review is. Others may love it.Bestselling and award-winning author,RJ Parker

I purchased two of these for my daughters for Christmas. They use them every day and really love them. This is a fine product that is durable, sold, excellent sound system, charges while playing music and it has a built in lithium battery for internal charge. Once the docking station is charged, simply take it outside or anywhere and play your music. I can see this being a good feature in the summer time out in the garden or tanning. My kids love it so much that they recommended it to a couple of their friends who also bought the exact same system.Highly recommended.

THE M5 MAGNUM 5 BLADE RAZOR WITH TRIMMER is by far the best razor I've come across. I am over 50 and have been shaving my head bald every day for the past 8 years. I've used so many different razors, including electric razors (which I haven't come close to one yet that gives a closer shave than the M5) until I discovered this razor about a year ago. Countless times I've nicked myself and I'm happy to say that using this razor, I've nicked myself only twice. Both times were my own fault as I should have replaced the blade.That's the other thing, I can get two weeks, head and face shaving out of one razor blade. It's really remarkable especially for the price. I highly recommend it to those who shave their heads.This however is my only my opinion. Our skin is all different but for me, I finally found the product that works.

UNSINKABLE: A MEMOIR is a well-written biography by American icon, Debbie Reynolds. It is an entertaining book of stories about many of her trials and tribulations,ups and downs, friends in the business like Elizabeth Taylor, Frank Sinatra Gene Kelley and of course her famous children, Todd and Carrie Fisher.What I like also is she tells many of these tales in a humorous way so it's hard difficult to read and not have a smile or your face. Lots of photos included in this book as well. Spanning over 60 years of memoirs, I highly recommend this book to those who enjoy reading about famous actors and actresses and especially someone as well known as Debbie Reynolds.I hope you enjoy this as much as I did.RJ Parker

EMILY'S TRIAL is the second book in the "Akasha Chronicles" after Emily's House (The Akasha Chronicles)Another great read in the growing series by Natalie. Well written with lots of suspense that kept me on the edge. The characters are becoming so real with wonderful descriptive action. Can't wait until the next in the series.This is another gripping fantasy adventure with Emily and her 2 friends, Fanny and Jake, away in Netherworld. The journey begins with a high school prank and ends with the death of a new friend. Emily must make some hard choices in order to stop the Apocalypse she started, while the Goddess Brighid is imprisoned and helpless.A well-written and captivating story. Highly recommended.Bestselling author and Top Reviewer,RJ Parker

THREE TIMES A LADY is the third book in the Dana Whitestone series after Kill Me Once and A Game of Chance. A suggestion to the author - insert a sub-title for each book so that readers know this is a series, for example, Three Times a Lady (Book 3 - A Dana Whitestone Novel).This is a well-written, suspense thriller that hooked me from the first page. It's gripping til the end. The synopsis is also written well so there's no need for me to re-word it. If you enjoy an on-the-edge-of-your-seat mystery, I think you'll enjoy this one.Bestselling and award-winning author,RJ Parker

READY TO DIE is the 5th book in the 'To Die' series with the main characters, Regan Pescoli and Selena Alvarez. If you want to follow this series, these are the books in order:1. Left To Die2. Chosen to Die3. Born to Die4. Afraid To Die (Selena Alvarez/Regan Pescoli)5. Ready to DieI started this series in 2008 with Left To Die and was hooked straight away as I'm sure many fans of Lisa Jackson were. This is another well-written story with lots of suspense, mystery, romance and murder.A killer has targeted six people that he plans to kill, one by one. As prominent members of Grizzly Falls are being bumped off Pescoli and Alvarez turn the tables on the killer. In a surprising twist, Pescoli's search for the killer leads her to someone she knows.This is a roller-coaster of a story and had me on pins and needles more than once. In my opinion, as what a review is, it's a very good book. I hope you enjoy it as much as I did reading the advance reading copy. Thanks for taking the time to read my review.Bestselling and award-winning author,RJ Parker

SOMETHING WICKED by Lisa Jackson and Nancy Bush is a well-written and most captivating story. Both authors have millions of fans, and some will be happy with this book and others disappointed. It's all in your own opinion and taste. I hope you enjoy it as much as I did reading the ARC copy.In a nutshell, a killer is at work in Deception Bay, Oregon. There's also a cult with dark hidden secrets. Are the two connected? Detective Savannah Dunbar is 8 months pregnant, a surrogate, carrying her sister Kristina's baby when all hell breaks lose and people are being murdered. Savannah was just about to start maternity leave, but this killer has other plans.A fast-paced, action, mystery/suspense, this story kept me on the edge of my seat.

PATALOSH: THE TIME TRAVELERS by Z Altug and Tracy Gensler is a most interesting read. I really liked this book as it had a captivating story line that kept my attention. I just didn't want to put it down so I finished it in two sittings. The author created very likeable characters, and a fast-paced adventure. Well-written with descriptions that made it easy to visualize.In a nutshell, this book is a story about the fantasy world of Patalosh; a young hero named Orion, and his time travels through the universe. His quest takes place on a magical ship called Exploricus and he must solve 7 riddles to save his parents from the bad Emperor, Daaggerd. Along the way he gathers friends who have strange abilities who help him in his travels. The end of the journey opens up a whole new adventure and leaves the reader anticipating the next book in the series.Highly recommended and looking forward to future books by these two authors.Bestselling and award-winning author,RJ ParkerTop 500 Amazon Reviewer

LET THE DEAD SLEEP by Heather Graham is another well-written, captivating story with some likeable and not so likeable characters. The suspense and plot was well crafted. I don't write long winded reviews because mainly I don't like reading them.In a nutshell, Danni, who owns an antique store, is about to purchase a rare statue that is plagued with evil and death. But before she can buy it, the owner is murdered and the statue is gone missing. Enter Michael Quinn, and private investigator who with Danni, is on a search and destroy mission: to find and once and for all, destroy this evil statue.This is fast-paced with lots of suspense and mystery. In my opinion it was a very good book but others may not like the paranormal angle. But, we all have our own opinions. I hope you enjoy it as much as I did.

WOMEN SERIAL KILLERS OF THE 20TH CENTURY by Sylvia Perrini is another in her collection of Women Serial Killers. This is a well-written, captivating book comprised of about thirty short story criminal cases on female serial killers.UK author Perrini provides a good overview of their backgrounds, crimes and punishment. If you're a true grue collector, this is a must have book. Check out her complete selection including WOMEN SERIAL KILLERS OF THE19th CENTURY: THE GOLDEN AGE OF POISONS (WOMEN WHO KILL) WOMEN MURDERERS OF THE 18th CENTURY (WOMEN WHO KILL) and WOMEN SERIAL KILLERS OF THE 17th CENTURY (WOMEN WHO KILL) just to name a few.Bestselling true crime author,RJ Parker

A TOUCH OF MALICE is the 4th book in the Nick Bracco Thriller Series and the first book I read in this series. I wasn't aware at the time when I bought it that it was number 4, so now I've gone back and downloaded the first book A Touch of Deceit (Nick Bracco Series #1)What a fascinating story that is well-written, fast paced and intense action. I found myself holding my breath a few times. Love the characters of Trent, Nick, Matt and Tommy. A brilliant, gripping read. Highly recommended.

MOBSTERS - THREE VOLUME SET is a well-written collection of NYC mobsters, gangs and crooks which reads like a history book. Fascinating stories about some of the notorious criminals and less known wannabes. I've been following Joe Bruno's writing for a few years and he never disappoints. Highly recommended.

COLD NORTH KILLERS: CANADIAN SERIAL MURDER by fellow Canadian author Lee Mellor is a well-written compendium of serial killers and unsolved serial killings in Canada.Mr. Mellor's knowledge of this subject is evident in this informative collection. Each case file is presented with factual details of the crimes and criminals without wading through pages of incremental boring details.Highly recommended for avid true crime readers.Bestselling and award-winning true crime author,RJ Parker

WOMEN SERIAL KILLERS OF THE 19TH CENTURY was indeed the golden age of poisons. I find it hard to wrap my head around the fact that there were so many Women Serial Killers in the 1800's. It was almost like an epidemic of female poisoners. Today, a female serial killer is rarely heard of.The author obviously invested a great deal of time researching this information and it reads like a history book....it is a history book, and a must have for the real true crime book collector.

LYKAIA (THE SOPHIA KATSAROS SERIES) is Sharon Van Orman's debut book in what is going to be a great series. I understand from her website that the second book, ERATO, will be launched either this month or April.This is a well-written story that is intriguing and hooks the reader from the start.Sophie, a Medical Examiner, travels to Greece as both her brothers have gone missing there. Her nor her mom haven't heard from the boys in several weeks. Upon arriving in Greece, she discovers that her brothers had become fascinated with unravelling their roots and during this time, they learned tales of Kings, Priests and Werewolves. After searching their apartment and discovering their obsession with folklore, she now believes it's possible that her brothers have been transformed into wolves during a ritualistic ceremony that takes place every nine years.Get ready for a mystical ride of suspense, mystery, fantasy, mythology, horror and magic. I look forward to reading more from this author who by the way has a very creative mind, as it shows in her characters and plot.#1 Bestselling Author & Top Amazon & Goodreads ReviewerRJ Parker

A well-written suspense book with more twists and turns than I've ever read in another book before. Two guys have planned to rob this bank for almost a year. Everything is going according to plan until they realize there is someone else in the bank, and in particular, in the ceiling fixing the AC. This book also has some humor in it. One minute the robbers are robbers, next minute they are hostages. This 'taking over' happens a couple of times. The ending was a huge surprise, I never saw that coming. All in all, a good read. I found that when the author was going back to where the robbers met, it was kinda boring and I flipped a few pages. Good read, captivating and enjoyable.

LEFT FOR DEAD is a well-written true story of a young woman who was abused. Not only abused, which unfortunately is common today, but beaten beyond recognition and stuffed inside a garbage can to die. I found myself getting angry at her ex-husband and would love to have a few minutes alone with him. But life in prison for him I'm sure won't be pleasant.After three years of marriage and two daughters, this brave woman had enough of the abuse and got out. She started to get her life back together and had recently re-married. She went to pick up her daughters at her ex-husbands place and he said the daughters were hiding so to come in a find them. After entering, he beat her numerous times over the head with a baseball bat. Taped her up, gagged her, and put her in a garbage bin in the back of his pickup and brought her to a storage unit. There he placed many boxes on top of the garbage bin, sealed the door and left.Without given the story away, when Jendusa was found, she was unrecognizable, lost all her toes due to frost bite, underwent surgeries, five weeks in hospital and miscarried. She had only found out the day before that she was pregnant.It's a sad gripping story but with a happy ending.Bestselling true crime author, RJ Parker

I read the first two books and gave them each 5 stars. I love the characters and these are easy reads with lots of laughs. I personally didn't enjoy this one as much. I thought it was a bit silly really... a cuddle club? But hey, that's just my opinion. Others will love it. I do love this series though and I will be reading more books by this author.

APPOINTMENT TO DIE I have a few things to say about. The story, as in the plot, is fantastic. Jake is in prison on death row and scheduled for lethal injection in the coming weeks. His brother Pete devises a plan to hold a classroom of 7 year old children hostage, along with their young teacher Alison. He's rigged with explosives and threatens to start killing the kids one at a time unless the Governor of Texas pardons his brother Jake and flies him to the school in a helicopter.A task force is brought in: negotiator, FBI agents, SWAT and the National Guard. There are some real tense moments that were gripping. The story moves along quite well and I was impressed. I liked it a lot. However, the book is also packed with typos. It was distracting at times as I had to re-read paragraphs and sentences over several times. I wasn't happy with the ending at all and I don't know what happened with the writing, but the last 10 pages are messed up. Paragraphs duplicated and several words typed twice together...several times. The typos I really don't have a big problem with, but the author needs to fix the last 10 pages.I have never given below a 4 star review and I won't this time either. This can be a 5 star book it really is that good. Fix the typos and it will be. As for the story, it was well thought out and captivating.

BLUEBLOOD is the second book in the Marty Singer series. I thoroughly enjoyed this story. I found it to be captivating and gripping right to the surprise ending. The book is well-written with likeable characters. I kind of compare Marty to Harry Boosh. He's a fun character. Add that to a who-dun-it mystery/suspense and it makes for a good read. I highly recommend it.

PLAY HIM AGAIN (A MATT HUDSON ROARING TWENTIES MYSTERY) is a blast from the past and is a well-written and captivating book. I'm not re-writing the synopsis and there's already a couple of lengthy reviews. The book takes place in the 20's, a time of mobsters, rum-runners and the birth of the film industry. I thoroughly enjoyed it and highly recommend if you like books set back in time. Brilliant story.

FAMILY JEWELS is the second book in the Dix Dodd Mysteries Series after The Case of the Flashing Fashion Queen: A Dix Dodd Mystery (Dix Dodd Mysteries) by fellow Canadian author Norah Wilson.Dix and her assistant Dylan, along with Mrs. P is off to Florida as Dix's mother has been charged with theft. It's another fun, relaxing and hilarious read. I simply love the character of Dix. She's just too funny. I'm looking forward to reading the third in this series Death by Cuddle Club: A Dix Dodd Mystery

I was searching for a light read with humour. Live has been stressful for me lately as the past two months one of my twin sons is on life support. I needed a distraction for nighttime reading and boy did I find a wonderful funny character in Dix Dodd. I just downloaded the second book now to start.Thank you to the authors for writing a fun story and putting a little joy and laughter back in my life. RJ

This is a short book of about 35 pages which includes 11 humorous stories. I liked some better than others but overall I enjoyed it. I have to say the author has a twisted and creative sense of humor.

DEMON INC by Bernard Lee DeLeo is the second book in the 'Demon' series after DEMON. A fantastic YA/Paranormal series with a well-rounded group of young likable characters, and of course, Demon the dog. After receiving notoriety of being successful ghost hunters, the team is in much demand. So much that they open up a business.This is well-written, past-paced and an exciting/fun read. I love the characters and look forward to the next in this series.

DEMON is the first book in DeLeo's 'Demon' series. This is a fun, well-written YA/Paranormal story of a group of kids who came across a lovable dog who hunts ghosts. In the author's usual style of action, suspense and humor, this book made for an entertaining read. Off to purchase the second book in the series DEMON INC

WHO GLARES WINS (Lexi Graves Mysteries) is the second book in this series, after Armed and Fabulous (Lexi Graves Mysteries) which by the way the first book is free.It's well-written with mystery, suspense, romance and lots of humor. A nice mixture that makes for an enjoyable fun relaxing read. Off to buy the third in this series. Loved it.

BRANDED (THE BRANDED SERIES) is the first book in this new series, and debut novel for K.L. Kawker. A beautiful, well-written young adult story with likable characters and a most captivating story line. I'd recommend this book to youth, adults and our elders, as it has a nice warm story.

I have read all of Joe Bruno's books on the Mobsters, the crooks, creeps and gangs. I'm not surprised he wrote a book on the Mob's wives too. I suspect there will be another book one day on the children of the mobsters? I can only hope. Love all of these book. Grab a copy..only a book for a few hours of reading enjoyment.

DIGITUS 233 is Ms. Emerson's debut novel and first of the Digitus Series. This is a fast-paced, hold-on-to-the-edge-of-your-seat, heart-thumping thriller. It captivated my attention from the first page and wouldn't let go until I finished it in one sitting. WOW! An amazing ride. Can't wait for the next book in this series. Well-written and highly recommended.

Beyond excellent! I have this installed on my Toshiba P75-A7200 17" laptop for about 8 months. The computer came with an additional hard drive slot and used the original HDD as dedicated memory storage only. So, now I have almost 1TB total memory storage. Also, the computer came with 8GB or RAM. I then added 16GB more. With its Intel Core i7-4700 CPU this computer is blistering fast and gaming is pretty good...for a laptop. I am going to get another one or two for my other machines. I have a "Crucial" SSD in my other small laptop and it doesn't even compare to the Samsung 850 EVO. Should have spent the extra $10...but, now YOU know and stay away from anything but Samsung SSDs. 20+ years experience computering/Cisco trained/certs.

Junk cable. SWR is through the roof (4.0). I used a calibrated meter and tested at the CB radio and tested at the antenna end. Both the antenna and CB SWR were below 1.2 at the entry points. Put this cable into the run and SWR goes through the roof and actual power out is below 1/2 rated. Disconnect this cable and power out is almost 4 watts.

1.5 tbsp in my coffee...life is good!  Oh man what a difference from the stuff they sell at Target and Walmart. I even bought some from an organic store. This Madhava is the smoothest and sweetest I have ever tasted. I am critical (46, lived in Europe for five years, and know what good is). When I write that this nectar is good...you can bank on it. Buy it...
It turns out I should have got a larger capacity Samsung. This one is okay and does the job, but I should have spent an extra $20 and got twice the memory. Oh well...
Taking these is better than mixed powdered chili pepper in my vegetable drink. Performing a #2 is a little more explosive, but still natural. Kinda cleans you out, you know?
Second one I have...actually use both now.
Very nice little unit.
I always buy too many of these but end up using them for something. Just like have Lego's in the 70's. Groovy!
Best pan ever. Nothing sticks to it and food tastes better. Use less butter.
Item is NOT as pictured. The one I received has two mounting holes, not six as pictured. If I would have known that, I would not have purchased this item.

Great fit and surprisingly strong anchors! I had some concerns and posted a question in the "Customer Questions" section. Within a day, I had three answers from guys who own these. One even sent a picture link of his install. VERY helpful.My new '14 Silverado has LineX spray-in bedliner. I was concerned about clearance with these anchors. I had to cut out the LineX around the plastic inserts..and then pried them out with a screwdriver. I unscrewed the bullet anchor as far as I could and put them in. You have to center the anchors on the oval opening/perforations on the sidewall of the bed to make a solid fit. Once I figured out that small detail...no problem at all. They look good, and appear to be stronger then other anchors.My old truck had those large eyelet type anchors you can buy anywhere (like wallyworld). They are cheap, and work decent, but these Chevy bullet anchors are stronger, pop in and out, and seem to match the aesthetics of the bed better.

Nothing beats Kaspersky...been using their products for years. NEVER had an issue with anything getting through. Love the "Safe Money" security. Most of the threats are coming from Russia...so why not buy a Russian anti-virus/internet security product? Duh?

Really like this little bug zapper. I got it hanging in my large garage.PROS:- Price- Size- Works well against flies, even little fruit flies. Seen dead moths, and skeeters, also- Power use...low. It actually uses around 25 watts according to my Kill-a-Watt meter- Fascinating zapping sounds...reminds me of my neighbors bug zapper growing up in MI in 1976CONS:- Transformer is up top and the unit does not hang straight up and down (weighted topsy-turvy). Had to tie a string on the lid to make it hang level- Power cord needs to be at least two-three feet instead of 10 inches long- Dunno reliability yet or cost of bulbs.- Can get messy underneath because it kills so many bugs (not really a "CON" but may be a pita for some)OVERALL:- Great purchase and it works well at killing bugs. I am considering getting another one for next spring.

EXCELLENT product. I am using it in the garage connected to the ceiling outlet for the garage door opener. It hangs down, so that I can use power tools and not run extension cords. Fits the bill perfectly. I just re-ordered another one!PROS:- Heavy duty all the way (12 gauge)- Lighted tri-outlet...way cool- Yellow...so it can be spotted right away- Feels like it will last forever- Price, Amazon Prime 2-day- UL listedCONS:- None. This is perfect

So, I ordered the 4x6' rug and was given the 3.3x5.2' version. Not happy with the false advertising, but the price was the same for the smaller version...and I like it. Not gonna pitch a fit to Amazon or Home Dynamix at this time...but, buyer beware! Rug is really nice.
Good high quality sticker and I am glad I got these.

Bought one of these at a local home improvement store. Got it home, unboxed it, mounted it on my Poulan 33cc weed wacker, and tried it out. Wow, what piece of crap! Sure it blows, makes some noise, but the blowing power is way too weak. Additionally, it "felt" very awkward...too front-end heavy. Even at full throttle, it only makes a lot of noise and doesn't blow strongly at all. Don't waste your money on this. I returned it to the store for a full refund and bought a yellow Poulan Pro gas powered blower. This one is better, more blowing power, quieter, and better overall. But, I kinda wish I would have spent another $40-50 and got something even stronger. I am going to keep the Poulan blower for now.

These beads are about worthless. I bought them on a whim to cut down inverter noise coming into my CB base station. They didn't work. Turns out, there are different ratings on these things and if you get the wrong one...they are worthless. I even bought some from another company that were rated for 27 MHz and they did cut down bleedthrough noise...but not that much. Guess I am SOL.

Been using Kaspersky for years and have never had any issues (worms, virus, computer crashing). When I used Norton, Mcaffee, and a couple others, I ALWAYS had issues. So, Kaspersky remains a solid anti-virus/internet security platform that reacts quickly to any threat. Safe Money is awesome with this program.
This one is a gooder. I am using it for connecting antenna components in my base station and does not affect SWR or TX out. Pretty solid build and am happy with this purchase.
I broke it trying to install the cables. Before I broke it, it worked alright. The cable connectors on this clipper suck...too flimsy.

This one is a gooder. I am using it on my CB base station. SWR was almost dead on after initial install. Didn't mess with tuning. Tested using 5w and 100w...handles both well. My reach to DX stations is pretty good. I was TXing one night and some truckers in the background chatter said they heard, "...someone is showing off". I busted out laughing. I have it mounted about 25' up on my chimney and it works well. As for good "skip" nights...was able to TX/RCV with a dude about 600 miles away.
It worked alright but switched over to direct wiring to my battery and Battery Tender. Don't use it anymore. When I had it wired up, it did cut down on noise...but not 100%. More like 60-70%
Very good pumpkin seeds. Packaging was tight and vacuum sealed. Color is genuine. Salt content is just right. Flavor is good. I might try warming them up in my toaster oven. Hmmm!

Buy this mount. Don't pay $75+ for a mount at a store. I have owned/used three of these for six years and they are the best. I am getting a fourth one for the guest bedroom.PROS:- Heavy duty construction- Comes with plenty of hardware- Leveling a HDTV is a must...so, it comes with one.- Lots of holes to choose from if you miss your wall stud- Tilts- Snugs to the wallCONS:- Can be a two person job installing this wall mount- Hard to reach behind to unlock...esp if you have a 50" + HDTV- Lots of "extra" parts...some of them important...easy to loseThis company could charge $50 for this and still make out like a bandit. Cheers!

PROS:- Super sensitive receiver- Digital display- PA and speaker outputs (I have a AUX speaker and the fidelity is superb!)- Scan function (can scan LSB, USB, and AM)- SWR and antenna calibration is awesome- Mic gain for adding accessories and cutting down on noise- Microphone clarity is very clear- RF gain "Local" button is spectacular for knocking down DX noise- Display color changesCONS- Annoying "beep" on every button (there is a video on You Tube to remove a small chip and this loud beep will go away)I did the mod and the beep is about 98% gone...barely audible. Easy.- Weather station call up seems to be a tad on the weak sideOVERALL- Been working with CBs since 1975 and I can say this one is by far my favorite. In fact, I am using it solely for my base station with a small 12v battery and Battery Tender charger (works awesome!). I am running a Firestik II (4') on top of my chimney about 30' up and I can pick up DX on skip and local traffic with ease. I live about 1 mile from the interstate and I can pick up chatter crystal clear.- ANL/NB seems to be a little weak, but does cut down on noise

Deserves "6" stars.Solid build, easy hook up, improved my SWR ratio/reach/DX pull in. A must have if you need to have better TX/RX. Badass little unit and I have done electronics since 1975. Be mindful of too much gain when receiving folks close by...some transceivers keep handle that much modulation...and could fry your input. Unit uses almost no power when in PREAMP mode, when going Linear and keying up...it will draw a lot of amps...which is fine.Deserves "6" stars and will make your set-up operate like it is on steroids/Viagra/supercharged V8 big block with true duels and no mufflers.

I have this mounted in the center console of my 2011 Chevy Silverado. It is hidden away and I use it when I get onto the highways here in Oklahoma and trips out east (Michigan, Ohio, Indiana). It works well.DETAILS:- Perfect size and ergonomically useful.- Cable junction box tucked away under cup holder...not inside center console (keeps wires out of the way from damage)- Using external speaker...got it at a local Pilot truck stop. Works perfectly- Weather function absolutely a necessity here in Oklahoma. Power goes out...I got weather updates from my truck- 1-3 mile range effective. I have a smallish hood mount antenna with a made-to-fit antenna bracket for the Silverado. Works well, even through car washes. It would nice to have a whip, but I have a short loaded style...still works okay.- I have had to "Mike up" sometimes (meaning talk louder into the mic). TX button could be made betterOVERALL- Glad I got this and have had a CB radio since I was a kid in the 70s. CBs remain the best "radar/cop detector" if people use them. You can't outrun a radio. Several 1,000 mile trips cross country and this Cobra has paid for itself 10x over. Thanks...and long live CB!

It is an okay flashlight. It puts out a good amount of light and can be focused. The focusing part is kinda interesting. It narrows the beam to a strange looking LED square. Packaging was non-existent. It came in a bag with some tissue. I was really expecting more...but this light is just "meh". I had a Surefire in Iraq and was smaller and threw out more light. For the price, it is a good buy.Also, LED light gives me headaches...weird shadows, not full spectrum.

Done messing with Whistler. Check out my set up in the Customer Images section above. Installation went well. I had to mount it vertically because of space limitations.INITIAL THOUGHTS:- It is big, heavy, and built strong- Amazon 2-day shipping is great. Double boxed. No issues.- Binding posts are larger and use a standard 1/2" nut...nice!- Very small chassis grounding post- No cables, but no biggie. I am using 0-gauge to my six-pack battery bank- Inverter turned right on after install.- Running two fridges simultaneously w/o any issues- Measured VAC output (with my true RMS Fluke meter) at 125v. The Whistler only had 115v.- No USB portOVERALL- Initial run up looks very promising. I will put some heavy loads on it later on and in a few months update this review.UPDATE (28 June 2014)- Well, one month+ in and this inverter still performs perfectly 24/7. I have run it up to 2KW and it ran strong...not even a hiccup/fart/burp. The single cooling fan only comes on occasionally. Inside my Oklahoma garage...it is getting up near 95-99 deg...but it doesn't seem to phase this inverter. One note: when the solar charge controller has charged my battery bank and the voltage gets above 13.8vDC, the inverter will hum and buzz a little more (nothing wrong with it tho). Neighbors and friends who come over are impressed. In fact, I bought a 100' heavy duty extension cord to run power to my neighbors house in case we lose power. Gosh I'm a nice guy. Grounded this unit NOT using the little grounding lug terminal...used the inverter's (neg) binding post straight to my sunken ground rod...SCC, inverter, batteries, are now all looped to true negative ground (works really well). It does produce a little RFI I can hear over my CB base station.UPDATE (20 Oct 2014)- Still running perfectly! When the battery bank is at full charge and in "float" mode (around 14.5v DC), this inverter will buzz a little bit when there is a load. Not an issue...all inverters do this. At night (no solar charging going on) the voltage goes down to 12.3-12.6v DC and there is no buzz when the fridges kick on. Again, no concern at all. This inverter is an absolute beast! Still produces RFI on some CB channels on my base station. On Channel 19 (truckers channel) it is okay...minimal or no interference. Other channels get completely washed out from this inverter. Turn this inverter off (and the solar charge controller) and my CB base station is crystal clear.
