The dog's found these so yummy that I was afraid there'd be fights! I have a 100# lab and a 15# mutt. Because Professor Picklepants (yes, that's really his name) is so small, we got two bones in the small size so both could eat them. Even so, one of them was almost too big for him. The other was just right. Since they're real bone, the sizes aren't uniform.I got one of each; Pet n Shape Filled Small Dog Bone Trachea Flavor and Pet n Shape Filled Small Dog Bone Bully Flavor. Well, they liked them both but, overall, the bully stick flavor was preferred.What's nice is that these are real bones, so the dogs enjoy gnawing at them even though they're now empty. You can also spread a bit of peanut butter inside once they're empty. The filling wasn't stinky and didn't leave marks on the carpet, either! My only issue is the high shipping cost. I will be searching for these locally.

The dog's found these so yummy that I was afraid there'd be fights! I have a 100# lab and a 15# mutt. Because Professor Picklepants (yes, that's really his name) is so small, we got two bones in the small size so both could eat them. Even so, one of them was almost too big for him. The other was just right. Since they're real bone, the sizes aren't uniform.I got one of each; Pet n Shape Filled Small Dog Bone Trachea Flavor and Pet n Shape Filled Small Dog Bone Bully Flavor. Well, they liked them both but, overall, the bully stick flavor was preferred.What's nice is that these are real bones, so the dogs enjoy gnawing at them even though they're now empty. You can also spread a bit of peanut butter inside once they're empty. The filling wasn't stinky and didn't leave marks on the carpet, either! My only issue is the high shipping cost. I will be searching for these locally.

When I was a girl back in the 70s, my sister and I - in fact all the girls! - wore Love's Baby Soft. It's a fresh, clean, light scent suitable for pre-teens and teens, but there's no reason an adult couldn't enjoy it as well! I also wore Love's Fresh Lemon by Dana for Women 1.5 oz Body Mistback then. That was my favorite. I picked out this set as part of my niece's birthday gift. She really likes it. My only disappointment was that I couldn't get the Baby Soft and Lemon as a combo. The cute heart shaped box also makes for a nice and easy to wrap gift. Just wrap in tissue and drop in a gift bag. Voila!

These are simply the most beautiful, softest blankets I've ever owned for my bed. I bought two for our home, and everyone loves them. It's almost a shame to sandwich them between a sheet and a bedspread. I usually use mine to cuddle up in while reading or watching TV. The quality of the manufacture and color fastness have been no problem. And, unlike other reviewers, I had no problems with the company.In fact, I ordered 4 more as Xmas gifts for my nieces and nephew, and expect they'll love them as much as we do.Next time I need bedsheets, I plan to buy the matchingBrylanehome 300-Tc Cotton Horizon Watercolor Sheet Set.

I was really tired of polishing my sterling flatware and my silver jewelry every time I wanted to use of wear something. So I bought both 3M Anti-Tarnish Paper Silver Protector 2 x 7 Inch (5 Strips) 45013 and Hagerty Silver Cloth By The Yard . Some of my silver flatware is already in a silver cloth covered and zippered organizer, but the rest is in the same drawer in regular plastic kitchen drawer holders. I simply placed a silver strip inside the zippered holder and another on top of the open silver. Then I cut the cloth to a good size to cover the opens pieces.I know it's effective because I also use part of the set on a daily basis, and those get very tarnished! They're just kept in a regular kitchen drawer. We open and close the drawer many times a day, so I don't even attempt to keep a strip in there.I have a jewelry cabinet, so I first cleaned all my silver jewelry. I lined a drawer in the silver cloth, then put all the silver in there with a strip, followed by another piece of cloth on top. Sure, I have to lift the cloth to choose jewelry and sure, I have to keep all the silver separate (so I sometimes forget it when choosing what to wear), but not having to constantly clean and polish the items makes it worthwhile.In addition, I have two sets of antique silver overlay tea sets. It's not a good idea to clean those often, so I only clean them a couple of times a year, then put them back in the china cabinet with a strip. Works wonderfully!

NO SPOILERS  "The Beckoning Fair One" is the longest (a novella) and best known piece in this collection of short stories. Writer Paul Oleron moves into several rooms of an otherwise long empty, neglected and run down home. He soon finds himself obsessed by what he believes to be a ghost. The question for the reader to determine is whether it is a ghost, a leanan sídhe, some other phenomena, or the deterioration of Oleron's own mind at work.This and the other stories showcases Onions' strength at creating mood. It's best to read the novella in one or two sittings only, as the reader's involvement in the tone and identification with the main character build as the story progresses. In some ways the stories reminded me of the slow building classic The Turn of the Screw by Henry James, so if you enjoyed that novella, you may like Onions' stories.Onions didn't write "jump out and BOO" stories. They're carefully crafted gems of mood, plot and characterization which have influenced many big name writers after his time. And here Amazon has a collection of his stories - for free! Enjoy!

This was a gift for my frog-crazy niece's birthday. She's moving into a new room with a new bed and a new green paint job on the walls. The rug was a huge hit; everyone at the party thought it just adorable.It has a couple of drawbacks:1. price - a bit on the high side2. not very soft - it's a very flat, low pilePluses:1. very cute design2. non slip backing
Baby likes it and just figured out that the vibration is activated with biting. Very entertaining to watch. The material is very soft on the biting portion. Easy to grab.
Richard Scarry's books are the best for kids! This one is really the best first book ever :-) I remember as I child my self spending so much time on each page.

So cute! They actually have the JD logo towards the bottom on the brown part of the sock. That is a plus :-) for some reason the picture on Amazon doesn't show it. I was a bit concerned about it I must say, but thought that they must come with a logo. And they did. Given that the size is 6-12M, they will be a bit large on a 6 month old. On my 9 month old baby they are just a bit large, but wearable.
Great for traveling by plane, you can fold it flat when empty. I've always found it annoying to carry a big empty nalgene bottle, when there's no water it still takes up space.

Love the size and thickness of this towel. It took me some time to find a towel that was bigger than the usual tiny baby towels, and that was also thicker and not paper thin. Very pleased, it's thick but soft, and size wise it is good for a toddler too.

Cute and comfy dress for breastfeeding. With this dress you can look a bit more dressed up than with other nursing dresses I have. Yes it short but not too short, I'm 5' 61/2'' and it looks like in the picture. I did not use when pregnant, I only purchased after that, so I cannot tell how it would look with a belly... The opening for breastfeeding is convenient and provides a lot of coverage (it has a sort of under shirt sewed in the front).

Looking forward to more Lieutenant Sorensen books! I had fun following this novel from US to France. I also liked the unusual settings of the story, a university department and foreign language professors, and small local police department. This is not what you usually find in thrillers.
I should have read this before giving birth, not after!

Looks very slick, you could not tell it's a nursing dress. Definitely you can go out or to the office and look all dressed up. The only negative is that the inside breast support goes over the breast and nipple instead of being to the side. I wear a nursing pad so it doesn't bother me too much. Since it looks so good on me I bear with it!
I started using it when baby was able to keep head up consistently and turning neck. He enjoys it and it allows me to have one free hand and not to carry him all the times while in the water.

My dog Bruno is diabetic, accident-prone, and has very delicate skin.  He's a Pit-Bull / Lab / Shar-Pei mix, and it seems his skin has been more delicate lately, and tearing open more often.  Vet bills have been piling up, so I need to start doing more at home.  I'm already doing glucose curves and administering insulin injections.  I've even done subcutaneous fluids at home when he got real sick about 4 years ago.Anyways, just last week, he was scratching his neck, and put a 3/4" gash in his throat.  I shaved the area, cleaned it and dried it.  Then I applied the Vetbond Adhesive while I held the cut closed.The Vetbond Adhesive held for a couple days until he was scratching (again), and re-opened the wound (unfortunately, it was in a location where a "cone" around his neck wouldn't have prevented this), which was now nearly twice as long of an incision (close to 1.5").  Time for the pro's to take care of it - back to the vet for some stitches.I'm not giving up on this adhesive yet, though.  It's the same stuff they use at our Vet (and have used many times on Bruno).  Hopefully it holds better next time (hoping there is not next time - but that seems to be a false hope.)

The stitching in the webbing around the D-Ring (where you clip the leash) came undone 5 minutes into the first walk after this was delivered.The only reason I needed this harness was so that I could walk my dog while his throat heals from an injury.  I didn't want to use a regular collar due to it potentialy aggrivating the area of his throat that is currently stitched up.Overall, the quality is good, and the fit is good...but the QC department let this one slip through the cracks.  I noticed that the stitching around the D-Ring was a little loose about 1 minute into the walk.  I was taking him for a short 10-minute walk, so I figured I'd chance it and finish the walk...well, it only lasted another 4-5 minutes when Bruno saw the puppy he's been playing with the for the past few days.  One slight tug, and the rest of the stitching came undone.  I was able to clip to one of the O-Rings on the side to keep him under my control for the walk back home.I have some spare webbing at home, and will just re-make the part that broke, since I don't want to deal with return shipping.  Besides, if I wait for the next one to be delivered his stitches will have already been removed.  I need to take him for daily walks to keep his diabetes under control, so I'd rather just repair it myself instead of waiting for shipments to be delivered.

I've got big hands, and usually wear a XXL glove, but always measure, and follow recommendations from manufacturers.  My measurements equated to an XL size for this glove.  The glove fits fine around my hand, but the finger holes are way too roomy.  I was hoping for something with a more snug fit.  I'll just have to alter them.  I can't go down to a Large, since it probably won't fit around my knuckles comfortably.Other than the fit, they work good.  My hands stayed warm and comfortable while paddling and fishing in the ocean for over 4 hours.  I may even use these as a bicycling glove, too.

They are fairly comfortable for kayak fishing.  There is no arch/heel support whatsoever.  I usually wear a size 14 or 15 depending on the shoe, as one of my feet is a 14.5.  With these NeoPrene boots, I could have gotten away with a 13, as the 14 had almost a full inch of clearance in front of my toes.

Almost a year ago I raised my desk at work and got rid of my office chair.  This single change helped relieve my back pain more than anything.  I prefer to stand.  When I go to people's homes, or to a party/gathering, people are always telling me to sit down, and that I'm making them uncomfortable...but sitting is simply uncomfortable for me unless I'm in a recliner.Last weekend I was at an annual 3 day convention that required a total of 6 four-hour sitting periods.  This usually would have left me with an extremely painful lower back and tailbone.  Just days prior to the convention I was on a cross-country flight (NY to SF).  While waiting in Denver for my next flight for 4 hours, I decided to take a walk around the concourse, and stumbled upon a BackJoy sales booth.  I had never seen these before, but the salesman doing what salesmen do - offered to let me try it out.  I did, and it felt fine, but I was a bit skeptical, so I walked away without purchasing.That's when I came to Amazon to read the reviews before making my purchase.  My rump was already sore from my other flights and Greyhound bus rides over the prior week.  After reading a few of the reviews I was sold.  I paid about $5 more at the airport, but I didn't want to get on another plane without it.Now, it's not perfect.  As others have stated, it doesn't work as well atop cushioned chairs, but it sure beats sitting directly on lightly-cushioned seating - like airplane / bus / stadium seating.  Some minor adjustments may be needed here and there to remain comfortable.After using this device during the 3-day convention, my lower back still hurt after sitting for extended periods of time - though only about 50% of what it would have been had I not had the BackJoy.  My tailbone had no pain whatsoever, and there was no hint of my legs or other parts going numb after prolonged sitting.I got a few stares, laughs, and some light ribbing from friends for bringing my 'booster seat' / 'tractor seat', but at the end of the day, quite a few people wanted to try it, and a couple were convinced that they will need one for next year's convention.I plan on getting into Kayak fishing, and am anxious to try it out on the water.  Anyone know if it floats?In case you're wondering, I'm 6'2" 250lb.  Supposedly this is a one-size-fits-all...but anyone that's either really small, or really big, knows that there's really no such thing.

I must say this is much faster, easier to use and provides for a quicker cleanup than my other method - which is using an old (clean) cotton t-shirt.  I still prefer the way that almond milk turns out when strained through something that is more tightly woven - which captures all of the fiber.I just received this new nut milk bag a couple days ago, and was eager to give it a try.  While it works good, it leaves the nut milk a bit too gritty for my taste.I'm making my almond milk in a Blendtec blender.  Maybe I'm just running it too long, and grinding up the almonds too fine.  I'll play around with the length of time, and blender speed settings...maybe I'll be able to make a nice smooth (not gritty) almond milk using this bag after all.  I'll report back after a few tests.

I installed this about a week ago in my 2006 Nissan Frontier.  Install was very easy thanks to the Metra 70-7550 Radio Wiring Harness For Nissan 95-Up Power 4 Speaker and the Metra 99-7581 Niss Pathfinder/Frontier 05-Up Dashkit.I was easily able to figure out how to pair with my phone via Bluetooth.  Operation is pretty straight forward.  I have been using many of the features, simply by playing around with it.  I haven't yet looked at the manual.  Everything is pretty intuitive and easy to figure out.Sound quality is good in some situations, but bad in others.  For instance:Great sound quality:Auxiliary inputBluetooth Pandora - when it actually worksUSB inputNot-so-Great sound quality:AM/FM Radio - factory receiver had a much cleaner-sounding radio signalBluetooth Phone - very scratchy audioI have yet to connect it to SiriusXM, so I can't comment on sound quality or features for it.

I purchased this locally after verifying that I'd be able to return it if it didn't work.  I didn't want to end up with a $40 sweater for my dog.I bought it on July 3rd in preparation for my annual sleepless night.  Not only are there random fireworks going on all night in my neighborhood, the city does their full-fledged tens-of-thousands-of-dollars fireworks show right next to my house.  They launch them literally 100 yards from my backyard, which makes it great for viewing the show, but not so great for my 2 dogs.The older (11) of the 2 dogs is a cattle-dog mix, and is easily controllable in these situations with simple verbal discipline.  The younger (9) is a Pit Bull / Lab / Shar-Pei, who is a great dog most of the time, but goes absolutely berserk when he hears fireworks.I was hopeful that this Thundershirt would help - even just a little.  But it did absolutely nothing.  There was no change whatsoever in his behavior or demeanor.For those that it does work for, it looks like it would last through many uses.  The materials and construction look reliable.  It's fairly easy to put it on the dog, if your dog will sit still for you.  If not, you'll definitely need a second set of hands to get this thing wrapped around the dog.

I installed a Sony MEXBT3100P Receiver, and while the install was a piece of cake, the fit & finish of this dashkit leaves much to be desired.The receiver is held in by a couple of side plates that are supposed to clip into the housing - but they aren't very secure, and the receiver can be pulled out pretty easily with no tools necessary.The receiver also sits a little too deep into the dash, which interferes with the removal of the faceplate.The trim piece that installs around the receiver to cover the gaps isn't straight (upper horizontal section sags), and doesn't clip in securely.I'd like to upload photos, but am unable to do so for this particular product.

I work right around the corner from Greenlee's bakery.  It's dangerously good.  It's also available at the local Costco's, Safeway's and such...but the bakery has them nice and fresh.  No preparation needed (or recommended) - just eat it right out of the package, or toss it in the toaster - but only for long enough to warm it up.  Maybe put a scoop of vanilla ice-cream on it for dessert.  It needs to be eaten within a couple days of purchase - but it won't last that long unless you have some serious will-power.***Update 10/28/14***Turns out this stuff is available across the country.  My cousin in CT told me she found some in a grocery store out there.  The woman at Greenlee's bakery told me that they are available at most Costco's across the country.Also, use this bread for French Toast.  You won't be disappointed.And, I just learned that they have 'rejects' at the bakery for only $2.50/loaf!

Most people look at me like I'm crazy when I tell them how much I spent on a quality set of optics, but these Leupold Cascades are worth every penny.Several years ago, I purchased a set of refurbished Cascades 8x42 bino's on sale for about $200.  3 weeks ago, when I went to twist out the right-side eye-cup, it broke off.  I e-mailed Leupold support through their website, explaining that I had no receipt, and couldn't even remember where I bought them.  They told me to simply send them in, and they would take care of it.A week or so later, I got a post-card confirming that they received the binoculars.  Yesterday, UPS stops by and hands me a package.  Inside was a brand new, retail packaged set of these newer-model binoculars!  I had always heard that their customer service is second to none - now I'm a true believer.This model seems a bit more refined than my old ones.  Better fit & finish.  Optics seem a bit clearer, and don't have the discolored (pink-ish) ring at the peripheral edges, like the old ones.It included a nice neoprene strap that will probably go unused, since I prefer a harness.  It also comes with rubber flip-away lens covers - like the Butler Creek ones, but a much simpler (cheaper) design.

I had never used trekking poles before, except for the odd sturdy stick picked up on the side of the trail.There is a local hill that I like to hike about once or twice a month or so, that gives me a pretty good workout.  Mission Peak in Fremont, CA.  It's about 3 miles each way, and ascends ~2,100'.  Most of it is a wide gravel / packed dirt trail, except for the last 1/4 mile which is narrow and very rocky.Before using these trekking poles, my legs muscles would be very sore from the hike up the hill, and my knees and soles of my feet would be very sore from descending the hill.  Now that I've been using the poles, I still get a great workout - even in my arms, but I'm not nearly as sore at the end.I was a little concerned about the strength of these poles, since they are in Leki's 'ultralight' series, and I'm certainly not an ultralight person, currently at ~260lb.  I've put maybe 50 miles on these poles so far, and believe they are worth every penny spent.Just a few weeks ago I used them as I walked up to the top of Vernal Falls in Yosemite National Park, on the Mist Trail.  The solid granite steps in front of the falls were quite wet & slick, but the tips of these poles just dig right into the rock, making ascending and descending them an absolute breeze.The grips and straps are also very comfortable.  I'm very happy with these as my first set of trekking poles.  The only reason I'll ever buy another set of trekking poles is if these break or get lost or stolen...and then I'll probably buy these same ones again (or maybe the anti-shock version of them).
There's not much else to say about it.  It fits in my 1991 Ford Escort Wagon 1.9L.  We'll see if it helps with my SMOG emissions next December.  Maybe I'll post an update then.

I wanted a rear wheel that is sturdy and would be strong enough to haul around my 270lb self, along with my clothes, tools, lunch, and whatever else I need to bring to work with me, on my 20+ mile round-trip commute, and not need constant maintenance.I should have paid closer attention to the spec's for this rim - apparently, it's only rated to 87psi (6 bar).  This is not good for a Clydesdale (tall or otherwise hefty cyclist).  I use 700x28 tires preferably inflated to 115 psi (7.9 bar).  Maybe I'll just get some 32's so I don't worry about pot holes as much.  But that's my own fault for lack of attention to detail, so I'm not deducting any stars for it.The reason for the deduction of a star is becuase the wheel was not properly trued, tensioned, and stress relieved.  Right out of the box, it was out of true, and when I mounted it, and jumped on the bike, I heard some pinging coming from the spokes.  I had to do a quick truing of the wheel during my lunch break, and will do a proper truing, tensioning, and stress-relieving later.Overall, it seems like a good wheel, made from quality components.  It should last me a good long time...after it's properly built.If you decide to purchase this wheel, and you don't know how to true, tension, and stress-relieve a wheel, plan on spending an extra $20-$40 at your local bike shop to have this done for you.

When I grind meat, I do it in batches - usually ~10lb at a time, and this grinder attachment was just too small and too slow for the job, and was also causing oil/grease to leak from the mixer.  Maybe up to 3lb at a time, if the meat is already cut up into small pieces.I ended up getting a purpose-built LEM grinder, which of course is absolutely no comparison to this attachment, but it fits my needs much better.I'd rather just use my mixer as a mixer, and put less strain on it.

I have another ear warmer that also works great, but prefer the Pearl iZUMi one because it doesn't hinder my hearing - which is very important while commuting, especially in a large city.If my wife decides to start riding in colder weather, I'll let her use this one, since it has an opening for a ponytail.

I was under the assumption that this peanut butter was simply peanuts and salt, like the description states under "Ingredients".  It turns out that it's about 15% sugar (cane juice).  Not what I was looking for.Amazon: Please fix the ingredient list to include Palm Oil and Sugar Cane Juice.

Cons:- Battery life - my bike-commute is less than 1 hour each way.  When I put it on the charger after a one-way commute, the charge-level indicator is Red, meaning not much power left.  Orange = ~50%.  Green = 100%- Charger design - I would have much preferred a micro-USB type charger instead of the magnetic electrode charging method.  Because of this proprietary charger, I'm forced to bring the charger with me on my commutes.  It would have been nicer to use the same type of charger that many phones use.- Durability - The first one I got worked one time and then failed.  I was able to charge it up right out of the box, and it worked once.  After a single charge the charger failed to charge the light.Pros:- Very bright- 3 blink settings- Very lightweight- Solar Charger - can be used to charge other USB devices as well - though very, very slowly.- Customer Support - I called customer support about the light failing to charge.  They sent me another one brand-new in retail box with all accessories - no questions asked.  That's when I realized that it was the charger, and not the light.  They didn't want the old items back, so now I have one working charger, and 2 working tail lights.Overall, I don't regret buying it, and will continue to use it.  If they both fail, I'll probably end up shopping around for a different model, though.

The hoses themselves were a perfect fit, but the metal hose didn't come with a rubber grommet where it mounts to the undercarriage, leaving a loose metal-to-metal contact which results in rattling.  Put a 1" section of 1/4" or 3/8" inside-diameter rubber hose, or wrap it with some durable tape, and you're good to go.Removal of the old hoses was a piece of cake.  You'll have to remove the vertically-positioned hose coupler from the top of the power steering pump in order to get the high-pressure hose loose.  A couple of adjustable wrenches will do the job nicely. Unthreading from the steering rack proved tedious because you can only turn the nut about 1/8 turn at a time due to lack of clearance.Threading the end of the new hose into the steering rack can be a bit tricky.  Removal of the left-front wheel is a must.  A 17mm crows-foot wrench is also very helpful. Getting the hose perfectly aligned, and getting the threads to 'catch' seemed an impossible task, but after ~40 minutes of struggling, I was finally able to thread it in.  No leaks.  Success!

I purchased this vest for commuting via bicycle.  Now that winter is approaching, I'm commuting both ways in the dark, in a busy city (San Jose, CA).  This vest gives me just a little more peace of mind, knowing that I'm more visible to motorists.

My initial reaction when I opened the package was that these were going to be a great addition to my bar.  I was very wrong.  I purchased these because I was going to be bartending (first time) at a friends party.  I quickly learned that these pourers don't fit very tight, and even if they did, they have to be held at a specific angle in order to keep them from leaking.  The little air-relief hole needs to be at the 12 o'clock position in order to prevent leaks.For this beginner, the flow rate is good.  Not too fast.  Not too slow.I'll probably continue to use them for smaller gatherings where I'm only making a few drinks, and can closely pay attention to their position.  But certainly not in a busy environment.

These are by far the best brake pads I've used.  They have incredible stopping power - and I need all I can get, since I weigh about 265lb, and enjoy hill climbing (and descending).I had the ones with the removable inserts until one of the inserts fell out on my commute home.  They had about 1,200 miles on them, and probably could have gone at least another couple hundred, had they held together.  Instead of buying new inserts, I purchased these, since they are more likely to be more durable.I've tried a few different brands of brake pads on my 2012 Trek FX 7.5.  All have been quite except for Kool-Stops.  It's got to be something about the combination of the compound, the brake hardware, and/or the rim, but they are very, VERY loud.  I've tried toeing-in the pads at several different angles, to no avail.Sometimes the loud noise is a good thing, because it's get's people's attention...like if a car is pulling out in front of you.  I think it helps out especially in crowded places, like when I'm riding across the Golden Gate Bridge.  No need for a bell or horn - just tap the brakes.

Great little tool that will probably get more use than you think.  Very lightweight & easy to use.  Just insert the pins into the chain links, and squeeze the movable piece closed.  Look through the 'window', and it tells you how much the chain has stretched.I work on bikes belonging to friends and family.  Every time they have a problem shifting, or need a tune-up, this is one of the first tools to come out of the toolbox.  It only takes a couple seconds to use.Now, I just need to make sure I don't lose it...it is pretty small; about the size of a pen.
I'll save my plastic levers for easy jobs like large MTB tires.  These steel levers are perfect for removing and installing tight road tires.  I should have bought them years ago.
What else can I say?  It does the job, and is priced appropriately.I have it installed on my Topeak Explorer rack, and it holds my PDW Danger Zone Light securely in place.

This was a perfect fit for my Brooks B17 saddle.  The material seems durable, and doesn't change the feel of the ride.  Well worth the peace of mind should I get caught in the rain.  Includes attached velcro strap that allows you to tightly pack it.

I bought the 10-pack, not because I need 10 of them, but because they make great gifts.  There's not much to say about these.  They're plastic, seem durable, and do the job of keeping your tie from shifting side to side, accidentally turning around, or hanging down when you bend over.Tie Chains and Pins do the same thing, but if you want a cleaner, no-bling look, these are perfect.Update - April 2015:They aren't as durable as I had expected.  They start to crack in the corners of the rectangle button hole, which will eventually break open.  I use these approximately twice a week, and have worn out several of them. The price has gone up considerably since I purchased them.  I've switched to a cheaper alternative - making my own from large paperclips.Design change recommendation - instead of having four 90 angles to make the rectangle shaped button holes, make the ends rounded (long oval).  This will prevent the cracks from forming at the corners, and will make the device more durable.  Do that, and drop the price to less than a buck a piece, and I'll definitely buy more, and recommend them to others.

Normally, XXL gloves fit me perfectly.  These one are quite snug.  My hand measures 3.75" across at the base of my knuckles.My 45 minute commute in 45ºF weather this morning was nice and comfortable, in part because of these gloves.  My fingertips started getting a little cold toward the end of the ride, but overall, my hands were nice and warm, but not too warm.I wore them in the rain a couple weeks ago in temperatures around ~50ºF, and they were great.  I wouldn't wear them in anything over about 55ºF.[update]I've been wearing these on my morning commutes in temperatures down to about 33ºF.  Below about 40º, these gloves just don't cut it for me.  Maybe I have bad circulation or something, but my fingers are numb from the cold about 20-25 minutes into each morning commute.  No issues with temperatures at 45º and up, but over 55º, and they are too warm.  Too narrow of a usable range for me.

I wear size 14 (49) shoes.  I purchased a pair of XXL Craft shoe covers from a local bike shop, thinking they would fit.  They didn't.  Searching online, I found that XXXL was the typical size shoe cover that I would need to look for, but when I brought the Craft ones back, the owner of the shop showed me these Louis Garneau shoe covers.  The size was XL, and I was a bit skeptical, but they were noticably larger than the others, and they fit (quite snugly) over my casual leather shoes, so I have no doubt they'll fit over my cycling shoes.  They are also much more flexible & stretchy.  An extra bonus is that they were $5 cheaper than the other ones.I would say that the XL size of these is probably good for shoe size 12-14 (46-49).  Not sure about other sizes.The one thing I don't care for is the small velcro opening at the ankle.  This should have been extended further down than just 2" from the top to make it easier to put on & remove...but then again, maybe it helps with waterproofness.I'll update this review after I actually have a chance to put them to their intended use...I just have to wait for the cold and rainy weather to return to Northern California.Update:  I wore them on my commute this morning.  No rain, and the temperature was about 50º F, but my feet were nice and warm.  Weather is supposed to start getting colder and wet by the end of the week.Sizing info from the LouisGarneau website:XS: 36 - 38S: 39 - 41M: 41.5 - 43L: 43.5 - 45XL: 45.5 - 50Update: After about 2 months of use, they are holding up alright.  There is a small tear on the underside of the toe portion, but it's not that big of a deal.  I've ridden in rainy ~45º weather and clear ~35º weather.  They kept my feet perfectly warm and dry.

I mix this into my Whey protein shakes, and it works great.  Much preferred over the name-brand label that adds sugar (sucrose) to their product.I also give it to my dog who's always had constipation issues.  I just add some water to it to make it into a cream-of-wheat type texture, and mix it in her food.  She loves it, and it works great for her, too.

I wasn't going to purchase this because I already own some many variations and arrangements of Oum Kolsoum songs. However I did and I'm glad!  Some of the arrangements are very beautiful and others I did not previously own.

I love this genre (post-apocalyptic or possible dark future), but even I'll admit that some books in this genre are "genre-fiction".  However, this one is literature.  There is intention in every word placed on the page, yet it never feels constructed - not unlike the tea garden where Nouria casually scatters leaves across the path, to look as if they were placed there, for that feeling of artful nature.  This book is beautifully written, like the Japanese garden it often evokes in its descriptions.  The fact that it stays small in scope, only hinting at a larger world and its events, is a very effective tool that usually only an experienced author understands.  Many post-apocalyptic books take on a huge scope, travelling across an entire world - in this book, we only know as much as the narrator herself knows.I LOVE that this book is mainly about two female characters - Sanja and Minja.  Because the two girls are written so well, like real girls, it never feels like chick lit or a princess book.  These girls are real and that's why they are relate-able for all genders, because real girls are not caricatures of femininity. You hardly think about their gender, actually, except when someone points out that it's unusual for a girl to become a tea-master.  Unlike SOME post-apocalyptic books, the world has not gone back to someone's misogynistic fantasy, but has maintained much gender equity.About the story itself, which you can also read in the description of the book, it is a world where water has become scarce, where the insects flock so fiercely that insect hoods are needed, and where winter doesn't even touch the northern reaches of Scandinavia.  New Qian rules all of the known world, including the Scandinavian Union, and the East Asian culture infuses everything, and it's unclear whether the characters themselves are Scandinavian or Chinese in origin.  And that hardly matters anyway.  Some modern technology exists - like something similar to a smartphone - and yet most of the past-world technology is in the "plastic grave" - or garbage pit.  The people escavate it looking for usable parts and metals, and  Nouria's friend Sanja is a techno-genius, able to put back together old technology.  The two girls discover something amazing in the plastic grave that changes Nouria, and yet she stays rooted in tradition, rather than following her mother to Xinjiang, she stays with her father to become a tea-master.  Of course tea is quite the luxury when water itself is scarce.

I wasn't sure when I offered tor review it (for vine) but when it arrived, I was QUITE sure.  It is a hilarious satire of business advice.  At the same time, there is a grain of truth in a lot of it.  It's a dark view of the world, to be sure, and not at all politically correct - but if you have worked in business at all, you will be roaring in laughter.  I kept laughing out loud and showing passages to my spouse.  I realize this is a short review, but I'd rather leave the jokes and content for the reader to discover.  An excellent book to pick up and put down - no need to read it straight through.It would make a great gift for a new graduate going into the business world.

This book is pretty comprehensive.  It covers several different ways to work out, and I admit that by the end I was a little confused, but there are specific workouts recommended.  There is a path to building your muscle base, which I suspect most readers would start with, and then other paths to follow for specific goals.  Each exercise is explained in detail, with pictures, and that serves as a reference later on in the workouts.  Sometimes it was body-weight exercises or simple dumbbells, and other times specific gym equipment was needed.Of course, it also talks about diet and how that impacts your results.  You can't eat too little, but you also don't want to eat too much. and you want to eat the right things at the right time.  The book goes into this, without exactly prescribing a diet - more guidelines.My favorite part about the book was the beginning where it explained the principles of fat loss and muscle building, and responded to some common misconceptions.  It confirmed the science behind the way that workouts are often designed. For example, I am following T25 and it uses some of the principles explained in this book, so I liked understanding why something works.for me, I do not do well following a book for a workout, as it's too much referencing the book, and carrying it around. I am more likely to do something that i can take with me on my tablet (perhaps an idea for the author to expand into mobile apps)  or a video to follow, so I don't know how much I'll use the actual workouts. I have considered packing it into my gym bag for work, so that I could make better use of the corporate gym.I gave it four stars because it's my honest assessment. I like it, but I don't love it. However I'm not sure if I'd love any book when compared to other ways of teaching fitness, as explained above.  I think a book like this would be a great guide to a trainer coming up with workouts for his/her clients.  I'd love to have someone take the principles from this book, design a workout and walk me through it. I just don't see myself however putting a book on a bench and trying to read and exercise at the same time.

If you work in a cube, no doubt you'll find this history interesting.  Each chapter focuses on a different time period or mndset in office spaces.  Overall, I found it interesting, some chapters more than others.  Much more research has been done lately on the effect of office spaces on different types of workers.  This book should not serve as a manual to the office planner, merely a history. We certainly do not wish to repeat the mistakes of the past.  Honestly I found it a bit depressing at times, revealing the nature of work, and the division between managers and workers (even in the knowledge economy), and how office space is used to indicate power, prestige, control and lack thereof.

Words cannot express how much I LOVED this book.  I've read pretty much anything I can get my hands on in this genre.  I've read all of Lisa See's books, but this one opened up a new world.  And it was a pretty special one.This story is about friendship and chosen sisterhood, about three girls, all trying to find their identity in America, as  Asians (Chinese and Japanese), from the thirties through the fifties, going through the war, and how that tests loyalty in friendships.  The three women are very different.  Grace Lee is a midwestern girl, who loves to dance and always wanted to be in show-business, but has a sweet and naive air.  Helen is a refined woman who grew up in a big family compound, is relatively well-off but lonely and has dark secrets in her past.  Ruby shows up in San Francisco from Hawaii, willing to do anything to be the star.  Despite their very different backgrounds and values, they form a bond when they try out to be dancers at the Forbidden City, the first Chinese nightclub outside of Chinatown.I related strongly to the characters and their experiences, because I am familiar with the world of bellydancers.  Both dancers are misunderstood and judged.  Both types of dancers portray a caricuture of a culture, in a sense, for an audience not part of that culture.  These entertainers knew they had to play on the stereotypes, make the obvious jokes, in order to bring in the crowds and actually show off their talent.  The women were not considered marriageable, and other women in the community looked down on their "big thigh show" - simply because of the jazzy costumes that they wore.  Of course, Ruby was always one to take it a step further as you'll read in the book.The characters had to experience racism and in one case homophobia beyond which most of us have been exposed to.  It was a different time in America back then, with far less diversity, and with people staying apart from other races. In fact, Asians and Whites were not allowed to get married, which is actually a bit of a plot point in the book.  At the same time, you can see the seeds of change, what preceded the sixties, in the characters and their friends who are beginning to buck tradition.I haven't been reading as much lately, with so much to do and so little time, it's a luxury. However, I never got bored of this book and I found myself choosing to read it the way I used to read - for long periods of time, just falling into the pages of another world.

This is a basic four port video display switch.  It requires a two-prong power outlet.  You plug your monitor into the blue-colored port, and you have up to four additional slots to connect additional VGA cables.  An item like this is commonly used if you have multiple servers or just computers and want to use a single monitor (space-saving).  you might use it if two people in one house share a desk.  You might use it if you have a home PC, and a work laptop.  I don't see a lot of home users needing all four ports.The switching mechanism is buttons across the top.It has a small form factor.I'll admit that I only ended up using it with one device, because it turned out that my work laptop doesn't have a VGA connection.Please note that it is ONLY for VGA cables (the old kind).  Many new monitors use HDMI these days, and some laptops only take HDMI. Do not purchase if your laptop or monitor is HDMI only.  A VGA connection is usually blue, with 15 holes in it.gave it five stars under the philososphy that it's a basic tool that works.  No one really "loves" a four port video switcher.

I work from home from time to time, and I tested this product with my iPhone5 this week.  I tried it for both voice calls and music. It works like magic. You simply lay your phone on the dock - no connection required - and it works.  It does need to be powered up by USB first, but then it operates on its own battery.  The sound comes out of the sound. It's not a professional speaker system such as you might use for listening to music for pleasure, but it's good enough to have background music.  For voice, it was great quality. I checked with the people I spoke with, and they said it was crystal clear.  I'm very happy to have a hands-free alternative that is better than a speakerphone.I did notice that you had to turn the volume far down on the phone to keep the speakers from being too loud, and I wish there was a volume control. When you then remove the phone from the device, you need to remember to turn up the volume again.

This is a great game! I bought it for my son at his request.  First, the awesome thing is that you can cook as a boy or a girl. The idea is that you are helping out your family in the food truck.  You also learn to clean.In the game, you go to different locations with your food truck, and make different meals. You are able to learn different recipes.  Cooking consists of the following activities:1.) selecting ingredients for the recipe from a pantry, a matching exercise2.) counting a number of items (say, carrots) and moving them to a scale, adding up to a goal number. A counting game.3.) slicing and cutting (hand-eye coordination)4.) cooking, which is mostly following instructions, like adding ingredients at certain times, flipping the food, and taking it off the heat.5.) selecting the right # of ingredients by recognizing numbers.  over time, these become small math problems. You start with recognizing the letter 5, then into two digit numbers like 13, and finally you see 5+5= and you have to select 10. My son got a bit stuck on the last one, but I explained he just had to choose the 5's twice.  It's totally do-able and teaches addition skills.The game doesn't require the child to know how to read, although I thought it would. It does require them to recognize numbers.At the end of the day, you have to clean the truck, put things away, and recycle the trash.  I like that part too!I think it's a really great game that grows progressively with your child's abilities, gives lots of positive feedback, and is apparently quite fun considering he keeps going back to play more (and usually he gets frustrated by games and stops playing after, say, 15 minutes).

I played this game with my son for one and a half levels to qualify myself to write this review.  He is four and a half years old, plus you have me as a "grown-up", with our perspectives.  First, I will say that this game is better for an older child - or at least a kid with really good hand-eye coordination.  Since we keep our kid away from tablets and phones, aside from the LeapPad, he isn't the best at "dragging and dropping".  He also is a bit behind on drawing, especially staying within lines.  So, given that, he found the game challenging and calls it "the hard game".  However, he enjoyed playing the game together, with me helping out from time to time.  With his small hands, he struggles to both operate the "A/B" buttons and the directional buttons in all games.  Ok, that aside, let me describe the game.It is an adventure game with a lot of creativity incorporated.  The main game is very much like Super Mario Brothers, with jumping on platforms, jumping on top of bad guys, and getting keys to open cages to save the good guys.  How it's different is that you have opportunities to add your own flavors.  At certain points, you can record your voice as part of the story, making up whatever you want to say within the context of the situation.  At other points, you can draw things that then become part of your game.  As an example, there are "hearts" you can pick up to get lives.  You get to free-form the look of your hearts.  Later on, you design the "lightning flowers".  For this exercise, you are led to trace the design of a flower, step by step, and then adding your own colored decorations.  Finally, there are coloring exercises where you color in, say, a car, before you can drive it.  You dont' have to do any particular colors - just pick whatever you like - as long as you put your stamp on it.  I really like the concept here, where kids get to have their own creativity.  As a kid, I had several games that let you "build your own game" and I always loved them, because they make you feel powerful and creativity.I really like how Leapfrog's games keep it easy enough for a kid to enjoy.  You never really "die" - if you run out of lives, you are disabled for a moment and you may not get a trophy for getting through the level with all your lives intact, but you don't have to start over.  You can't fall off platforms and "die".  It is a good entry point for video-game playing.  When I had to play the Atari 2600 as a kid, it was so difficult to learn how to use the controller and play games because they were designed for adults, so I appreciate that these games are made easier for kids to get a foot in the door.  (We're gamers, so we want him to learn to play games with us!)I really see my kid growing into this game over time, and it seems to have long-term appeal.
Works like a charm and throwing out the ugly wheel cutter right now.  This is attractive, easy to clean and you can really push down and cut.  Pitch the handled single wheels, this is the way to go.

Attractive set of plates and bowls.  The design is not precise but uneven and gives the plate a more casual, relaxed feel.  I feel they are just a tad fragile for an everyday plate unless you are very careful of chipping.

Nice lighter weight cover set for those without extreme weather conditions or needing easy to fold and store when not in use.  This Classic  cover line is like a quality raincoat for your furniture, not heavy canvas nor heavy lined, but still yet a very sturdy, vented and well gusseted protective cover. Color is slightly deeper, more towards a Coleman camping tent or Army green. Very pleased.

Low profile printer and scanner and worked fine for us.  Pics and document sent from iphone 6s and printed just fine and check your work on the lcd screen before wasting a bit of ink.  Not our first Canon printer and we have always gotten a long life from them.  Very nice photo quality printing.  I don't mind that it doesn't have a FAX.  I dont need the fax, who does anymore with how easy it is to send documents online or from iphones?  Just adds bulk.  This is thin and attractive and not space hogging.

I gave this Chromebook to my husband and now I'm jealous and want it back.  The more I played with it showing him how it works the more I fell in love with it.  The screen display is absolutely brilliant clear quality and true color. It is high definition or HD, and does have an HDMI port as well.  The sound or audio quality is clear and very loud for a small laptop/book device.  Keyboard is crisp and responsive.The Google search using the microphone and speaking into the Chromebook and asking what you would like to search for or find is extremely useful and never missed with us asking it questions.  This is a great feature to have on any of your laptops or this Toshiba Chrombook comes with it already downloaded.If you have always used Windows, one of the main things you will notice is this has no start button or menu. You go to Chrome emblem on bottom which opens the browser tab just as it would if you were using Mozilla or Internet Explorer/Edge.  In the upper right corner you click the menu looking box and opens your settings for mouse, keyboard, screen shot (you can take a pic of what is on your screen and save or mail, etc) in settings you can enable Bluetooth and connect to other Bluetooth devices, set up new users, and other preferences.  It is really simplified and kinda leaves you feeling a little unsure, but it really is quite a simple operating system.For  video chat you press the Launcher button that looks like a magnifiying glass and got to "hangouts" icon.  Does not use iTunes for music you got to Google Play Music to listen and shop for songs.You can have several individual users or sign on as guest.  No printer dialog you can do it through bluetooth or use the usb plug in.Does have a SD card slot, no CD or DVD drive but you do have the HDMI or use the internet for movies, also the "Google Play Movies".  Bluetooth enabled so you can connect with Blu-Ray DVD players and play Youtube music vids over the internet through your Bluetooth ready home speakers.Oh has a pretty darn decent forward facing camera as well which you can use for snapshots or the Hangout (Like Facetime)A sleek little outward appearance and a slight textured cover for easy no slip carry. Inside you have black keys on a gunmetal silver with a solid touch pad.  Battery goes on and on, I have yet to run out of power with intermittent charging you can sit for hours unplugged.All techies I am not going to be able to help you with your extreme tech questions, but as a simple average family experience this Chromebook has been fun and enlightening.  I imagine this would be a great choice for the older generations due to ease and safety.  Great for lounging around and reading the news, answering emails and searching new info.

Most algaecides have worked well for me but this one just seemed to be very fast and effective.  I cleared pool of all leaves, debris and kids toys, vacuumed bottom of pool to waste so I wasn't running the algae through the sand filter, then circled the pool pouring this in.  We just happened to have a 10,000gal pool so one bottle is all we needed. Went around with a brush and brushed all sides and the floor to upset and expose all algae to the chemical.  After circulating the water for 24 hours and filling up water level, I vacuumed to waste one more time the dead algae left on the bottom of the pool and filter back on to filtration.  Sparkling clear water not a moment of cloudiness.  Will keep this on hand for next years season.  Remember to keep dogs away from your pool to drink out of it or swim if they have swam in a pond or stream as their coats will reintroduce algae to your pool.  Every year I have to deal with this drama as we also have a large fish pond nearby our dogs love.

What a lovely Lenox version of Dr. Seuss's Grinch.  So tragic that during shipping this beautiful ornament was shattered and destroyed. However I can't give it 1 star because the shipper failed.  I hope you get yours intact, as it is a wonderful collectors item as you can see the detail in my photos.  Max is adorable and ornament catches his personality completely.

Fit my husband perfectly with generous sleeves and comfortable in the shoulders with good length to tuck in. I sometimes have to purchase him one size larger for bigger shoulders but this shirt was true to fit for his size and comfortable. He is not a big man, but very muscular and Army fit and this shirt is cut to give a clean line slight trim fit.  No threads hanging, buttons sewn tight a very nice quality of craftsmanship and a great price.  He does prefer a pocket on his shirts and this does not have one, but I wont hesitate to purchase this brand of shirt in the future for him.

Left a paid subscription for McAfee to switch back to Norton.  Had used Norton for years previous, and like an old friend as used on my first PC way back in the late 90's.  This operates flawlessly.  No bugs so far.  McAfee was more like a virus with programs not running and endless popups telling me to go update or not fully protected but would never update and the popups would be constant. AND Norton found a Trojan and Trojan 2 that McAffee did not!  Just nice to have something that works correctly as it should.

My daughter uses nearly daily for her college work and essays.  Has worked flawlessly on her Windows 10 operating system.  Had no problem with the key at all.  Plan to purchase another one for my home business. (This version is only usable on one PC)

Very inventive.  Easy to put together.  Lightweight and very easy to move it around with it on your floors. Love how the floor vac head will grab items, dirt, fuzz, or objects (like a dead beetle) right up next to the baseboards does not just merely shove it up against the baseboard out of reach.  A quiet but powerful motor.  Easy dump tank.  Best aspect for me is using the extension to get all the way in and behind furniture and appliances.  Very generous heavy cord.  the cord winder was a little in my way using as a crevice tool but still does the job.  I think you are going to be surprised how much this vac is going to help you get your dusting, vacuuming and deep crevice cleaning done.  To swap out the head, the dust buster, or use the crevice tool is extremely easy and convenient. You will look for more things to do that you normally don't get done routinely. Really love this vac.

I too did not receive Kulipari Tree Frog, instead I got Kulipari Ranger frog (series is based on poison tree frogs), a female character.  Cute collectors items for your kids.  If this is what they are into, then that's the value, not so much what they cost and the fact it's a tiny piece of painted plastic.

Excellent choice and amazing price.  If you research this brand, Asus, it has high accolades in consumer electronics and not an economy brand such as Acer.  The look and feel for an over 15" screen laptop is not bulky or square.  Extremely attractive, hinge is not flimsy, the entire laptop has a great feel and quality to it. The audio is really outstanding, loud and clear, you can play Youtube music videos while on the table or counter top and hear the music very well across the room, something my more Dell cant do. Set up took just under 10 minutes. Friendly language rather than commands used to guide you through the process so makes the experience of a new laptop even more exciting and fun. This is my daughter's laptop and she uses for college work. She uploaded Microsoft Office Home & Student 2016 and works great. Has the CD DVD RW tray, along with 2 USB 2 and 1 USB 3 ports. HDMI ready as well. Wireless connection easy. Bluetooth capability. Keyboard is quiet and smooth, and responsive, not clicky.  Operates on Windows 10 with Microsoft Edge and you are going to want to change the settings Edge opens with or you'll be force fed news feeds every time you start the Edge browser.  Sometimes you need a break from the world.  Click three dots on top right (not the cog wheel) and go to settings and down to "A specific page" and change to Bing or another search engine you enjoy or a homepage.Laptop has pretty decent forward facing camera. This laptop is not a touchscreen, and pixel display is not as sharp or deep as say a Sony or Dell laptop, but the colors look true and pretty good for a laptop priced so affordably!  One more small thing, comes in an attractive, easy to wrap Asus box for gift giving.

We use on our agriculture equine industry farming.  Tough gloves I can get through a lot more work with these than other gloves without wearing through the fingers.  Only had one tear when putting it on.  I wear under regular gloves if I know they are going to get wet so no staining on my fingers from the dyes.

I use these in the agriculture industry and in our kennel and have had no rips, tears and gloves are all uniform no irregulars and fit true to size.  Can take a lot of wear!  Very happy with this glove.

I use these in the agriculture industry medicating and treating livestock and equines.  They have great fit, do not rip under pressure and all gloves are uniformed and not irregulars.  Pleased with their performance.

This enchanting bowl brings that feeling of a happy, vintage Christmas of years ago.  Amazing beauty in the cardinal and design, just totally delivers the magic of an old tinsel, snowfall, fireplace crackling, Bing Crosby crooning, popcorn popping Christmas into your home.  This is also a very sturdy heavy bowl, not light weight nor delicate, it can take what you dish out.  Absolutely love this and will treasure it for years to come.  Heirloom quality.

Best tanning product ever!  So non messy, the applicator smooths across your skin.  I used latex gloves under the mitt applicator just to be safe, but no need really it washes off easily.  No built up areas on heels or between toes.  I accidentally had to leave on for way over 3 hours but was not a problem.  Beautiful golden, non orange or red tan.  Completely natural looking and smooth, nothing uneven or streaky AT ALL. I cant wait to do the rest of my face and body.  I had to wait because I just had surgery on my wrist for a very atypical mole that could've become melanoma that had to be removed surgically.  Forever I will need to get checked every 6 months by a dermatologist.  My days in the hot sun are over this was a big scare.  Put your sun screen on everyday and stay out of the sun without protection while sun is over head!!

Scents and aroma are subjective, but I feel if you want something that enhances your guy, not over powering or cheap smelling, this is the one!  My new favorite!

Wow this is nicer than I thought it would be!  Very attractive, easy to put up and move. Quality made and great idea for those of us who have had chronically ill young children that have to go to doctors a lot.  Would be a good gift idea for anyone in that situation with their young toddlers.  Not just about health it also teaches letters, etc as you place the dolls in various interactive areas of the clinic.  Heads up only comes with the Doctor Doug figure, no other figures are added although featured on the front of the box.

This is a classy, well made cloth case with good padding on both sides and quality zippers.  Has a tuck away sleeve on the side to carry workbooks or really just what ever.  This case is a beautiful blue, not a dark gray. Holds my Toshiba Chromebook 2 snugly, does not slip around inside.

Liked it. This book is written as tho you are sitting across the table from Burt in a conversation with him. I read his previous book, which was a bit more chronicled and organized, but was also very, very interesting, enlightening and entertaining.  This book is not a rewrite of the old book, there are tons of new stories about famous individuals and thoughts that are in this that add to, and compliment his first book. Will open your eyes to the Burt that is an extremely intelligent, thoughtful man not the silliness we see in the Bandit movies or Canonball Run, although he does have quick wit.  He does go for revenge in both books pretty blatantly, but figure we all would if we wrote a book.You will get more from this book if you read his first one beforehand which displays his personality more.

Product worked well and fleas were gone from my dogs under belly in a couple days. The applicator...meh, it gets the flea product all over the front of it and messy. I truly don't understand the need.  Kinda a gimmick I feel. The applicator bends over the top of the product packet to open but is that really hard to do manually?  I will continue to use Bio Spot but without the odd over thought applicator.
My husband takes these at the recommendation of our naturalist for his immune system support. He's had zero negative side effects.

My stepson thought this was an excellent glove.  He's a big guy with big hands and these were perfect sized, comfortable and can take a lot and protect you.  Heavy Velcro wrists steady and protect your wrist from impact.  Hitting surface is soft grain leather.  Attractive glove as well.  Attaching information on the interesting fill this glove has.

My son and husband use this, and absolutely no complaints.  Quality, flawless glove soft black leather.  Heavy hardware, no nylon straps, you get reinforced hardware and heavy duty chains ready to hook up.  They commented it was more heavy tight filled from other bags, as a woman it did not impact me too hard when I tried it due to the one inch foam under the leather this bag is wrapped in.  We don't kick but thinking of lowering it and trying it someday.  Really great fun for athletic families and has me intrigued to get into boxing and kick boxing more.

Absolutely the best there is!  For years I bought the double pack of Bounty napkins, those crinkly, crisp thin ones.  Just thought these were for tea parties and too expensive.  Not true, these are affordable, do a better job of absorption, soft and cloth like, a real treat!  I will never go back to any other brand. Tried the Chinet version and it is crisp, off white and just not the quality as Vanity Fair.

I give this to my worker for his son who is in high school preparing for college.  It is put together in a manner that is uncomplicated and easy to go along the chapters. He has not taken the TOEFL yet, but is much better prepared and learned a lot from this book.  Will keep him out of trouble as far as misunderstandings and provide for better communication with professors.  4 practice tests and CD included.  Tons of review.  This book a must have.

Pay attention parents!  Your schools and counselors are not going to get your kid prepared unless you educate yourselves as well and make sure your kids are getting the best of opportunities. The cousnelors and staff are not always looking out for your kid and helping them get into college with scholarships, advice, etc I have first hand knowledge.  It is seemingly assumed you have done this before, several degrees and even graduated from high school.  But high school steam rolled over my child, even tho a National Honor Society kid, and now we are playing catch up while she is in college.  But even for us this book is extremely informative and helpful as we go along every semester and very much still valuable but you are going to want this book if your kid is in any high school grade.  A must have!!  Remember, someone wrote it for a reason! The school systems are not going to hold your hand.  You need to be proactive!

Walked back in carpeted room hours after cleaned and room smelled fresh!  Does not fade fast like other cleaners.  Not a "pet" shampoo smell ether, it just smells a lovely fresh and clean like fabric softener.  Did a fantastic job cleaning the carpet.  Good choice and I will buy in the future.  Have 3 stinky hounds that live in the house with us. This works!

Bolder taste than Canada Dry.  Just a tad after taste but it is slight.  This is a great choice to get away from the harmful effects of Aspertame in diet drinks.  LOVE that it is caffeine free!  We have become such caffeine junkies but truthfully it is hard to find a restaurant or soda fountain that offers anything zero calorie that is caffeine free.  I hope the trend of more choices continues with drinks like this one.  This is pretty great in mixed alcohol drinks such as with gin.  However I feel the flavor is going to be off putting for some and still more tweaking on flavor needs done but high fresh carbonation makes this an easy drink to have.I also appreciate that my young Type 1 diabetic daughter can drink this and I won't have to worry about the aspartame effects on her body.

Works really well cleaning our carpets, not soapy and light fresh scent.  Rugdoctor has become a mainstream brand and not just for rentals.  While not Oxyclean the same premise that brightens and cleans laundry. Gets the stain and odor out and we were pleased using it in our Bissell cleaner.

Cute twist to typical stamp pads and keeps furniture and floor protected from regular markers and stamp pads.  Lights up according to the color you choose to stamp with, but you need your own batteries for this feature, DOES NOT COME WITH BATTERIES if you are gift shopping.  Grandaughter and her girlfriends stamped and then colored in the stamped caricatures with the included markers, and had a lot of fun with it.  A good rainy day arts and crafts for the younger kids or to take to other homes you might be visiting with young kids without worry of stains or scribbles off the paper.  This is a very sturdy set and still going strong after several weeks of use.
Big and bright, sounds and songs are great.  Sturdy, quality made Mega Bloks product.  We live on a farm and found this just absolutely adorable for our grandkids.

Ok, it does work, it did entertain, and love the thoughtful storage underneath for all the half balloons. Its really a lot better made than some of the reviews and the kids do love playing it.  Got to think like kids sometimes!

Looks very difficult to make and build, but it's not really and will entertain for quite a while.  For preteens and teens this is no problem to make, younger children, such as 7-9 years old will need help from an older sibling or parent but once shown, they do fine.  Very clever and fun!

Our grandsons and their friends played with this endlessly over the weekend.  Really put it through a lot and nothing broke or malfunctioned.  It is bold, bright, happy and loud!  The voice is very animated and very much like Lightning McQueen in the movie Cars, however the truck is off the Nickelodeon cartoon featuring Blaze. As adults you cant help but watch this do it's tricks over and over.  Like being at a Monster Truck show in your living room!  Super fun well constructed toy!

Big, soft, does not clog our toilets, except right after we have used a thin single ply and not use to slowing down and realizing we don't need a huge wad of this.  Seems to dissolve well as it is going down.  Big rolls last and not a constant chore of changing out rolls.  Treat yourself to this awesome 2 ply.  I like it better than White Cloud and Northern without a doubt.

I'm sorry, I really wanted to enjoy this book but it's just not enjoyable nor interesting.  If I had to take a shot at the premise behind this book, I would say a therapist has at some time asked her to write down childhood slights & sadness in a binder.  And that's how it reads, a hodge podge of brief stories and some of them just seemed more private and unnecessary really, and made me feel icky like I was peering into George's homes, which for him were his sanctuaries, where we all like to think we lead private lives.Most people can curse, you use expletives to highlight a situation or make fun or light of something.  She curses in a vile, hostile way meant to degrade and devalue others.  It repulses instead of adding anything to her story.This author is a product of the 60's, as am I, and I remember the strong feminist mantra that it was insulting to raise your own children in the 60's&70's.  She posts a couple paragraphs on how intelligent her mother was and far too smart to ever be a stay at home mom.  But this is 2015 and we all know better, and raising your own children rather than paying another woman to do it, is extremely valuable to society/community and the family and very intelligent well educated women are leaving jobs/professions to raise their children to return later if they choose.  Point being, there is just no evolution here in this author, like she is locked in the mindset, thoughts and agendas of the 60's. A bitter clinger.  No point to this book for me and felt creepy after reading it.  Poor George.

This is an affordable light cream that compares to my very expensive Bio Silk (clear thick liquid) in that my hair is silky and soft and clean looking after using.  My hair did not feel over gunked up or heavy and flat.  Easy to control pump and opaque cream product comes out in fine stream so no over loading your hand and wasting and no worries of a tipped over bottle that leaks.  Very light clean soap scent.

Perfect for the Harry Potter fans, this makes the best Hedwig and just the right size.  No moving beak but his head can rotate 180 with a plastic stick inside.  Large generous furry wings.  The eyes look real.  We love this puppet!

My daughter uses this along with the Benzac Mask.  She did say this can be a little drying and felt moderate results but at the same time admits diet and regime can dictate a products usefulness. This has been no less effective than the expensive prescription meds she has used in the past.

I found nothing as healthy and palatable for my cockatiels than the ZuPreem line of feeds.  I mix this with the ZuPreem Fruit Blend to give my birds variety.  Dump out the crumbs daily.  I won't feed anything else but these products.

My daughter likes using this mask.  Was not harsh or drying to the skin albeit the mask does dry very quickly.  She has very sensitive skin and had no reaction or problems using this on her skin.  She likes this product and feels it does help clean her face.

While the appetite suppressant aspect of this product works really well, the harsh laxative effects makes you miserable.  We are not talking "gentle relief".  I would love this product if it didn't prepare you for a colonoscopy.  I had to stop after the first day. This should be absolutely noted on the box that it causes cramping and diarrhea but it's no where.  The drink was nasty but do-able.  Capsules seemed fresh.  I'm positive you will lose weight with this, if not just for the running you'll do to the toilet.

My husband is a blacksmith and lifelong welder.  Here is his review:  Very nice wide screen, adjustment in the back is the best I've ever used.  Comfortable, absorbent, well padded forehead.  Longer neck guard keeps you safe from burns.  Just a great helmet and affordable price.

Used this morning and left my hair light, relaxed, not weighed down in anyway.  Nice Tresemme' scent.  Not watery at all, easy to get to your hair without losing any of it to the shower floor.  Really good product.

Scary as all get out.  Mouth can open or close.  Nice large size.  Part of series called Dragons.  This is Warrior, and there is Battering Ram, Runner, Fighter, Flyer, and Hunter.  These dragons are fierce!

Love everything about this pack  This is top of the line, amazing quality.  Tightly woven supple materials, thick smooth zippers, sturdy buckle, enough pockets and zippers for virtually any excursion, including airline travel.I don't understand the strap complaints at all?  They are very thick and cushy and have anti sweat cooling material on the inside of the straps and down the back of the pack where it sits on your back. I don't want any larger or cushiony straps for a day pack for sure.  For one it would look unbalanced and unnecessary, it's not a "hike the mountains" for a week kind of pack.  Love the ease of the pull down thumb straps to tighten and secure your load on your back.  Soft, thick lined or padded pockets for protection of your smart phones, tablets, & smaller laptops.My daughter is starting out her college semester with this pack, but we also will use for our day hikes, horseback trail rides, and airline travel.  This pack is rugged and made to last!  The orange is bright, I'd call it close to hunter orange and plan to use this when we ride our horses in the wilderness during deer season to carry water and basic needs for the day.  It never hurts to have plenty of orange on even if in no hunting areas.  The bottom a drab army green.  Bright, easy to find no matter where you stow it away.  Adding pics of me using it for a kayak trip.

Very clean scent and non sticky gel that I love for my hair.  Not too much, or too heavy.  TRESemme' makes the closest to salon products on the market yet grocery store priced and affordable in my opinion.

This cowboy "takes a hold of the reins". I liked his big presence or persona in the writing of this book. A good atmosphere set early on to listen and focus on what he is telling you (he doesn't suggest, he is firm.). Good lessons in why to farm out the work to good employees, but may have to continue their education if they ask questions or actions that they haven't really thought through (the Katelyn Rule). Sometimes employees just want to hear themselves talk, be acknowledged, and not really think about what they are asking or doing.He asks you to make a list of all your customers from a 12 month period, organize the list in descending order of revenue, split the list into four equal groups, noting the top 25% revenue and the bottom 25% revenue. Asks you to drop the bottom 25%, "the minnows", and focus on the 25% top, "the whales", and drop the minnows, even if the bottom minnows contain long, loyal clients. However any one of the whales could swim off, get caught in a whalers ship and made to blubber. While being a cowgirl myself, I was always taught to dance with the one that "brung ya". So in our business, we co-op the minnows, or rather make a "school of minnows" if you will, into the shape of a whale. All resources are put into that area for that day or time frame so no added expenses and the co-op pays off as one big whale and you take care of the ones that built your business from the ground up. But not my book.As I read deeper into the book, it felt like many of the companies he used as examples where sponsoring him and therefore he has to kudos their business in the book. I also felt this was a revenge book at times, but hey, if I write a book I will get revenge too. Not a problemThis book does have a lot to offer and I liked his style and was never offended by him at all if that matters. He does not come off as a "know it all" or pompous, more like he takes the bull by the horns (that whole cowboy thing again.) so he does keep you engaged, interested and absolutely you will find value in this purchase.

My hard working husband is using this deodorant stick.  He shoes horses all day and it is HOT here in the central plains.  This AXE product kept him dry, no wet underarms showing through his shirts so truly does keep you dry in the worst of conditions.  Product is not white and chalky but more a soft waxy product with blue tint. Has a pretty strong scent, a bit like Irish Spring.

This Classic Chutes and Ladders Board Game is the classic 1970s Board game many of us played as kids, No bells and whistles no computers. Climb up Ladders and slide down Chutes in the fun game of ups and downs. Your  character goal is to progress along and make it to square marked 100 first. it's not so easy to get there. If you land on a good deed, you go up a ladder, but if you land on the wrong spot (a bad deed) and you'll shoot down a chute! There are many interpretations of what it all means, but I think critics overplay putting to much meaning into it. The game teaches you that Good Deed's take you to where you want to go and bad one stake you backwards. You just Spin the spinner to move your Player piece. Its a very inexpensive game and fu for the whole family its for age 4 and up, and it fun for the whole, family.

I exercise outside just about every day and I tend to get chafing on my chest and between my fat (ham-hack like) thighs. So this Gold Bond Friction defense works perfectly. I got no chaffing at all now. I can highly recommend it.

I basically use this to walk, jog and also shovel snow.
