I am always ordering more for our family.  Great on cuts, bruises, as a mouthwash and more.
Exactly what we were looking for.  Durable and priced right!
Healthy,safe, and a must have for holistic homes.
Better than BenGay!  I always have a tube on hand for painful muscle days!  Also great when stiff from arthritis.
This is the most amazing thing ever!!  Great for kneading out those painful muscles...especially great for sciatica!  Strong, durable and easy to use!
everyone in business needs this book.  Go Pro is about focus and growth.
Exactly what we needed.

Works great!  Pretty comfortable and used often! I love the fact that I can use with the mic on my left or right, and the headphones don't bother my ears!  It is also lightweight, which is a huge bonus when using all the time.
Tony Robbins does it again.  Motivational and on point.  A must have reference!

These gloves are stylish and so comfortable!These are very comfortable Winter gloves. I am a 30 something year old woman with very large hands and these gloves fit me comfortably and feel so nice against the skin. They are not tight fitting, and they don't rub against your skin or feel like your fingers are rubbing against the inside of them. These gloves are black in color with blue designs and have a design that to me resembles pipes.In terms of how they handle water, I put these gloves on and then dunked my hands into a bucket of ice water. My hands stayed warm, but more importantly my hands stayed dry. Even though these are thick Winter gloves, my fingers still had plenty of flexibility and I was able to grasp things easily without having to remove the gloves.I love that there is a little clip that holds the gloves together. I cannot count the number of times that I have lost a glove, because they were not attached to each other. I also love the little "cuff" that comes up over the top of the gloves. It helps "seal" in the warmth of the gloves and prevent water from getting in through the top of the glove, even when the gloves are fully submerged in water. I also really love the strap that you can adjust to tighten the gloves in rain, snow, or water, and loosen them on a typical day around the city. The look and feel of these gloves is a "men's" glove style in my opinion, but I love the style, the extra warmth, and extra room that these gloves provide me as a female.At the end of the day, these are durable, waterproof gloves, that are super warm, and very comfortable. You can tighten or loosen them according to how much waterproofing and warmth you require.I received these gloves for free in exchange for an honest product review

This is a very luxurious looking Charmeuse silk scarfThis scarf is very beautiful. I received style B10633, the design appears to be set at night with couples sitting at tables at an outside cafe. The colors are dark blue, yellow, orange, and black. The design repeats itself over and over again on the scarf. The scarf measures 62" long and 16" wide according to my measurements.This scarf has the look and feel of luxury. The design is somewhat abstract the way it comes across, it reminds me of an abstract painting that you would find hanging in a museum. The feel of this scarf is heavenly around your neck. I also like to wrap it a few times and wear it around my wrist, as a wrist scarf.I have no experience with silk scarves, so I cannot speak about the quality. Since I am a newbie to silk scarfs, it would have been nice if the manufacturer would have included care instructions, as I have no idea how to care for a silk scarf.At the end of the day, it's a beautiful scarf that is a versatile addition to any wardrobe.I received this scarf for free in exchange for an honest product review

At first glance, these look like denim jeans, but notice the words "fake jeans" in the title of this product. These are actually denim printed jeggings, which is an interesting concept, but I'm not really sold on the ideaSizing:These jeggings will fit size extra small through size medium. The person who tested these jeggings for me wears a size small, size 6 in jeans, and I cannot imagine how these would fit someone who wears a size medium normally, because they were hugging her really tightly, definitely gave her a camel toe, and there was no way a size medium would be able to pull these jeggings up. She has a 27.5" waist and 36" hips for those who are trying to figure out if these jeggings will fit them. The measurements that these jeggings claim to fit are: waist between 22"-37"; hip between 26"-40", length of 34.5", and an inseam of 25"Comfort:The nice thing about these jeggings is they are breathable and lightweight compared to denim jeans. That makes them super soft and not stiff to wear and super comfortable. You can bend over in these jeggings without feeling like you are going to bust a button and you don't have to worry about forgetting to zip up your zipper. These jeggings are made of 55% cotton, 35% polyester, and 10% spandex. The material is stretchy and smooth and feels good on the skin. You don't get the chafing that you get with jeans with these jeggingsEven though these jeggings are breathable, they have a slim fit and a very tight fit. This could be seen as a good thing or a bad thing. On one hand, they have a very skinny, tight, slim fit to them that shapes your curves and makes your bottom look beautiful. On the other hand, they give you a pronounced camel toe and you can almost see the panties that you are wearing, and can depending on what type of panties you are wearing, right through the materialColor and style:I received these jeggings in the style Blue3. I love the addition of the leopard print cut outs here and there as well as on the back of the jeggings. It added a little pop of color, and makes these jeggings look awesome with a leopard print shirt, or just when you are carrying your favorite leopard print bag or purse aroundThese jeggings have a very distressed/old look to them. They look like they've been through the ringer a few times, or like they are your favorite pair of worn out old jeans. I know this is the look that the manufacturer was going for, but it's a very poor look overall, as the leopard print looks stylish and new and then the distressed look comes across as cheap and old fashionedThe worst part about these jeggings is the fact that they do not have pockets you can actually use. All of the pockets are "painted on" or already worked into the material. In other words, they wanted to make these look like jeans with functioning pockets, without actually making real pockets. This is a really dumb concept all the way around. Who wants to look like they have pockets, but have no pockets they can actually use? Definitely not the person that tested these jeggings for meThe button and other closures on these jeggings are also "painted on" or already worked into the material. They are all decorative elements, and definitely help lend to the jean look of these jeggingsCare:There are no care instructions included with these instructions that are in English. So I have no idea of how to care for these jeggings. I am so sick of manufacturers including care instructions in other languages, and ignoring their English speaking customersFinal thoughts:At the end of the day, these jeggings are not quite what I was expecting. While they fit my friend, they are super tight and show off a little more than she would like to. No care instructions included in English, no functional pockets, and the distressed feel all drop my star rating two stars for these jeggings. At the end of the day, they are a cute idea, but are maybe for a younger, hipper audienceI received these jeggings for free in exchange for an honest product review

These little fur wrist cuffs are so cute!I received this fur wrist cuffs in black. They are made out of 100% polyester. These would be appropriate for both older children 9+ and adults. I am in my thirties and I have a large wrist, and these fur wrist cuffs fit me beautifully. They have a very luxurious feel to them while you are wearing them. They are warm, soft, and really cozy. You can wear them on your wrists without gloves, or wear them above gloves to keep the gloves sealed around your hand and the warmth in.These fur wrist cuffs can be dressed down with a pair of jeans or dressed up with a nice coat. They are fancy enough that you can dress them up for holiday parties. They are extremely versatile because of the color. The black also does not allow dirt to show as well as I am sure the lighter colors would.My only complaint about this product is that no care instructions were included. Once this product is dirty, I have no idea how to clean it, and no idea how to care for them. I loathe when manufacturer's do not include care instructions or instructions in general with their products.At the end of the day, these little fur wrist cuffs will help keep your wrists warm all Winter long. They are comfortable, feel luxurious against the skin, and they look expensive.I received these fur wrist cuffs for free in exchange for an honest product review

This is an adorable little beanie hat and scarf set, and all though it's advertised as being for girls, I was surprised to find that it is more for the preteens through adults. I have a fairly large head (I'm in my thirties) and this set fit me perfectly. It is so adorable, and it doesn't scream little kid, which is really nice. I would recommend this for older kids 7+ and preteens mostly, though I'm really enjoying it myself!This cute little set has an adorable hat. The hat is a dark pink that is more dark, than bright, which is nice. The hat has a bright turquoise pom pom on top of it. The pom pom sticks straight up and does not flop around which is nice. The hat has an adorable little Minnie Mouse ears/head with a satin bow on of Minnie's ears. The hat is made out of 100% acrylic. The hat is super warm, comfortable, and looks great when you are wearing it. It does not feel heavy, even with the pom pom on top so you do not feel weighed down, something that is always a concern with pom pom hats.The scarf is just adorable. The scarf has a pom pom on each end. One of the pom poms is the same turquoise color that the hat has on top of it, and the other pom pom is the same dark pink as the scarf and hat. Like the hat, this scarf is made out of 100% acrylic. It's very comfortable, and it allows you to manipulate it in any direction, tie it any way you like, and it still looks fashionable. The scarf, even with the large pom poms on the end, does not feel like it weighs you down, or feel uncomfortable, whether you are wearing it over a coat, or without a coat for extra warmth. The scarf measures approximately 60" long and just about 5" wide. While the hat fits older children, the scarf screams young child and I cannot really see an adult wanting to wear it, maybe there are some that do, but it's definitely not my style. For kids though, it is the perfect amount of novelty without looking childish.I love everything about this set. This would make a wonderful gift for any child or tween. Teenagers will like it as well. The ONLY thing I would change about it, which is not enough to dock stars off of the rating of this product is that there are no care instructions written in English, so I have no idea how you would take care of this item, or wash it when the time comes. I'm really sick of manufacturer's not including English care instructions with their products, when they are trying to sell here in the United States.At the end of the day, this is a cute little set that will add some novelty to your winter wardrobe, or the winter wardrobe of that special young child in your life.I received this scarf and hat set for free in exchange for an honest product review

This is a cute little "do it yourself" ballerina figurine kit but there are some problems with the included paint and paintbrushThis is a really cute set that allows you to create two ballerina figurines. The figurines are made out of resin, and are really high quality. Neither of the figures had any cracks or chips when we opened the box. Unfortunately, the included paints and paintbrush are not very good materials to use with these figuresWhat's included in this kit:2 ballerina resin figurines - one ballerina is in a standing position dancing and the other ballerina is in a sitting position6 paint colors - these paints are NOT WASHABLE. Colors include: lavender, baby pink, skin color/light peach, bright yellow, light brown, and blackPaintbrush - plastic paintbrush that is pure junkProblems with this kit:Highly detailed figurines - the details on the figures are intricate and hard for young children to paint, especially with the included paintbrush. I recommend purchasing an ultra fine tip paintbrush. Due to the intricate details on these figures, I recommend them for ages 5-9+Paintbrush - paintbrush is low quality, plastic junk, the kind that you buy in bulk at the dollar store. The bristles fall out and it's incapable of painting the fine details on these figurines. The bristles also end up in the paint, making a mess on the figuresPaints - the paints do not work on the resin figures, period. They clump, they don't cover evenly, and they dry somewhat tacky. I recommend purchasing acrylic paints, which is what we did, and they worked fine. The paints are also NOT WASHABLE from hands, surfaces, or clothing. All Melissa & Doug DYO paints are this way, so I recommend purchasing some paint that you are comfortable with your child using and using it with all of the Melissa & Doug kits. If you do use the included paints, I would recommend that you have your child wear old clothes or an artist's apron, cover the work area with a party plastic tablecloth, and allow paint to dry on hard surfaces and then wipe it off with a Mr Clean Magic EraserAt the end of the day, these are adorable ballerina figurines, but the paints and paintbrush are inadequate

This is a cute little "do it yourself" zoo figurine kit, but I highly recommend purchasing your own paint and paintbrushThe concept of this "do it yourself" zoo figurine craft kit is a good one. The figures are made out of resin and are very high quality. The figures did not have any chips or breaks straight out of the box. The problem is that the paint included and the paintbrush included are not really suitable for use with the figurinesWhat's included in this kit:Resin tiger figurine - high quality resin figurine of a tiger in a crouched or laying down positionResin giraffe figurine - high quality resin figurine of a giraffe in a laying down/sitting positionPaintbrush - low quality plastic paintbrush that I don't recommend using6 colors of paint - non washable paints that stain clothing, hands, and fabric. Colors included: bright yellow, light peach/tan, orange-yellow, light brown, white, and blackProblems with this kit:Paint - the paint included with this kit is a joke. It does not stick to the resin figures at all. We even tried sanding the figures down slightly and the paint still would not stick. It's impossible to get even coverage with the included paint. We ended up purchasing acrylic paint at a big box store which worked perfectly for this kit. The paint included is also NOT WASHABLE which is a big no no with kids craft kits. It stains hands, clothing, and surfaces. To remove paint from hands, use an acetone free nail polish remover. To remove stains from tables and other surfaces allow to dry completely and then scrub over the stain with a Mr Clean Magic Eraser. Wear old clothes or an artist's apron to avoid paint stains on clothing. Cover your surface with a plastic party tableclothPaintbrush - the paintbrush included is a cheap plastic paintbrush, the kind you can buy in bulk from the dollar store. The bristles shed, and end up mixed in with the paint, the paintbrush doesn't paint evenly, and it's impossible to get the small details on these figures with the included brushSmall details - these resin figures have very small details like spots and stripes making them difficult for young children to paint themselves. I highly recommend an ultra fine paintbrush. This craft kit is best suited for children 5-9+ years old due to the amount of detail on the resin figuresAt the end of the day, the figures included in this kit are cute, but the paints and paintbrush are inadequate, buy your own and you can use them for all of the Melissa & Doug craft kits, which all suffer from terrible paints

This is a cute little "do it yourself" wooden plane craftThis is a cute little kit that allows your child to create their own wooden plane. The finished plane has wheels that really turn that your child will be able to wheel along the floor or a table.This kit includes:Wooden plane - the wooden plane is the color of natural wood with no pre-printed design on it. It is partially assembled and already has the front wheels on itWooden plane front wings - natural wood in color and are easily glued into the slot in the planeWooden plane back wings - natural wood in color and are easily glued into the slot in the planeWooden axle - natural wood in color2 wooden wheels - natural wood in color with black rims pre-painted on the outer edge of the wheels4 colors of paint - these paints are NOT washable. To remove paint from hands, use acetone free nail polish remover. To remove paint from table, allow to dry and use a Mr Clean Magic Eraser. Will not wash out of clothes, wear an old shirt or an artist's apron. Protect surfaces with a plastic party table cloth. Paint colors include: black, dark blue, red, and whitePaintbrush - cheap plastic paintbrush, the kind you can buy in bulk at your local dollar store. Not good for painting fine details. Bristles shed. Definitely buy your own paintbrush before attempting to make this kitSheet of 47 stickers - stickers that you can use to add details to your wooden plane. Stickers include: stripes, numbers, wheels, stars, lettering, bullseye, and moreWhite glue tube - tube of white glue, not strong enough to assemble this kitProblems with this kit:Stickers don't stick - the stickers do not adhere to the paint, whether the paint is wet or dry. They constantly fall off. I recommend using a paintbrush or a foam brush to apply a thin layer of tacky glue to the back of each sticker before putting them on your plane after the paint has driedPaintbrush is pathetic - included paintbrush is junk. Buy your own high quality paintbrush and you can use it with all of the Melissa & Doug DYO kitsGlue isn't strong enough - glue is not strong enough to hold the wings or the wheels in place. I recommend using tacky glueTips for a successful plane:Apply tacky glue to the edge of the wing that will fit into the slot only, do not try to apply the glue directly to the slot. Repeat this with the other wingFor wheels that will definitely turn, stick the axle through the opening in the plane, and then put a drop of tacky glue on each end of the axle to attach the wheelsAt the end of the day, this kit could use stickers with stronger adhesive, a better paintbrush, stronger glue, and washable paint to make it a better kit. If you buy some of your own supplies, it makes this kit a whole lot better!

This is a cute little "do it yourself" wooden princess carriage kit, but there are a lot of problems with itThis is an adorable little "do it yourself" wooden princess carriage kit that allows your little one to create their own wooden princess carriage. The finished carriage is made out of wood, and this kit gives you everything (sort of) that you need to create the princess carriage. This craft has a lot of small parts, including stickers, that I would not recommend for super young children. I would say the perfect age group for this craft is between 5-8 years old.This kit includes:Wooden princess carriage - the wooden princess carriage base is pre-assembled and the windows are already painted purple. The carriage is a natural wood color2 wooden axles - the wooden axles are un-painted and they are a natural wood color4 wooden wheels - the wooden wheels are a natural wood color and they have outlines of the outer wheel (or center wheel depending on your view of them) pre-printed on them24 stickers - the stickers are self stick stickers that are pre-decorated and meant to put small details on the princess carriage. You receive two sheets of stickers. One sheet is for the front of the carriage and one sheet is for the back of the carriage. The sticker sheets are exact mirrors of each other (printed in the opposite directions). Each sheet of stickers has the following stickers on it: 2 windows; window with a princess in it; 2 wheels; 2 squiggly accents; 2 hearts with a circle around them; regular heart; crown; and a door sticker. The stickers DO NOT stick once you paint the carriage, they will continue to fall off. I recommend that you use a paintbrush or a foam brush to apply a little tacky glue to the back of them and then add the stickers to the carriage, otherwise they will constantly peel off4 paint colors - the paints are NOT washable. They are made to paint on wood, and they paint evenly. Because of this, they do not wash off evenly. To remove paint from skin use non acetone nail polish. To prevent damage to surfaces, use a plastic party tablecloth. To prevent damage to clothing, have children wear an old shirt or a crafting apron. Paint colors included are: white, purple, baby pink, and a dark bluish-purplePaintbrush - cheap plastic paintbrush that you can buy in bulk at your local dollar store. Not good for painting small details. Bristles fall out. I recommend that you do not use the included paintbrushWhite glue tube - small tube of white glue that is pretty much useless in this kit. It's meant to hold the wheels on, but it is not strong enoughProblems with this kit:Stickers don't stick - the stickers do not adhere to the paint, whether you apply them when the paint is wet or after the paint has dried. I recommend using a paintbrush or a foam brush to apply a small amount of tacky glue to the back of each sticker, and then adhere them to the princess carriageGlue is worthless - the glue tube included in this kit is worthless. It is made to attach the wheels and axles, but it  just isn't strong enough. I recommend using tacky glue insteadTip to make sure your carriage rolls: Put the axle in the opening in the carriage, and then apply a drop of tacky glue at each end to attach the wheel, that way your finished carriage will rollAt the end of the day this is a cute kit, but the stickers could be stronger to adhere to the paint, the glue could be better, and the paint should be washable

This do it yourself kit is perfect for any mermaid fanThis is an adorable little "do it yourself" kit. This kit let's you make three different projects: a mermaid doll, a seashell mirror, and a starfish shaped box. All three of the items are made out of wood and have varying levels of difficulty. The easiest project to make is the seashell mirror. The second easiest project to make is the starfish shaped box. The hardest project to make is the mermaid doll. This kit contains small parts, and is not recommended for children under 3 years of age. I think the ideal age group for this craft kit is 4-7 or 4-8 years old.This kit includes:Wooden seashell mirror - pre-painted wooden mirror that is purple in color and in the shape of a seashell. The center of the seashell has a round mirror which is made out of safety glass so it does not shatter when droppedWooden starfish shaped box - small wooden box in the shape of a starfish that is natural wood color that does not come pre-printed or pre-designedWooden starfish shaped box lid - small wooden box lid in the shape of a starfish that is natural wood color. Comes pre-printed with the shape of a starfish on itWooden mermaid doll - wooden doll that looks like a paper doll, in the shape of a mermaid that is natural wood color. Comes pre-printed with the shape of the mermaid and all of the details from hair to scales on itWooden mermaid doll stand - small wooden stand that allows the wooden mermaid doll to stand up and is natural wood color15 gem stickers - tiny little self stick stickers which are somewhat raised/3 dimensional. The stickers are in the shape of stars and are bright pink and bright blue in color28 foil stickers - tiny little self stick stickers which are flat, and not 3 dimensional. Stickers range in size from super tiny to small and include seashells, starfish, stars, and pinwheels in varying shades of pink, purple, blue, and yellow7 colored pencils - mini colored pencils that are less than 1/2 the size of a standard colored pencil. Do not have erasers. Tiny, thin, and hard for little hands to grasp. One each of the following colors: lavender, sky blue, brown, bright pink, baby pink, yellow, and green2 glitter glue tubes - mini tubes containing glitter glue that can be used to add three dimensional outlines to any of the wood crafts in this kit. One each of the following colors: silver and bright blueWhite glue tube - mini tube containing glue that can be used to attach the stand to the mermaid wooden doll4 colors of paint - paints that can be used to decorate the three wooden craft projects included in this kit. The paints are NOT washable, and so plan ahead and have your kids wear old clothes. Mr Clean Magic Erasers work great on tables once the paint dries. One each of the following colors: baby blue, baby pink, bright pink, and lavenderPaintbrush - standard kids craft paintbrush that you can buy in bulk at the dollar store. Weak, flimsy, and does not paint small details. You are better off buying your own paintbrush. The bristles shed on this paintbrush as wellThe crafts and how you make them:Seashell mirror - the seashell mirror is pretty much "pre-made" you can decorate it with the sticker gems, the stickers, or with glitter glue, but only decorate the edges or you will not be able to see yourself in the mirror. This craft is easy for young children because there is no painting involvedStarfish box - a cute little trinket box with matching lid. The box is natural wood in color and is ready to paint. The paint covers the box nicely and the paint applies in even coats, even with the crappy paintbrush that is included. Even a young child can paint the box portion of this craft. The lid is a little trickier. It's pre-printed with a starfish design. You cannot paint on top of the design, or you won't be able to see the starfish outline. In addition to painting this box and lid, you can also decorate them with gem stickers, stickers, or glitter glue outlines. Younger children can decorate the starfish box and matching lid with the included colored pencilsMermaid doll - the hardest craft in this kit, the mermaid doll is pre-printed and the details are tiny. So tiny, that you need a fine tipped paintbrush if you are going to try and paint it (not included), but I recommend coloring the mermaid doll with the colored pencils which work nicely on the wood surface. The stand for the mermaid also needs painted or decorated with colored pencils, and then you use the included white glue to attach the stand to the bottom of the mermaid doll (in theory), unfortunately the glue was not strong enough and we had to use tacky glue to attach the stand. You can also decorate the mermaid doll with gem stickers, stickers, or glitter glue detailsProblems with this kit:You can't see the pre-printed outlines through the paint - if you have a child that insists on painting the starfish box lid and the mermaid doll, you'll quickly forget what those two items were, because you won't be able to see the starfish design or the mermaid's detailsPaints don't wash off easily - these paints work great on wooden projects, which is a good thing. But, they don't clean up easily, which is a bad thing. This paint is really hard to wash off of hands, tables, and will stain clothes. Let your kids wear old clothes or an art smock, cover the table with a plastic party tablecloth, and use non acetone nail polish to remove paint from hands. If your child does get paint on the table, once dry, it cleans up well with a Mr Clean Magic EraserNo pencil sharpener - there is no pencil sharpener included for the colored pencils. They are too small for an average pencil sharpener, and too large to fit in my mini pencil sharpenerMermaid doll tough to fit the base on - the mermaid wooden doll is really difficult to fit the base onto. You might need a piece of sandpaper to sand down the rough edge of the bottom of the doll so that it fits in the base without being tiltedGlue not strong enough - the included tube of glue was not strong enough to attach the mermaid doll base to the mermaid dollAt the end of the day, if you have a mermaid fan that loves crafting, they will enjoy this cute little craft kit from Melissa and Doug

This is the best song that I have ever heard by Phil Collins and my favorite song from the Disney animated movie Tarzan.You'll Be In My Heart is the ultimate love song, sung as only Phil Collins could sing it. Whether you are looking at the relationship between a couple, or the love between a mother and her child, this song will touch your heart and move you. This song is powerful. It reaches into the depths of the soul and talks about true love, true companionship, agape love, love without expectations, without boundaries, without conditions. Love that crosses divides, racial stereotypes, gender stereotypes, and is accepting, real, and powerful.This song shows the power of love and how everything in the world is different when you face it with someone, rather than alone. This is one of my all time favorite Disney songs. It is sung in a way that is moving, and the first time I heard it, outside of the movie Tarzan, it actually brought tears to my eyes, because I understand the kind of love that it's talking about. Once you feel that love, it's a feeling that you never forget.In terms of being a Disney song, this isn't the kind that you sing along to, or sing karaoke to, it's the kind of song that you sit back and let take you to a wonderful place that you have never gone before. I love this song, it is so beautiful!

This is such a powerful, moving song from the Disney animated movie MulanThis song is one of the best songs in the movie Mulan, second only in my book to Reflection. This song is much more upbeat than Reflection is and very easy to sing along to, which is exactly how a Disney song should be. The rhythm and tone of this song is very happy and makes you feel good inside.Honor To Us All is a song about turning an ordinary girl into a powerful warrior who everyone can be proud of. It's about meeting people's expectations and surpassing them with flying colors. It's about breaking away the molds and stereotypes that the world has set before you and coming out a new, better, proud person.At the end of the day, this is an inspiring and powerful song for anyone who is trying to spread their wings and break free of any situation that is holding them back or holding them down.

I am a huge Disney fan, but I dislike the movie Mulan. Even disliking the movie Mulan, I love this song. It is by far, my favorite song on the Mulan soundtrack.If you've ever had one of those days where it seems like everyone's expectations of you are running super high and your opinion of yourself when you look in the mirror is the complete opposite of the expectations, then this is the song for you. This song talks about not being able to see what others see in you as a person, as a human being, as a daughter, etc. This is a song about trying to figure out how to raise your own self esteem within the events that are going on in your day to day life.Christina Aguilera's voice in this song is beautiful. The song has a beautiful tone and rhythm. This song is a great song for anyone who feels lost in themselves. It's definitely one of the top Disney songs of all time!

This is a very short little introduction type of song that introduces the story of Hercules in the Disney animated film HerculesThe voice work done in this little introduction is awesome. It's super short (around 30 seconds) which can stink if you don't buy the entire soundtrack and are purchasing songs individually. This introduction sets the stage in ancient Greece, and talks about Hercules. This is more like an introduction of events to come, then a song that is really about anything in particular.At the end of the day, if you are looking for a quick song that introduces the story of Hercules, than this is the song to go with, otherwise, skip this song, especially if you already know the story.

This is a very short song from the Disney animated film HerculesThis song is sung by one of the Muses in the Disney animated film Hercules. This particular song is sort of depressing, and is about not ticking off one of the most powerful Gods, which is Hades (in the movie). They talk about Hades personality, how he's mean and ruthless, and how he didn't get along with people who were in the Underworld.This song sets the stage for Hades plan. It lasts just about 59 seconds in length and is one of three parts of "The Gospel Truth" which hashes out Hades plan for the character of Hercules in the movie.At the end of the day, there are some pretty decent songs in the movie Hercules, this is not one of them.

This is a short little song from the movie Hercules.This song has a nice little rhythm and tune to it, but it's way too short for a song. It's only a minute and five seconds in length, and is a very, very short part in the Disney animated movie HerculesThis song is all about how Hercules became mortal, but how it didn't change who he was as a person. It talks about his parents crying when they found out that he was no longer immortal, and how he was different from the other children all because of Hades.It's sort of a depressing song, and you can feel both of his parents pain in this song. It's definitely not the "always positive", "always happy" tone of a Disney song that I am used to, and definitely could be longer!

I had high hopes for this homeopathic remedy for Sciatica, but unfortunately, this product did not do anything at all for my Sciatica pain. I am currently suffering from Sciatica pain. I have Fibromyalgia, so any activity that is above and beyond normal activity, and any strain on my back tends to cause Sciatica to flare up. The pain is excruciating. Pain medication doesn't help with Sciatica pain and muscle relaxers do nothing to help the discomfort. I saw my doctor, and unfortunately the only advice was heat, gentle stretches, and rest. Of course, that's all fine in my book, but when it feels like you are sleeping on a bed of nails all the time, it's hard to rest.When Naproxen Sodium and Tylenol failed to help with the Sciatica pain at all, I turned to homeopathic remedies. The reviews on this product were mixed between completely helping and not helping at all, so I decided to take a gamble and try this product. I have a lot of allergies, so I carefully studied the ingredients in this product and determined that none of the ingredients would cause an allergic reaction. These tablets dissolve under your tongue, but they are not acid tasting, and do not taste like dissolved aspirin when they dissolve, in fact, they don't have much of a flavor at all, which I actually prefer. The tablets are somewhat gritty as they are dissolving, and I often find little pieces of the tablet stuck between my teeth, or my tongue finds one in the back of my mouth long after I took the tablets.Sciatica Therapy tablets are completely homeopathic, they don't contain any actual modern medicine of any kind, just all natural ingredients. They are recommended for ages 12 and up. You need to dissolve 1 tablet under your tongue up to 3 times a day and not swallow the tablet whole. You can actually use the tablets up to 6 times a day if needed, according to the product's label. It recommends that you take Sciatica Therapy 10 minutes before or after eating or drinking. The bottle does warn that it may not be effective for everyone. There are 70 tablets in the bottle.Active ingredients in this product are:Arnica Montana HPUS 6x, 12x, 18xColocynthis HPUS 6x, 12x, 18xGnaphalium polycephalum HPUS 6X, 12x, 18xHypericum perforatum HPUS 6X, 12x, 18xKali iodatum HPUS 6X, 12x, 18xMagnesia phosphorica HPUS 6X, 12x, 18xRhus toxicodendron HPUS 6X, 12x, 18xInactive ingredients in this product are: Advantol 300, Lactose, Magnesium Stearate, Mannitol, Microcrystalline CelluloseThe first thing that you need to know about this product is that your Sciatica will actually get worse when you start taking this product. The product even warns you that your symptoms may worsen. I am not sure if the product itself actually worsens the symptoms, or if the progression of Sciatica is just what makes the condition more painful, but I definitely noticed an increase in my Sciatica pain once I started taking this product.The second thing that you need to know about this product is that it's not a quick working miracle homeopathic remedy. People who claim it works in a couple of days, are probably completely lying, or fooled by the way that homeopathic remedies are "all in your head" because this medication takes weeks to months to become fully effective, according to the manufacturer's own website. So, if you feel some relief right away, it's probably more in your head than actual relief, but if that sort of thing works for you, then all the power to you, I wish I was that lucky.When I first started taking this product, I felt absolutely nothing. There was no decrease in pain, there were no side effects, it was basically like I had taken a tablet made of nothing. I really wanted this product to work because of the amount of pain that I was in, but this product never did work for me. I continued to take the product for six weeks to no avail. I did feel more pain in the beginning when taking this product, but I think that was because of the Sciatica itself, and not these tablets. I also found out that it did not make a difference if I took 3 tablets a day or 6 tablets a day, that the end result was the same...no results at all.I continued taking the bottle until it was gone and purchased a second bottle. I got half way through the second bottle before I completely came to grips with the fact that this product was never going to relieve my Sciatica pain, so I finally stopped taking it. During the time while I was taking this product, I used a heating pad on my back with moist heat in 20 minute intervals, lots of rest, and gentle stretches. Those things provided some relief at first, but now, over 6 weeks into the Sciatica, the pain is still just as bad as it was on day one, and I'm still miserable.Products like these work for some people and don't work for others. This could potentially be a good product, but it's definitely not the right product for me, and I did not get any relief from taking this product.

If you love Peanuts and you love taking baths, then you will want to check out this Peanuts Bath Squirt toy set.This bath toy set includes three squirting toys: Charlie Brown, Snoopy, and Lucy from the popular Peanuts cartoons and comic strips. Charlie Brown is the tallest of the three toys measuring approximately 4.75” tall. Lucy comes next in height, and she measures approximately 4.5” tall. Snoopy is the shortest of the three characters and measures approximately 3.5” tall. Charlie Brown and Lucy are dressed in their classic outfits from the Peanuts comic strip and shoot water out of a small hole located on their mouths. Snoopy is clutching Woodstock in his arm, and has his eyes closed. Snoopy squirts water out of a small hole in his hand.Like all squirt toys for the bath tub, these adorable little toys are subject to mold growth inside. To prevent mold growth inside, you can do one of a number of things:1) Bleach water – mix 1/4 parts bleach water with 3/4 parts water into a small dish pan and dip the toys in, fill them up with the bleach water, and then squirt them until empty2) Hair dryer – after each bath, squeeze as much water as possible out of the squirt toys and then use the hair dryer on the low setting, right over the hole to dry out any remaining waterThe best way to make sure that your squirt toys don’t grow mold is to make sure that you squeeze as much water as possible out of the toys after each bath. I would love to see squirt toys that had little “plugs” that were removable that would enable you to remove them after bath time and let the remaining water drain and dry out. That would certainly make life easier.In terms of how these squirt toys compare with other squirt toys, they are easy to fill with water, just by submerging them. You don’t have to squeeze them to fill with water. They are also pretty easy to make squirt, and don’t require a lot of hard squeezing to make water come out of them. Unfortunately, due to the placement of the holes on these squirt toys, using a hot glue gun to plug the holes does not work like it does with other squirt toys.At the end of the day, I’m not really a fan of bath squirt toys, because of the mold factory, but these little characters are adorable both inside and outside of the bath tub.

This is an adorable little Peanuts figure set that would make an adorable gift for a Peanuts fan, or an adorable cake topperThis set includes the following: Snoopy figure, dog dish filled with bones, dog house, and Woodstock figureThe Snoopy figure is really adorable. He looks just like Snoopy from the Peanuts cartoons. The Snoopy figure measures approximately 2" tall. The dog dish is green in color and is piled high with plenty of dog bones from Snoopy to enjoy. The dog dish with bones measures approximately 2" tall to the very top dog bones and slightly shorter than Snoopy. The Woodstock figure is really cute, it is Woodstock in his nest, and measures 1.5" tall including the nest. The dog house is just over 4.5" tall. The dog house opens, but not really the way you would expect it to open.Snoopy is definitely the best figure in this set. Snoopy has arms that can move, his head can turn from side to side, and he's in a standing position. While Snoopy's legs do not move, and you cannot make him sit down, he can stand on top of his dog house. You can also balance the dish of dog bones or the Woodstock figure inside of it's nest on top of the dog house.I have two main problems with this Snoopy set:Woodstock - Woodstock while adorable, does not come out of his nest, this limits his play value immenselyDog house - the dog house opens up. I was thinking that it would be kind of a door that swung open, but this is not the case. It actually opens sort of like a hinged box, the top half of the dog house including the lid is on a hinge and it pops open to reveal the inside of the dog house. Because of this, you can't just walk the characters into the dog house. It would have made more sense to have a door that swung open on the front of the dog houseAt the end of the day, this is a cute little set. It would look adorable on top of a birthday cake or sitting on an adult's desk at the office. The figures are small, but really capture the look of Snoopy and Woodstock from the Peanuts cartoons

This Spongebob Squarepants Kooky Klicker pen is adorable! I am a collector of Kooky Klickers pens. For those who are collectors, this pen is number 001 Spongebob Squarepants and is part of the Spongebob Squarepants Series 1 collection of Kooky Klickers pens. Kooky Klickers pens are fun pens with a face on them that have a Koosh ball on top of each pen.This Kooky Klickers pen is bright yellow in color. It has the face of Spongebob Squarepants on it, and is very detailed. The face even has Spongebob's teeth and tongue. The expression on Spongebob Squarepants face is priceless on this pen. The Koosh ball portion of this pen is shades of green, blue, and yellow. Like all Kooky Klickers, this pen is narrow at the top and bottom and wide in the middle. It's also refillable. To refill this pen you just have to unscrew the stem attached to the Koosh ball portion of the pen and pop in a Kooky Klickers refill. This pen writes in black ink like all of the Kooky Klickers pens.This Kooky Klicker's pen has a metal clip so you can attach it to a purse or backpack. I love the way that this pen looks. Keep in mind that the design is only printed on one side. The backside has the Kooky Klickers symbol/logo, the name and number of the pen, and the series name and number. I wish Kooky Klicker's pens were double sided.In terms of how long the ink lasts in this pen, it's fairly average for a Kooky Klickers pen, the ink lasted 29 days with daily use. For a Kooky Klickers pen that is about average, some last longer and some last a lot less time. It depends on how many times the pen was scribbled with in the store and how full the ink stick was when it was placed into the pen.At the end of the day if you are a Kooky Klickers collector, or you just love Spongebob Squarepants, you will love this pen. This pen would make a great stocking stuffer, Easter basket filler, or party favor.

This digital kitchen timer from Bwert would be the perfect kitchen timer if they corrected a few simple thingsThe main thing I love about this digital kitchen timer is the size of the digital display. I love how large the numbers are, and how I can see how much time has passed or how much time is left from across the room. The display size is what every kitchen timer should have in my opinion. Even though there is a large digital display, the numbers on this timer can be confusing. I don't know what font the company used, but the 2 looks like an 8 from a distance, and many of the numbers are either more rounded or more square than they should be and it can be hard to tell which number it actually is. That's the only reason I am docking one star from this timer.I LOVE the alarm that this kitchen timer has. You can hear it from across the room or in the next room, and even from the bathroom. Granted I live in a place that is under 1,000 square feet, but even with the bathroom door closed, I can still hear the timer in the kitchen which is great, and it's much louder than other kitchen timers that I have tried. The alarm is not so loud that you need earplugs when it goes off, but it is loud enough that the neighbors hear it if I let it beep for too long, just an FYI if you live in a small space or have close neighbors.You can use this as both a kitchen timer to count down the time until something is ready or as a stop watch to count up until you reach the desired time. There are three buttons, one for minutes, one for seconds, and a start/stop button. I generally prefer the digital timers that have numerical keypads, which makes setting them much easier, but this one is really easy to set, even with only a minute and second button. The numbers don't run too fast, so you do not go past the time that you are wanting to set it for, something that I have experienced with other timers.The backside of this timer has a strong magnet on it. The magnet holds this timer easily on both the refrigerator and the filing cabinet. It also has a stand on the backside when you are not near a magnetic surface. The stand is durable, and I don't knock this timer over like I do other kitchen timers when I use them in stand mode.I love the color of this timer, the pretty blue looks great in the kitchen or out of the kitchen. It doesn't look white and sterile like a standard kitchen timer, or the ones that I am used to. It looks more like a pedometer or fancy stopwatch then a kitchen timer...which is a good thing. This kitchen timer runs on 2 AAA batteries which are not included. I am not sure how long the batteries will last, but if it's anything like other kitchen timers, I don't think I'll have to replace the batteries for a very long time.One feature this timer has that other kitchen timers I have tried do not have is a memory. When you turn the timer back on, similar to a thermometer, it shows you the last timer setting. This is handy if you want to repeat a recipe's cook time. I have also found it handy to have the stopwatch like function on counting. This timer will count up to 99 hours before it tops out and comes with a 90 day warranty.If the manufacturer fixed the difficult to read numbers, this would be a five star digital kitchen timer.I received this timer for free in exchange for an honest product review

This is a pretty basic zombie killing gameThe object of this game is to kill all of the zombies. Killing a zombie is a three step process: aim at the zombie using your stylus or finger; touch the target that appears to zoom in on the zombie; and touch the fire button. I'm either really bad at this game, or there is a strong learning curve to it because I found that I had to fire again and again to hit a single zombie. This was really frustrating, which is why I gave this game four stars instead of five.I found that more often than hitting zombies, I would hit innocent bystanders by knocking them over. I didn't like the idea that innocent bystanders could be killed, but hey, it's a game about zombies, it's not like it's a game about fairy tales. I enjoyed the fact that this game is not disturbing or overly gory and bloody.Compatibility wise, this game worked with my ASUS Memo Pad tablet; my Verizon Ellipsis tablet; and it worked with an Android game player on both the iPad and the iPhone.At the end of the day, this is a basic zombie killing game. There are not a lot of pesky ads in the way and game play is simple enough that a child could get the hang of it.

This is the original Kikkoman Soy Sauce. It's very tasty but also very salty (most soy sauces are) so use it sparingly if you don't want to suffer from high blood pressure/high sodium levels.I love this soy sauce. I use it all the time in recipes that I am making for other people, as I am no longer able to have this variety of Kikkoman Soy Sauce due to allergies. This Soy Sauce tastes wonderful on both white rice and when used in fried rice recipes. I love putting it into fried rice made with egg, and it tastes fantastic on scrambled eggs as well, whereas some Soy Sauces overpower scrambled eggs. One of my favorite ways to use this Soy Sauce is when I'm making "gourmet hot dogs" (I know, those two words should never be used together). I put a tablespoon of the Soy Sauce inside of a skillet and then I coat the pan in it, and dump the hot dogs in, and coat them in the charbroiled Soy Sauce as they are cooking. It gives hot dogs a heavenly taste that even adults love. I've also added this Soy Sauce to BBQ sauce recipes, used a basting brush to "paint" it on hamburgers on the grill, and it's awesome in beef noodle soups. I've used it to create my own version of Top Ramen as well.While Kikkoman Soy Sauce adds a lot of flavor to a variety of foods, it is really high in sodium. If you use too much of it, all you will taste in your dish is salt. I have ruined a few dishes by adding too much. Always add less than you think you will need to start, and then add more later for flavoring if necessary, otherwise you can end up with flavor overload.In terms of ingredients, Kikkoman has always been known for simple ingredients. It used to be just water, wheat, soybeans, and salt in their Soy Sauce. Now however, there is less than 1/10 of Sodium Benzoate added to the ingredient list and it's used as a preservative. A serving size is considered 15ml which is roughly 3 teaspoons. I cannot imagine using 3 teaspoons on rice or regular recipes, as that is a lot of Soy Sauce. That 15ml serving size has 10 calories, 2 grams of protein, and 920 mg of sodium. That's a lot of sodium.The flavor of this Soy Sauce is rich, flavorful, and extremely salty. Go easy on it, and use it sparingly, it's great in recipes or as a stand alone topping on rice.

This is an adorable Hallmark Ornament of the Cat In The Hat.I love this cute little Cat In The Hat ornament. Unlike some ornaments that scream "Christmas", this ornament has nothing about it that is related to Christmas at all. The Cat In The Hat is sitting down, and he's holding a blue book "reading" the book. The problem that I have with this ornament is that the Cat In The Hat's eyes are closed. Seriously, how can you read with your eyes closed! This ornament would have been so much better if his eyes were open.I had originally purchased a dozen of these to pass out on Read Across America day in March 2016, but when I found out the Cat In The Hat had his eyes closed (I didn't check the photos out ahead of time) I ended up returning them all. I didn't even keep one for myself and I'm a huge Cat In The Hat fan.In terms of quality, this ornament is below Hallmark quality, like a lot of the mainstream Hallmark ornaments are these days. It looks like one of those $5 big box store ornaments and not really like a Hallmark ornament. The Cat In The Hat's fur is painted unevenly, meant to look like fur, but it just comes out looking like clumps more than anything. The book is painted unevenly and some of the blue of the cover runs into the inside where the Cat In The Hat is reading.At the end of the day, this is one of my least favorite Cat In The Hat ornaments to date. The poor quality doesn't say Hallmark to me, and the fact that his eyes are closed doesn't make much sense.

I saw this puzzle at Disney's California Adventure Park inside of a gift shop, and I knew it would be perfect for a special puzzle lover in my life. I sent it to her last Christmas, and I couldn't help but purchase a copy for myself as well. When I purchased the puzzle at DCA, the clerk said that it was a "hard puzzle" which is one of the reasons why I purchased it. I love a challenging jigsaw puzzle.The puzzle pieces for this puzzle are very small, but I'm used to that with most large puzzles these days. This is a 1,000 piece puzzle, and the box literally has the nerve to say ages 3 and up on it. After having worked with preschoolers the majority of my life, I can say, without a shadow of a doubt, that there is no way that a 3 year old could put this puzzle together, not even with the help of an adult. If I had to put an age group on this puzzle I would say 12 and up, yes, it's that difficult. It is definitely a jigsaw puzzle for adults and teenagers who like a challenging jigsaw puzzle.The finished puzzle measures 18"x26". The size is weird. I would have preferred 18"x24" because I make puzzles and then frame them, and an 18"x24" puzzle would have fit in a poster frame. This puzzle does not fit in a poster frame, nor did it fit any normal sized frame that I could find, at a craft store, big box store, or a frame store. I had to get a frame that was larger and then put a mat around this puzzle to frame it, otherwise I would have had to spend a small fortune to get a custom frame made. Just something to keep in mind if you like to save your puzzles. This puzzle handled puzzle glue well and did not cause the pieces to bend or warp, the designs to fade or bleed, or the finished puzzle to look glazed or shiny.Putting this puzzle together is a challenge. The pieces are small and there are 1,000 of them. The border is not a straight border like you might be used to, and is instead decorative. I found the border to be one of the most challenging parts of this puzzle. Additionally, the puzzle itself is difficult to complete because you don't have a finished picture that is large enough to see detail on, of what the puzzle should look like. There is a picture on the front of the box, but the detail is so small, that it really doesn't help you much with which puzzle pieces go where. If you know Disneyland Park like the back of your hand like I do, you will find this puzzle easier than those not familiar with the park. This would have been a better/easier puzzle if they would have included a poster inside that showed the finished puzzle.The pieces fit together smoothly and do not come apart while you are assembling the puzzle. The pieces did not bend or curl while putting together the puzzle. There were no pieces missing when I built this puzzle. Even though the pieces are small and there are 1,000 of them, this is definitely not an impossible puzzle and I found it easier than the Disney Photo Mosaic Puzzles, which I have come to loathe as they seem to take forever to put together.At the end of the day if you have a Disneyland fan in your household, he/she will love this puzzle. It comes out looking like a map of Disneyland and is a bright, colorful, and challenging puzzle.

When I started taking Doctor's Best CoQ10, I had only just learned about CoQ10. I found it on a website for solutions for high blood pressure, and was delighted to find the Doctor's Best brand here on Amazon. I was experiencing high blood pressure due to eating habits and stress, and I was not able to control it on my own. The doctors wanted to put me on medication for high blood pressure, but bad experiences with Hydrochlorothiazide in the past left me skeptical and not wanting to go on medication. Weekly visits for blood pressure checks were becoming annoying at best, and I knew I had to find a solution.CoQ10 first impressions:My first impression of CoQ10 was that I did not feel anything. No side effects, no benefits, my blood pressure remained the same, and it felt like I as taking nothing at all. I did not change my eating habits, as I did not want to, and I did not change my exercise habits either. The Doctor's Best CoQ10 soft gels were easy to swallow, a good size, didn't leave an aftertaste in my mouth, and didn't have to be taken at a certain time of the day. Still, I thought I was wasting my money since I felt nothing at all.CoQ10 second impressions:My second impression of CoQ10 came 72 hours after my first dose. My blood pressure started to stabilize itself. Blood pressure readings of 185/129 were now down to 128/87, and I felt like my blood pressure was, for the first time in a long time under control. If I missed a dose, I could see a difference in my blood pressure. At the advice of my pharmacist, I started taking Doctor's Best CoQ10 once in the morning and once before bedtime. I could definitely see the difference in my blood pressure.As time went on while taking CoQ10:As time went on, I found that my blood pressure was staying under control all of the time. Readings were consistently in the 125/82 to 129/87 range, and I was happy with the results. Swallowing two soft gels a day was no big deal in the grand scheme of things, and CoQ10 had become a part of my everyday vitamin and mineral routine. I was not sure if it was a placebo effect (I thought it was working) or if it was actually working. So, I decided to stop taking it, for three days, and I had nothing but high blood pressure readings in the 185/130-200/150 range. It was definitely working, and I was definitely now a fan of CoQ10.Research:I don't like to put anything in my body that I don't understand, and I knew nothing about CoQ10 when I first started researching it. CoQ10 is a naturally occurring coenzyme in the body that acts as both an antioxidant and helps with cell growth. It is found in some foods, and is strongest in animal organs like liver and kidneys...two things I wouldn't eat if I was on a deserted island starving to death. I also found out that it is found in peanuts and beef, two foods that I eat occasionally, but definitely not enough to be beneficial in the long run.The medical claims associated with CoQ10 seemed to go on forever, it claimed to be good for everything from cancer to muscular dystrophy, but it's main claim was that it helped with having a healthy heart and high blood pressure, which is the main reason I started taking it.What about side effects:I hate medication side effects. I am pretty much allergic to EVERYTHING under the sun, and so I always worry about side effects when taking a new medication or supplement for the first time. I have not experienced any side effects while taking this medication. Generally I experience some minor side effects from every medication that I take, but I have had zero side effects while taking CoQ10, making it even easier to take it day after day.For those worried about side effects, side effects possible with CoQ10 supplements are: abdominal pain, dizziness, fatigue, headache, heartburn, increased liver enzymes in the body, irritability, mild insomnia, nausea, rash, and sensitivity to light.Does it interfere with other medications:I always worry about medication interactions. I take a lot of medications including Elavil, Tolterodine, and many acid reducers for heartburn like Cimetidine and Pepcid Complete. I have experienced zero drug interactions with CoQ10 and have not had it affect any of my medications. If you are taking high cholesterol medications or medications that lower your blood sugar you should talk to your doctor before taking CoQ10 and the same goes for those on insulin and blood thinning medications.What happens if you don't get enough CoQ10:Not getting enough CoQ10 can result in aching joints, aching muscles, angina, arrhythmia, bad gums, fatigue, heart failure, high blood pressure, and stomach ulcers.How much CoQ10 should you take:There is no official recommendation for how much CoQ10 the body needs. My pharmacist suggested one capsule twice daily, which is 200mg of CoQ10 a day. The average recommendation is 120mg per day. Doses of up to 1,200 daily have been recorded, and toxicity does not occur until you reach a dose of 3,600mg or more daily.What are the ingredients:I have a lot of allergies, so ingredient lists are very important to me. I have not had any reaction to the ingredients in the Doctor's Best CoQ10. The ingredients in this product are: Coenzyme CoQ10-100mg; Black pepper fruit extract BioPerine-5mg; extra virgin non gmo olive oil; beeswax; soy lecithin; rosemary oil; softgel capsule (gelatin, glycerin, and purified water). Something to keep in mind if you have allergies is that Doctor's Best CoQ10 contains soy ingredientsContinued experience:I have now been taking Doctor's Best CoQ10 for a little over two months. I no longer suffer from high blood pressure, even when I'm stressed out. I have not changed my diet or exercise routines. I eat what I want, and I enjoy no longer having to go to the doctor on a weekly basis for blood pressure readings. I monitor my own readings at home, and the readings have been spot on in the range that I would like them to be 122/83-129/87. I definitely feel like CoQ10 is beneficial for lowering blood pressure, but I cannot attest to it working for other medical conditions or claims that CoQ10 products in general make.Packaging:My biggest complaint, and the reason for a four star rating instead of a five star rating of the Doctor's Best brand of CoQ10 is the packaging. The packaging is a white bottle with an orange lid. The lid has this flap that lifts up. After lifting the flap normally, only twice, the flap broke off. Once the flap is broke, it does not go back on the bottle tightly, so the soft gels become rock hard. I had this happen to the first bottle I bought, and I ended up dumping the second bottle into an old vitamin bottle when it came because the lid on that one broke day five. I use other bottles with lift a flap style lids and I have never had a problem with breakage. It always breaks at the hinge, so I definitely think it's the bottle design and the cheap plastic that is the problem. If you are going to buy the Doctor's Best brand of CoQ10, I recommend that you pour the soft gels into a separate bottle as soon as you receive itAt the end of the day, I'm happy with Doctor's Best CoQ10 supplement. If they changed the packaging, this would be a five star supplement.

I have purchased many different brands of acrylic soap dispensers over the years. Some last a few weeks, some last a few months, and some last a few years. They all have basically the same design, and they all suffer the same problem...the pump is fine but the acrylic container that holds the soap cracks. For years, I tried to figure out what the problem was, and then I talked to someone who makes acrylic fish tanks, and I found out that the problem is actually that acrylic cannot withstand a lot of chemicals (more on that in a bit) and those chemicals cause the acrylic to crack and weaken over time when the acrylic is exposed to those chemicals. Some research proved that many of those chemicals are found in dish soaps. Even all natural dish soaps contain some of those chemicals. Hopefully, if you are like me and suffering from the cracked soap dispenser problem, this review will help you decide is an acrylic soap dispenser is right for you.In terms of acrylic soap dispensers, the Prepworks one is top notch. I have tried 9 different brands of acrylic soap dispensers and the Prepworks one lasted the longest. The problem with the other brands that I tried is that the pump's spout would fall off the bottle when you push down on the pump over time, due to soap build up, and you would have to put the spout back in before you could dispense soap. This is not only frustrating, but extremely messy. I have not had this problem with the Prepworks bottle, and the spout has not detached from the bottle once.Size wise, the Prepworks soap dispenser is pretty average. It holds 12.5 ounces of liquid soap, lotion, or body wash. I recommend that you don't fill it to the top, in fact, you shouldn't fill it up past 1/2" to the top. Doing so will cause the soap to leak out of the pump's spout while it's just sitting on the counter. There is no fill line on this soap dispenser, but putting a permanent marker mark at around 12 ounces has worked just fine for me. The Prepworks soap dispenser does not clog easily, like other brands. I have used it for liquid dish soap, lotion, and body wash over the years. The pump is secure and stable and does not take a lot of strength to pump. You get a decent amount of soap, lotion, or body wash dispensed with each pump, so you don't have to pump multiple times to get enough to do dishes or wash your hands.In terms of durability, if you use the right kind of soap, this acrylic dispenser is longer lasting than most. With an all natural dish soap in it, this soap dispenser lasted three years before I had to replace it. The outside is easy to clean, and the inside is easy to rinse out. I use a baby bottle brush to clean the inside every time I refill it, and all though this likely isn't necessary, it seems to prolong the life of the dispenser compared to other dispensers that I have owned. I love the base of the Prepworks soap dispenser. It does not slide around on a counter top like other brands that I have tried and the bottom of the dispenser does not mold like other brands I have purchased in the past.This soap dispenser will clog if you use something that is too thick for it. As a general rule, anything that is clear or see through will easily dispense and anything that is foamy or creamy will likely clog the spout on this dispenser sooner or later. For example: this will not dispense the baby Aveeno body wash that is creamy but will dispense the regular Aveeno body wash which is clear. When it comes to dish washing liquid soap, it will dispense most original formulas, including concentrated formulas, but it will not dispense the foamy or creamy formulas, usually the ones with added vitamins, minerals, and moisturizers.Then there is the cracking that I mentioned earlier. If your soap, lotion, or body wash, has any of the following ingredients, then I recommend that you do not get an acrylic soap dispenser. Even if you use an all natural soap, lotion, or body wash, I still recommend that you check the ingredients, because not everything labeled all natural is in fact completely all natural. In terms of how this compares to other acrylic soap dispensers, this is one of the better ones, and lasts longer than other ones but it depends on how many ingredients are in your soap or lotion.Here is the list of ingredients that damage acrylic that the aquarium guy gave me. This goes for all acrylics, and not just aquariums. I thought I would list everything, even though all of these are not found in soaps and lotions:Acetic Acid which may be listed as Acetic Acid, Acetic Acid Glacial, Acide Acetique, Acido Acetico, Azijnzuur, Essigsaeure, Ethanoic Acid, Ethylic Acid, Glacial Acetic Acid, or Methanecarboxylic Acid,Acetone which may be listed as 2-Propanone, Aceton, Acetone, Beta-Ketopropane, Chevron Acetone, Dimethylformaldehyde, Dimethyl Ketone, or Methyl KetoneAnilineBenzene which may be listed as Annulene, Benzeen, Benzen, Benzene, Benzin, Benzine, Benzol, Benzole, Benzolene, Benzolo, or Bicarburet of HydrogenButyl Acetate which may be listed as 1-Acetoxybutane, 1-Butyl Acetate, Acetate De Butyle, Acetic Acid, Acetic Acid N-Butyl Ester, Butile, Butyl Acetate, Butyl Ester, Butyl Ester Acetic Acid, Butyl Ester, Butyl Ethanoate, or N-Butyl AcetateCarbon TetrachlorideChloroform which may be listed as Chloroform, Chloroforme, Cloroformio, Formyl Trichloride, Methane, Methane Trichlorometheny Tricholoride, Methane Trichloride, Methyl Trichloride, Trichloro, or TrichloromethaneChromic AcidDiethyl EtherDimethyl FormamideDioctyl Phthalate which may be listed as 6-Naphthalate, Dioctyl 2, or Dioctyl Phthalate,Ethyl Acetate which may be listed as Acetic Acid Ethyl Ester, Acetic Acid, Acetic Ether, Acetidin, Acetoxyethane, Aethylacetat, Essigester, Ethyl Acetate, Ethyl Acetic Ester, Ethyl Ester, Ethyl Ester Acetic Acid, or Ethyl EthanoateEthyl Alcohol may be listed as Alcohol, Alcohol Anhydrous, Absolute Ethanol, Aethanol, Aethylalkohol, Alcohol Dehydrated, Distilled Spirits, Ethanol, Ethanol Undenatured, Ethyl Alcohol, Ethyl Hydroxide, Undenatured EthanolEthylene Glycol may be listed as 1-Dihydroxyethane, 2 Dihydroxyethane, 2-Diol, 1-Ethandiol, 2-Ethandiol, 1-Ethanediol, 2-Ethanediol, 2-Hydroxyethanol, Athylenglykol, Dowtherm SR 1, Ethane 1, Ethylene Glycol, or GlycolGasolineHydrofluoric AcidHydrogen Peroxide which may be listed as Albone, Albone 35, Albone 35CG, Albone 50CG, Albone 70, Albone 70CG, Dihydrogen Dioxide, Hydrogen Dioxide, or Hydrogen PeroxideIsopropyl Alcohol which may be listed as 1-Methylethanol, 1-Methylethyl Alcohol, 2-Hydroxypropane, Butanone 2, 2-Butanone OSHA, 3-Butanone, Acetone, Ethyl Methyl Cetone, Methyl-Aethylmethylketon, or Methyl Ethyl KetoneMethylene ChlorideMineral Oil or other products that contain Mineral Oil which may be listed as Adepsine Oil, Alboline, Aromatic Mineral Oil, Bayol 55, Bayol F, Blandlube, Blandol White Mineral Oil, Cable Oil, Carnea 21, Clearteck, Crystosol, Crystosol 325, Deobase, Drakeol, Electrical Insulating Oil, Ervol, Filtrawhite, Fonoline, Frigol, Gloria, Glymol, Heat Treating Oil, Heavy Mineral Oil, Hevyteck, Hydraulic Oil, Hydrocarbon Oils, Jute Batching Oil, Kaydol, Kondremul, Kremol, Light Mineral Oil, Lignite Oil, Liquid Paraffin, Liquid Petrolatum, Lubricating Oil, Mineral, Mineral Oil, Mineral Oil Hydrocarbon Solvent, Mineral Oil Mist, Mineral Seal Oil, Molol, Neo-Cultol, Nujol, Oil, Oil Mist, Parafinium Liquidum, Paraffin Oil, Paraffin Oil Class, Paraffin Oils, Paraffinic, Paraffinum Liquidum, Paroleine, Peneteck, Penreco, Perfecta, Petrogalar, Petrolatum Liquid, Petroleum, Petroleum Hydrocarbons, Petroleum White Mineral Oil, Primol, Primol 355, Primol D, Prolatum Oil, Protopet, Refined Mineral, Refined Mineral Oil, Saturated Paraffin Oil, Saxol, Severely Refined, Tech Pet F, Triona B, Uvasol, White Mineral Oil, or White OilNitric Acid which may be listed as Magnesium Salt, Magnesium Salt Nitric Acid, or Nitric AcidPhenol SolutionSulfuric Acid which may be listed as Acide Sulfurique, Acido Solforico, Battery Acid, BOV, Dihydrogen Sulfate, Dipping Acid, Electrolyte Acid, Mattling Acid, Oil Of Vitriol, Schwefelsaeureloesungen, Sulfuric Acid, or Sulphuric AcidToluene which may be listed as Antisal 1A, Benzene, Benzene Methyl, CP 25, Methacide, Methane, Methyl Benzene, Methyl-Benzene, Methylbenzene, Phenyl, Toluene, or ToluolTrichloroethyleneXylene which may be listed as Benzene, Dimethyl, Dimethyl-Benzene, Dimethybenzene, Meta-Xylene, Mixed Xylene, Total Xylene, Total Xylenes, or XylenesAt the end of the day, this acrylic soap dispenser held up better than others, but it's still not going to hold up if you use a soap, lotion, or body wash with chemicals in it that damage acrylic and can cause it to break down and crack. If your soap, lotion, or body wash contains any of the above mentioned ingredients, then I would recommend a glass soap dispenser. I am giving this soap dispenser five stars as it did last more than a couple of months, which for an acrylic soap dispenser that you are putting chemical containing products in, is pretty good.

If you grew up playing the classic game of Trouble, you might be thinking this is the same game with a Frozen theme. I thought that too. But this is not like the classic game of Trouble that I grew up with. Sure, the rules are the same, the object of the game is the same, but the quality of the materials including the Pop O Matic Bubble itself are very poor quality and much different from the original Trouble.The game board for this game is a thin piece of cardboard. It's about as thick as a cereal box. You need to manipulate this piece of cardboard until it is under the plastic piece that becomes the actual gaming surface. It is difficult to manipulate and get set just right. If you don't get it lined up just right the cardboard bends and it causes the plastic gaming surface to be uneven, wobbly, and bounce around on the table as you play. It also prevents the pieces from sitting on their pegs if the gaming surface is uneven. Bottom line, you have to get the cardboard right the first time, or you mess up the entire game. Since everything is printed on the cardboard from the colors to the paths, you need that cardboard insert under the gaming surface in order to play.The next biggest difference I noticed right away is the Pop O Matic Bubble that is on this game board is MUCH harder to pop than the one in the classic game of Trouble. This game is recommended for ages 5 and up. While regular Trouble can easily be played by a three or four year old, once they get the hang of the Pop O Matic Bubble, this game is definitely for 5 and up because it's so hard to pop the bubble. You have to press it down so hard that sometimes all of the game pieces pop right out of the board and then you have to set them up again to restart the game. There are also times when the Pop O Matic Bubble gets stuck on the side, and doesn't clearly show one number. In the classic game, you could lightly tap the Pop O Matic Bubble and the problem would resolve itself. In this version, if you tap the Pop O Matic Bubble, the problem doesn't resolve itself, instead it causes the game pieces to go flying.The game pieces themselves are larger than the original Trouble game I remember playing with. They have a hole on the top, and open bottoms. The game pieces come in four colors and there are four game pieces of each color. The gaming pieces are purplish pink, orange yellow, green, and light blue in color. There are four stickers for each color peg featuring popular characters from the movie Frozen. Anna gets the purplish pink pegs, Sven gets the orange yellow pegs, Kristoff gets the green pegs, and Elsa gets the light blue pegs. The stickers take some careful placement for pegs to come out looking just right. The problem is, the stickers don't stick tightly to the plastic, so as you move the pegs around each game, the stickers start actually peeling away from the pegs. Then you are left with plain colored pegs, which defeats the whole purpose of a Frozen themed game.At the end of the day, this game is a far cry from the original Trouble, with cheaply made parts that I would not expect from a company like Hasbro. I would not recommend this version of Trouble, even for a die hard Frozen fan.

This is an adorable Sketchbook Ornament featuring Tigger from Winnie The PoohThis is a 2015 Sketchbook Ornament. This ornament has the Disney 2015 charm attached near the top of the ornament. The charm is actually hooked to the hanging ribbon, so you could remove the charm if you don't like the charms (I don't). This Tigger ornament is made out of resin and is just under 4.5" tall.This ornament looks like Tigger and captures Tigger's bouncy spirit. He is carrying a stack of presents in his arms. The middle present has a glitter ribbon running down it. The glitter sheds everywhere, and leaves bare spots on the ornament. I don't mind Christmas ornaments with glitter, but I think it needs to be the kind of glitter that does not shed and leave a mess all over your house. Tigger is wearing a Santa hat, has a red and green striped scarf around his neck, and has a bell hanging from his tail. The bell hanging from Tigger's tail does not actually ring.The one thing that bothers me about this ornament, besides the shedding glitter. Is the fact that Tigger's eyes are tightly shut, and it looks like he's force closing them. They don't just look closed, they look forced shut. I don't know why they would close his eyes at all on this ornament, as it doesn't seem to fit the vibe or the look of the ornament.At the end of the day, this is a cute Sketchbook Ornament, but the glitter and Tigger's eyes being closed are two big turn off's for me.

Does your Elf on the Shelf wear the same outfit all the time? Is he ready for a new outfit? If so, then you need this adorable little tuxedo! I had no idea that Elf on the Shelf had clothes available until I saw this adorable little tuxedo in a store. This tuxedo is part of the Class Couture Collection and is the Dapper Tuxedo. This tuxedo will only fit standard Elf on the Shelf dolls (like the ones that are included with the books) and will not fit the Elf on the Shelf Plushees.This tuxedo is so cute! It reminds me of the old Ken (of Barbie Doll fame) tuxedos that he used to wear. The tuxedo is mainly black in color and the material feels is smooth and satin like. It is supposed to be "silk like material" but to me, it's more of a satin like material. Either way, it's the perfect material for the Elf on the Shelf because it doesn't show wrinkles, even after the elf has been up to all of his tricks and movements. The tuxedo has shiny silver coattails and a shiny silver lapel. There is a cute little red bow tie that is attached to the tuxedo. The tuxedo is very detailed and you can see the details in the lapel, right down to the adorable little fake buttons and shirt lines which are drawn on.Like all Elf on the Shelf clothes, this one comes with instructions from the big man at the North Pole himself, Santa Claus. Santa's instructions for this tuxedo are: "Simply place the Dapper Tuxedo where your scout elf can see it, and he will put it on before his nightly flight to the North Pole".For families that love Elf on the Shelf and make it a part of their holiday season, it is great that they offer clothing that allows you to make your elf stand out from all of the other elves. The tuxedo is easy to put on your elf and I was able to machine wash it on the gentle cycle in cold water inside of a delicates bag and hang it up to dry. The tuxedo came out of the wash looking brand new, which is great if you have a chocolate thieving elf like we have in our house.The one thing that bothers me about this tuxedo is that our elf has to wear it with his Santa hat, which is the only hat that he has.
