I would have loved to see them include a top hat with this tuxedo, which would have made it the perfect outfit for our elf. This outfit is recommended for ages 3 and up.At the end of the day, if your Elf on the Shelf has somewhere special to be this holiday season, then you will want to pick up this handsome little tuxedo for him (or her) to wear.

This is an adorable little Clarice bean bag plush toy from the classic Christmas movie Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer.I purchased this Clarice bean bag plush toy as a companion for the Rudolph bean bag plush toy. I must say that I think that Rudolph is the cuter of the two. Clarice's mouth on this plush toy is really weird, it sort of looks like she has lips and is wearing lots of light pink lipstick. Her bow is not in proportion to her head, and her eyes look really cheap overall. Her eyes do not capture the look of the Clarice from the movie, and her mouth is way off as well. This bean bag plush looks more like a female deer than it does Clarice.One thing that I do like about this Clarice bean bag plush when you compare it to the Rudolph bean bag plush is that Clarice can actually stand by herself. Her feet are closer together, and that prevents her from tipping over. She measures the same 5" tall that Rudolph does and is the same length of Rudolph, just about 6" long. Her body is filled with pellets, but she is still soft to the touch and fun to cuddle with. Unfortunately, she cannot be made to sit down on her hind legs like Rudolph can, so you are left with Clarice standing and Rudolph sitting (since Rudolph doesn't stand on his own) if you buy both of them.At the end of the day, this is a cute little female deer bean bag plush, but I don't feel like it captures the cuteness of Clarice from the movie Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer. I do not recommend this bean bag plush.

This little Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer bean bag plush is absolutely adorable.This is one of the cutest mini Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer bean bag plush toys I have seen. Rudolph measures a little over 5" tall and just under 6" long if you include his red nose and his cute little tail. Unlike some of the bean bag plush toys that I have seen around Christmas time, this one actually looks like Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer from the classic Christmas movie. Even though the body of this little guy is filled with pellets, he is super soft and lots of fun to cuddle and squeeze.The only reason I am giving this bean bag plush toy four stars instead of five is that he cannot stand up by himself. You have to prop him up against something on the side to get him to stand. You can however make him sit up on his hind legs by adjusting the back legs, this works quite well, even though they are not really meant to be bent. Rudolph's body looks a little more like Bambi than it does Rudolph in my opinion, but the face captures Rudolph's personality and red nose perfectly.This bean bag plush is the perfect size to stick out of a Christmas stocking or use as a centerpiece on a holiday table. I purchased this little bean bag plush for a six year old girl and she loved it. She calls Rudolph "Rudy" and loves to carry him everywhere.At the end of the day, if you don't need a Rudolph plush that sings or has a light up nose, then this is the one for you.

This Christmas Story puzzle is a must have puzzle for any fan of A Christmas Story.This puzzle is manufactured by Ceaco. If you have never done a Ceaco puzzle before, you are in for a treat. Ceaco puzzles have glossy images that do not peel like images on other brands of puzzles. This puzzle, like many Ceaco puzzles is made in the United States. This puzzle has well cut pieces that don't bend or warp and are easy to fit together. This is something I have come to know and love with Ceaco puzzles and this puzzle did not disappoint.The image on this puzzle features Ralphie from A Christmas Story in front of a Christmas tree with glass bulb ornaments on it. The glass bulb ornaments each have a separate scene from the movie A Christmas Story in them. The scenes in the ornaments include: tongue stuck to the pole, pink bunny suit, fragile leg lamp scene, and a family portrait. This puzzle really captures the spirit and fun of the movie A Christmas Story and is sure to bring some holiday fun to your family this holiday season. This puzzle was easy to assemble, and not overly challenging.This puzzle is made up of 750 pieces and measures 18"x24" when completed. This puzzle will fit in a poster frame available at most big box stores if you choose to use puzzle glue and frame this puzzle when it's completed. I love Ceaco puzzles, including this one, because when you apply puzzle glue to the pieces, they don't become soggy and the images do not look like they are glazed over or faded. This is one of my favorite holiday puzzles, and the friend I gave it to once framed who loves A Christmas Story hangs it up in her living room every holiday season beginning on Thanksgiving.At the end of the day this is a great puzzle depicting classic images from one of the greatest Christmas movies of all time that your entire family will enjoy making together.

I love TY Beanie Ballz, and often purchase them as gifts. Unfortunately, with the Arizona Cardinals, the quality is hit or miss.This TY Beanie Ballz is of an Arizona Cardinals football player. Unlike the other small TY Beanie Ballz, this one is not 5" in diameter, but is actually 4.5" in diameter. I prefer the 5" size whenever possible and I don't know why TY chose to make this one smaller than the other small TY Beanie Ballz on the market. The fun thing about TY Beanie Ballz is that you can toss them around like real balls, without breaking anything or hurting any one.I purchased a couple of these Arizona Cardinals Beanie Ballz, one for my collection and one for a gift. The one that I gave as a gift was the disappointing one, but I did not know this until after the fact. The way that this particular Beanie Ballz is made, is that the helmet is sort of squished on top of the Beanie Ballz character. Usually, it makes for a nice, round Beanie Ballz that looks like the one in the picture on Amazon. But, every once in awhile, when they squish the helmet down, you end up with a Beanie Ballz character that has a squished, egg shaped head. and the helmet on top of it's head sort of comes to a rounded point. Unfortunately, that's what happened with the Beanie Ballz that I purchased as a gift.The second Arizona Cardinals Beanie Ballz that I purchased did not suffer from the egg shaped problem. It has a perfectly round helmet, and everything about it is absolutely perfect. This Beanie Ballz was introduced to the Beanie Ballz line on July 2, 2012. Like all Beanie Ballz toys, this one has the classic phrase inside of it's hang tag "Roll Me! Throw Me! Catch Me! I Always Land On My Feet!"Because 1/2 of the Arizona Cardinals Beanie Ballz I purchased were not up to normal TY standards, this is one of those Beanie Ballz that I would recommend that you purchase in store, rather than online whenever possible. Otherwise, make sure the store has a good return policy, like Amazon does.

This is an adorable TY Beanie Ballz of Alvin from Alvin and the Chipmunks. I am a huge fan of Beanie Ballz. I generally prefer the small ones, but this particular one is the medium one. At the time, only the medium Beanie Ballz of Alvin was available, so that's how I ended up with this one.This medium Beanie Ballz measures approximately 8" round. Like all Beanie Ballz, Alvin is manufactured by TY, the company that was responsible for the Beanie Babies craze. This Alvin looks like the modern Alvin from the newer Alvin and the Chipmunks movie. I would have preferred a classic looking Alvin, but TY doesn't make one in the Beanie Ballz line. Like all Beanie Ballz, you can toss Alvin around like a ball without hurting any one.The biggest problem I have with Alvin is the proportions. His arms are super tiny and look out of place while his head is huge and makes him look more like a hamster with food in his cheeks than a chipmunk. I also dislike the fact that the red shirt that he is wearing is a hooded sweatshirt, including the hood, but there is no way to make the hood stay on top of Alvin's head. This is really disappointing, why put the hood on the toy, if it cannot stay on the top of the head.Alvin was introduced to the Beanie Ballz line on July 1, 2012 and has the classic Beanie Ballz saying "Roll Me! Throw Me! Catch Me! I Always Land On My Feet" inside of his hang tag. Like all TY products, Alvin comes with a heart shaped swing tag.At the end of the day, I wanted Alvin to add to my TY Beanie Ballz collection. I was disappointed with the proportions, the hood that doesn't stay on his head, and the fact that it's not a classic Alvin, but other than those minor things this is a great Beanie Ballz.

While Aladdin may not be one of my favorite Disney movies, I love the song Friend Like Me. I'll admit when I first saw the movie Aladdin, I had no idea that the Genie was Robin Williams, I was young and clueless back then. Now that I'm older and I learned years ago that the Genie is voiced by Robin Williams, I have listened to this song dozens of times, both before and after Robin William's death.To me, this song isn't just about the Genie's magic, but it's a song about true friendship, and being there for someone. It's about being that odd person in the crowd that your friends love because of who you are. It reminds me that it's okay to be quirky, strange, different, and out of control some times, and that people who are your true friends will love you in spite of all of those things.This song has a wonderful melody, rhythm, and sound to it. The lyrics are fast moving, and it's definitely not a slow, sappy song. This song is a get up and go type of song, and it's my favorite song from the movie Aladdin, even though A Whole New World is also a good song.

This Elf puzzle is adorable and the perfect puzzle for Christmas time or any time of the year.I love puzzles. Big puzzles, small puzzles, floor puzzles, three dimensional puzzles, I love them all. I especially enjoy puzzles that are themed around television and movies. I came across this Elf puzzle and I fell in love with it. This puzzle features Buddy from the movie Elf (played by Will Farrell) with his hands on his hips forming the letter "L" in the word Elf. This exact same design is made by this exact same manufacturer in a 300 piece puzzle if you are looking for something that is less challenging.This puzzle is manufactured by Ceaco. If you have never assembled a Ceaco brand puzzle, you are in for a treat. Ceaco has been making puzzles since the late 1980's and I can remember making their puzzles as a tween and teenager. Their puzzle pieces are extremely high quality. The images are well attached to the pieces and don't peel off like other puzzle manufacturer's images do. Their puzzle pieces don't suffer bending and warping whether you make the same puzzle one time or ten times. This particular puzzle, like many of the Ceaco puzzles is made in the United States of America, something that is rare in the puzzle world.Putting together this puzzle was a treat. The pieces are smoothly and evenly cut so that they fit together without having to force them. The pieces do not bend or lift up like some other brands of puzzles do, so you don't have an uneven finished puzzle. The image is really glossy and looks like a photograph when you fully assemble the puzzle. The puzzle is somewhat challenging because of the amount of the color green that is used in the image, but not so challenging that it's impossible or takes the fun out of assembling the puzzle.This puzzle, like all of the Ceaco puzzles that I have purchased, worked really well on a puzzle mat and the pieces did not curl when the mat was rolled up like some brands of puzzles do. Additionally, I was able to apply puzzle glue to this puzzle when it was finished, without the image being damaged, torn, ripped, or faded like occurs with other brands of puzzles. It was an easy puzzle to frame, and the finished size is 18"x24". I found a black poster frame at a big box store, and then gave this puzzle framed as a gift to an Elf movie fan.At the end of the day, this puzzle has high quality pieces that are well printed and well cut. It's challenging but not difficult to assemble and makes a great Christmas gift for any fan of the movie Elf.

I have pretty basic needs when it comes to a vacuum cleaner. I want something that has a bag, that's inexpensive, that's lightweight, and that has on board tools. I don't need a Dyson or an Oreck for my vacuuming needs, a simple bagged vacuum works just fine. I've owned Kenmore, Hoover, Dirt Devil, and even Dyson vacuums, and Hoover was always my favorite brand of vacuum, until I purchased this vacuum cleaner. It will be the last Hoover vacuum cleaner I ever purchase or own.Day one of vacuuming, I was impressed with this vacuum cleaner. It was quick and easy to assemble with the included instructions, a single bag (not containing a HEPA filter) was included, and I was vacuuming in a matter of minutes. I have carpet in my living room and bedroom only, and the entire area counts for less than 700 square feet. After the first pass, there was still visible lint on the carpet. After the second pass, there was still visible particles on the carpet. After the third pass, the carpet was clean. I was impressed because I've owned cheap vacuum cleaners that require seven or eight passes to pick up visible lint, so this was an improvement on those vacuum cleaners to me.Day two of vacuuming, less than one week later. I ran the vacuum across my living room floor. I made the first pass, second pass, third pass, fourth pass, and then a fifth and sixth pass and there was still visible lint. I flipped the vacuum upside down and it was completely clogged. This vacuum was not used on high pile carpet, was used on the correct setting, and wasn't used on new carpet, so I did not understand why the clogging. I pulled and cut all of the visible hair and other particles from the bottom of the vacuum cleaner, ran it again, no improvement. I looked through the book for instructions on how to take apart the vacuum to de-clog it, and there were none. I called Hoover, and a very nice customer representative walked me through taking it apart, how to remove the clog, and how to re-assemble it. The whole process took 45 minutes and I removed enough lint particles that I could have given a chihuahua a fur coat. I don't have pets, have only shoulder length hair, and live a pretty normal life, so I didn't understand where all this clog was coming from, or even more importantly, why it never clogged my older Hoover vacuum (the motor finally gave out).Day three of vacuuming and I made one pass over the living room and the vacuum stopped picking up. It was clogged again. I once again cut the visible hair and other particles from the bottom, and it still wouldn't pick up, I had to take it apart and completely clear the clog and reassemble it again.When this vacuum was not clogged, it was only an okay vacuum cleaner. There was great suction action  and power through the hose/wand, but the vacuum cleaner bottom never seemed to have that same suction action and power. It would take multiple passes to clear the room of visible particles, and it would clog if the slightest thing got in it's way, as well as during the course of regular vacuuming. Before I knew this was such a bad vacuum cleaner, I recommended one to a family member, and they bought it on my go ahead, I felt bad for recommending it to them, and when their's clogged after the first use (they have only carpet in their living room), I offered to unclog it. The amount of gunk I pulled out could have provided a fur coat for a poodle.This vacuum seems to choke on lint and anything other than fine particles of dirt. It gets clogged with very little effort, and makes it difficult to vacuum multiple rooms. Changing the bag is quick and easy and the bags are inexpensive, two things that this vacuum has going for it, but those are the only two things that this vacuum has going for it, other than the color (I love the color blue for a vacuum cleaner). I avoided buying a Dirt Devil because it was red, and thought that the blue Hoover was prettier, that's the last time I buy a vacuum cleaner based on color. I love my Dirt Devil and this Hoover went in the trash after sitting around for over a year, being unclogged approximately 30 times, and getting used as little as possible.Some other things I did not like about this vacuum cleaner:Weight - heavier than I thought it would be, weighs just under 15 pounds. It's heavier than I thought it would be, but not so heavy that it makes it impossible to vacuum, even with my FibromyalgiaSelf propelled feature - this vacuum has a self propelled feature, so it sort of takes off by itself. This is annoying at best. It doesn't make vacuuming easier, it actually makes vacuuming harder because it takes off like a race car at Daytona, going out from under you as quickly as possible. I'm a plus sized woman, and have a hard time controlling this vacuum cleaner. The man of the house weighs 200 pounds and is 5'6" tall and it gets away from him all of the time. It doesn't go crazy when you lose control of it, it just takes off, until it hits a wall. Adjusting the setting for surface doesn't help, it's overly powerful for this type of vacuumOn board tools - this vacuum comes with on board tools. I LOVE on board tools, but I don't LOVE or even LIKE the on board tools included with this vacuum. First, the tools do not stay in their spots on the vacuum cleaner and they are constantly falling off. No matter how you position them, no matter how secure they seem, they always fall off. Every time you put the vacuum away and pull it out again, you have to go looking for the tools. Every time you vacuum and get to the next room you have to go look for the tool that fell off along the way. The extension wands are great and don't clog as easily as the vacuum does itself. The upholstery tool is pretty much useless as it tends to eat or pinch the upholstery too tight and leave weird creases in it, even on upholstery that was successfully vacuumed with other vacuums in a similar price range with similar features, and by my old Hoover vacuum. The dusting brush is basically just a hair brush that gets clogged every time you use it. It's like the bottom of this vacuum magnified, and you are stuck cutting particles and hair out of it, or it doesn't pick up anything. The bristles also bend very easilyHose - the hose on this vacuum is the worst quality vacuum hose that I have seen. It is made to wrap around the back of the vacuum, like a standard vacuum hose. Unfortunately, when you put it on the little hooks, it kinks the hose. Once the hose gets kinked there is no removing the kinks from the hose. It stays kinked forever. I've tried every method of removing the kinks that have worked on other vacuum cleaners, and they have all failed with this vacuum cleaner. I have never owned a vacuum cleaner where the hose kinks so easilyFilter - the filter is advertised as being able to be rinsed and reused once it's dry. I don't know why they call it reusable. I rinsed the filter in a very small amount of cool water, and it literally shredded apart and could not be used again. This was on the first washing, definitely not what I consider to be reusableThick front - the front of this vacuum is wide (15") which is really nice, but it's also extremely thick. Because of this, it cannot vacuum under beds, sofas, or any of the other places that my old Hoover vacuum canLoud - this vacuum is louder than my old Hoover (over 8 years old) and my neighbors all know when I am vacuuming. Unfortunately, that also means I cannot vacuum early in the morning or late at night no matter how badly my floors need itScratches laminate floors - I have laminate that looks like hard wood in my dining room, kitchen, hallway, bathroom, and vanity areas. Even though this vacuum supposedly works on hardwood floors, I have found that it leaves scratches on my laminate flooring. Not deep gouges, but noticeable scratches, I know they are from the vacuum cleaner because they first appeared after vacuuming, in the same areas I vacuumed. I had to stop using this vacuum on laminate floors because of thisRecently, we moved to a new location. Despite this vacuum cleaner being only a little over one year old, and only being used around 40 times total (less than once a week), this vacuum did not make the move with us and went in the trash can, which is where this vacuum cleaner belongs. I would not recommend this vacuum cleaner to anyone. I have had stick vacuums that perform better, and dust busters that are harder to clog than this vacuum cleaner. This is not the Hoover quality that I have known and loved for years, this is absolute junk and the last Hoover vacuum cleaner that I will buy.And that family member, who has this same vacuum cleaner because I recommended it to her, her's continues to clog as well. She now uses a stick vacuum for her apartment. She used her Hoover vacuum twice and found it too problematic to continue using it. I believed all of the reviews I read about this vacuum that were positive, and trusted the Hoover brand name, but I won't make that mistake again.Photos show the front of the vacuum, the backside of the vacuum where you can see the permanently kinked hose that no longer will hang where it should, and how little it takes to clog this vacuum. With this size clog, the vacuum basically makes noise but provides no suction

I am not usually a Cheez It fan. Cheez It's to me have a strong chemical taste to them and are very artificial tasting. The cheese flavor is also somewhat overpowering, unless you are a young child. I was delighted to find a White Cheddar variety of Cheez It's, and couldn't wait to try them. I am already a fan of other White Cheddar cracker products by other manufacturer's, and I was interested to see how Cheez It's stacked up to the competition.These Cheez It White Cheddar crackers have the perfect amount of cheese flavor. It's not too sharp, not too strong, and not over powerful at all, like regular Cheez It's. I prefer these White Cheddar Cheez It's to regular Cheez It's. The flavor of the White Cheddar Cheez It's does not taste chemically like the regular Cheez It's nor is it over powering like regular Cheez It's.If I could change anything about White Cheddar Cheez It's it would be to remove the annatto that they put in it. I have an annatto allergy (it's a coloring agent in most products) and white cheddar flavored products generally do not contain annatto because they are lighter in color than regular cheddar products. Unfortunately, White Cheddar Cheez It's do contain annatto and it's on their label, I just didn't read it the first time I had them.In terms of flavor comparison to other White Cheddar flavored cracker products, here's how Cheez It's rate:Cheez It Get It Grooves Sharp White Cheddar - much more white cheddar flavor than White Cheddar Cheez It'sBack To Nature Rice Thins White Cheddar - much less white cheddar flavor than White Cheddar Cheez It'sCrunchmaster White Cheddar Multi Grain Crackers - much more white cheddar flavor than White Cheddar Cheez It'sAt the end of the day, I prefer the Crunchmaster White Cheddar flavor to the Cheez It flavor, but the Cheez It's are much less expensive and more readily available. I like this product, if they would remove annatto from this product, I would continue purchasing it.

I often wonder about the path I have chosen for my life. This is one of those moments when I cannot help but wonder why I purchased a product that allows you to make your own frog snot. Yes, I said frog snot. It's one of those kits that I thought "ew" and "cool" at the same time and decided that I had to buy it, try it, and review it.Let me start by saying you don't make actual frog snot with this kit. You make green slime that is a little thicker than green slime and it is not what I think of as snot, but then again, I've never actually seen frog snot. It does not really look like phlegm either, it looks more like green slime, but slightly thicker.There is no frog included. How can you have a frog snot making kit and not include a cute little toy frog? They could have included a little squeezable frog, one that could actually shoot the snot out, that would have made this kit awesome. Or even just to have a little plastic toy frog with this kit would make sense, because once you take the ingredients out of the box, you don't know this is frog snot, and it ends up looking like a green slime kit.I was a bit concerned when I opened this kit. I bought it for self use, but this is not a kit I would consider giving to a child. There are two ingredients included with this kit, a bottle of "frog goo" which is Sodium Alginate and little pellets of "snot activator" which is Calcium Chloride. While I don't think either of these ingredients are dangerous on their own, there are poison control numbers included with this kit, something I never like to see when I'm researching kits for possible Christmas gifts for kids.Making the frog snot was pretty easy. You fill a bowl with 1 cup of warm water, pour in the "snot activator" and stir with a spoon until it's fully dissolved. Then you remove the cap from the "frog goo" and poke a small hole in the middle of the seal and squirt the "frog goo" into the activator solution. Once you squirt in the "frog goo" you immediately end up with a long, stringy piece of green slime with some clumps in it. It's not really snot looking, it's more like green slime that's not mixed thoroughly in consistency. It breaks apart really easily, so you cannot really play with it much. When it does break apart, you can dip the gooey string back into the solution and it will patch itself back up and you can use it again.When you first make the frog snot, it is very runny. You have to dry it out on a paper towel. The frog snot stained the paper towel and the counter underneath it a yellowish green color. I could not get the stain on the counter to wipe off with soap and water, and had to use bleach to remove it. It is very sticky and gooey to the touch, again more like slime than snot. It also stained the container, which was luckily a dollar store container. Even bleach could not get the container clean. It also stained my hands a yellowish green color and I had to use nail polish remover to get it off my hands.This is not what I consider a complete kit. It includes the ingredients only. You need to provide the container for mixing and storing the snot. The snot has to be stored in an airtight container. You also need to provide the spoon or other stirring implement that you will use to stir the snot. So basically you are getting two chemicals for this price, no toy frog, and no real indication of frog snot other than the box.At the end of the day, since this product contains chemicals, I would not feel comfortable giving this kit to children. Again, the inclusion of the poison control phone number is a bit worrisome to me, as someone who would consider purchasing this kit for a child. The finished product was more like green slime than snot, and is overall disappointing. Staining surfaces and hands is never a good idea when dealing with children's products either. I don't recommend this kit.

When I first heard about this packable backpack with a lifetime warranty, I had my doubts. I go through backpacks like they are going out of style. Whether I'm carting them around Disneyland, wearing them around town instead of carrying a purse, or cramming them full of stuff for an overnight trip, I almost always have a backpack with me. All of the backpacks I have used from cheap $5 backpacks to expensive all leather backpacks, suffer from the exact same problem, poor quality materials that wear down overtime. Again, I was skeptical, and then I received this packable backpack and my skepticism quickly went out the window.The backpack I received is black in color. It was all tucked inside of a tiny little pouch that measures 8.5" by a little over 1" thick. No way could a full sized backpack fit in the pouch I thought. And, even if they somehow got a backpack to fit in that tiny little pouch, there was no way that I would be able to fit the backpack back inside of the pouch after using it. So, I put the backpack through it's first test, the packing test. I took the backpack out, filled it to the brim with stuff, and then emptied it, and then started the process of putting it back inside of the pouch. I folded it sort of haphazardly and thought no way would it fit back in the pouch, but it fit just fine, and I did not need to spend any extra time packing the backpack.Okay, so it's portable, and it folds up into almost no space at all, so it can't possibly hold much, can it? I was wrong on that as well. This backpack seems huge when I start filling it. There is the main part which easily fit my women's size XL Disney hooded sweatshirt, women's size XL spare t-shirt, women's size XL spare pair of cotton shorts, spare pair of socks, spare pair of sandals, three 16.5 ounce bottles of water, and my keys. There was room left in the main pocket, but I did not put anything else in it. The two front pockets fit my pressed penny book, bag of quarters, bag of pennies, autograph book, three pens, keys, full sized wallet with checkbook holder, a pack of glow necklaces, and a portable flashlight with batteries. The two side pockets easily fit a 16.5 ounce bottle of water in one pocket and my mini Disney umbrella in the other. Everything that I needed for my trip to Disneyland easily fit in this backpack, and there was room to spare.This backpack is super lightweight, weighing only .7 pounds. I have carried around some backpacks that are heavy, even when they are empty. This backpack feels like you are not even wearing it when it's empty, and only becomes as heavy as the objects that you put inside of it. There is no thick, bulky backpack to carry around and you don't feel like you are carrying around a heavy shell like you do with some backpacks. The zippers are very high quality and don't snag or get stuck like the zippers on other backpacks that I have used. The buckles and straps are really durable, and do not stretch or suffer from whiting or loosening like some plastic buckles do on other backpacks that I have used.In terms of comfort, this backpack is awesome. I wore it all day at Disneyland from park opening to park closing, and it was ultra comfortable. It fit on every ride and I did not have to leave it behind at Disneyland or Disney's California Adventure. It even fit in the under the seat compartment on Soarin' Over California. I took the backpack on Grizzly River Run, which is a water raft ride at Disney's California Adventure, that ride has killed and worn out many backpacks over the years. Nothing inside of my backpack got wet, not even the paper pages in my autograph book, and the material that this backpack is made from dried super quickly and did not leave any water stains, faded colors, or water spots on the fabric.At the end of the day, I have tried a lot of backpacks, but this one is the lightest weight and the most comfortable that I have tried. I now use this as my go to backpack for everything, and I love the design, style, and size of this backpack. If you are looking for a lightweight backpack, this is the backpack that you want to go with, the quality is unmatched and the comfort level is awesome for a backpack of this type or a backpack in general.I received this backpack for free in exchange for an honest product review.

It seems like Selfie Sticks are a dime a dozen these days and everyone is trying to get into the Selfie Stick market. This Bluebits Selfie Stick is one of many Selfie Sticks that I have tried. While it's not my favorite Selfie Stick, it's an above average Selfie Stick that will definitely perform under normal Selfie Stick conditions.This Selfie Stick is very basic in styling. It is black in color with the Bluebits logo on the Selfie Stick itself, which I don't mind as it's a normal brand like logo, but then the strap of the Selfie Stick is plastered with the Bluebits logo over and over again. Seriously, we get that it's a Bluebits Selfie Stick, give it a plain black strap and call it a day. I had to remove the strap and replace it with my own strap because the logo was so prominent that I found it distracting, plus I don't like to be a walking advertisement for a company.This Selfie Stick has some neat features that I found really useful, and some that did not work as well as I hoped.Bluetooth shutter - this Selfie Stick has a Bluetooth shutter so that you can pair it with your cell phone and then take Selfies without actually touching your phone. I had an extremely difficult time with the Bluetooth pairing of this Selfie Stick. It took six attempts to pair it with a Samsung Galaxy and nine attempts to pair it with an iPhone. It did eventually pair correctly, but it should not have taken so many attempts to make the Bluetooth shutter feature fully functionalRotating head - the head can rotate up to 270 degrees so that you can take Selfie's in different angles. I like the rotating head and feel like the company should have made it a 360 degree rotation like many of the other Selfie Sticks that I have tried haveBattery life - battery life is awesome on this Selfie Stick, compared with other brands that I have tried. I got 22 hours of use time on the first charge, 26 hours of use time on the second charge, and 19 hours of use time on the third charge. The average use time for this Selfie Stick is 20 hours, so I think that it is definitely battery friendly compared to other Selfie Sticks that I have triedCharging time - charging time for this Selfie Stick is incredibly fast, which is great if you don't like to wait around for batteries to charge. The first time I charged it, it charged completely in 28 minutes, the second time I charged it, it charged completely in 31 minutes, and the third time I charged it, it took just under 26 minutes. The average charge time for this Selfie Stick is 30 minutes, which is much faster than many of the other Selfie Stick brands that I have triedMaterials used in manufacturing - very high quality. The plastic bracket that holds the phone is tight fitting and clamps tightly on your phone. It has rubber grips so you don't get damage or scratches to your phone, which I have experienced with other brands of Selfie Sticks. The bracket was able to clamp over the soft cases on both my iPhone and Samsung Galaxy without having to remove the phones from their cases. The pole is made of stainless steel and appears to be very durable. I have dropped it on tile, concrete, laminate flooring, and hardwood floors, and have yet to experience any breakage, or bending of the poleWeight and portability - this Selfie Stick is extremely portable. It folds down pretty much to the size of the handle, and it weighs just over 5 ounces. It's very easy to tuck in a purse or backpack to carry with you wherever you go. Even though it's lightweight, it doesn't feel cheaply made, and both my iPhone and Samsung Galaxy feel extremely secure when they are on this Selfie Stick, it doesn't feel like they will slide off or fall off like it does with other Selfie Stick brands that I have triedLength - in terms of length, this Selfie Stick is much shorter than other Selfie Sticks I have tried, even when fully extended. It is great for close up Selfie's, but if you plan to use it more for far away photos as a monopod rather than a Selfie Stick, it doesn't work quite as well due to the short lengthAt the end of the day, this is a durable Selfie Stick that gets the job done. It has awesome battery life. The main improvement that is required is to make the Selfie Stick easier to pair with Bluetooth and to extend the pole. If they made those two improvements, this would be a five star Selfie StickI received this Selfie Stick for free in exchange for an honest product review

This is a beautiful and luxurious looking dress at a very affordable price.This dress is made of polyester and Lycra. It is extremely easy to wear, and has a casual way of wrapping the body in pure luxury. I knew my friend, who wears a size 4 would love this dress, and I was right, she did love it. The sizing is very accurate. I would say that this dress will fit an extra small to a medium, even though it states small to medium. I think a lot of that will depend on your actual measurements. For reference, my friend has a 34" bust, 24" waist, and 34" hips. This dress fit her like it was made for her. It was roomy enough that someone who is a size 6 could easily wear this dress, but not so roomy that it looked cheap or baggy. The dress measures just over 50" in length, if you are wondering if it will fit you. My friend is five foot one and this dress fits her beautifully.The colors of this dress are gorgeous. The main color of the dress is an aqua blue color that is quite serene looking. The pattern reminds me of peacock feathers done in shades of pink with yellow and green accents. The dress ties around the neck, and the ties are extremely well made, and don't pull, stretch out of shape, or dig into your neck. I love the fact that you can throw this dress on with a pair of flats to go out on a date, or you can put it on with flip flops or sandals to wear to the beach. It's definitely a casual dress, but you could dress it up as well, on a summer evening with a plain black sweater.My friends biggest complaint with this dress is that she does not know how to care for the garment. Unfortunately, the tags are written in a foreign language (Chinese I think). The words washing instruction are written in English, but everything else is in Chinese. The first time it was washed, it was washed in the washing machine in cold water on the gentle cycle, and we laid it flat to dry. I do not know if this is the correct washing procedure or not, but it came out beautifully, unfaded, and not damaged in any way.At the end of the day, the fit is wonderful, the color is beautiful, but every garment needs laundering instructions or it becomes a one time use garment. If this is something that the manufacturer changes, this would be a five star dress.I received this dress for free in exchange for an honest product review.

I have tried a number of maternity belts and other types of support belts. Some just support the back, others support both the back and the belly. This particular maternity belt is what I would consider a low support belt. Meaning that it provides only a slight amount of support for your belly and your lower back.I ordered this maternity belt in a size XXL. I ordered it for a friend who wears a size L usually, but based on measurements, I thought the XXL would be the best fit for her. My guess on sizing was correct. If you plan on ordering this maternity belt, I recommend going up two sizes from your normal size. Her first comment was the fact that she had never worn a maternity belt before, and had no idea which piece went where. This maternity belt comes in two pieces which have to be attached together with Velcro, but there are no instructions, or a picture of how the finished maternity belt should look, so if you've never worn a maternity belt before, you might not know how it goes.The part with the stripes goes on your back and the strap goes up over the top of your belly, just under your breasts. Getting the two pieces to Velcro together properly is the hardest part of using this maternity belt. The pieces tend to want to stick together, because the Velcro is attracted to the entire belt and not just the part that it should Velcro to. I wish the rest of the maternity belt would have been made of a type of fabric that Velcro does not cling to.Once the maternity belt is correctly assembled, it provides next to no lower back support because of how it fits on the body. It does provide plenty of belly support, which is nice if you are carrying a large bun in the oven. The strap that goes on top of the belly provides some breast support so you don't get tons of sagging over your belly, which is also nice.In terms of comfort, my friend enjoyed wearing this maternity belt. It did not bunch up or ride up while she was wearing it. It's very lightweight and not bulky while you are wearing it. While it does show under clothes, it doesn't scream maternity belt and it looks like you are actually wearing a belly sling when you see it through clothes. The material is very soft and doesn't dig into your skin which is nice.At the end of the day, if this belt was made to provide a some lower back support, it would be a five star maternity belt.I received this maternity belt for free in exchange for an honest product review.Photo shows the pieces of the maternity belt and NOT the way that the maternity belt is worn.

I will start this review by saying that I have no experience with this type of hammock, I've only ever owned the old fabric kind with ropes that you had to tie to posts, you know the ones, that rip when it's windy and the fabric fades almost immediately. The kind that you have to be a sailor to tie the ropes to the posts or the hammock disappears the first time it's windy or raining outside. This hammock is not your typical hammock, in fact, it's a lot better than your typical hammock.This hammock comes in a cute little packable bag. The bag is small enough that you can tuck it in a backpack for camping or a beach bag for a day spent at the shore. The problem that I have with other items that come in packable bags is that once you remove the item from the bag, you can't get the item back into the bag without being a rocket scientist. With this hammock, that is not the case at all. Once you remove it from the bag, it goes back in quickly and easily. You don't have to do any special folding and you don't need directions, you literally just push the hammock back into the bag, and you are ready to take it on the go again. One of the best things about this packable hammock is that the storage bag is attached to the hammock. Because of this, you don't have to worry about losing it, or worry about it flying away never to be seen again, you always know exactly where it is.This hammock is made out of nylon parachute fabric. This is the same type of material that they make the sky diving parachutes out of, and as such it's extremely durable and extremely easy to clean. To clean this hammock, I just squirt it down with the garden hose and let it dry. The fabric is comfortable when you are relaxing in the hammock, and you don't go slipping and sliding all over it, even though it's made of parachute material. The hammock's colors do not fade when it's left out in the sun and stains rinse off easily, as I found to be the case when I dumped a glass of Hawaiian Punch accidentally while relaxing in this hammock.As I said before, this hammock is durable. It is weight rated to support up to 330 pounds. I tested this hammock with a child weighing 65 pounds, an adult weighing 185 pounds, an adult weighing 259 pounds, and an adult weighing 335 pounds. All of these people were able to be comfortably in the hammock, and the hammock was able to support their weight without bending, tearing, stretching, or ripping. This hammock is also very roomy to accommodate a large variety of body sizes, weights, and shapes. The hammock measures approximately 8'8" in length by approximately 4.5' in width, definitely large enough to accommodate all of our test subjects, the tallest of which was 5'10" tall. Anyone under 6 feet will be extremely comfortable in this hammock. I have a neighbor who is 6'2" tall and wanted to see how comfortable she would be in this hammock, she found it comfortable for relaxing in as well, and with some measuring, we feel like this hammock would be marginally comfortable if you are between 6 feet and 6.5'. I wouldn't recommend it for anyone over 6.5' tall.The colors on this hammock are very steadfast. They do not bleed when the hammock gets wet, and they do not fade when left out in the sunlight all of the time. The colors are a bright blue and gray. The colors are gender neutral, though I would love to see this hammock made in a dark purple with maybe a maroon center, that would be truly beautiful and a little more on the feminine side. The material does not tear easily. I often relax in this hammock with keys in my pocket and I've yet to see the hammock tear, or form a hole.This packable hammock includes 2 rope tie downs and two large carabineer style clips. This is the easiest hammock that I have ever hung in my life. It's so simple to tie the hammock down and the carabineer clips ensure that the hammock is sturdy even if you aren't a sailor who ties the worlds best knots. I tested this hammock between two strong trees, two wooden posts, and also a hammock stand that stands on it's own, and this hammock was easy to hang in all of these testing environments.At the end of the day, I could not find a bad thing to say about this hammock, and I definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a durable, portable, long lasting hammock. Even if you don't need a portable hammock, this is a great all purpose hammock that is roomy and comfortable.I received this hammock for free in exchange for an honest product review.

This is a fantastic ring for both men and women. I actually wanted this ring for myself and I'm a thirty something female. I have large fingers that are on the thick side, and I prefer mens rings because they are bolder with a wider band then women's rings. I wear a size 9 in rings generally, but I ordered a size 11 because I thought it looked a little small in terms of sizing online, the 11 fit perfectly and was a great choice!I love the fact that this ring is made out of tungsten. So many rings are made out of Titanium, especially when it comes to men's rings, and Titanium rings cannot be cut off by emergency personnel and you cannot wear them in the military in some cases, so it's nice to see ring manufacturer's, like this one, that are making rings for men out of other materials. I have never owned a tungsten ring before, so I was not sure what to expect, I have to say that I really like the feel of tungsten, it feels substantial without being overly heavy on my finger, and it doesn't feel like it's going to bend or break over time. I also love the fact that it doesn't scratch easily, as I have already banged the ring against cabinets and counter tops, and so far, it shows no signs of damage, wear, or tear.This ring is made out of tungsten carbide, which I have found to be very strong and durable. I have yet to damage this ring. It also is much shiner than I expected and the shine does not fade with constant hand washing, doing the dishes, etc. Keep in mind that this ring does contain some nickel inside of it, but it is plated, and I have a severe nickel allergy, the plating does not contain nickel, and I have not had any allergy problems while wearing this ring. This ring also does not stain your finger, leave marks on your finger, leave black spots on your finger, or leave green rings on your finger, all things I have experienced with other brands of mens rings that are inexpensive.In terms of care, this ring is super easy to clean, I just wipe it with a jewelry cleaning wipe, and it's good to go. It has stayed shiny and looks nice. I've received many compliments on this ring, and when I tell people it's tungsten and not titanium, they cannot believe it, because it looks like a strong titanium ring.At the end of the day, I would recommend this to anyone who loves a wide ring. It's a great gift for men, but as you can tell from my review, it makes a wonderful women's ring as well.I received this ring for free in exchange for an honest product review.

This corset is a corset without laces or zippers, it has a hook and eye closure only. There are 16 hook and eye fasteners that allow you to adjust the sizing of this corset to three different sizes. 12 hook and eye fasteners take a LONG time to fasten, and I prefer the newer styles of corsets with zippers to those with the hook and eye closures. I actually find the old style of lace up corsets easier to put on then the hook and eye closure corsets as well.This corset looks like a corset, but it doesn't function like one at all. It doesn't suck in your gut, or make you look skinnier. In fact, it doesn't really do much of anything except fit tightly around your body. It is made out of Lycra, so it breathes well and it also fits comfortably, but it doesn't function like a corset, so I don't consider it a true corset. It's overly flexible, so it doesn't provide you with any kind of support. They use elastic cotton throughout the corset, and I think that's what made it overly flexible, and not really supportive.This corset uses a memory steel bone support. It sort of reminds me of a memory foam mattress that in the beginning conforms to your body perfectly, but as time goes on, it starts getting flatter and flatter. That's sort of what happens with this corset. The first time you put it on, it fits comfortably and provides a very small amount of support, but the material is so stretchy and flexible, that every time you take this corset off and put it back on, it becomes looser and looser. It ends up not providing you with any support at all.I noticed that this corset did not have any odor or chemical smell straight out of the package, which is a nice change of pace from other corsets I have tried recently. This one is also very true to size. I wear an XL and this corset fit me perfectly, a large would have been too small. Definitely order your true size with this corset.I think this had the potential to be a great corset, but it doesn't provide any support and it takes a long time to fasten shut. I definitely would not purchase a corset like this in the future.I received this corset for free in exchange for an honest product review.

This is a great running belt! I have tried a number of running belts lately, and they all seem to either be too small or too large. This running belt is the perfect size. It fits my Samsung cell phone, my house keys, cash, and my iPod. I love being able to carry everything with me, without having to wear a full size fanny pack, because they just are not very stylish or comfortable, especially when you are running, jogging, or riding a bicycle.I really love the fact that this running belt sits comfortably against my body. It doesn't ride up, shift around, or become bulky and uncomfortable. When I am riding an exercise bike, the running belt stays comfortably in place and does not feel like it's too big or in the way while I'm riding, a problem that I have had with other running belts. This running belt has two pockets with zipper closures, one is a large pocket and is just under 8" wide and about 3.5" deep. The other is a small pocket which is a little over 5" wide and a little over 3" deep. The pockets are deep enough to secure valuables, and they stay in place without shifting. The large pocket has two smaller pockets inside that are mesh pockets, and are the perfect place for stashing your cash or credit cards.One of the things that I love about this running belt is the fact that it has reflective strips on it, so that you can easily be spotted at night while you are running or biking. This company truly thought of everything and put a lot of care and concern into their product. This running belt is completely adjustable. I have a 42" waist and it fit me perfectly, but it also fit my boyfriend who wears a mens XL and has a 38" waist perfectly. I would say if you have up to a size 44" waist that this running belt will fit you comfortably without being tight or in the way.This running belt is completely waterproof. It is made of a material that feels sort of like diving rubber. The material does not have any kind of odor and you don't need to air out this running belt like I have had to with other brands. I tested the waterproofing ability of this running belt by filling it with cotton balls, and then completely immersing it in a sink filled with water. The cotton balls on the inside stayed completely dry. This reassures me that the waterproofing ability of this running belt is just as the manufacturer claims.At the end of the day, this is a wonderful running belt that provides me with enough space and pockets to take everything with me whether I'm running or just running a few quick errands. This is definitely not just a sports running belt and would be great at amusement parks where you only need a few small things. My Sony Cybershot digital camera even fits in the larger pocket.I received this running belt for free in exchange for an honest product review.

These sports sweat shorts are a different type of short than I generally wear, but I had the opportunity to try them out, so couldn't wait to receive them.The first thing that you need to know about these shorts is that they run small. I generally wear a women's size XL, and the size XXL fit me perfectly. I picked out the size XXL in gray and it was a good choice. These shorts have a multi-colored waist band that was black and red. Each section of the waist band has a separate drawstring which don't really serve a purpose like you would expect them to, they are just kind of for show beyond the first drawstring. The black section has a white drawstring and the red section has a black drawstring. There are two pockets. I love the fact that the pockets are really deep. I was easily able to put my keys, wallet, and cell phone in a single pocket and not have to worry about things falling out.In terms of comfort, these shorts are so comfortable. They are made of 100% cotton and are ultra soft. They fit wonderfully, and they stay securely around my waist. They don't ride up like some brands of sweat shorts do. They also don't get sweaty or absorb sweat odors like some brands of sweat shorts do. The legs don't rub together and cause chafing, a common problem that I have with shorts that are 100% cotton. These shorts are really breathable and feel so comfortable while you are wearing them. They are also super easy to clean and are machine washable and can go in the dryer. They don't get wrinkly when you machine wash and dry them, and that makes it easy to wear them straight out of the dryer.The one thing that I dislike about these sweat shorts is the length. They are overly long, like below the knees long. They make me feel like I am wearing a pair of Capri pants rather than a pair of shorts. If the length was even a little shorter, like slightly above the knees or at the knees, these would be perfect.At the end of the day, these shorts run about a size smaller than you would expect them to, so order one size larger (at least) than you normally would. They are also a little too long to be considered shorts in my opinion. Otherwise, this would be a five star pair of sweat shorts.I received these shorts for free in exchange for an honest product review

I want to start this review out by saying that I know nothing about fisheye lenses, nor have I used them in the past. I'm not one for smart phone "add ons" but when I had the opportunity to test and review this product, I thought it was worth the time so I decided to try it.The Aerb Fisheye Lens is actually three lenses in one. The three lenses are: fisheye lens, macro lens, and a wide angle lens. The lenses are stored all together and you have to unscrew them from each other in order to use them. I found this to be somewhat annoying, as the threading on the lenses is difficult to line up, and makes them somewhat difficult to remove from each other. Also included with this Fisheye Lens are two different lens caps. The lens caps are made of thin plastic, and they protect the lenses from scratches, grooves, and breakage. I think the lens caps are really well made compared to the rest of the items in this set. There is also a storage bag for the lenses, which is a nice touch, but make sure you screw them together before you put them in the bag, or you will end up having them bang together, which scratches the lenses. There is also the lens mount, which is the weakest link of this set.The lens mount is made out of plastic and clips onto your cell phone or iPad to hold the lenses in place. The clip is made out of very cheap plastic and does not form a tight grip on a Samsung Galaxy S4, iPhone 6, or an iPad. Because of this, the clip slips around, resulting in multiple problems. The first problem is that the clip is not cushioned in any way and will actually scratch the surface of your phone. I did not have scratching problems with the Samsung Galaxy S4, but I did have scratching problems with both the iPhone 6 and the iPad. The second problem is that the clip tends to move as you move your device, so sometimes the lens doesn't stay over your device's camera, and you end up being able to see the clip in your photographs. The third problem is that the clip does not mount over cell phone cases, so you have to move your case from your device every time you want to use this fisheye lens.The mount with the clip does allow you to position it over your device's camera, and because of this, it works with a wide variety of devices. I was even able to use it successfully with a Toshiba Satellite laptop with a web cam as well as a Verizon Ellipsis Tablet. I love that it's quick and easy to remove the mount from your device and switch it to another device or store it when not in use.The lenses performed as follows:Wide angle lens with the macro lens - taking a panoramic photograph of a sunset through a standard glass windowSamsung Galaxy S4 - clear, crisp photograph with plenty of detailiPhone 6 - clear photograph with only minor detail, somewhat fuzzy over the entire photographVerizon Ellipsis Tablet - clear, crisp photograph with plenty of detailToshiba Satellite Laptop - clear, crisp photograph with plenty of detailiPad - clear, crisp photograph with plenty of detailMacro Lens - taking a photograph of a Micro Machines fire engine to capture the detail for an online auction listingSamsung Galaxy S4 - clear, crisp photograph showing all of the detailsiPhone 6 - fuzzy photograph with very few details showingVerizon Ellipsis Tablet - clear, crisp photograph showing all of the detailsToshiba Satellite Laptop - fuzzy photograph showing no details, cannot make out what the photo is ofiPad - fuzzy photograph showing minor detailsFisheye Lens - photograph of the skyscrapers in downtown San Diego as seen from the sidewalk along the bay in front of Anthony's RestaurantSamsung Galaxy S4 - clear photograph showing most details, average photograph, with black sections on both the left and right sides of the photograph. When fully zoomed in, black sections disappear but the photograph becomes fuzzy and blurryiPhone 6 - clear photograph showing all details, above average photograph, with black sections on both the left and right sides of the photograph. Photograph was unchanged when adjusting camera settingsVerizon Ellipsis Tablet - clear photograph showing all details, above average photograph, no black sections on the photograph. The highest quality photograph that I had during my test photosToshiba Satellite Laptop - clear photograph showing most details, average photograph with black section on the right side only of the photograph.iPad - fuzzy photograph, hard to make out what the photograph is of, worst of the test photographs that I tookMy tests and photographs with the Aerb Fisheye Lens show that this is an average quality macro lens and wide angle lens and a poor quality fisheye lens. The device that you use this product on, really changes the photograph results.At the end of the day, this product is definitely one of those gimmick add ons for your smart phone or tablet. It barely does what it's advertised, and yet the macro and wide angle lenses are good enough to warrant a three star review.I received this fisheye lens set for free in exchange for an honest product review

This is a really nice case but unfortunately, it suffers from the same problem that most of these wallet cases do: the makers of these cases give little attention, it seems, to the fact that people are going to use those pockets for credit cards and other cards in addition to cash. Once you put in several of these items and a few folded bills, it really bulks up. The latch still closes but they should make the case more able to accommodate all of the things people typically carry in a wallet. The only other thing I would have liked is if they would have made the case long enough to hold a flat dollar bill. As it is now, you have to fold the cash you put in there which further bulks up the case. The 6+ is large enough that another bit in the length to accommodate flat cash won't make a world of difference.I have had it for a few months now and it seems to be holding up well. I bought the mint color and love it. When I first took it out of the package, I thought I would hate it. I can't explain it but the color made the wallet look kind of cheap and fake. I can't really explain it. It grew on me though and a lot of people say "Oh, I love your phone case."
Good value. My plants seem to like this. I put one in each plant every 30 days.
Bought this basket to hold a plant on our balcony railing. We have the very thin metal railing and when hooked on, our plant is not held straight but it is good enough.

I must say that if you have a small deck or patio and an umbrella that you bought 20 years ago, DON'T throw it away! The stuff they make today is just terrible. I cannot impress upon readers enough how incredibly difficult it is to find a 5 foot patio umbrella that actually does its job. First, since most patios and decks are not that large, the need for good quality 5-6 foot max umbrellas is great but options are extremely limited.First, I bought these very lovely looking rainbow color umbrellas locally. They were labeled beach umbrellas. Beach usually means sun right? When I got them home and put them into the umbrella holder, they looked really nice and I was very pleased with them. Then the sun came out and it was like sitting in the sun without an umbrella. You could see the sun right through and there was no protection or comfort sitting under this. Returned them.Next, I moved onto a dark, navy blue umbrella I found in another local shop. Same issue. Nice umbrella, great size, but you can see the sun right through the top if it. Returned that one as well.Then I went all out and bought two expensive (nearly 100 each) 7 foot umbrellas figuring if I wanted real sun protection it was going to cost a good bit of cash. Even the expensive umbrellas that I bought were made of a layer of fabric and nothing else. It did not provide the sun protection that is the whole point of an umbrella. The quality of the material was better than on the smaller umbrella but if you can make out the sun from sitting under an umbrella then it is not doing its job. So I had to send those back as well.This umbrella and the Wondershade are your only options it seems. They have a viny-like insert and feel like a rain umbrella but they completely block the sun. The only problem I have with them is that they are an "As Seen on TV" type product so the construction of them is kind of lousy. Within a few months of putting them outside, they get really beat up looking: faded, washed out looking, and the seams begin to get pin-type holes that you can see through much the same way a computer monitor looks when it has a dead pixel and that's pretty much all you see when you look at the screen.Still, I am glad there is at least an option to get a real sun blocking umbrella in a small, patio size. I worry that these As Seen on TV type products tend to vanish. Hopefully these will not.

This is simply a great table. It may look a little ironing board-ish because of the way the legs are but I love it. I needed a table to put on the deck to hold my new plants: Kukla, Fran and Ollie. The outdoor table I had was too small to hold all of them and the deck is not that large. This table fit just perfectly in the space we have and doesn't mind being rained on since it is a resin top. We will fold it up for the winter when we take the plants in, and use the table indoors until the following spring. It's really well made and fits our needs.
Great cat litter that's flushable. The lavender ones controls odor much better than the unscented one does. Great price on Amazon for the 28 pound bag.

Bought this to replace the broken handle on a patio door that was put up in the 80s. Fits great but I had to use the old screws. They give you three pairs of screws of differing lengths for your door, but I had to use the screws that were in the old handle because the ones it came with were either too long or too short. No Goldilocks screws in the package for me. :)I also love that the piece that goes on the outside is made of metal rather than plastic. The old one was plastic and was cracked.

Terrific, fun book for kids that teaches computer science terms and concepts. It's one of those books that kids will read and then later on in a computer class say "Oh yeah! I remember that from this book!"

I'll stick with the soups. This meal was okay, but pretty bland and not filling at all like the soups are. Very watery when heated up. Make sure you let it sit for at least 8 minutes after removing it from the microwave; 6 minutes did not do it for me. Also, be prepared to still be hungry after you finish. More expensive than the soups. The soups are a way better value.

You have got to be kidding me. I cannot believe how difficult it has been for me to find an umbrella for our deck. I thought my requirements were pretty simple:No larger than 7 1/2 feetMust tiltNeeds to block the sun.I thought the last item was a given until I bought a couple of umbrellas locally and found them to be pure junk that don't block the sun at all.  I searched endlessly on Amazon, reading descriptions of every umbrella I could afford and this seemed like the ticket. So I ordered two.For whatever reason, only one got shipped and the other one got tied up somewhere, so about an hour ago, I retrieved the box, opened it up, put it in the umbrella stand and opened it up only to see that when she sun is not out, you can see through this umbrella even more than you can on this temporary, twenty dollar beach umbrella I bought to use temporarily until I could find a real umbrella. This is not the quality that's expected at this price. When a non-waterproof, discount store umbrella made of cheap material that I can't even tell what it is blocks the sun better than this one, there's something not right there.So now I have try to cancel the other order that's in limbo and drag this thing to a UPS store to return it. Save your money. This thing is junk.

This DVD will serve me well as I improve as a drummer. Right off the bat, Tommy invites you into the circle to play. I hopped in with him for a bit but quickly found that as the speed ramped up, I was out of my league. I look forward to gaining more staying power as I improve. This seems like it would be a terrific cool for experienced drummers as well for practice purposes. I can't really speak to that though. I know I love it and will be using it very frequently in my practice sessions.

Look no further than Igoe for a welcoming and instructive intro to drums and drumming. He is incredibly personable and right out of the chute you will be comfortable with him and his style of teaching. The first half of the DVD is about setting up a drum set. The second goes into beats to learn and he has some of his students helping out. The beats are broken down by hand/foot and you slowly add each limb into the mix. The presentation is just fantastic.
So glad these are still available! I needed one for my new Roland drum kit. The old one is packed away in a moving box somewhere and I did not want to have to go nuts looking for it.

I was so tempted to go cheap but decided against it. I'm glad I did. The cable works great and I won't have to worry about replacing it every few months because it was cheaply made. I have been burned buying cheap HDMI and other cables that I've switched over to dropping the cash on a good, name brand cable and not having to deal with constant troubleshooting.

I picked this up to use for practice with my Roland kit and for the price, I think the DVD is definitely lacking a bit. The play along is nice and I'm still getting used to the "game" version of that, but for the cost, I thought there would be more to it than just loading up the DVD, choosing a beat to play along with and then playing along. It's not really a tutor because it doesn't teach you anything that I can find. It boots up into a screen that allows you to play along with pre-made songs and beats and does show where you went off, but there is no opening video of a person going over the basics, as any tutorial would.It's great that it works on a Mac and I do like it but again, at sixty bucks, it feels like it is overpriced.

You cannot go wrong with Tommy Igoe. His personality and delivery will hook you from the jump. You cannot manufacture personality, so despite all the other products on the market that teach drums, this one pulled me right in and made me feel like I am sitting in a room with Tommy rather than watching a DVD. I guess you'd have to experience it to understand, but he's just a terrific teacher and you feel like you are being totally supported in your learning.

If you need a midi cable, don't go cheap and buy the two dollar cable. I used to buy based on cheapest price and learned that the cables just don't last. This is a mid-priced cable that has a great feel and build quality and has worked like a charm for me on my Roland drum kit.

I have a discount store nearby and every month or so they fill one aisle with things like Nature Valley granola bars, Fiber One bars, Special K bars and things like that. They are priced very low-- today they had Nature Valley Oats granola bars, we in a box for a buck sixty nine-- and have a far off (6 months+) expiration date. It is a great opportunity to try something out without paying the ridiculous retail price.I saw these brownies there today and grabbed two boxes, each box was under two bucks. I figured I'd bring one box to the office and leave one at home. I just tried a pack for the first time and here are my impressions:1 - This company should be ashamed of itself with all the wasted packaging that these come in. The outer box is about the length and width of a typical box of granola bars but it is twice as deep.2 - The packet that the brownies come in is probably 10 times larger than the product inside.3 - When I opened up the packet, I counted 7, moist, squares that were about the size of two nickels stacked on top of each other. That was it. All that packaging and if you dumped out the contents of all the packets in the box into one bowl, it would look like a single serving of something.The brownies tasted wet to me rather than like a moist cookie. Like others have said, it was like cookie dough but not yummy cookie dough. There was something very off about the flavor.As far as a healthy snack, I'd stay away from these. I thought Special K was all into healthy snacks so I never really scrutinized the box, but again, as others have said, these seem to be a very high calorie food that has been chopped into tiny pieces and it's the paltry quantity that keeps the calories at 100. They are not 100 good calories though.Next week, I will put them out in the office for others to try and see if they ahve the same view. Judging by all the other negative posts here, I havea  feeling they will.

Putting aside the outrageous price here on Amazon, these are just not a great value even from Walmart. The paper the bars are wrapped in are about 25% larger than the square itself. The taste is pretty good but it's just too small to be a realistic breakfast on the go. It is not nearly as filling as a pack of two of their granola bars are. I am sure the caloric content is smaller on these bars but what's the point if you eat one and are still very hungry?There is too much sugar. I wish they would take out most of the sugar and leave us with a relatively tasteless but healthy snack and people would get used to the lack of sugar.

I thought these would be the rival to Belvitta biscuits but Belvitta has nothing to worry about. I found a box of these in a discount store with an expiration date that is well over a year away. That's usually not a very good sign. Lemon Poppy sounded like a weird flavor so I thought maybe they did not sell well and they were unloading this flavor. But here they are on Amazon so I guess they are still being made.The first thing I noticed is that they were hard as a rock compared to the Belvittas. I guess when I saw the shape I was expecting a sort of cookie consistency. Instead, these are like the hard granola bars squished down into a flat oval shape. The taste was not appealing at all at first. It was kind of cardboard-like and had very little flavor. I continued eating them and they were less unpleasant but still not something I'd ask for again.It's a shame that they went the Belvitta route and put FOUR of these into a package. I would rather they had two per package because you can't reseal it and two of these should be plenty for a quick snack.
These picks were too large for my taste and the quality just wasn't there. I was experimenting with various picks to find something that felt comfortable to me and these did not do it at all.

Downloaded this app on to my Kindles for the sole purpose of watching Little League World Series regional games that were only available on ESPN 3 which is only accessible over the Internet. I was not disappointed.

Guitar picks are a personal thing and the size, thickness and material vary depending on what is comfortable. For me, these are the best picks I've used. They are not wobbly or give much and have a nice grip.

I love these pants and I'm a female. They are just want I want. All the women's pants like these are made of stretch material now, have no really useful pockets, are capri type pants, or are designed to be tight fitting. Not interested. I want comfortable pants with real pockets and a closed bottom. They are so comfortable because they are cotton, have roomy pockets and are great for gardening, talking a walk, biking or exercising. I love them and cannot find them locally so I buy them on Amazon every spring for wear during the summer months. I only wish they would make them in a dozen or more colors. I would buy them all if they did.The only issue that I have noticed with these pants is that they have changed the waist and now use a sort of hard elastic band so it feels a bit irritating when you first wear them.
I buy these on Amazon because the price is better than picking them up locally. They do the job.

Bought this for an Alcatel phone that my spouse was using. He did not like it at all. Too bulky and the rubber part of the holder felt very cheap and did not mold well to the phone. We ditched both the holster and the phone and he went back to an old school flip phone.

Does the job. I bought a small, travel guitar and bass (here on Amazon) and the way the pegs were placed, the strap kept coming off. It was driving me crazy. I ordered these and now the straps stay put. Very happy!
Very good quality set of tongs that lock when not in use. Very pleased.

Bought this for an Alcatel phone that my spouse was using. He did not like it at all. Too bulky and the rubber part of the holder felt very cheap and did not mold well to the phone. We ditched both the holster and the phone and he went back to an old school flip phone.

This is a pretty nice platter but was too large for my grill. I was unable to put the cover on with this pan. If it was smaller, I would have used it. It's a well made product and I think you'd be happy with it if you have a grill that's large enough to accommodate it.

These worked as they should but I purchased 1-liter water bottles to hopefully get a week's long worth of watering while on vacation. A pre-test allowed me to see that every single one of the dozen I purchased leached the full (1) liter bottle per plant within hours. Had to come up with another solution for self-watering while on vacation.

Returned only because for the price for one pot with shipping I could have received 5 pots and free shipping from a competitive vendor. Shop around - these pots are nice and will grow healthy, productive tomato plants - but pricing is all over the map depending on the seller. Amazon has plenty of offerings for these pots -- I ended up purchasing (10) 5-gal pots for $40 plus $12 for 2-day shipping. These pots are made to endure 2-4 seasons worth of gardening before they breakdown. They allow roots to self-prune and aerate -- putting forth lots of produce! Love that they are portable as well, so you can shift locations as needed.

Worked well - spaced 3 racks of baby back ribs with 1 open rack/spacer between - so this can hold as many as 5 full racks of ribs! Clean-up was a breeze. Sturdy to transport/shift around on grill. This is a great product for grilling ribs!
Little larger than what I normally get but it is adjustable and the colors are vivid. The structure is sturdy but flexible and soft. It was exactly as I hoped and I will get lots of use out of it.

These fit like a glove and I wanted a looser fit. Purchased a size up but still too snug for my liking. Good quality and feels like it would function as a fast-drying rash guard well enough. Just wish they fit more like depicted in the picture.

I was considering this for a container garden self-watering system. Other products rely on natural enzymes to break the cycle of mosquito larvae populations. I considered this product before finding the label info had alarming data:Active Ingredients(% by Weight): Diflubenzuron N-[[(4-Chlorophenyl)Amino]Carbonyl]-2-6-Difluorobenzamide (2%). Inert Ingredients (98%).WarningsKeep out of reach of children. Precautionary Statements: Hazards to humans and domestic animals. Causes moderate eye irritation. Avoid contact with eyes or clothing. Wash thoroughly with soap and water after handling and before eating, drinking, chewing gum or using tobacco. Environmental Hazards: This product Is extremely toxic to aquatic invertebrates. Do not apply Cutter Backyard Mosquito Control Tablets to drinking water, water used for irrigation to food crops, or water that may drain into public waterways such as streams and lakes. Runoff from treated areas may be hazardous to aquatic organisms in neighboring areas.

Purchased mine in November 2014 - by April 2015 it is sound only - screen went black. Have not been able to stream Netflix using the TV app (picture only received, no sound). Dead in the water. Out $1700. I will never buy a Samsung TV again. The picture was great - but less than 6 months life span for $1700 is insanity -- this should NEVER happen for a 'quality' product in this price range.PS: keep in mind that the Samsung 30 day out of box warranty limits you to having only their 'authorized service techs' perform any repairs.
