There was only one in my entire region -- and it was 200 miles away. I ended up going another route with a trusted 'unauthorized' tech and the masterboard had to be replaced for $200. Why it went bad in under 6 months is a mystery but not uncommon experience for consumers. I am now watching a Sony Bravia tv that cost $700 new and streaming Netflix with sound AND picture sans any problems that were part and parcel of the Samsung tv we paid more than twice as much for.

Rich colors - truly looks like the mid-18th century/early 19th century nursery rhyme book characters with equal richness in color found in those glossy, gilded pages. The fabric itself is mid-weight and soft, like a mid-light wt denim shirt. I am using to make a chair pad for the seat and back of a child's rocking chair. The tones look lovely on this oak chair and would look just as lovely on a cherry, walnut or other stain/colored chair. Love it and it is sure to hold up well and make a nice heirloom gift.

not even 4 months old and the screen went black. No sound. Common problem for this brand. Invested in this tv thinking we'd get to enjoy it awhile. China products remain disposable under any brand name...just remember that. Go with less 'bling' unless you don't mind throwing a couple grand away after a few short months. BTW, nearest 'authorized service center' for Samsung is over 200 miles away -- that's something to check out before you invest as well!

Reeeally helps with soreness and recovery! Getting back into working out and taking a bit longer to recover -- this stuff reduced the soreness that typically lingers days which allowed me to work out longer and more often.
Also purchased a navy one and the neck on that was extremely wide and flopped around the neck leaving exposed to sun. The white fit perfectly.
9" length is perfect. Lace front - easy on/off. Comfortable fit. No stretch fabric. Nice print and color.

I bought this for coverup from sun since I spend a lot of time in water. Wanted also for modesty so I didn't like the fitted style. Purchased a L and usually get a M. I would have wanted it to fit like an XL or 2XL to get the looser fit I was seeking. Well made but cant' attest to how quickly it dries or if stitching holds up over time.
Colorful pictures for reading with children. Stories are simplistic for children while remaining relevant and thorough. The parents loved these gifts for their kids!
Used to mark apparel -- holding up nicely and withstood washing/line-drying well!
There is a subsequent book to this one but it rehashes and expands on info. For proper dieting with a wide array of menus and simple ingredients and exercise guidance, this is all you need.
Blocks light well and is comfortable to wear over extended periods. Comes with ear plugs but those are only 'good' because they lessen as opposed to block noise.
Does the job - 2 settings (spray and stream) and the adjacent 2 remaining settings are 'no spray'. Consistent spray, doesn't leak and sturdy sprayer.

Made in USA and uses natural food-grade mineral oil and beeswax to condition and protect the wood surfaces in our kitchen. I found a recipe to make this myself but for convenience, this uses the ingredients I would have chosen so I simply purchased online and provides ample conditioner for many uses. We recently refurbished a wood kitchen rolling cart with chopping block surface and used this product to condition and seal the work surface. The wood readily soaked it up and there was a nice smooth feel to the top. I let it soak in and gave it one more coat for good measure. Don't put synthetic or potentially toxic chemicals on surfaces that come near food -- This is a wonderful wood block conditioner and protectant for surfaces that come in contact with food.
engraved, these would make nice personalized gifts for toddlers. I have a set for each of my grandbabies for holiday meals.

Cross Flow Micro-Filtered Whey Isolate, Micellar Casein, Cocoa, Natural & Artificial Flavors, Egg Albumen, Golden Flax Seed, Fibersol-2™, Sodium Chloride, Sucralose, Acesulfame Potassium.  Contains: milk, soy, lecithin, egg, wheat and tree nuts (kola)

Super for infants and small toddlers -- notsomuch for older toddlers (2-ish, 20lbs) despite the chair being rated for up to 40lbs, my 1.5yr old grand daughter (who is height/weight-appropriate based on age per medical provider) is already almost to big for the chair. The adjustable seat features is great for infants however, and my other grandbaby is getting much use from this chair, albeit for a few months. Will be looking for a chair that can grow with the child to toddler stages.
Beautiful - classic style with flair. Stains wash out easily but did wash on gentle and air dried based on other comments that the gold threads retract under heat.

I had to return two of these to get one that didn't have a broken wheel or a handle that wouldn't extend. Third time is the charm. Not super sturdy for heavy objects. Using this to keep paracord crafts organized and transportable.
Seems to be holding up well in the elements -- Craftsmanship looks well made. My last set of flags held up for over a year in harsh elements before looking worn so hopefully these will last as long.
Spacious - Neiman Marcus sells exact same item for much more $$$
Nice quality!
Used them ONCE after purchase (within 2 weeks of buying on Amazon). Ink was dried out. ALL of the pens were this way! What a waste and ripoff.
K-free but has copper and a form of cyanide in the B12 (synthetic) component.

It used to be safe for people on blood thinners (avoid Vit K) -- but the new formulation contains Spirulina, and Vegetable Extract (spinach, kale, Dandelion greens) -- all VERY RICH IN  VIT K!!!  While this supplement alleges it doesn't "ADD Vit K", it no longer claims it is safe for those on blood thinning medication!
It reminds me of the cheesy background music playing in movies from the cheesy movies from the 1980s.

Looks great - Gift for an 8yr old nephew who likes to dress more like a grown-up -- and being a Gamecock fan, this will delight him, I'm sure. The face is easy to read and has a satin nickel-look finish to it. Sweeping second hand -- looks pretty durable. Sure he will love it.

The worst plot and totally lacking substance. Remove all the fight scenes and you may get 5 minutes of drivel that doesn't even add to the character development, relationships or plot-in-absentia. The actors are doing their jobs -- the writers and director are the problem. This movie does not keep in step with the other Marvel movies where the heros and supporting characters have well-defined relationships and dialogue is meaningful. Rather, all you get are a bombardment of fight scenes and watered down plot that, by the time the movie ends, you realize that it actually was as bad as you thought before ever getting off the ground. Anyone who is more than 10 years old will find this boring. Anyone who is 10 or younger shouldn't be allowed to see it for all the violence in guns and beatings that dominate this 'movie'. Bleh. Waste of money and time I'll never get back.
Baby loves how comfy it is and falls asleep quickly and for long naps. Mommy who is nursing loves having newborn baby alongside of her in various rooms and within easy reach.

Baby loves that she cannot spitoon her paci and lose it anymore. Especially helpful when she breaks into full conversation and just forgets that it's in her mouth -- it's just a reach away. Just the right length and made with good durable materials to stand up to a lot of use.

Wish the contrast between red and orange was a bit more distinctive - should have put warm/cold/warm color arrangements to pull that off. But it is a great means of eyeing your 10-second counts from a distance without your eyeglasses... after the first 20 seconds. :oD

Nice nature sounds -- being outside on a quite summer evening - gentle rainfall, loons, crickets... nothing that 'recycles' the sounds and love to keep it playing in background as I work or am stressed and it naturally destresses after just 10 minutes of play. I've also enjoyed Misty Forest - one of my favorites.

Well made and good stitching at edges and over each side. Good sturdy breathable soft canvas-type material and nice density. Doesn't say situated well with 4 active dogs. Has 2 white straps that fit around the base/seat cushion and some metal grommets with sturdy latch clasps/elastic to use -- and those aren't sufficient to stabilize for long trips -- but it's ok for short stints. Good coverage as far as covering the bench seat backrest and a bit of foldover to the front of the seat. Glad to have it after a day of hiking and letting them romp in the river! ...Eh...Not waterproof :o) but does machine wash really well and holds up after multiple washes. Would definitely buy this product again but think this will last many many years.
Fun!

Aside from the tiny printed instructions and sketchy methods for calculating mixtures (from various dry/wet products' instructions and converting to this device requirements for dispersal), the product works great.

Doesn't mix well in ice water or cold dispensed water (from refrigerator door). Remains cloudy and has a chalky taste. That said, I would add it to flavored beverages and heat/cool after mixing at room temperature, or add to dry mix recipes to bump protein intake.
poor packaging. 3 were broken right out of the box. the product themselves don't last long but that is to be expected I guess.

Some good ideas but fared better finding realistic, affordable applications on the internet. My challenge with books such as these are the ideas cater only to the wheelchair-disabled person and fails to address how to make 'combined spaces' that non-disabled people could function within alongside the disabled person.Not all disabilities are wheelchair disabilities. It would have been helpful to have focused chapters that provide info regarding total hand loss of use, total feet loss of use, vision-disabilities, etc. so as to not have the reader pluck out of the recommendations for wheelchair users to ponder viability for non-wheelchair disabilities their loved ones have.There are lots of pictures showing what one particular home (the author's?) looks like in various rooms but it's certainly not something that people with less space or limited budget could consider. I was hoping to find specific things I could incorporate to the construction aspect rather 'ideas' such as buying elaborate ADA cabinet-systems and special appliances that would limit the functionality for everyone else in the home.From my own research (and not many of these ideas were found in this book), you have zero-thresholds for showers and doorways, lever handles, lowered light switches, raised wall outlets, expanded electrical (for home generator if you have an elevator/chair lift), thermostatic valves, ADA flooring (avoid carpet and engineered wood which will snap/break at the seams under weight of wheelchair-- search "ADA flooring" for more info) and tile which will exacerbate falls and fall injuries; roll-in showers, 36" wide doors, pneumatic doors at exterior doors, home technology (for individual to manage lights, climate, entertainment, security), at least one front and back ramp, ADA height commodes (17-19"), drawers (rather than doors) on lower base kitchen cabinets, 5' turn radius in closets and transition spaces...just to name a few.

Filled with superfluous case studies that are irrelevant or inappropriate in the context of the chapter they appear. The cross-referencing capability is impossible with this book. There is redundant information 'verbatim' from one chapter to the next. Clearly, the author was getting paid by the page! Don't rely on this book to learn medical law.

These are nice in that they don't fog one's eye glasses. However the upper and lower rubber-band mechanisms to hold to your face requires you pull the top and bottom rubber bands back to near full extension and clamp onto head. On older patients and persons with long hair, the rubber bands (that absolutely cannot be any shorter for making this product unusable by adults) would pull out hair and leave stripes on tender skin of elderly wearers when situating or removing.If using these for tender medical patients, I would find something else.
Holding up well and work as well as any thirsty-stone coaster. Hope the images withstand time/use.
Glad to find on Amazon. Proper amount of cotton on tip of applicator (i.e. not skimpy but not bulky either).

Noticed improvement in how I feel. Yellow granular-filled capsules start to dissolve immediately -- in the throat -- which is very unpleasant. However, willing to tolerate since this formulation is vegan and incorporates the safe B12 supplement as opposed to the the cyanide-laden B-12.

this product was discontinued by the mfr in 2012. Whatever product was used to fill my order was counterfeit. I had the last of several bottles purchased in a local franchise drug store and the contents are not even similar in smell, texture, performance.
Lays flat around the edges and handle to remove from drain to clean.
This is the exact OEM replacement for my LG Exalt phone.  Fits perfectly, same quality as the original.  Very pleased to find it for a good price.
Good quality, exact replacement, fits perfectly, works well.

Since all microwaves are different as far as cooking goes and since there are many different brands/kinds of mac and cheese, it takes a bit of practice to get this done to your liking.  This would apply to just about any microwave cooking.  We really like this 2-pack Rapid Mac Cooker.  I have found that you have to be very careful to get the water level just right.  This is how we make ours...  We have an 1100 watt mid-sized micro.  We usually use regular Kraft mac and cheese, occasionally generic.  I put the noodles in the Rapid Mac, fill the water to a smidge below the waterline and give it a quick shake.  Put it in the center of the micro.  Cook for 2:30 minutes at Power 8.  Take out, stir while adding a smidge more water bringing it to the water line. Back in the micro for 2:30 minutes at Power 8.  Take it out and stir in additional ingredients in the following order:  butter first, cheese powder second, milk third.  Sometimes we add other things like additional cheese.  Then I micro it for 30 seconds longer at Power 10.  Perfect every time!  This Rapid Mac works especially well for us, as we are on different eating schedules due to work.  Sometimes when one of us will be very late, one of us just wants to eat now.  Easy to do with Rapid Mac.  Don't need two pots, one doesn't have to eat cold mac and cheese, each of us can easily and quickly have our mac and cheese hot and fresh!  Rapid Mac cleans up easily in the dishwasher!  If there was one thing I would change, I would have made the container a bit taller.  The noodles can sometimes boil over, if you add a bit too much water or forget to use less power.  This is not just for kids, we are senior citizens!  Hope this was helpful!

My dog loves this Bounzer toy.  Bought all three sizes, big ones for outside, medium one for inside.  She carries the medium one around all day, often chewing on it.  The bigger sizes are favorite outside toys she wants to chase and retrieve every day.  Great bounce to these toys.  I tied an old rope chew toy through the handle on the largest Bounzer to make it easier for me to throw.  Holding up really well for my GSD.  Well worth the money.  Lots of fun.  Not as boring as a ball; the erratic bouncing makes the difference!  Works just fine in the heat and extreme cold.  Easy to wash.  No noisy squeaking, just a soft wooshing, which my dog and I both like.  Great toy Kong!

Good job West Paw!  Another great toy that my GSD just loves!  I bought both sizes; using them together and separately.  The fun is endless and so far, my easily bored GSD, still loves these.  We have found several different ways to stuff/use these Toppl's.  Easy to get the treats in.  When the food is gone, my dog loves to just play with these.  They bounce, rock, roll, float, can be chewed on, carried and tossed.  They clean up very nicely/completely in the dishwasher with no signs of deterioration.  I had always thought that Kong was the best brand for treat toys, but my dog and I agree, this one has Kong beat!  (Thought I'd NEVER say that!)  Great treat toy!
This is the exact replacement Dyson part.  If it fits your model Dyson, it will work just fine!

Great one ingredient treat for a dog with allergies.  My GSD loves these.  Have bought these before and will buy again.  Wish they came in a bigger sized container for a better price.  Very good treat!

Simply excellent!  My GSD loves them and so do I!  One ingredient; great if you need a limited ingredient treat for your dog with allergies.  Have tried several of the other flavors, all good too!  Good price for the amount/size.  Long shelf life.  Will buy these again.

Bought these to use in treat dispenser toys.  My GSD hates these and will not eat them.  She leaves them on the floor.  They are so very hard that I can not break them in half with my hands.  Difficult to cut with a knife.  Expensive for the amount you get.  Will not buy these again.

These egg cups are just lovely!  Beautiful, quality, Polish crafted pottery.  They fit my large size soft boiled eggs perfectly.  They make my breakfast and day a bit more pleasant.  I just love these.  They are the real deal, no made in China imitations.  Heavy clear coat over the glaze.  Pretty pattern coordinates well with my Sandstone based Corelle dishes.  Glad I ordered these, much nicer than cheap, plain egg cups.  Not a bad price for a set of four.  Dziękuję bardzo!

I've used it on my dogs and it seems to work pretty well.  Smells nice--of wintergreen!  Since using it, my dogs pads don't seem to crack or get quite so worn from walking on concrete.  Seems to help keep the winter road salt from hurting their paws, too.  I'll purchase it again!

We love Lindt Truffles, but these arrived in poor condition.  The weather is very cool here and along the route these took, so these must have been melted before shipping.  They are just a deformed mess.  This is the first time we tried this flavor; the taste is not completely terrible, but not good either, having a bit of an artificial, chemical, waxy taste, not very chocolatey and not white chocolatey either.  Don't think we would ever buy these again.  Disappointed.

We love Lindt Truffles, but not these.  They arrived today in a terrible condition.  They had been melted before arrival, which must have happened before shipping, as the weather is very cool and the other brand of candies we ordered wasn't melted like these.  In addition, they taste very peculiar, not at all like caramel with milk chocolate.  First time we tried this flavor.  Very disappointed, definitely would not purchase these again.

This would be a good supplement for any time of year, but I use it primarily for the colder months.  My dogs like to eat a bit of grass during the warm weather.  In the early spring/late fall/winter they seem to miss that, sniffing at the places where they ate grass in the summer.  When I started adding a little of these dried greens to their food each day, they seemed not to look for the summer grass spots anymore.  They seem to like it in their food.  It seems to be a good source of fiber for them, helping to keep their digestive tract working smoothy.  I have purchased this for several years now and will do so again.

Purchased three of these and like them very much.  The ribbed knit collar acts as a neck gaiter, keeping the wind and snow out.  Very insulated, wind-proof and warm.  A bit on the small side; would have liked a slightly more generous cut in the hood and a slightly longer knit collar.  Great that there are no snaps.  Easy to use with ANY jacket, not just Carhartt.  We like the fact that by NOT having the hood snapped to the jacket, you have increased mobility and are able to turn your head freely, such as when snow blowing or needing to see traffic, etc.  Okay price for Carhartt items.  Durable, kept us warm on windy -30 degree F. nights during blizzard conditions.  Would definitely purchase again!

Just plain funny from good ol' Don Knotts!  Great actor, family friendly, entertaining for all ages.  Four great movies in one set at a good price!  Wish there were still movies like this made today.  DVD's played just fine.  Glad we purchased and would do so again!

This is NOT the regular Lipton's Tea sold in the USA.  This Lipton's Yellow Label Tea is what most of the rest of the world drinks when they drink Lipton's.  It is not acidic as is the regular USA version we all know (IE: no pucker/dry mouth).  It is bold, but mellow--sometimes with a hint of smoky flavor.  We first drank this while living overseas, I love this Yellow Label tea.  It is very good made as hot tea as well as iced.  Very good with milk or cream.  I have purchased this for years and will definitely purchase this again!

I loved the very pretty opal in this pendant, BUT the gold setting was of very poor quality.  The setting had numerous pits, flaws and scratches.  This did not appear to be something done after manufacture.  These marks were VERY visible, close up and from a distance.  It ruined the look of this otherwise very lovely pendant.  The diamonds were okay, better than average, for this type of pendant.  Due to the quality of the setting, I reluctantly returned this.  The setting was made in China.  Very disappointed.

I loved the very pretty opals in these earrings, BUT the gold settings were of very poor quality.  The settings had numerous pits, flaws and scratches.  This did not appear to be something done after manufacture.  These marks were VERY visible, close up and from a distance.  It ruined the look of these otherwise very lovely earrings.  The diamonds were okay, better than average, for this type of earring.  Due to the quality of the settings, I reluctantly returned them.  The settings were made in China.  Very disappointed.

I purchased this collar for my large German shepherd dog.  I like it because it is comfortable for him to wear and for me to "grab" when I need to hold him by the collar.  It is very sturdy, won't slip like some other collars and is easy to put on/take off and adjust the fit.  No pinched fingers, fur or skin with this buckle!  It has lasted for several years and still looks almost new.  Easy to wash, when needed.  I would purchase again!

This is a very nice pendant and at a pretty good price.  The stones are surprisingly large, sparkly, bright and clear.  The pendant is quite large and of heavy/sturdy 10K yellow gold construction.  The chain is the usual flimsy thing.  I would use a different chain.  It is made in China.  The only problem I had was that of the two I had here, each time there was one defective prong equaling a loose stone.  It could have been fixed, but I purchased for a gift, so rather than give a repaired gift, I returned them.  I would order this again in the future--perhaps I just got the last two defective ones.  (It was out-of-stock after my order.)  It really is a lovely pendant, especially so for the price.  I would like to see a matching set of earrings available for this pendant.  Hope this helps!

This was a very strange and yet very funny movie!  Sad, funny, gory, deceitful and sweet--all rolled into one movie.  Each time you thought you had the plot figured out--WRONG!!!  This movie keeps you guessing right to the end!!!  Had to watch the end twice to make sure we got the whole thing.  Pretty good acting, quirky funny characters, good story, brutally cold setting (like this winter of 2013-2014 in the lower 48--yes?).  Just hilarious!  We will watch this one again!

This wasn't the worst movie, kind of so-so...  It started out pretty good, but seemed to kind of "lose it's focus" leaving us a bit confused as to what the point was.  It wasn't really funny, sometimes sad, mostly mediocre.  I think the nudity was way overdone, adding nothing to the movie.  I would have liked not having to read sub-titles so much--my spouse didn't have reading glasses along, so missed all the meaning in the sub-title part of the movie.  We might watch it again someday.  Really just so-so...

I think this could have been a much better movie.  Robin Williams and the supporting actors Diane Lane, Brian Kerwin, Fran Drescher, Jennifer Lopez and Bill Crosby are capable of much better acting and deserve a MUCH better script and directing.  Mostly, Robin Williams seemed kind of creepy and so did Bill Cosby.  We did not find this to be a funny movie and were glad when it ended.  Big disappointment...

Well, I don't know about everyone else, but WE loved it!  This movie was just the thing we needed.  Funny and yet reminding us of things in our own life.  Robin Williams is the guy we can all identify with.  This movie is great for all ages, sweet at times, funny all the way through and makes you feel good, especially in the end.  Made you still believe that nice guys don't always end up the loser and that families are still the most important thing.  I am glad we purchased this movie and will definitely watch it again someday.

This rack will fit in an oval 6 quart West Bend and an oval 7 quart  Hamilton Beach slow cooker.  It is made of very heavy gauge wire; very sturdy!  The non-stick coating on the new rack arrived with an area about an inch or more long that looks like it has been repaired with black shiny, speckled paint.  The coating isn't very non-stick, but somewhat better than nothing.  If I have future durability problems, I will update.  I would have liked this rack so much more if it were raised about double the current height, which isn't much.  The meat, etc. doesn't sit high enough to stay out of the juices.  There is room for improvement; but it fits-works-is sturdy!  Hope this is helpful!

This is a good rack for oval slow cookers.  It fits in a 6 quart oval West Bend and a 7 quart oval Hamilton Beach.  If there is something I would have changed, it would be to make it a bit sturdier.  It's a bit flimsy, but it does the job!  Cleans up fairly easily.  Not too expensive.  Hope this was helpful!  UPDATE:  I have downgraded this a bit due to the VERY SHARP ends on the rack spokes.  The spokes on this rack are cut very sloppily and are very sharp--I cut my hand when handling this.  I did end up sanding the ends of the spokes with fine grit sandpaper, which was annoying and time consuming, but mostly fixed the problem.  Might NOT buy this one again until it's improved...

I ordered this Hamilton Beach 7 Quart Slow Cooker because I wanted one that was BIGGER than my older West Bend 6 Quart; which is great, but not always quite big enough.  When this arrived, I very carefully measured water TWICE to fill the crock.  I wanted to be sure it would hold a full 7qts.  IT DOES NOT!!!  To the very top of the inner rim, it holds 6 quarts plus barely 1 cup.  My good old 6 quart West Bend slow cooker does hold exactly 6 quarts.  So, if I keep this Hamilton Beach, I've gained only 1 cup in capacity!  I looked on the HB website for a replacement crock (thinking this one may be defective) only to find that the replacement crock for this model is clearly stated to be 6.5 quarts capacity!  To say that this is 7 quarts is very misleading, as it clearly is NOT.  Other than this, I did like ALL the other features very much; except I really would have preferred a decorative patterned white or bisque for the color.  I do own another older, smaller HB slow cooker that I like, so this is a BIG disappointment.  If a full 7 quarts is not important to you, this is a great slow cooker, if 7 quarts is important--keep looking.

This replacement screw--KitchenAid Part # 9709194--fit my KitchenAid K5SS mixer just fine.  The shaft on the knob end of the screw sticks out of the machine about 1/16 of an inch farther than my old one, but it works just like the original.  Good price, too!

These are great gloves if you want fingerless.  My spouse is a UPS driver and needs to have finger tips free to work the diad board.  Yet, my spouse still wants some sort of glove for hand protection and a little warmth.  These work great.  My spouse has used these for many years.  A pair will last my UPS delivery driver 6+ months of hard 12 hour days, 5-6 days a week.  Delivering, loading, handling and driving.  No other glove has held up as well; most others fail in a month.  Comfortable, durable, well worth the money and saves your hands from wear and tear.  Will definitely buy these again!

These are possibly the best quality vanilla beans I have ever found.  Very fresh, heavenly aromatic, strong vanilla flavor, nice size and seem to be as advertised.  Very happy with this purchase and will buy again when needed.  Very good quality!!!

Bought this brush to clean coffee/tea stained thermos mugs and this certainly does the job quickly!  It is holding up pretty well.  This brush is similar in texture to Scotch Brite scouring pads, but thicker and pleated.  I do wish the handle was an inch or two longer, but it works.  This brush needs a thorough rinsing after use and needs some time to air dry.  Otherwise, I believe it would grow bacteria and smell.  Sometimes I put it in the dishwasher for a good cleaning/sanitizing.  I would buy this again.  Hope this is helpful.

This Sierra Club Wilderness Calendar is nice.  Beautiful photos, big area to write appointments each day, okay printing, paper is a bit on the thin side.  However, I DO NOT like the spiral binding, as it is rubbing on the wall leaving fine marks on the paint.  I had to cover the spiral binding with a large, long piece of sticky felt.  That took time, cost money and caused aggravation.  One other thing, this calendar is much longer than the standard-sized calendar.  For us, it hangs too low in our "calendar spot", making it slightly harder to read/use.  Just something to take into account...  Might order again next year, not sure.  Hope this helps!

I bought this calendar to use by my desk, as it is smaller.  It is surprisingly nice, especially for the price.  The paper it is printed on is the thickest calendar paper I have seen in decades.  The paper is coated (spill-resistant, I think) and textured.  The prints (paintings) are exceptionally beautiful.  The quality of the printing is very nice.  The cover has a brass-colored rivet in the hanging hole, so the page won't rip through.  The quality of this calendar is outstanding and I will buy this John Sloane's Country Seasons calendar again next year, maybe in the larger size, too.  Glad I bought it, very nice!

We just love this cereal.  It is creamy, tasty, different, fairly quick and easy-to-prepare, gluten-free, comfortingly warm on cold days, but good anytime of year.  We do not NEED to eat gluten-free, but have found that we seem to feel better after eating this cereal versus other grains.  I think the price could be MUCH lower (other brands are).  Since there is just the two of us now and we buy it here cheaper than locally; we enjoy this cereal weekly.  I make a whole box full at a time, cooked with milk, usually on Sunday.  This is about 4 generous "real" servings.  We eat two servings and I portion out the other two servings into reheatable microwave bowls for hectic Monday morning!  Good served with butter.  Cream/sugar/maple syrup is optional.  We will buy this again!

I ordered these several months ago and like many things about them, but even though I am very careful, they are showing cracks.  The cracks have not affected their useability as yet, but probably will someday.  I like the fact that you can read the measurements from the outside or inside of the cups.  The shape is "fun", however, when full of liquid, these are a bit tricky to carry without spilling.  Especially the largest one.  I like that they nest for storage.  Would I order again?  Maybe, maybe not...  Hope this helps!

We bought these SweetLeaf SteviaTabs for traveling and like them very much.  The tabs dissolve very well in warm/hot beverages.  Travel container is small, sturdy and handy.  Doesn't need refrigeration.  Handy to keep in the truck.  Slightly too sweet for smaller cups of tea, but fine for larger cups of coffee (could be half strength).  Still prefer the liquid drops for at home, but these are great for travel.  These are much, much too expensive and the nice container could easily hold more than 100 tabs (for the price, the container should be full).  Not messy like powder, no tearing open packets.  Will buy again for traveling.

I bought this Thomas ABS Plastic Traceable Refrig/Freezer Thermometer with Bottle Probe to use in my large freezer.  My freezer has 2 regular thermometers inside, a power light on the outside and I check all regularly.  But recently, my freezer temps started to fluctuate wildly and then plunged sharply downward.  Even though I checked it, I missed the wild fluctuations until I had a freezer full of mostly freezer-burned food.  After purchasing a NEW freezer, I found this thermometer.  So far, it works WONDERFULLY!  I can now see the temp from the outside, so can check it much more often and I can see the high/low fluctuation in temp, so I know if it's too much.  This thermometer has an alarm that can be set with high/low temps, so I might know even sooner, if something is amiss.  It is a bit tricky to figure out how to set it at first, as the directions are a bit confusing, but once figured out and set in place, it is great!  The main temp display is fairly large (easy to see from a distance).  The alarm is fairly quiet, not too easy to hear from outside the room it's in, but I guess you can't expect too much from one small (included) battery.  At least it's something and along with the display will give me more piece-of-mind than before.  The fold out stand is tipsy, so I use the enclosed magnetic/Velco strips.  The bottle probe is nice because it moderates the temp fluctuation when I open the freezer door.  That way the alarm isn't going off each time I do so.  The generous 10' long probe wire is thin, but still leaves a small gap in the freezer gasket.  An unfolded paper clip works well for pushing the reset button.  I like it so much, I ordered another one for my smaller freezer.  I wish the price were lower.  Hopefully, it will last longer than my freezer did!  If I encounter problems, I will update...

This Portable 24 LED Super Bright Deluxe Camping Lantern with Compass by Think Tank Technology is NOT very sturdy, so is of minimal use for camping, where you would want something more rugged.  However, it is useful for in the house "lights out" emergencies or in the back yard sitting on the picnic table at dusk.  It is easy to hold on to and stands up nicely.  Very bright, producing a wide area of light.  The battery compartment is a bit hard to open, but if you are careful, it can be done.  The little hanging loop is sturdy and handy if you want to hang it up.  The compass is of minimal value and not very accurate.  The plastic this is made of is very thin and hard.  I am a very careful person, but soon after purchase, I knocked it over; it dropped about 18 inches or so onto the vinyl floor, landing on the top corner which shattered into three pieces.  The good news is the light still worked, I was able to find the pieces and fitting them together one at a time I was very successful in gluing them back together with a liberal amount of Gorilla Super Glue.  Would I buy another?  Well, it is fairly inexpensive, so I might, unless I could find something better for a similar price.  Hope this is helpful!

I bought this Quartet Magnetic Dry-Erase Board Tile (85401) mostly for the magnetic properties.  I attached it to the back wall of my desk hutch, so I could post small notes, etc. with magnetic push-pins or clips.  It attaches with 4 double-sided, self-stick foam squares that you may place as needed; manufacturer suggests the four corners.  The back of the board is thick corrugated cardboard, tucked inside a front metal shell.  If you ever want to move the board once attached, the cardboard back will likely just tear off, leaving bits stuck to the 4 pieces of foam.  You could attach new foam pieces in a slightly different spot, purchased separately, to reuse the board.  The board I received is plain white (not assorted colors or silver).  The dry-erase pen is small, held on the side with a clear plastic clip attached to the board.  It also has a magnet on the pen cap, but this doesn't hold the pen onto the board very well, as the pen (in cap) is too heavy.  The pen seems to write just fine on the board, the cap has a felt eraser, which works fine, too.  Doesn't seem to leave ghost images, when erased.  Comes with two round button magnets about an inch in diameter.  One is slightly defective, but still works.  The board has a few small dings on the front, probably due to shipping.  I would have liked a slightly longer board with a better way to attach and remove, but otherwise, it is okay.  I think it should be cheaper, but I needed something that would fit a certain area, so...  Hope this helps you decide!

My GSD has many food allergies, so finding treats she can have is a challenge.  She loves these Whole Life Beef treats and since they are one ingredient (that she can have), it is simple and easy.  These are great for stuffing in her Kong toys, crumbled over her food for variety and added protein and make excellent, not messy training treats!  They come in a wide variety of flavors, so my dog has more than one choice.  They are a bit expensive (price could be lower), but are very light in weight, so they last pretty long.  We will buy these again.

I love, love, love this KMF Olive Oil soap and have used it for years.  Great for gently, yet thoroughly removing make-up and leaves my skin soft and lightly moisturized.  Very simple, basic ingredients.  No perfume smell to set off my allergies or clash with other scented products.  Just clean happy skin!  Only one brand I like very slightly better--Olivella--from Italy, but since it is hard-to-find and only available here in a 12-pack (which will go stale before I use it all), KMF is the winner!  Love it!  Bet you will, too!

My GSD has many food allergies.  It has been a struggle to find a dry kibble that she could eat, likes and is higher in protein.  Most limited ingredient kibbles are low protein, mostly fillers--potatoes, peas, grains and must be flavorless, because my dog won't eat them.  Plus, they seem to upset her intestinal tract.  This NV Instinct LID Rabbit flavor is not as good/tasty as the NV regular rabbit flavor, or as high protein, BUT my GSD can eat it, likes it and it is significantly higher in protein than the competition.  It is simple ingredients, has meat FIRST, does have some peas and tapioca, but it does not upset my dogs intestinal tract or cause an allergic reaction and comes in a LID Duck flavor she can have too!  So, we have two choices, to rotate a little bit and keep her from getting bored.  My only "gripe" is that the LID rabbit flavor ONLY comes in a small 4.4 pound or a large 25.3 pound bag size.  For my dog a medium sized bag would be right.  Small bag (very expensive) only lasts a few days; large bag goes stale before she finishes it.  The LID duck flavor comes in a medium sized bag, as do the other 2 LID flavors--lamb and turkey (which my GSD can't have).  So, when this comes in a medium sized bag, it may become 5 star.  I would like to see this LID in other unique proteins or perhaps in pork flavor.  Otherwise, this is pretty good and we will buy it again!

I have fed these to my dog for years (two strips per day) with no ill effects.  My dog has allergies, doesn't like most treats and this was one of the few things she could have and loved.  BUT, not only are they made in China, which I DID NOT like (and hoped Dogswell would change to USA or other sources), NOW Dogswell has changed the ingredients to include VEGETABLE GLYCERIN AS THE SECOND INGREDIENT.  I wish Dogswell would source these from the USA or other reputable country with NO VEGETABLE GLYCERIN.  One more thing, the packages with the added glycerin have a light blue strip on the bottom of the bag where the weight is (on the front) and the company address (on the back).

We haven't even had this table 2 years and already the top and seats are crazed and cracking.  It sits on my patio, semi-protected from the weather and mostly, it sits there unused.  We sit/eat at the table a few times each year, just the two of us.  Yes, it is exposed to the weather, but is protected some, especially in the winter, when we cover it with a tarp.  We paid a lot for this and expected a much longer lifespan.  The plastic is too thin.  One other annoying thing is that the plastic table/benches are statically charged.  My clothes/hair stand out; dog fur, grass, dirt jumps on the table and is difficult to remove, as it is so statically charged that it sticks to your hand, if you do manage to get it off the table.  The shipping was bad; as others have said.  It is not the fault of UPS, rather, it is the packaging.  This very heavy table is just shipped in an inadequate strength carton.  This may be fine for bringing home from a local store, but it is NOT FINE for shipping cross country.  Mine arrived with the box totally ripped apart into pieces that UPS taped back together, as best they could with (no kidding) about two or more rolls of packing tape!  Yes, my table was scratched some, I was not happy about it, but the thought of trying to return or exchange it and having to try to tape the mess of a box again was just too difficult, so reluctantly, we kept it, scratches and all.  I think it would be better if shipped in two boxes.  Disappointed.

I have several other pieces of Swiss Diamond cookware, recently adding this one.  I love the pan, but I hate the metal handle on this pan.  It is similar in shape to the black handles, but not quite.  It is slippery to hold, so your grip is not as firm as with the black handle.  This is of concern because this pan is heavy empty and MUCH heavier when full.  The handle is too long (longer than the black handles) and it doesn't match the collar on the pan (which looks strange), nor my other Swiss Diamond pans, as this is the ONLY one with a different handle.  I wanted this pan for the size, so I guess I will keep it, but I'd like to see the black handle on it, not the metal.  Not too keen on the glass lid or vented knob.  Would like a plain metal lid or at least, a knob without the "spin" vent much better.  Lid is very large and heavy, glass can break and you can't really see through the lid when cooking, as it steams up.  The spin knob closes/opens to let out steam, but spins out of adjustment when you move the lid or sometimes by it's self while cooking.  It also traps water/soap/dirt after washing, which keeps dripping out/running down the glass lid from under the knob for days.  Very annoying!  Hope this is of help.

This is a VERY nice pendant.  The smokey quartz stone is perfectly cut with a very nice medium color.  The filigree setting is very pretty with heavy, not cheap-looking prongs, holding the stone very securely.  The bail is large enough to allow you to put the larger ring on a much sturdier chain.  The one thing I would have liked to see is the ring holding the filigree setting to the bail soldered a bit more, but it is okay so far and could easily be re-soldered, if needed.  The chain that comes with it is the usual thin, flimsy thing, but it is pretty.  The pendant lays nicely when wearing, doesn't roll backwards easily.  All-in-all, a very pretty, above average pendant.  I would like to see this pendant available with different colored stones.  I would buy this again!

This grinder shuts off before even 20 seconds of grinding and even if you wait the 5 minutes the manufacturer says to wait, it will only grind a few seconds and then shuts off again!  I tried to grind 13 T. of coffee for my coffee maker and after a half hour of trying, still didn't have enough!  The other reviewers who said it grinds too fine are absolutely right.  Even on the coarsest French Press setting, it was powdery fine and clogged my filter using the 11 T. I finally was able to produce!  The glass container produced less static than the other brands with plastic containers (such as Capresso).  Going back to pre-ground coffee in a can for now!

These mini turners are more great stuff from Mundial.  I have many of Mundial's knives/utensils from our days of owning a bar/restaurant and food co-op/butcher shop and I love them all!  These mini turners are NSF certified, dishwasher safe, hold up to hard use and handy for cutting/flipping/serving small food items.  They will scratch non-stick bakeware, if you aren't careful, but otherwise are dependable and solid.  They are a small, but very handy size.  I would definitely purchase again.

This is a very good and detailed book if you are a dog owner looking to understand more about your dogs anatomy and how it functions.  Makes it easier to speak intelligently with your veterinarian about your pooch!  Was very helpful during our dog's recent CCL surgeries.  Not enough detail for a vet science student, but more than enough for a concerned/interested dog owner, shelter worker, dog groomer, etc.  Has many detailed, but not cluttered drawings, some photos, a large appendix with anatomy/medical terms/definitions and explainations along with other helpful tips/info.  Book is grouped into logical sections (ie: locomotor section which covers bones, joints, muscles; sections on heart/lungs, internal organs, skin/hair, nervous system, the senses, etc.) and it is reasonably easy to comprehend/understand.  I would buy it again.

From my wife Sarah: This is adorable. Here's what I like about it:- The crib soother fabric animation is adorable. The fabric has a nice feel to it.- It attaches reasonably easy to the crib.- The nature, lullaby music and white noise sounds are very soothing and pleasant. I actually use a sound machine that has some similar sounds. Soothing sounds works for adults, and for babies too!- There is volume control.-  It plays for up to 30 minutes.- There are two light modes (twinkling and tracking) which keep the child's attention. The light lights slow down after 5 minutes, which is relaxing and soothing to the child.- It's over 2 feet long so it provides plenty for the child to look at and decor-wise it's very cute.- The control panel is easy to use and faces out away from the baby.- The surface is washable.Really, it's just very sweet and a really good tool to soothe babies and help them go to sleep peacefully at bed-time. I'd recommend it.

This book is a very good manual for those people in the scientific and engineering fields, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone else.I’ve read many networking books over the years, and decided to review this book because I often think of myself as kind of a nerd. What was not clear to me from reading about the book on Amazon was that this book is really for nerds who are high tech scientist and engineer types. I'm in the creative industry, and quite honestly I did not find this book be a good fit for me.Personally I found the book to be very dry, rambling, and difficult to get through. I felt like I was reading a manual. A lot of the information was basic material that I've found in other networking books that were more appropriate for me. On the positive side, I found the book to be organized well, and enjoyed the fact that there are many highlighted tips scattered throughout the book. I found it helpful that each chapter ends with what the author refers to as Chapter Takeaways. These takeaways are written in bullet point form, allowing the reader to review and remember what they read.Overall, this book will most likely help high-tech people who are looking for jobs or clients. However I wouldn't recommend it to anyone else.

From my wife Sarah: Very simply, this does a decent job of moisturizing and is made of some cleaner ingredients than most products, but it's got some issues.Here's what I like:- I love that it's gluten free and fragrance-free. It's also paraben-free, vegan, and non-GMO. That's fantastic, uncommon and very difficult to find. I'm very sensitive and it does not cause me any allergic reactions.Here's what I don't care for:- I wish it had a better texture. While it does a nice job of moisturizing, I don't like the heavy feel of it, especially on my nose and hands. It's kind of oily and thick, and I feel like I have to wash my hands to get it off my fingers after. Still, after I rub it into the rest of my face it seems to do a decent job of moisturizing.- I don't care for the fact that you can't use it around your eyes. In fact it says that you must avoid your eyes, lids and lashes. Naturally anything going on my face is going to make its way to my eyes, even in very small amounts, so that concerns me. I would also have liked to have the ability to use it in my under eye area.- Though it has some natural ingredients, it also has some of the chemical-sounding ingredients you'll find in non-natural brands.Ultimately, I've been using it for about 5 days, and haven't noticed any real changes other than the fact that my skin feels moisturized. If you're looking for a moisturizing product that's free of all the things I listed above, this will work. For those with oily skin this may be too much.

From my wife Sarah: This unit is well built, sturdy and does its job extremely well. With this Cuisinart it's all about efficiency and quality.There's a great video put out by Cuisinart on YouTube that goes over all of the features of this unit. It can help you get a better sense of what this food processor is like. Amazon doesn't allow for the link address, so just put "Cusinart 14 cup food processor" in the search bar on YouTube.Here's what I like about it:- It's sleek looking if you plan to leave it on your counter. It looks like a very professional grade device.- It does an excellent job of shredding, chopping, pureeing, etc. It even allows for mixing dough.- It's reasonably easy to use and figure out. The directions are well written and easy to follow (that's a big plus in my book).- The accessories box that comes with it is convenient, nicely designed and sturdy. It makes it easy for me to safely store the parts together. My old unit didn't have this, and it was annoying to figure out how to store the blades without getting cut. It's also lockable, which is a great safety feature for those with kids.- It's easy to clean up.- The retractable cord is very convenient, neat and clean.- The two work bowl sizes are really perfect for me. One is 4 1/2 cups and the other is 14 cups.  The pour spouts are helpful and the bowls have measurement markings which are also helpful.- A small note - It comes with a spatula that works well with the unit.The only thing that may be challenging for some people is the size and weight. It's tall and large. It does fit under my cabinets, so for me the height is not a problem. However I noticed one poster who said it didn't fit in theirs. For me personally, it's on the heavy side, so I don't want to be moving it around.Other than that, I have no negatives. It works great, looks great, and is easy to use, so I'd highly recommend it.

From my wife Sarah: This is a nice, casual table cloth of decent quality. There was a flaw with a pull in the fabric, but it seemed minor. The fabric had a nice sheen to it, and the texture brings it up a level. I agree with the other reviewers who say that although it's 100% polyester, it looks like linen.I'm happy with it. For the price it's just right for having friends over for a casual dinner. I'd recommend this table cloth.

We're fans of GermGuardian and own three of their large units and a small unit that fits into an outlet which we keep in the bathroom. We're really happy with this air purifier. It does a nice job of cleaning the air in our bedroom.  We love that it has the UV light, along with the HEPA filtration, so we find it to be effective. It handles odors and dust along with germs, bacteria and mold.The size is great for our bedroom. It's small and very light. It fits easily on our desk top.If you turn it all the way up, it's on the loud side, but at bedtime we just turn it down to the lowest level and it's a very quiet white noise kind of sound. When I walk into the room I'm usually not even sure if it's on or not and I have to come close to listen.Another good thing is that you don't see any light emitting from it, so it's fine to use in your bedroom at night.The only issue we have with this unit is that it's hard to tell whether the UV light is still working or not. These bulbs need to be replaced periodically, and on all the other GermGuardian units that we own, you can easily see if the light has gone out. On this unit to see that the light is still functioning you have to get up close and peek inside. You can see a very tiny pinpoint of light if it's working.

From my wife Sarah: This book is very informative, well written, easy to understand, and it has actionable steps. It's appropriate for anyone with almost any kind of illness, and anyone wanting to maintain good health for life.Lately I've been hearing about the massive impact of your gut microbiome on your term health, and how any imbalance can be the root cause of a large number of illnesses. I've known for decades that after having taken antibiotics you needed to take replenish your good gut bacteria, but I thought it was enough to take one acidophilus pill a day for a couple weeks. It turns out that it's far more complicated than that.Dr. Robynne does an excellent job of describing the problem. I was really surprised to see how many illnesses could have this imbalance as the root cause. This book should bring a lot of hope to many people - turn around your microbiome and you may be able to improve your health. The book is packed with the information that you need to do it.Dr. Robynne shared actionable steps that you can take to reverse the problem. It turns out that restoring the microbiome throughout your body requires a number of steps including the intake of much greater quantity and a much wider variety of good bugs than I had thought. It's also done through a variety of other means including the addition of fermented foods, and pre-biotics (foods that feed the good bugs), etc. She suggests dietary changes, lifestyle changes and time to heal.The book is well organized, very easy to understand, and eye opening. I'd say pretty much everyone should read it.

From my wife Sarah: My husband and I have been using Purell for years as a way to avoid viruses that are spread by touch. I purchase a bottle of this size that I keep in my car, and I also get a small purell container that attaches to exterior of my handbag. I refill the small one with the large Purell I keep in my car. This is so convenient.I've found the claims to be true - It does leave my hands feeling a bit softer, and it's not sticky. It dries quickly. I'm not sure that I notice a difference in the effect on my skin between the regular clear Purell and the Purell with aloe.The Purell with aloe seems to have a slightly stronger fragrance than the clear version.For those who are on a gluten free diet - This product is NOT GLUTEN FREE. I'm on a strict gluten free diet, so I had called the company years ago and they said it was gluten free. I called again today and they said it's not. The only gluten free purell is the alcohol free version with product number 5784-04. However when I look it up on Amazon and around the web, for some reason it's selling for an amazingly huge amount $67 for 4 bottles.So although this is a great product, unfortunately I'll be moving on to a gluten free hand sanitizer, but my husband will finish our Purell bottles.

These are excellent! I'm using them with my iPad to watch movies and videos, and I'm very happy with these headphones. I don't have a Samsung or Android smartphone or tablet so I can't address that.We have Bose sound systems in our home for our TV's, and they give excellent sound quality, so I'm not surprised that the sound quality with these headphones is also excellent. The sound is crisp, clear and full of depth. And they really do block out outside noise quite well. The world kind of disappears when I have these on, but you can also use it with "Aware Mode" which is cool because it allows you to hear outside noises in the background.The ear pieces fit in my ears comfortably, and they're very secure. It comes with a nice little case to protect them when not in use.While I haven't tried other noise cancelling headsets in the same price range, I can say that I'm really happy with this set, and would recommend it.

This set includes the following:- 8" pliers- 6" cutter pliers- 6" long nose pliers- 10" vise-grip pliers- 8" adjustable wrench.All of the pliers are made of carbon steel and are very high quality.  They are very solid and well-made. They're comparable with other high quality tools you can purchase.Upon opening the packaging, I noticed that the tools have a slight oily film on them, which leaves your hand smelling like a mechanic's hands.Most of the tools feel comfortable in my hands, because they have soft grip handles. That makes them easy to use and grip tightly for many jobs. Unfortunately the adjustable wrench does not have a soft grip, and the steel feels very rough in my hands. It's not very comfortable to use, but because the metal has a rough feel, it's still easy to grip. I would have preferred a soft grip handle on that wrench as well.The vise-grip, seems very rough to adjust at first, but working it a few times loosens up the mechanism.The pliers and wrench all have the Ford Emblem imprinted on them. Not being a Ford lover, I don't really care for this, but it really doesn't effect the usefulness of these pliers.The packaging indicates that the pliers have a "Limited Lifetime Warranty." However there's no information on what the limitations are, or what you can do if a tool fails. For craftsman tools, you can just bring them back to Sears and they'll replace them. I would have no idea on what to do with a defective tool from this set.Overall, I'd say that this set of tools is a very good add-on to my tool box.

We own many different air purifiers because of, and use them around the house. Those include a Delonghi Energy Star Air Purifier, and a Germ Guardian 3-in-1 Air Cleaning System, a Germ Guardian Stainless Steel UV-C Room Air Sanitizer, and Aireox model 45.  All of these do a decent job, with different strengths and weaknesses.The higher priced Aireox is the most complete air filtration system, and many people with chemical sensitivities and allergies prefer it. I've reviewed the Delonghi unit on Amazon, and to summarize we find that it does a good job for the price. The Germ Guardians are excellent at removing and killing mold spores and bacteria from the air.The AeraMax Baby DBB5 does a decent job of air filtration. Although the unit is supposedly for a baby’s room, it can work in any small room in your house.The unit is very easy to set up. It comes with a very simple diagram that tells you how to open it and remove the filters from their plastic wrap. Once I powered it on, the first thing I noticed when I turned it on was the smell - it was really overpowering. I let the unit run continually at a high speed in my home office for around 48 hours before the odor finally dissipated. Several weeks later there's a very faint smell left. You should be aware of this before you just start using this unit for the first time in a baby’s room.What I like about this unit is it’s small size and it’s quiet operation at its low speed. At it’s lowest fan setting, I hardly notice the unit is working.  However when the unit is moved to even the second setting, the sound gets louder. This may be an issue for anyone who needs real quiet for sleep.The lights on the unit change from blue to orange if there’s a sudden odor in the room. That’s a comforting feeling to know the unit is working and removing bad things from the air.Overall, I feel that this unit does its job reasonably well.  Although the size of the unit prevents it from working effectively in a larger room, it certainly can do its job in a small bedroom or home office.

There’s a lot to like about this phone AND a lot to dislike. It depends on what you’re hoping for in phone.After unboxing the phone, I experienced this right away. The first challenge was figuring out how to open it, to insert the sim card and battery. There are no arrows indicating if the back slides off or just pops open.I found that I was able to pry the back off and insert the sim card and battery. After a short charge the phone started up.One cool thing with the phone is that it comes with a screen protector that you can apply. It also comes with a rubber cover for the back of the phone. Those were two nice surprises.The phone instantly recognized my T-Mobile sim card, and all of my contacts appeared.Phone OperationThe manual that came with the phone contains very little useful instructions. It was a matter of trial and error, playing with the phone to learn how to use it.  After a few weeks, I’m still trying to figure things out. The fact that this phone has a lack of clear documentation, instructions and support is a major mark against it in my opinion.TextingI like the texting features, especially the ability to do voice texting. I find the voice texting to be about 90% accurate. The on screen keyboard is comparable to other phones. I find it easy to text.VoicemailSo far this is the most frustrating feature of this phone. I cannot find any indicators that let me know that I have a voicemail message.  There’s a text icon on the home screen that has a small red number when you receive texts. That also holds true for missed calls. But there’s nothing that lets you know you have a voicemail. That’s disappointing.Voice QualityI find the voice quality to be good. I need this phone for business, and I can hear every call and they can hear me fine. It has not dropped a call since I’ve had the phone.ScreenThe screen is bright and easy to read. The size of the phone and screen are more than adequate.Audio notificationsI keep hearing beeps that are indicating some form of notification, but I have no idea what I’m being notified for. Is it a Text, and email, Facebook? Who knows?!CameraThe 5 MP camera is not very good quality. It’s barely adequate if we’re being honest.Sim CardsThis phone allows for dual sim cards. I still have no idea how to take advantage of this, but for some folks this is probably a great feature, if you can figure it out without any sort of direction.Battery LifeBattery life for this phone is horrible. Just using it for about 2 hours I noticed that I was down to 40% battery remaining. That’s bad.Yesterday I had a 52% battery left when I put the phone down for the evening. When I awoke, the battery was completely drained, and the phone would not turn on. That battery lasts about 6 to 8 hours with very little use.SupportSupport for this phone is non-existent. There’s nobody to call, no YouTube videos to watch, outside of a few unboxing videos.Overall impressionFor my first android phone, it certainly has lots to offer. I really needed this as a good phone for business purposes.  In certain respects it’s met that need. I think for the price, it’s a decent phone. But I need something better and easier to use.If you’re looking to just upgrade to an Android phone from a flip phone, this may be a good starter phone for you.

From my wife Sarah:On the plus side:- For the price, these razors do a capable job. They were great on my skin, and I've had no scrapes or cuts. They've given me a smooth shave on my legs.On the downside, it may be unfair to compare these to the Gillette Venus because it's a more expensive razor, but I'd recommend purchasing that one if you can spring for the extra few dollars. Here's why:- The grip on the Bic Soleil is a bit awkward and it's easy to drop when it's wet. I dropped it several times in the shower this last time. The grip on the Gillette Venus is natural and comfortable.- The razor head on the Bic Soleil is locked in place, making it a bit more awkward to use. The razor head on the Gillette Venus flexes smoothly and moves with the curves of your body, making it easy to use. I'm also more confident that I won't be cut with this because of the motion of the head.While I feel the Bic Soleil did a good job, I've found the Gillette Venus easier to use, more comfortable, and I feel more confident that I won't get cuts or irritated skin with it. However if your budget allows for the Bic Soleil, I'd definitely recommend it.

From my wife Sarah: I'm actually kind of confused on how to rate this because there are things I like about it a lot, and things I strongly dislike.First, this is a small gift book, at 4 inches wide by 3 3/4 inches tall. It's got a hard cover, and it's nicely made. The pages discuss rituals and/or beliefs found in different countries and cultures around the world. The author has chosen these beliefs/rituals, and presents them as a lesson - and as something that supposedly helps make these people happy. The author then offers a life lesson for each page, and sometimes a ritual that the reader can do themselves. The idea is that these lessons and rituals can help make the reader happy.Here are the pros and cons as I see it:Pros:- Just the very concept of the book makes you think. I found myself thinking some deep thoughts, such as what would make me happy, and what happiness meant to me. I even contemplated about whether happiness was essential in life. I think this is a really positive thing as it makes you examine your life, your beliefs and your values.- Some of the lessons really make you think, and are even helpful. For example, I liked the lesson titled "Get lost to find yourself". The author suggests the following: "Everyone can take time out. Book a solo holiday - you'll be forced to find yourself, and discover what really interests you. Take control of areas  in which you feel vulnerable - master basic car mechanics, or learn how to boil an egg. Gain confidence in your own abilities, and take comfort in knowing that you can rely on yourself".I like those suggestions. Maybe I wouldn't do the exact things the author is suggesting, but I appreciate the concepts and I think this could easily be applied to my personal interests and needs. I think this could be helpful.Cons:- While it's interesting to learn about other cultures and faiths, some of the life lessons the author is coming up with based on those ideas seem completely against common sense and at times, against my Judeo-Christian faith.For example, on the page related to Buddhist sand mandalas, the author suggests the following: " Celebrating transience is strangely comforting. Draw chalk pictures on your front path, then watch them be worn away by time or rain. Make a sand castle. Accept the inevitable truth that nothing lasts, and savour the peace that comes with it."Maybe someone else will find that comforting, but I do not personally find transience anything to celebrate. I recently lost two close family members and it's been very difficult. To me the author's "lesson" feels very shallow, and even ridiculous. There's absolutely nothing about drawing chalk pictures on my sidewalk and watching them wear away that's going to comfort me regarding my own mortality or the death of those I love. Someone writing that I should accept the inevitable truth that nothing lasts, doesn't help me to do that. Savour the peace that comes with it? I don't think so. Maybe there's peace within my own personal faith, but not with these suggestions.So would I recommend this book as a gift or even for yourself? Personally I wouldn't feel motivated to give this book away or to suggest it as something to buy for yourself, but it's certainly got some value if you can pick through it and find the things that have value to you.

From my wife Sarah - This just didn't work for me. I've had pain in my coccyx (tail bone) on and off for years, and when it recently flared again I purchased this pillow. Unfortunately it didn't relieve the pressure on my tail bone. I also found the cushion to be very hard, and the shape put pressure in various places  including my tail bone. I found it to be quite uncomfortable.Fortunately Amazon is excellent at taking returns, so this will be going back.The pillow case is nice and soft, and I like the color. However this is just not effective for me. I see that many people feel it's perfect for them, so I think we can assume that the effectiveness of this product will vary, depending on your body shape and your area of pain.

From my wife Sarah: I purchased this as a part of a plan for lyme disease to break down biofilms. I found that this stuff is the best natural anti-inflammatory I've found! This was actually visible on blood tests - my inflammatory markers were down significantly. It diminished pain significantly (though not as significantly as with drugs like NSAID's or prescription pain pills, of course).I take serrapeptase with this product: From Fatigued to Fantastic's End Pain, but that product by itself didn't do nearly as much as it does with the serrapeptase. Combined the two products really take the edge off. I wish I knew about this sooner!After being on this product for several months, I decided to try Dr.'s Best serrapeptase because it's stronger. However it jut didn't work for me. My pain increased and I finally went back to the NutraMedix brand.Serrapeptase will also thin the blood and break down clots.It's Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Starch Free and Dairy Free.I'd definitely recommend this product.

From my wife Sarah: When we opened the package we were surprised to see that it was nicer than we expected. The color was a very attractive light periwinkle blue - it had more intensity than the photo. The fabric had a nice sheen to it, and the woven texture also brought it up a level. It's on the thicker side, isn't wrinkly, and resists staining.I see some people saying that it's cheap looking. Is this appropriate for your next fine dining gourmet event? Maybe not, but for the price it's just right for having friends over for a nice dinner. I'd certainly recommend this table cloth.

The first thing I noticed was the size of this unit. It's huge!  It's actually larger than our microwave oven. That's a problem for us, because we have limited counter and cabinet space. I can't imagine most people being able to fit this dehydrator in their kitchen.That being said, the good part about the size is you can fit a LOT of food in it because of all its 6 large trays, and 2 expansion trays that add height and allow you to accommodate taller, thicker items.The trays seem a little thin to me, but they seem to fit and work properly. The timer is a great feature and you can set it for a full 24 hours. The unit is very easy to use and easy to clean. The instructions are very well written, but the cooking times and temperatures were not right. Some experimentation with longer dehydration times and higher heat were necessary to get the right results.If you have the space, I'd recommend this item.

From my wife Sarah: I tend to be super sensitive and was disappointed that I developed headaches when taking this, so I had to stop. I'm sure that's an unusual response. I think this supplement would be worth trying for anyone trying to lose weight or to help with blood sugar issues like insulin resistance.I'm a big fan of the Jarrow brand and I take many of their supplements daily with no problem. Most are gluten free, and free of many allergens, and they seem to be of consistently good quality. If you're looking to try Garcinia Cambogia, I'd suggest trying the Jarrow brand.

This is an excellent book that would be helpful to anyone who fears rejection. I would say that applies to most people. This book is full of strategies on how to rethink and overcome the negative impact of rejection.The author recognizes that rejection can cause negative emotions and it can be de-motivating. This book is a literary version of a pat on the back! It makes you feel good, helps you get motivated, and helps you to take positive actions.The book includes several inspirational stories that help put things in perspective. I particularly like the "Rejection Toolbox" section of the book. This section encourages the reader to not give up, and to keep trying. It offers several practical strategies for moving forward. These also include negotiation strategies to turn around a situation when you've received rejection.This book is  great for entrepreneurs, sales people, and even those looking to raise their self-esteem after having suffered from personal rejection.I highly recommend this book!

First I'll say that the materials seem sturdy, and the glasses are of nice quality. The fit was very good for me.The problem is that they don't work for all distances for me. I'll explain:1. Reading - They work nicely. When looking down and reading, the words are nice and clear.2. Computer Screen - The view is kind of blurry and slightly distorted.3. Looking across the desk - This view is fine for me.So for me, these glasses are not practical for me when working on the computer because I can't see the screen well, though I will be able to use them for reading. I do see that most other reviews here that are positive, so it could be something about my vision that differs from what these glasses were meant to fix.

From my wife Sarah: Three teens are being heavily trained physically and mentally to become "Seekers". They're not quite sure what that means, but they are told they'll be hero's, saving lives, righting wrongs, protecting the innocent. One of the teens has some secrets that complicate things.Once the other two become seekers, they find out that being a Seeker is not what they were trained to believe. They can travel from one place to another by accessing another dimension. I don't want to give too much away, but trouble ensues as people fight for power, and the lines of right and wrong become blurred.I enjoyed this book. The concept was very different and original, and throughout most of the story I was entertained and kept interested. There were times that moved a bit slowly, but overall, I really enjoyed it.Certain parts of the world building seemed somewhat fuzzy to me, but the character building was well done. There was some romance in there that complicated the story and made things interesting.Of course as all scifi's do these days, the book ends before you see how everything turns out, but the story will continue with a second book released in the spring of 2016. I'm looking forward to seeing what happens next.While it's not actually one of my all time favorites, it's entertaining, so I'd recommend this book to all scifi fans, YA fans, and fantasy fans.

These are really tasty, crunchy, satisfying and relatively healthy. I was hesitant to get all 5 flavors but this was the best buy on Amazon so I took the chance. It turns out that I enjoyed all of the flavors that come with this pack, but I especially like the margherita pizza. It's a delicious, flavorful treat that satisfies my craving for pizza flavors. I also enjoyed dipping the sea salt flavor into salsa for a healthy treat.Here's what else I like about Plentils:- The texture is light and crunchy. It's very satisfying as a fun chip snack.- It's only 130 calories for the full bag, with no saturated fats.- It's only 16-17 grams of effective carbohydrates for the bag, and zero sugar grams.- The lentils yield 3 grams of protein for the bag.- They're free of gluten, wheat, dairy, peanuts, fish, shellfish, tree nuts, eggs and soy.  They're verified non genetically modified. There are no artificial ingredients. I really appreciate the thought and high quality ingredients that went into this product!So is it as fantastic as a bag of lays potato chips, fritos, etc? Maybe not, but it's so much better for you and it's still really good. So I'd definitely recommend this product, and this variety pack in particular if you're interested in having healthy low cal snacks.

From my wife Sarah: I used to drink a different whey shake daily for weight control and for the nutritional value. It was low calorie, low carb and low sugar. It was a real treat, tasted very delicious, and was filling.Then I had to go on a gluten free diet, and I couldn't find a single gluten free protein shake that was low carb, low sugar and low calorie that tasted good. I tried somewhere around 7-10 different brands and nothing tasted remotely tolerable. I don't even know how some of these brands stay on the market with the terrible flavors.I find this nogii to be the best of all the brands I tried. It's actually pretty tasty. I especially like the chocolate. I love that it's low calorie, low carb and low sugar, and it has live cultures. Now I'm drinking it almost every day, and I'm so excited to have found this. It's works great with my weight loss plan and my health regimen.Rather than using two scoops, I use one to decrease the calories so it's only about 85 calories rather than the 170 you get with the recommended two scoops. I add some ice in a blender with water or almond milk and blend it smooth. It's really good!I'd highly recommend this protein powder to anyone looking for a gluten free, low carb, low calorie, low sugar drink with healthy ingredients and live cultures.

This is a beautiful monitor that really rivals my 30" Apple Cinema display on my Mac workstation. The colors were superb right out of the box.I love how you can adjust the height of the Dell monitor, and even rotate it vertically and horizontally.  I rotated it vertically so I could attach the HDMI cable into the proper port, as the ports are fairly hidden. This made connecting the HDMI cable easy.I also like how you can thread the power cord and HDMI or other cables through the monitor's stand to hide the cables and give your desktop a neat look.I wouldn't call myself a super computer techy person, so when I received the monitor I was a little hesitant and slightly intimidated as I unpacked it. I didn't recognize the cables that came with it. My plan was to hook this monitor up to my Dell XPS 5800 tower and use is as a second monitor. The only monitor connections my tower has are aDVI, a USB 2.0 and an HDMI connection. I had an HDMI cable lying around, so I connected it to the monitor and to my PC tower. Nothing happened. Then I discovered the controls on the lower right of the monitor. I switched the input to HDMI and presto, it worked!The next trick was to set it up with windows so I could have 2 monitors extended. Just 2 clicks of a mouse and it was done!So ultimately I found this very easy to handle and set up, and I'm quite happy with the visual quality and ease of use.The only thing I'd suggest to Dell is that they include an HDMI cable with the unit. I realize you can't have every kind of cable included for every scenario, but for the price of the monitor they could include that as many people will need it.Kudos to Dell for this monitor! I'm definitely happy with it and would recommend it.

From my wife Sarah: This is a decent eye shadow set. It went on evenly and smoothly, and lasted reasonably well - perhaps even better than most comparable brands.
