My 16 year old now thinks biscuits with sausage and peppered gravy should be for breakfast every single day.  5 Stars for the Product; 2 Stars for the Seller that's just taking advantage (not sold by Amazon, though it is Prime Eligible).
It is an extension cable and it works as such. It seems well made and handy if your USB is just on the short side and you need to "extend" it.. Gee ... logic beyond belief.
This is an ice crusher blade, it crushes ice. What else can one say?
These are what they are. The cover fits nicely and so much more room saving than the round containers.
Makes a nice milk shake or smoothie. But if you're adding any type of solid fruits, use a bladed blade.
I carry these adapters so I don't need to carry extra complete cables. This saves some room.
I carry these adapters so I don't need to carry extra complete cables. This saves some room.
I carry these adapters so I don't need to carry extra complete cables. This saves some room.

Bought this as one of the daily deals. Seems nice and sturdy. Smooth on/off. However, I won't be using this until next spring when I once again turn on the outside faucets. If it's a dud, at least it wasn't that expensive. I will update this review as needed.
I carry these adapters so I don't need to carry extra complete cables. This saves some room.
I make a lot of smoothies and these reusable straws are great. These are long enough for the tallest cups out there.
I carry these adapters so I don't need to carry extra complete cables. This saves some room.

Makes a quick and tasty snack. Just add hot water. All the ingredients are there. We just add a drop of sesame oil for extra flavor. For a better price, we have this on subscription.
My wife uses these for making her beaded jewelry. They are just as described .. no problems.
Cable seems sturdy and well made. Purchased it to "have on hand" if needed. I do not anticipate a lot of use for this item, but it was inexpensive enough to buy.

My first set of ceramic knives. I have always been hesitant to purchase them , as they were a bit expensive and I have heard so much about how easily they chip. These were a great deal (set of 4 for $15). so I ordered them. They are fantastic, VERY sharp. I am still a bit paranoid about dropping or chipping them, so they will get limited use. But they are a pleasure to use.

I bought these to test T10 and T15 LED auto bulbs I purchased, just to make sure every bulb in the multi-pack worked. I hooked the socket up to a smaller 12V lead acid battery and it did its job perfectly, testing the bulbs. I used a RED marker to mark the side of each bulb to identify the side that had to go to positive for the LEDs to work. Keep in mind I did NOT mount these in my car, just plan on using them loose.
Great for the price. The tags come with straps and are fairly strong. My plan is to use these to identify what tools are in tool bags.
We bought this just to keep our new sleeping bags a bit cleaner. These are very thin and light. It comes with zippers and is large enough for adults. Excellent for the price.
We bought this just to keep our new sleeping bags a bit cleaner. These are very thin and light. It comes with zippers and is large enough for adults. Excellent for the price.
For the price, this is a great little reel. It is small, but perfect for a 5 foot compact rod.

OK - I admit it, I couldn't resist the "lightening deal" price. That being said, it is actually a well made tactical vest. A place for my AR-15 mags and my .45 pistol. Pockets for tons of other stuff also. Just getting ready for the zombie apocalypse.

A very light weight sleeping bag. But our planned use is for indoors, not regular camping, so it did not need to be made for the arctic or such. It comes in a VERY nice carry case, with very strategically placed straps, made for keeping the volume on the smaller size. However, I did have to make up 2 straps for "pre-strapping" the folded bag, other wise it was very difficult to get it back into the carry bag.

This is compact and works with my ASUS tablet. The on/off switches are just a bonus (unless they stop working, then they become a liability), but so far so good. It won't get a lot of use - as I only use it when I travel, maybe once a month or so.
These are just as described. However, I found that I can get the same amount size bottle at my local Sam's club for half the cost. So when these run out, that's what I'll do.

I bought this because my ASUS tablet needed a high powered charger for it. Some lower powered USB chargers didn't even light the charge LED on the tablet. I tested this when it arrived, and it DID light up that charger LED when plugged into this iOTTIE unit in the car. I purchased this to have the option of charging in the car, but will probably rarely use it. I just want it to work for the few times I may need it.
I prefer "hardcore" Sci-Fi over fantasy. Some were OK, some were not. Not entirely to my taste. I definitely didn't need the lengthy "bios" of the authors. Thank God I only paid .99 for it.
Very nice set of USB micro cables. They are sturdy and all worked fine.
These are very bright bulbs, and work just fine in place of the standard T15 bulbs. I tested all 10 and each one lit up. I guess I'll have to see how long they last.
Cute sign. I put it on the door to my "man cave" office. Made of metal, but I used 3M command adhesive strips to mount it. I was quite surprised that my wife let me put it up.

Just received the FM Transmitter today. It took me all of 5 minutes to set-up (most of that time was taking it out of the box). Just used the buttons to set the frequency to 87.5 FM, then set the radio to 87.5 FM, plugged the audio cable from the IPOD to the audio in of the unit and voila ... worked great. No noticeable static or noise. (We did replace an existing unit, so all the cables, etc were already in place). When powered down, the Transmitter retains the frequency selected. The old unit still worked, but the display panel was tiny and on the side and impossible to read the display. I will update when I try the USB flash drive function with the Remote.UPDATE:  09/24/15 Received Kingston 16GB USB 2.0 Micro flash drive, copied all of our MP3's onto it and plugged it into this FM transmitter. It played songs without any problem and the remote worked just fine. VERY HAPPY WITH THIS UNIT.UPDATE:  11/11/15 We used the FM transmitter on a road trip (12hrs going and 12 hrs returning). It worked perfectly, including the use of the remote and the manual buttons on the unit. Absolutely no problems.

I am not going to go thru the story line .. other reviewers have done that. I just want to say that in my opinion, this has turned into another West Wing.  As we watched season 3, we felt that we had tuned into reruns of that old series. Until I received season 3 (We had watched season 1 and 2 from borrowed DVDs from my brother-in-law.) We watched the BBC series of the same name, that this series was based on. I had purchased it years ago, but didn't watch it, as my wife thought it was boring. It was worth watching, to see how closely this series was based on it. Once we got into it, it was just as riveting as this American series is. Then we watched season 3 of this series, still interesting, but not as intense as season 1 or 2. However. we will probably get subsequent seasons just to follow it out.

Nice case .... it's just too bad it didn't work for my ASUS T100TA transformer tablet. The bottom part of the case that holds the keyboard covers the right and left hand keys along the edge. This renders the keyboard useless. Other than that one big flaw, it is a nice leather case for the price. I am sure it may fit other ASUS models, but definitely NOT the T100TA.UPDATE: My mistake ... The case came with no instructions, I realize now that I had the case on backwards. I only realized this when I looked closely at the product photos. It is unfortunate as I have already returned the case. It MAY have fit well and worked ... But I am still giving it only 4 stars due to lack of instructions.

I use PDF's extensively for archiving all online bills, statements etc. I have the full blown PDF Converter Pro on both my PC and laptop. I just purchased an ASUS T100TA tablet (Running Win 8.1). Since I plan on using this tablet only for periodic trips, I did not want to spend up to $100 for another full blown software package. I considered PDF Create, but read some reviews about constant requests to "upgrade". The free "Cutewriter" was also said to have "Ad" problems. At $35 this seemed a reasonable alternative. The download was simple enough (I will admit I had to do a second install, as the first one did not seem to take). But doing a "remove" and re installing wasn't that big a deal. Once up and running, the software simply creates a "printer" on your system named Win2PDF and you select it to create a PDF of what-ever-it-is you want to print, be it a document, webpage, etc.  I've only used it a few times, but it appears to be doing exactly what I wanted it for.UPDATE:  11/5/15  When I went to use this program to print from IE, it errored. It also errored with Firefox. I decided to remove the program and then re-installed it. That seemed to fix it. It is working for now. If this re-occurs, I will update again. For now I removed 1 star due to its apparent instability.

Not bad ... it works and does feel like MS Word enough that you can use it fairly easily if you normally use Word itself. I needed it on my ASUS T100TA tablet (Running 32-bit Win 8.1) and they wanted a monthly fee to activate "MS Office" on it (well over $100 a year).  I use Word in my PC and Laptop (Paid mucho bucks for them too) and didn't want to shell out big bucks for a tablet I would only use periodically for trips. So I removed "MS Office" from the tablet and installed this. It is perfect for my needs ...

This series was lent to us by a relative. From the very first episode, you are hooked. If this series is even remotely close to how our government works, we may as well give up. My wife and I finished this series in about 3 days. The story and plot are absolutely riveting ... and you can not wait for the next episode to see what happens next. I am NOT going to go into details, I am just going to say the casting and acting were absolutely superb. There was only one single character in the entire series that you will even remotely like, and that was Freddy, the ribs guy (yet even he turned out to be flawed to a degree). We realized that there was not a single politician, lobbyist, staff member, military, etc that the series portrayed that was at all sympathetic or likable. The government that was portrayed in this series needed to be flushed down the toilet, but that would ultimately desecrate the toilet.

Tested each cable in the 3-Pk and they all functioned fine. Using them to convert a reg USB 2.0 down to a Micro USB to hook up a DVD reader/writer to a tablet so I can load software for a Windows 8 OS. Will update if the loading process shows any glitches.UPDATE: 08/30/15 - Used the adapter to hook up my external USB Samsung DVD r/w to my ASUS T100TA tablet. The install process went fine - no glitches in reading the CD or installing the sofware.

I am rating this only 2 stars because it worked only one night, when we refilled it for the second night, the on/off light stayed red, indicating the tank was empty. Emptied the tank and let it dry-out overnight. Tried it again .. same thing, it never sensed that there was liquid in the tank. I returned it for a replacement, and will update this review pending how or if the replacement works.08/28/15 UPDATE: We received our replacement diffuser yesterday and we used it all afternoon and overnight. It seems to be working fine. I opted for this unit because it was recommended by my sister and sister-in-law. All the Amazon reviews were positive, and we had tried it out while visiting my brother and liked it. The seller contacted me and was very apologetic about the unit that failed, and was extremely sincere about making sure we were happy with the diffuser. Well .. we certainly are happy with it. I have one suggestion for users. I had a small unused measuring cup that had come with one of my wife's large washing machine detergent bottles. I measured how far to fill the cup so the amount would refill the diffuser just up to the fill mark. I put a score mark on the cup at that level. This works great for us in refilling the diffuser easily to the proper level without spilling..

I finally had a chance to try these out .. they seem to work just fine. They seem to be well made and they snap perfectly onto the back of the Baofeng BF888s radios (In place of the battery) and power on via the 12V car lighter socket. Depending on how far away the socket is from where you will be using the radio, the coiled cord will definitely stretch, but it appears to be fairly sturdy. There are cigarette lighter "extension'" cords available if you need them. Realize of course that these ARE NOT chargers, and will NOT recharge the regular radio battery (as this adapter actually replaces the battery itself). I am still on the lookout for a non-AC charger (preferably a USB) for the radio battery.
A great snack - the soup comes with all the little fixings and soup mix. We simply add a sprinkling of garlic powder and sesame oil and we have a really fast and tasty little pick me up

My wife uses these, but since the dollar stores stopped carrying them, we haven't bought any, as the prices at the local drugstores were outrageous. She is very selective on what she uses. Then I thought that Amazon might have them ... VOILA !!! They did - and at a GREAT price. This is less expensive than the dollar stores. My wife was thrilled to finally get these again. She was on her last tin.

I purchased this for a friend who needed to have the composite (audio L-R and video) connections for his DVD recorder  We did just fine up to trying to link the unit up to the Roku website. IT WOULD NOT LINK. After putting in all the required info, the webpage just kept saying it was "loading". Did this for 3 attempts using 3 "link codes" (They expire after a certain time, so the "loading" made each one expire). The last attempt we let it "load" for several hours - just kept "loading". Tried to find a 800 number or such to call ... no luck. So we wound up returning it.

I read other reviews and some people did not like this. For the price, I figured I'd try it, as we really love green onions (scallions). This was not at all bad. We learned not to use too much water, as it weakened the flavor. A large mug about 2/3 full worked well. We added a sprinkling of garlic powder and sesame oil and it was actually very good. You can also add a bit of french frIed onions to it for extra flavor (the kind you put on string bean casseroles for Thanksgiving).

Waited 3 weeks for this to arrive from China (Yet still ahead of projected delivery date). It was a bit smaller than I imagined, but it did hold all the flies I needed to store (12 total). Despite the long shipping time, I saved some money, as I did NOT need it quickly.
These are exactly as they are described. They are fairly rugged and hold 8 C batteries perfectly.
Using these in place of the 1500mAh batteries that originally came with my Baofeng BF888S radios. Using the Original batteries as spares. Seem to be working fine.

After looking at several blind spot mirrors, I opted for this one.  It fits perfectly on the right passenger door top surface near the front of the window. I placed it so it didn't block any portion of the driver's view of the right hand rear view mirror. I was able to adjust it so it displayed a perfect view of the right side blind spot. The flat mounting bracket sat perfectly on the horizontal surface of the door panel by the window.FYI - using it on a KIA 2008 Sportage
A great basic inexpensive sling shot. Much less lethal alternative for discouraging pests in your garden. The landmines kept waking the neighbors.
Great addition to my bug-out bag. You never know when they may come in handy. Much more compact than a rod and reel.
I bought these to add to the fishing basics in my bug-out bag. They are very nice and inexpensive. A great addition at a great price.

I am using these with the Baofeng BF888s radios. They work just fine. They enable you to clip the radio to your belt, and clip the lighter speaker/mike to your shirt pocket (there's a small clip on the back of unit). It just makes the radios more convenient to use.

My wife has been using one of these fans for several years now. I happened to see these at a great price, so I bought 2. They are really nice fans. They run on 4 AA batteries, and has a small sponge that you moisten so the fan has a better cooling effect as the water evaporates. Not sure how effective that really is. The blade is well enclosed and my wife uses it in bed when she needs some quick cooling relief.

This bag was just as described. It is fairly heavy duty and rugged. The only negative is that the shoulder strap doesn't detach. I am actually using this for a clip on 6 inch fan I need for traveling. The size of the box it came in, was about the size of a bowling ball, so I thought that a single ball bag would make the perfect travel bag for the fan. It has worked out perfectly, the fan and all the accessories (Clip, Base, extension cord) all fit in the bag. I am also assuming a bowling ball would fit just as well.

This cooler bag is the perfect size for storing our 2 FRS radios in the car during the hot summer months. It will, I am sure, also be effective to keep our radios from freezing during the winter. The outer covering is very sturdy, and the inside is soft vinyl with a some kind of insulation in between. We found that the heat apparently caused the batteries to lose their charge more quickly. So we decided to find something "insulated" to keep them in while they are left in the car.
Used this LED to replace the D.O.A. LED for the Viking VS125 car alarm I ordered. Nice and bright LED to indicate alarm is armed or not.
Nice little keychain/keyring knife. Saw it on another site, but Amazon was quite a bit less expensive.

I wanted a very basic car alarm. The description made this appear to be what I needed. The alarm installed VERY easily. I ONLY installed it with the power wire to the positive battery terminal and the black to ground, The current sensing function was all I really needed. I ignored all the "starter" disable, parking light flashers, etc. I did want to hook up the LED indicator. That was the reason for only 4 stars. After spending 30 plus minutes running the LED into the windshield area, it NEVER worked. The dome light triggers the alarm when any of the doors or rear hatch are opened. ALSO - as a side note, the remote uses a A23 12v battery.

I purchased this holster for my new North American Arms 22MPS 1 1/8 inch barrel 22 magnum 5 shot revolver. The holster is sturdy and appears well made. It fits my gun perfectly. Very happy with purchase.
These are an exact duplicate of the Phillips OEM brush heads, only at a much much lower cost. We are very happy with these brushes.
I am using these on our Baofeng BF888s radios. They are much shorter than the original antennas and seem to work just fine for us. We are very happy with these.

Very nice sturdy visor. The material is well put together and the rear strap has a velcro closure for size adjustment. Excellent way to keep the sun out of your eyes, yet is cool enough to let your head "breathe".

The outer chrome shell appears really sturdy. The inner compartments are of a light plastic. The locking mechanism is solid and I think this will stay closed in my pocket. It is thin enough NOT to be bulky. I really like this pill box.

Some of the reviews said this 3-way LED bulb did NOT work. I have a standard 3-way floor lamp that uses a 3-way bulb. I had found a 3-way  CFL that worked, and decided to try this LED bulb. It worked perfectly after install. The lamp cycled thru the 3 brightness levels without a glitch. All levels were soft yellowish, just like the incandescent bulbs used to be. We are VERY pleased with this bulb.

This was a very interesting read, but I did not find anything I haven't seen touched upon in my many years of reading sci-fi. That said, they have been put together cleverly in this narrative. I did find the pace to be fast and it did keep my interest. It was a bit frustrating that  although man has reached the stars, the dregs of society came with him. Not only do some of these scum not deserve to live, but with the advent of disintegrator beams, they don't deserve to even exist. I didn't love this book, but I did like it very much and I do recommend it.

OK - first of all, I feel this is more fantasy than Sci-Fi. There is very little actual "science" in it at all. The plot bases its drama on the stupidity and naivete of its main characters. I actually felt that some of them deserved what they got. I could not imagine calling these "aliens" intelligent. I found myself skimming over a lot of the paragraphs and pages, as they were just so "wordy". The main thing that kept me shaking my head, was that after witnessing and experiencing so many "miracles",  the characters were still letting their pride and egos guide their own selfish motives. I totally agree with the premise that a certain middle east fanatic religion will cause the end of civilization if not the world.  The projection of the ultimate welfare state of this country's future is right on. The author has basically projected the future based on present circumstances and situations. If you remove the fantasy stuff, this is ultimately a political thriller. Not sure if I will continue reading after these first 3 books, the sample of book four indicates more of the same. More problems caused by naivete, arrogance, pride and just plain stupidity. I hate it when characters never seem to learn.
I found this to be a good read, it's a typical young heroes at war type of  novel, that comes to an open conclusion. The present battle is won, but you know that the story will continue.
Works well to sooth a sore gum - good as a temporary relief, but if a pain persists, go to the dentist.
IT'S AN AIR FILTER ... SEEMS TO WORK OK
Replaced a dead battery in a hallway emergency light. Seems to work OK. Functioned ok during our last 1 hour power outage

While on a trip to NY/NJ from NC to visit relatives, I inadvertently left my Kindle at our first stop. We weren't returning there for our trip back to NC for a whole week. I was in the middle of reading a book and wasn't very happy. Then I remembered that I did have my laptop and Amazon did have a PC app. Found it, downloaded it and it works great. I was able to download the book I was reading and continue. I really like the dual page option, as it is very much like opening a book and having two pages in front of you. Don't even need the mouse, the L-R arrows move the pages forward and backward. Most of what it does is intuitive ... I was able to use it within a minute or two. A great alternative to the Kindle. (But I still will use the kindle, as the laptop is definitely not what I want to lug around in place of it). I am really glad to have this additional option for my Kindle Books.

When I first thought about this necklace I figured it was going to be cheaply made and something for a kid, especially for $20. But I was pleasantly surprise when I received the necklace. It comes in a plastic bag in a nice velvet drawstring bag inside another plastic bag. It was well protected and had the feel of finer jewelry.The horse has some weight to it, it does not feel flimsy. It is a touch bigger than a quarter. I also really like how the stones are set into it. I usually see some that are half-heartedly glued in. These stones are set into the horse and look like they belong there. Not a hint of glue anywhere.I admit that I am not a fan of the chain. It is an 18” ball chain with an extra 2  inch extender. This is not a bad chain but to me it kind of makes the horse look a little cheaper. But I found a nicer silver chain and switched it out, which is really easy with the big loop on top of the horse. Not it looks really elegant.If you are looking for a nice horse jewelry piece I recommend getting this one. Although I don’t agree with the $50 value I agree that $20 is a good price to pay.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

I have to say that I am a long time Adobe fan, approaching 15 years and am currently the owner of its latest Masters Collection. However, I have to say that this software and other Corel software have me truly appreciating what Corel has to offer for a fraction of the cost of similar Adobe products. In addition to cost, I also find that the Corel software is often times a lot easier to use than the Adobe software and that is really a great selling point for me. Does this software offer everything that a similar Adobe software offers? No, but often times you don't really need all those extra bells and whistles unless you are a professional editor or perhaps even use it extensively in your business. But if you are the average person trying to create some beautiful work, then I would definitely give this and other software from Corel and definite look because I don't believe that you would be disappointed at all.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

I just recently received this product and at a very fortunate time I was getting ready to go out hunting shortly after it had arrived. Therefore, I was actually able to take this out in the field and under actual conditions to try it out, and I have to say that I wasn't disappointed at all with the results.To start off with, this rangefinder arrived in a very well packaged box and had incurred no damage during shipping. Always a bonus! It is very lightweight and easy to handle even with gloves on, although it the gloves are to big and bulky then you more than likely will have some handling issues with it. I am not particularly a fan of camouflage, but I have to admit that it does look nice on this rangefinder. A lot better than hot pink anyhow. I didn't have any problems with it at all in the cold, and it did get below freezing and worked flawlessly. I was able to get it to range out to just over 500 yards, but I don't know if it will go much further than that. The manufacturer advertises 500 meters/yards and I would have to say that claim was accurate as far as I could determine. I used it for about 10 hours off and on throughout the day and found it to be very reliable.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

I have to say that I have been a huge Adobe fan for going on 15 years now and have the most recent Masters Collection. My only complaint is the pricey upgrades that also seem to pop up every year or so. But anyhow, on with the review for this product.This is a much simpler and more basic version of the Adobe Photoshop software so therefore it isn't capable of doing everything that Photoshop can, but it does offer a lot of awesome possibilities for someone who doesn't need the full version. Each successive version of this product, just like all the other Adobe products, does offer some improvement upon  the previous versions and this one is no different. Now I am not going to go into lengthy detail on all of the features as other reviewers have already done so and to repeat it would be annoying and redundant. However, I am going to say that this is a very reasonably priced product that is well worth the price for the features offered. It is more than adequate for the average user and is only outshone by the full Adobe Photoshop version.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

I thought that this would be an early Christmas present for my cats. When I got the box it was pretty good sized and heavy, I recommend moving the box with help. I had to try and squeeze it into my truck and drive home with the lid unlatched.I took everything out of the box. All of the pieces are pretty easy to figure out and the sisal wrapped poles have numbers on them so it was very easy to figure out what went where. You will assemble this cat pole from top to bottom. I admit that this confused me for a little bit but once you start assembly it makes perfect sense. I have assembled other cat poles before and they work from the ground up. Then there are some places that are not as secure as they could be. When working top down you can get everything tight and not worry about wobble from the cats scratching it.This is a fair sized cat pole, just over 2 foot by 2 foot on width and length and about 5 foot high. When I set it up I expected the cats to sniff and ignore it. I took the box to the trash and by the time I got back in the house I had two cats on the pole. Within an hour several had come by and scratched it.The little round beds have a little padding in them and I have had a couple of the cats already sleeping on them. The round cylinder with two holes doesn’t have a cut out so they can go from top to bottom but I did have my stocky 13 pound boy crawl into the top hole.The only thing that I am wondering about on the design is that this pole looks like you can put it in the corner of the room. On the round two hold cylinder there is a section of sisal to the cats can scratch it. When put together it is basically facing a wall and there is no access to the scratcher.Beyond that, this is a great cat pole and a great price. It is very sturdy and has handled my cats racing onto it, tearing it up, and catapulting off again. If you are looking for a smaller cat scratching post I would recommend checking this one out.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

This is a beautiful pair of hoop earrings made of 10K yellow and rose gold. The Rose gold is a little heart at the bottom of the hoop. There is beautiful scroll work that also says Mom. I admit that I didn’t see the Mom at first because it blends into the scroll work. The scroll work also has some decorative lines in it and makes the earrings sparkle like they have a gemstone in them.These earrings have a click-top clasp and if they are pulled down I could see losing one. But if you notice that one doesn’t seem to be catching as well, just push the clasp together a tiny bit and it will fix the problem.The earring are a touch over ½ inch in diameter so they are not too bulky and delicate enough to look like other expensive earrings. These are one sided earrings so you will have to pay attention when wearing. They are designed to have the Mom on the outside of the earring. The other side is just the plain hoop.This would be a great gift for any mom, new or grand. Since Christmas is coming up I would recommend adding this to your list for your special Mom.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

This thermostat not only provides automated temperature control from your home, once you have it all set up of course, but it also has remote access capabilities from another location. You can also download the app to your smartphone that enables you to take advantage of the remote capabilities.As always, please READ THE INSTRUCTIONS before attempting installation.Installation was very simple and only took me a few minutes to accomplish. I would recommend that you look at the status of your current thermostat and then go onto the website provided with your instructions and view some of the installation videos that they have there. This should answer any questions that you may have and should make the installation process that much easier. As always, make sure you follow all safety guidelines when installing this thermostat. There is no reason you need to light yourself up like a Christmas, tree even though the holiday season is fast approaching. If you do require additional help from the manufacturer, they do provide a toll-free phone number that you can call for assistance.Once you have everything installed, it is simply a matter of programming in the settings you prefer and away you go. Well, you also need to download the app to your smartphone in order to utilize that feature, but that shouldn’t be that difficult.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

Okay, the first thing I have to say is that I was really impressed that it came with its own batteries and I didn't have to go purchase more in order to get it to work in the first place. So major kudos to the manufacturer for including batteries with their product, I know I am not the only one that is going to like that. So besides the fact that batteries are included, how does it work? Well, it actually works quite well and doing a wide variety of tasks. The one thing that you MUST DO first and foremost is to READ THE INSTRUCTIONS first before attempting to use this device. It may take a few minutes of reading, but it will make using this device much simpler and with a lot less headaches.Not only does it measure in a straight line, but it also works measuring angles as well. Now they say the range is 165 feet + or - 1/16th of an inch, and I would have to say that the plus or minus part is accurate, only I can't say for sure at the distance because I have yet had the opportunity to measure it out that far and see if it really works out to that distance. Sure I could have went out onto the sidewalk to test it, but I preferred to test it under normal conditions in the house and garage. Okay, hand on a minute and I will run outside and give it a try...(Approximately 3 minutes later)Okay, I just got back from running outside to try the 165 foot claim from the manufacturer and I actually got it to measure out past 170 feet. Not to sure on the plus or minus accuracy statement at that distance as I don't have a tape measure that will reach that far, but if I had to guess I would say that the plus or minus statement is probably pretty accurate, even at that extreme distance. I know it is accurate well under that distance as I tried it out inside the house and the garage.The case appears to be well made and feels really sturdy and should hold up to the normal demands of a construction project. However, I don't think I would purposefully drop it from any kind of height over say just a couple of feet for fear that it probably would cause some type of damage to it. I mean it is an electronic device so you should exercise better care with it than say you might with a hammer. You can also download some really nice apps for even more measuring capabilities, such as; floor plans, documents, etc. The apps are free and although they do take a few minutes to download and figure out, they are actually quite user friendly.The manufacturer also claims that you can take up to 10,000 measurements before needing to replace the batteries. I have absolutely no idea if that is a correct statement or not and I have no inclination whatsoever to try it out. I really would like to maintain my sanity and I think sitting, standing, lying, or even walking and taking 10,000 measurements of anything would be enough to drive the sanest person in the world over the edge. So on that claim I am going to take their word for it.Highly recommended!Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

Okay, I already have an OtterBox protective cover on my Galaxy S5 and it works great! Very well made and solid design that protects my phone from accidental drops and dings. However, this new protective case from OtterBox fails in that it sacrifices the normal amount of protection in order to give you an admittedly kind of cool gimmick. And that is where you can swap out the back of the case with a wide variety of inserts, although only one insert comes with this case and you have to purchase any others that you may want, that you can exchange in order to customize the look, which I guess for some people is more important than protecting your several hundred dollar phone.I have to admit that it is a neat idea, I just think they could have implemented it better where you don't have to sacrifice the protection and still add the cool changeable inserts. Perhaps the next version will do that, I don't know I guess we will just have to wait and see.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

The is a very well made planner with plenty of room to write in it, although you aren't going to be writing your next novel with it, but you could jot down notes and have plenty of room to do so. The pages are sturdy and not flimsy so there is little chance of accidentally ripping out a page unless you are actually intent on doing so. Very pleased with this product!Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

At Lux, a large think tank, in Rhode Island a Dr. Willard Strachey has been in charge of the restoration of the West Wing of Lux. But while working he discovers a strange room with no door. After being in there he reseals it and tells no one about it. He then starts displaying strange behavior, attacks a co-worker, then kills him self in a brutal fashion.Jeremy Logan, who used to work a Lux ten years prior before he was forced to leave, is called back to figure out what happened to Strachey. Jeremy is known as an enigmalogist, he specializes in the paranormal and finding explanations to the events. This is not going to be an easy investigation since there are still some people around that knew Jeremy when he worked a Lux and they seem to be ready to give him a hard time.Jeremy does have his empathy abilities to help him out with the investigation. He finds the secret room and a strange machine from the 1930’s. Somehow this seems to be what caused Strachey’s problems. It’s now up to Jeremy to figure out what it is, how it works, and why it caused Strachey to kill himself.I am an avid Lincoln Child fan and I recently read The Third Gate and loved Jeremy Logan. He is a great character. This was an interesting story; I admit I was hooked from the beginning about the Loch Ness monster. Anyway, there is a lot of action and secrets. It’s hard to know who to trust and what to believe. I felt for Jeremy when dealing with former co-workers, but I loved the whole mystery around the strange machine.This is a great, quick story. I got wrapped up in it quickly and couldn’t wait to see where it went. I admit that it’s a bit different than the Pendergast series but it is still a really good book.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

Well, I can't honestly say that I like them because I really wasn't too inclined to try them, but the dogs sure did love them.I really am not sure what else I can really say about them. The price is reasonable, although admittedly they way the dogs wolfed them down I am sure that there is going to be an added expense each month in dog treats. None of the dogs turned their noses up at them, nor got sick from eating them, so I would have to say that is has Fido's paw stamp of approval.Shawn Kovacich100% Animal Lover (Especially puppies and kitties)Author and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

This review is almost the same as my review for another similar product from the same company. Both are identical in nature and are essentially the same product except that my previous review is for the iPhone 6s and this review is for the iPhone 5s, which by the way came with a ultra cool gold color to the screen protector. Can we say six (6) star rating!This is truly a fantastic screen protector and is far and above the best one that I have ever used as of the date of my posting this review. I am sure that somewhere down the road someone will come out with one that is even better, but not today! This product was easy to put on and is really durable and damage resistant. Notice that I sent damage resist and not damage proof. Nothing is damage proof, but you would really have to go out of your way to damage this product. You should be able to go through your day-to-day activities and not be concerned about causing any damage to this product, which in turn means that your iPhone is going to be even more so protected. What else is there to say!I did receive this item from the manufacturer in exchange for a fair and honest review.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

Okay, I am not into "selfies" nor do I have any inclination to ever do so. However, I found this to be an excellent device for getting overhead angles when filming various projects. Now you have to play with the angles a bit in order to see exactly where you need to film, but that pretty much goes without saying as you really don't have a way to view the subject matter that you are filming at the time. I found everything to be functionally correct as advertised and I didn't really have any issues with any of the features, although there can always be more options available. If you are looking for a good selfie stick or pole, then this would be a very good choice.I received this product from the company in exchange for a fair and honest review.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

This is truly a fantastic screen protector and is far and above the best one that I have ever used as of the date of my posting this review. Well I must say that this is a very well made and well thought out product that really out does itself as far as what it advertises it will do and what it actually does, and that is an outstanding job! I have had this product for several weeks now and decided to really put it to the test before posting my review on it. I have used it during normal day-to-day activities, as well as, on weekend excursions and it has held up each and every time. Now I am not much of a wine drinker so at times I put in a bottle of sparkling grape juice, etc. and it more than stood up to the challenge of constantly being moved around from location to location and I never had a single issue with it. I actually was quite surprised that I would really have an opinion on this product other than it was a plastic storage bag. However, these are really very sturdy and I have been using them to storage a variety of non-food items and they hold up extremely well. Very nice in size and not to small like a typical sandwich, or those even smaller snack storage bags. These bags also have the "slider" opening and closing tab unlike the typical press and seal type storage bags. This makes it a lot easier to open and close, which is always a plus. I will definitely be buying more of these for storage in the garage and heck I guess I could even get some for the house.Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

I guess the best place to start this review, like any good story, is at the beginning. When my packaged arrived, I had one hole torn out in the corner of the box and one on the opposite side of the box about 8 inches from the opposite corner. And in both cases, parts of the product were sticking out. Thankfully this is metal, so other than a minor scratch or two there didn't seem to be any major damage. I did end up having a few missing screws, but I merely went down to the local hardware store and got replacements. Yes, they should have been in the box and yes, I wasn't very happy about the missing parts, but if that ends up being my biggest complaint then I guess that is okay with me.I ended up installing this in my garage and mounted it from the ceiling beams, which by the way I was pleasantly surprised to see that they were at the standard distance as they seem to be the only things in the house that were built to the proper specifications. It took me about 30 to 40 minutes to get it installed with my girlfriends help. Once installed it easily held my weight of just under 200 lbs. with no signs of trouble. However, I will be monitoring the screws closely for a few weeks just to make sure.Shawn KovacichMartial Artist/Krav Maga InstructorAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

Well, I suppose I should start off this review with the following disclaimer; I am a HUGE Alice Cooper fan, therefore, I am sure that I am quite bias about the contents of this book. So, if you are an Alice Cooper fan, you really don't need to read this review, just simply purchase the book and enjoy reading it as much as I did, twice (as of the posting of this review) and working on the third reading. Now I am NOT going to spoil the wonderful reading experience that this book is, well at least as far as I am concerned, by giving away a bunch of spoilers and teasers like so many other reviewers do. Instead I am simply going to give you a list of chapters in the book and then encourage you to read this very enjoyable biopic of this awesome rock-n-roll band.ACKNOWLEDGEMENTSPrologue. The Opening Chords1. School's In...2. Headliners and Guillotines3. Sunset Stripped4. Threadbare, Broke, and Spacey5. Topanga6. Your Music Is Killing My Wife's Pentunias7. Pretties For You - the Accidental Album8. So Fine in '699. Blood, Sweat, and Toledo10. The Freak Farm11. Spidery Eyes12. Love It to Death13. Killer on the Loose14. Bowling Them Over in Hollywood15. Hello, Dali16. Conceiving Billion Dollar Babies17. Muscle of Love18. Breakup19. The Cold Room20. There's No Business Like No Business21. The Hall of FameI highly recommend this book!Shawn Kovacich100% Rock-n-Roll FanAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

Okay, what can you realistically put in a review about a memory card? I mean it either works, or it doesn't work. Sure, you can have varying degrees of storage space, like for example this card has 32 gigabytes of memory while others have less and still others have more, so you really can't comment on the storage space unless it doesn't meet the amount advertised. Now perhaps they can start putting them out in a variety of colors, but what sense would that really make, I mean you are only going to see them for a short period of time so it's not like you would need to be color coordinated with your outfit. Now there is also the possibility of some kind of formatting issue, but really, I haven't ever had an issue like that with any of the memory cards that I have purchased in the last several years. Sure, I often times have to get everything synced up with the device I am using it in, but never have I not had a memory card work for me. So having got all of that out of the way, on with the review...It works and does exactly as it advertises! Plain and simple!Shawn KovacichAuthor and Creator of numerous books and DVD's.

I received a sample of this for free from BulkSupplements for the purpose of reviewing it.I've found Tyrosine to be a wonderful addition to my life. My mood is better, I seem to have a little more energy (which could just be related to my mood), I sleep better, and I feel a better sense of general "well-being."What a vague load of unverifiable crap, I know, but it's true! Tyrosine is an interesting compound that, through several mechanisms of action, signals your body to produce more dopamine, thus also adrenaline. Between the two, you'll feel just -better- and also respond to stressful situations with more ease. I don't believe there is anyone out there who wouldn't benefit from Tyrosine supplementation, honestly.N-Acetyl L-Tyrosine is a variety of this amino acid bound to Acetic acid, which increases the bioavailability and absorption rate. Arguably, NALT is superior, but Tyrosine still works!As always, Bulksupplements has fast shipping, good packaging with reasonable listed doses, and good pricing. I find that the taste of most amino acid powders is unpleasant, so I ultimately decided to go with tablets for my Tyrosine needs.

(Full disclosure: I did take it with grapefruit juice, which has some citrus bioflavanoids that change how some compounds are absorbed by the body.)I received a three-capsule trial of this product with an order I placed through a different website. I checked the ingredients first, and it all seemed reasonable. A couple herbal extracts and something called "methyltheobromine." I'm familiar with theobromine as a compound present in cacao, which gives energy without the jitteriness or dependency of caffeine.My experience with it was pretty intense - there wasn't much to speak of at first, but about an hour later (near the tail end of my workout) I noticed I was pumped full of energy and speed, as if I had consumed quite a bit of caffeine! I was getting into the music like never before, and felt great! My appetite was shot all day afterwards - barely ate a thing - and I was just shy of vibrating with energy for about 10 hours straight.So, pretty good stuff, and the ingredients are interesting if not intentionally misleading. See, I try to watch my caffeine intake as I'm relatively sensitive to it. I typically try to keep it at under 90mg / day because of irritability, insomnia, and anxiety. So, when I saw this had no caffeine, I was excited... And then I google searched "methyltheobromine". Caffeine. 160mg of it. That's not a super huge amount or anything, but it's more than zero and that is more than they make clear on the bottle. Heck, the instructions even say "do not take with caffeine" which is absolutely hilarious.As for the other ingredients:- White Willow extract: known to reduce fever and pain, which will increase your endurance a little bit.- N-Acetyl L-Tyrosine: the amino acid L-Tyrosine bound to acetic acid, which increases tyrosine's bioavailability and absorption rate. NALT increases the production of Dopamine which is closely tied to the production of Adrenaline. There's more to NALT than that, but that's a whole essay in itself.- Naringin: Remember what I said about grapefruit and bioflavanoids? This is one of them, built right into the capsule. Generally speaking, it will increase the bioavailability, absorption rate, and duration of most compounds - notably, caffeine.- Cymbidium Goeringii extract ("Orchidlean"): An extract of a Himalayan orchid that this company touts as "THREE TIMES STRONGER THAN DMAA" (a substance recently banned by most sports anti-doping agencies). There isn't much information out there about this particular ingredient as a supplement aside from what this company is stating, and there's a pretty dire conflict of interest there. I wouldn't assume this actually does anything.- Pikatropin: GABA and Niacin combined. Between the two, they are anti-anxiety and vasodilating (widens and softens blood vessels for increased circulation), and Niacin helps the body produce energy as well.This is a well-rounded supplement, and the ingredients are decent. Just keep in mind that the majority of the effect is likely to be the caffeine, and you could probably replicate the most noticeable effects of this supplement by getting Niacin, grapefruit juice, and caffeine pills - for considerably less than this product. It's worth getting if you don't want to get the ingredients separately, I would say - the price is reasonable for the quantity and effect. Certainly, the appetite suppressant aspect was most notable to me.

I have a lot of protein mixes, and this is probably my favorite. It doesn't have the best flavor out of all of them, but what it does have is, hands-down, the best muscle recovery blend I have seen.I've been a fan of hydrolyzed collagen for a while now. It helped me get rid of my loose skin around my stomach and it also boosts the appearance and resilience of your skin and joints.What isn't often touched on with this "beauty" product is that it also helps with muscle development. Hydrolyzed protein is broken down to bi and tri peptides, which are more readily absorbed by your digestive system. Indeed, within 30 minutes of ingesting this on an empty stomach, those peptides are already getting to your tissues - be they muscles, ligaments, or skin.I prefer to use this pre and mid workout, and as a nighttime snack. To avoid protein uptake competition, I eat it on an empty stomach. That also ensures the BCAAs inherent in the protein are at their optimal ratios for recovery and muscle building.My skin and muscles have never looked or felt better. This is going to be a staple of my regiment until I find something superior - which I strain to imagine. Between the high-quality proteins, vitamins, minerals, fiber, and delicious taste, this is a hard one to replace.

Even almost a full year after I purchased this TV, it is still a good deal! Great picture, low power usage, intuitive design, no unnecessary bells and whistles - just sharp picture on a big screen for a low price. I'm even using it now as I type this, because I use a cable DV to HDMI cable to turn my 13" laptop into a 40" desktop! Good times. Highly recommended.

I was pleasantly surprised with how quick and easy this was to set up. Even without the stupid proprietary software, my computer (2012 Macbook pro) was able to recognize it and steal my neighbor's unsecured wireless signal through two brick walls and 20 feet of air!

I used to hate my intestines more often than not. Now, we hang out. We're cool. We don't fist bump because we tried that once and it hurt a lot. After a few days with this stuff, I noticed a difference even though I was jaded by my previous probiotic purchases. This was the missing key, it seems! I've never had a better digestive tract. I went from mild gas and painful bloating to... just being me. Seriously. Get this. It's worth it.

While reasonably effective as a Creatine source, I can't say that I noticed any substantial difference in recovery time, endurance, or results. It seems to basically just function as a Creatine, which tells me I overpaid by about 1000%, as I can get 100 servings of creatine monohydrate for about fifteen bucks.Not to say there's anything wrong with this product - it worked just fine - but I wouldn't say the effects are proportional to the cost.

Hogue makes an amazing knife. For the price of, say, a mid-grade Spyderco or a Benchmade, you end up with a knife that has the fit-and-finish of a good mid-tech knife. The materials are sound, the action is incredible, the lockup is perfect, the blade shape is just right, and the clip and carry weight are a dream come true.Seriously, it's hard to beat the level of absurd quality these are built to. You might scoff at the blade steel, but they heat-treat it so well that you'd swear it was M390. I've carried and used a pair of these for over six months, and they have only needed occasional stropping to maintain the factory-polished hair-popping edge.

Hogue makes an amazing knife. For the price of, say, a mid-grade Spyderco, you end up with a knife that has the fit-and-finish of a good mid-tech knife. The materials are sound, the action is incredible, the lockup is perfect, the blade shape is just right, and the clip and carry weight are a dream come true.Seriously, it's hard to beat the level of absurd quality these are built to. You might scoff at the blade steel, but they heat-treat it so well that you'd swear it was M390.

Very effective stuff! I take it at night for enhanced sleep, and in the morning for my workout! I've experimented with cutting inositol out, and I noticed the same lethargy and lack of iron will that I was experiencing before I started taking it. NOW makes a fantastic product, and the price can't be beat!As a side note, I used to take the "Life Extension" brand inositol, which was 1000mg, and this seems to be just as effective at half the dosage. Placebo? Maybe. I'd wager that there's some higher-quality production going on in the NOW facilities, though...

I bought this for my roommate for christmas, and it has functioned absolutely flawlessly. Assembly was easy, the finish is attractive, and the base has enough heft to it to counterbalance really a fair few coats and jackets. At no time has there been an issue of tipping or structural failure, even when loaded down with as many as six heavy coats.This coat rack is more than adequate, given the price. I have no issue recommending this.

I received this product for free in exchange for a review. In my time using it, I have noticed absolutely zero effects whatsoever, even in the slightest degree. I have not taken it for days straight, taken it for days straight, alternated, taken it with meals, taken it on an empty stomach, taken it in the morning, evening, and afternoon... I have yet to notice any effect whatsoever.HOWEVERThat does not necessarily mean that this product is not working. By it's own description, the effects it purports to have are subtle and ideally would not be noticed by anyone who was not taking blood samples and/or regularly monitoring their blood pressure. As such, I cannot honestly downrate this product, but I also cannot positively attest to its effectiveness.I can tell you a few things about the product's physical characteristics, however:- It seems to dissolve and mix relatively easily.- It is a somewhat coarse brown powder.- It has an unpleasant odor, somewhat reminiscent of mold.As a 26-year-old athletic and physically active male who has no major health concerns, I cannot say that this product is worth the expenditure for anyone in a similar situation. I was hoping for some kind of aid in my exercise regime - blood thinners and antioxidants have many uses in that setting - however, I noticed no increased vasodilation and no perceivable increase in performance.I have had very positive experiences with Bulksupplements in the past, and have no reason to doubt that the substance is at the very least what it claims to be. However, I have noticed no effects, be they positive or negative, in the time that I have been using it regularly (roughly two weeks).

I have been impressed with this product for a number of reasons:- Taste: I was initially hesitant to order an unflavored protein powder - especially one that mentions it might be "less smooth tasting" due to the hydrolyzed why component - but I was pleased to find the taste was almost neutral, if slightly reminiscent of Mozzarella.- Mixability: AMAZING! A full scoop, which is quite substantial, mixes very easily and quickly into as little as 4oz of water (as suggested on the label! I still didn't believe it when I read it and looked at the scoop size). However, it does not mix -perfectly-, as there is a consistent teensy granular residue left on the inside of whatever container I use. That said, the only protein powders I have seen mix -perfectly- used quite a bit of fat and/or soy lecithin as emulsifiers. It's unsurprising that this doesn't dissolve completely, is what I'm getting at.- Nutrition: OFF THA CHAIN. WHAT. 27g OF PROTEIN FOR 113 CALORIES? THAT'S NOT JUST CRAZY, THAT'S CRAZY SAUCE. THEN YOU HAVE TO TAKE THAT SAUCE AND BOIL IT TO REMOVE WATER SO IT BECOMES A CRAZY REDUCTION. YOU CAN THEN DRIZZLE THAT CRAZY REDUCTION AS A GLAZE ONTO YOUR MUSCLES. Also, it has very low fat! 0.3g per serving! Fantastic.- Digestibility: As someone who typically gets gas and bloating from dairy, I can report that I get zero such issues with this product.- Functionality: Very high! I drink one serving in 4oz of water at night, immediately prior to bed, to stay anabolic throughout the night. I also use it for my post-workout shake!- Affordability: This is easily the most expensive jar of protein mix I have purchased, but the number of servings and the quality and ratio of ingredients make it perfectly justified. It really just is a big jar of quality, source-traceable, well-balanced protein. It's exactly the kind of thing I never knew I wished existed.This powder adds almost no flavor whatsoever, so you have a pretty blank slate to work with. Also, given that it has almost no fat, it is a very light and watery substance when mixed. I like to use 12oz of water and add cacao powder, maca powder, hemp oil, and coconut sugar (2 tbsp / 1tbsp / 1tbsp / 1 tbsp, respectively) to the mix to give it a nice, thick, creamy, nutty flavor and texture. (Of course, that also adds about 400 calories, but, eh.)If you're relatively serious about nutrition or bodybuilding, I strongly recommend this. It's the perfect protein mix for building lean muscle.

This stuff is so effective I wish I could take it every day. Alas, one of the characteristics of this compound is that it loses effectiveness if taken for too many consecutive days. I always take this pre-workout in the morning, and I noticed increased mental focus and clarity along with visibly (!!!) increased circulation.I'm on my third bottle, and these results are pretty consistent:I seem to be able to get the full effect out of this for two days in a row. On the third day, the mental effect is notably diminished, but the circulation boost is still there. On the fourth day, there seems to be no focus boost AND the circulation boost seems to be greatly diminished as well.After day three or four, I seem to only have to wait about 24-48 hours before it will work again, albeit to a notable diminished degree. After 72 hours, I seem to be able to get the full effect out of it.So, in my experience, the ideal consistent intake methods are:- on two days, off the next three days, repeat- on one day, off the next, on the next, off the next, repeat- on two days, off one day, on one day, off two days, repeat (this is what I do now, as it means the most consecutive days at admittedly diminished efficacy.)This is the only nootropic and pre-workout supplement that I have to give a schedule, but I find it's entirely worth it.

This is a pretty dynamic supplement. It pretty much hits you everywhere all at once, and, if you work out regularly, you can then fully appreciate the effects. The ALCAR-T brings focus and clarity, and the rest gives you stamina and some energy.This is a staple in my pre-workout stack. I highly recommend this if you find yourself dragging around during your workouts or work days.

I have been taking this pretty consistently - once a day in the morning with a small meal - for a couple months. I have noticed a slight bettering of my mood, and it seems to work synergystically with centrophenoxine and phenylpiracetam - magnifying the effects of both. By itself, the effect is subtle and seems to build on itself with repeated use.These are all things that I noticed, and then discovered had been documented as observed effects of this substance - so, I'm fairly confident in what I have stated here. I wouldn't say it is worth buying by itself, but, combined with either of the aforementioned substances, it's a great thing to have.I've seen some concerns about addiction, as this substance may directly influence your dopamine receptors. I had stopped and started at varying intervals prior to when I became consistent about taking it, and noticed no impulses or withdrawals. However, I have taken just the one 500mg capsule daily, and many people are likely to take more and more often. In that case, addiction may be a valid concern.I did take 1500mg in one day once, and noticed no significant difference. Certainly, I noticed that there was a difference, but I had spread the dosages across the day and that probably mitigated any of the stronger or potentially ill effects it would otherwise have had. Certainly, I don't recommend taking more than one a day, as it really is quite enough and makes the bottle a pretty decent value.

I picked these up on a whim just a little before I was scheduled to work. I took one just about a half hour before I got to work, and by the time I had clocked in I felt like I had taken a caffeine pill. I was firing on all cylinders and ready to go.It's worth noting some things, however:- I'm 26, male, and active. I work out daily, and make a point to exert myself at all opportunities.- My job involves quite a bit of walking and lifting.- I eat a high protein / high carbohydrate diet, and I snack consistently throughout the day as opposed to having what would typically be considered meals.I am not sedentary, I am not overweight, and I was moving around the entire time. As I carefully monitor my diet and the supplements I take, I am very confident that the drastic energy boost was from the 7-keto.I did also notice that I felt a bit warmer than usual, but that could easily just be psychosomatic as I had read the label and had seen "thermogenesis " as the intended effect.This feeling lasted about four hours in total for me. I also noticed that I didn't get nearly as hungry as I typically do during a work day.I really like these, and will be making them a staple of my workouts. At a cost of twenty bucks for 60, that's ten bucks a month for rage-workouts without the need for caffeine. Done deal. Sold. Yes please and thank you.

A little bit of research into stress and mood elevation led me to these beauties, and boy am I glad it did. While this was not the first form of tyrosine I have taken, it is certainly just as effective while being considerably cheaper. I take one at night and one in the morning, and have enjoyed peaceful sleep followed by powerful and determined morning workouts. I feel more confident and energetic throughout the day, and seem much less easily cowed or browbeaten as I used to be.Few supplements land in that "take until I either die or cannot afford" category, and this is certainly one of them.

This is kinda my dream supplement. I used to take a very expensive Gaia brand supplement that had essentially the same ingredients (Adrenal Support, IIRC), but the cost was unsustainable for someone of my meager (retail) income. After some looking around, I found this supplement loaded with almost the exact same ingredients at a much lower price!I've found these to be absolutely indispensable. The energy boost, physical stamina, and mental clarity it brings is something I do not wish to go without. I am very glad to have found these.The tablets are pleasingly small and easy to swallow, and even have a pleasant aroma to them! I could hardly be happier with these.

I usually wear a small in my gloves, so I ordered the Small/Medium. Despite the gloves fitting well on my fingers, the thumbs fit very awkwardly and I cannot operate anything with any dexterity because of that.They are quite handsome and grippy, though. You could almost convince someone they were slightly adhesive, but they're just very grippy and comfy!I'll be returning these and will return to using their normal "mad grip" gloves which I had liked so much. While the product line is good, this variety (or maybe just the pair I got!) does not fit in the same way the others do.

I drop a tablespoon of this, along with two tablespoons of cacao and a half tablespoon of maca powder, into my post-workout protein shake, and it adds a really delicious nutty flavor that I have come to find indispensable. Sure, weed isn't addictive, but I think this stuff may be. All my normal shakes seem bland and boring compared to my morning hemp-oil-boosted shake.I can't say I've noticed any real changes in body composition or overall wellness or mood, except for how much I enjoy it when drinking the shakes.

I throw a couple tablespoons of this into my post-workout protein shake at a 4:6:1 ratio with maca root and hemp oil respectively, and it makes for the most delicious nutty chocolate flavor! By itself, it's very bitter and dry, but it's also very nutritious and very good when combined with a sweetener of some variety. I've found just mixing this with coconut oil and either stevia or coconut sugar makes for a good impromptu high-energy snack if I'm dragging in a workout.While this is surely useful for baking and other things, I can only attest to how good it is in shakes and the aforementioned snack. In both of those instances, it is very good indeed. Highly recommended, and well-priced!

I can't make any claims of newfound health or anything, but I can tell you this stuff is damned tasty when mixed into shakes. I'll throw this into my post-workout protein shake along with some raw cacao and some hemp oil, and it's the most amazing combination of nutty chocolateness that I've ever experienced. I've even tried just the maca in my shake, and it adds a really pleasant toffee-like note that rounds out and compliments a lot of different flavors.Yeah, fiber, amino acids, protein, etc etc etc. That's just how I justify adding delicious flavor powder to my shakes.

I take one of these with a meal after my daily workout, and it both seems to positively affect my mood AND hasten my recovery. While I've sure there was an initial boosted effect as the newly-elevated caffeine levels gave me a little more energy, it's been so long that I've surely become attuned to the caffeine... and the mood and recovery effects seem to persist!If you follow the directions (one a day with a meal), this is 2/3 of a year supply. That's one of the most economical supplements (that actually works) I've seen in my life!

I switched from the Nature's Life High-Folic B-Complex to this, and have noticed a stark drop in energy levels. I compared the two, and the Jarrow formula seems to be significantly weaker overall. I will finish out the bottle out of penny-pinching stubbornness, but I'll be going back to Nature's Life for sure.

I'm a healthy 26-year-old man. I've been taking this for a while now, and it seems to be effective. My memory is much faster and more complete than it had been in the past, and it wasn't even deficient to begin with.I started taking these on a whim, but, honestly, I don't think I'll be stopping without good cause. I really quite enjoy being able to recall things so easily and completely.

This knife has no business being as nice as it is. It costs too little for how well put-together every aspect seems to be:- KVT Bearing pivot. It snaps open quickly, smoothly, and easily without any wrist-flick or a spring.- Gorgeous stonewash finish, which is both attractive on its own and has the benefit of hiding scratches.- Wonderful hand-filling-but-not-clunky handle, and the "k-texture" grip on the G10 fiberglass handle scales provides great retention even with wet or greasy hands.- The absence of a thumbstud makes it that much better of a cutting tool - there is no metal nub to get caught on whatever medium you're cutting through, and the fully flat-ground blade makes it wonderfully effective.- Deep-carry pocket clip, seamlessly integrated into the handle.I also like that it's essentially a frame-lock knife with a handle scale overlay, as opposed to a bare frame or a linerlock. It makes for a lockbar with a confidence-inspiring thickness without sacrificing grippiness or symmetry.This knife has a lot of the features and qualities that I expect from substantially more expensive knife. All they have to do is change the blade and handle material and it would fit right in their Zero Tolerance line and command $200+.

I'm not entirely sure how effective these are, honestly. While I have no reason to doubt the contents of the tablets, I wonder if either the delivery method or the amount is somehow ineffectual. I've been taking HICA consistently through BCAA mixes, and decided that I would like to use the tablets as well. After three jars, I have been left with the overall impression that it didn't do a whole heck of a lot when compared to the BCAA mixes. Off or on, it didn't seem to have any considerable effect.I tried multiple methods and times of ingestion: 15, 30, 45, and 60 minutes before and/or after, during, with or without protein, carbohydrates, fats, or other amino acids. Any combination of those, I have tried. I've tried taking multiple over the course of the day, taking 2-5 at once... Nothing seemed to do anything noticeable.I'm forced to conclude that I've wasted just shy of $200 on these things. Please learn from my mistake. The BCAA mixes seem to be the more effective delivery method.

I really like these BCAA mixes. I've tried several of the flavors, and this is both the best flavor and currently VERY competitively priced (under twenty bucks) for 30 servings of BCAA with HICA (look it up! Promising, effective stuff), citrulline, agmatine, and beta alanine. That's a particularly effective mix of ingredients, and I've diluting it into 32oz bottles so that I can stay anabolic all day.If I were to rank the flavors, it would be as such:- Juicy Pineapple- Watermelon- Mango Orange- Cherry Limeade- Sour AppleI have noticed that, out of the five jars of the stuff that I've purchased, every single one had SEVERE clumping issues that I can tell the manufacturer is well aware of - they provide two quite large anti-dessicant packets that still don't seem to alleviate the problem. Regardless, taking the scoop and the packets out and shaking the container really violently for quite a long time seems to more or less break up the clumps. Both Beta Alanine and citrulline cargmulate, which I've interacted with the pure forms of, are prone to clumping, so it's no surprise when you take that into consideration.This is, at present, one of the best-designed BCAA mixes I have seen for day-long anabolic sipping (each scoop makes 12oz, which can easily be diluted to 32 without sacrificing efficacy), and the presence of HICA is wonderful! Strongly recommended.

I really like these BCAA mixes. I've tried several of the flavors, and, while this is one of the least pleasant, it's still very good and currently VERY competitively priced (under twenty bucks) for 30 servings of BCAA with HICA (look it up! Promising, effective stuff), citrulline, agmatine, and beta alanine. That's a particularly effective mix of ingredients, and I've diluting it into 32oz bottles so that I can stay anabolic all day.If I were to rank the flavors, it would be as such:- Juicy Pineapple- Watermelon- Mango Orange- Cherry Limeade- Sour AppleI have noticed that, out of the five jars of the stuff that I've purchased, every single one had SEVERE clumping issues that I can tell the manufacturer is well aware of - they provide two quite large anti-dessicant packets that still don't seem to alleviate the problem. Regardless, taking the scoop and the packets out and shaking the container really violently for quite a long time seems to more or less break up the clumps. Both Beta Alanine and citrulline cargmulate, which I've interacted with the pure forms of, are prone to clumping, so it's no surprise when you take that into consideration.This is, at present, one of the best-designed BCAA mixes I have seen for day-long anabolic sipping (each scoop makes 12oz, which can easily be diluted to 32 without sacrificing efficacy), and the presence of HICA is wonderful! Strongly recommended, but get the pineapple flavor.

Judy, though only in her 60s, becomes aware that she's losing her memory. Not the simple misplaced purse but whole sections of the day she can't remember – finding herself out dog-walking and unaware of how to get home. Her daughters Laura and Kelly find a respite place for her and it rapidly becomes apparent that she can no longer cope. While clearing her house, Laura finds part of an A4 pad on which her mother has started writing about her youth, with special reference to a mystery disappearance. Laura's own life begins to echo some aspects of her mother's. Things come to a head with a family wedding.This is a super mystery story but it's also a detailed and affectionate look at a mother's failing mind. The day to day difference between a good day and a day when things go completely haywire is well observed. Judy is sometimes irrational or anxious which makes Laura's exploration of her past very difficult. We finally discover the truth about the past but it wasn't as simple as Judy, or her daughter, believed. A splendid story, highly recommended.I received an advance copy for review.

This little book will give you an evening of pleasure – and you can’t say that about everything you buy! The three stories tell of people’s reactions to the loss of a loved one. In the first, Strange Shores, a teacher who has lost his wife to cancer, find a way that he believes he will reach her again. In Alfonso’s Looking Glass a young man who has lost his wife has spent three years wrapped in grief. His grandfather’s looking glass offers joy or despair. He finds a way to utilise this for his own happiness. Finally, A Matter of Perspective thrusts us into a grim, post-apocalyptic world where those few survivors live on the edge.These three stories are very different in genre but are tied into a thoroughly satisfying whole by the overarching theme. I really enjoyed them.

I suspect most of us reading Nowhere Child will have already read Stranger Child and been left with – not an incomplete story, but one with a few dangling edges. Tasha has deliberately made herself homeless and Emma won’t rest until she finds her. The problem is, Tasha doesn’t want to be found. She fears that Emma hates her. After something happens to the young man who shares her homeless state and looks after her, she begins to fear that she brings misfortune on those whose lives she touches.This novella has some very exciting points which I can’t tell you for fear of spoiling it. The characters all feel real to me, with their good points and their annoyances. We get closer to finding out what happened to her mother and meet Tom Douglas and his mysterious brother Jack again. It all ties in beautifully and it’s a delight to watch Tasha, the child victim, opening up when she finds that people actually do love her.I received a pre-publication copy of this book for review purposes.

I really enjoyed this creepy story set in the US farming community of whispering Pines. The Red Church is now no longer used for worship but as a storage area for hay bales. Then a local man returns from California after twenty years away to open it again to an uncomfortable style of religion with midnight services and some dubious activities. The sheriff is riddled with guilt over his little brother's death years ago and the great grandfather of the new incumbent is still seen to haunt the graveyard - the hung preacher is a local legend. The local 'old blood' families are being preyed on and young Ronnie Day is in danger of being the next.This is a compelling read. Any story set in a place cut off or set apart, as this small mountain community is, has a feeling of claustrophobia which greatly adds to the horror. It occupies a familiar niche within the horror genre but it does it very well. I was on edge to the end to see what would happen and there were some shocks along the way. A great read for horror fans.

This is the second of Paul Levinson's Exo-Engineers books.A suspended chord has a dissonance which creates tension and a feeling of unease and incompleteness. Just before a settler is killed by an out-of-the-blue lightning strike, the birds which inhabit the planet being investigated for signs of intelligent life are heard to sing suspended fourth chords. Jack, the husband of the woman who dies, is convinced the birds were issuing a warning. He investigates sudden deaths to try to discover if the birds are able to anticipate or predict a death.I've really enjoyed both of these short stories and the ideas underlying them. I feel the cost for such a short ‘book’ will deter people from reading them. It’s great to read intelligent ideas about intelligent life. A book full of these stories would definitely merit a five star review.

Actually, three and a half. I read and really enjoyed the author’s thriller for adults, M.O.D. so I thought I’d try his Young Adult fiction. In this story, the first of a trilogy, Rick is single father to teenaged daughters, and has effectively adopted some of his children’s friends.
