One of the girls finds an artefact which turns out to be the key to an amazing hidden cave in which it’s possible to access other times. A time machine! Rick’s lady-friend is an archaeologist and during the course of the book they become closer and the girls act as cupid to ensure that she moves in. There are several little threads like this woven together which make for plenty of interest.I found the beginning hard going. It rested heavily on the girls’ sporting prowess and competitions and matches. I’m sure some people would love this but for me it held up progress. I bought the book for the time aspect and fought to get there. Once the artefact and the cave were in play, the story ripped away and I enjoyed it a lot. The writing isn’t too heavy and young adults will enjoy it and not feel talked down to. All in all, I found it a good story.

Kate is still grieving for the loss of one of her twin daughters to cancer, a circumstance which destroyed the dregs of an ailing marriage. She meets Mark who comes to make shelves for her new cottage. He has experienced the loss of his partner Emma’s young son in a house-fire for which Emma blames him because he slipped out for a few minutes to the shops and that was when the fire broke out. Then children die in fires up and down the country – wherever Mark is. He knows he is in the frame. Can Emma believe him?The story touches on guilt, family rivalry – Kate’s sister is a detective working on the cases – friendship, loyalty and love. Kate’s husband reappears to insist on taking his daughter out at weekends and also, to Kate’s horror, refusing to allow her to be alone in Mark’s care. It’s an interesting study in why people fall apart and what helps to pull them back together to remake their lives. I enjoyed this story which is a thriller with a psychological edge. Highly recommended.I received an advance copy of this book for review purposes.

This is Book 1 of the Exo-Genetic Engineers series in which humans are searching for evidence of intelligence in the wider universe. A group arrives for a research mission on a planet with life, but nothing suggests any of it has the kind of intelligence they are searching for. Then they start to eat the fruit of the trees.It’s an interesting concept and I enjoyed the ideas concerning how one would define intelligence – is it deliberate interference with evolution, for example? The writing, as I’ve found before from Paul Levinson, was crisp, interesting and accessible and I’ve already bought Book 2 to find out more. The only criticism is that for ‘books’ of 25 or so pages, they are expensive in comparison with a full novel. I’d have preferred to see a collection of stories like this marketed as a single book. That said, I’m hooked, aren’t I?

In this American High School story our narrator, Miles Halter, is a shy young man with few friends. He becomes part of a small group including the bouncy Alaska. She has a boyfriend at another college and most of the group of friends fall under her spell. She's dynamic, enigmatic, occasionally moody but often fun. We are often allowed into their secret smoking and drinking as well as their classes. Miles, who loves reading of people's last words, is particularly entranced by the religion class run by The Old Man who wheezes his way through lectures.This is intended, I believe, as a book for young adults but it grabbed my attention and never let up. After a catastrophe for the group, Miles is forced, not only by his own obsessive need to know, but also by the final paper set for the religion class, to consider the meaning of life, the finality or otherwise of death and the whereabouts of Alaska.

I enjoyed Slur, the first book in this series, not least because it is set in the part of Manchester where I was born. The action in A Gangster’s Grip takes place four years later and the girls have matured considerably. Rita and her husband Yansis return from his native Greece for a protracted stay in Manchester for a reason we discover later. She finds things at home are not as cosy as she’d come to believe from letters and phone calls. Her sister Jenny is visibly pregnant to a dodgy and bullying partner. When Rita and her friend Julie try to help Jenny to get her life back, they find she isn’t the only person under this man’s influence.The characters here are believable and I wanted things to work out well for Rita, Julie and their families. It’s easy for the reader to become involved in this story and there’s plenty of action and excitement. I was drawn into it and read it quickly and I eagerly await Part Three of the trilogy.I received an advance copy for review.

This is the fifth in the Pitkirtly Mysteries series and is a rather claustrophobic adventure in which Pitkirtly is cut off by snow for the Christmas and New Year period. There is a robbery at the jeweller's and the local police force is seriously hampered by the weather. All my favourite characters were there and the remarkable Amaryllis Peebles, donning her pink PI bulletproof vest, decides to take on the jewel robbery, when it's discovered that the most expensive item on the list turns out to be a fake.This is another great little story in which, although there are murders and bodies, the reader is never subjected to gratuitous violence. This series is full of quirky characters and is delightfully written. I’m pleased to see that I have several more to read. A bit of a mystery wrapped in a wonderful gentle wit is just what I enjoy.

After the nail-biter ending of Book 1 we pick up exactly where we left off – which I won’t elaborate on for fear of spoiling Book 1 for anyone yet to read it. Barnes and Woods end up on two opposing sides but still working together. They have a method of leaving coded messages – which Woods needs help to decode. My opinion of various of the characters shifted as I read and because Angie Smith can juggle so many threads and can breathe life into such a lot of characters, I was sucked into it as into quicksand. I couldn’t have got out until the end!As the title implies, we discover secrets about some of our characters, including Maria Barnes. She must be one of my favourite characters in modern literature. She and Woods go deeper into the secrets of the Intelligence Service and turn up some nasty things crawling under there. There’s such a lot happening in this book that to pick on one aspect is to ignore others. It becomes very exciting towards the end. I can’t describe it – you need to read it!I received an advance copy for review purposes.

I bought this ages ago and have no idea why I left it so long to read it. Something else must have cropped up to distract me. I found myself really pulled into the story of Hannah, her dreary husband Cliff and her loose-moralled sister Jill. They holiday together with their children (one per sister) and Jill’s gay friend, the chef Tristan. One day when Hannah’s out, there’s a phone-call from Cliff’s brother which throws Hannah’s composure out of the window. Her son Luke has an accident and this, too, makes her re-evaluate her life and its direction.This is one of those books where you don’t instantly fall in love with the characters. There are, as in life, those you warm to and those who make you squirm. I liked Hannah, though I sometimes wanted to shake her, found Jill annoying and Cliff cold. The children and Tristan were people I liked. I couldn’t guess the ending (I think there’s more to come in another book) and I thoroughly enjoyed the read.

If you have a young person with a sense of humour and a thirst for knowledge in your life, you really need this book. I ordered two copies. My nearly -11 year-old grand-daughter will really appreciate it, but I wanted one for myself. Why should the youngsters get all the fun? Each full page illustrations (for example, Felix Mendelsswan – the cover character) faces a page with a little information about the animal and a brief biography of the person. It’s beautifully done, with delightful pictures and is both fun and factual. If you buy one to give away you’ll want another to keep! For the number and quality of the illustrations it’s an absolute bargain.The author writes for young people and doesn’t talk down to them. It’s all done with wit and imagination. The best thing about it is discovering there’s a Volume II in production. Wonderful!

This book is a really exciting and readable tale of a woman in the most dreadful of circumstance. She faces the deterioration of her five year-old daughter’s health with a condition which is terminal. Another crisis occurs in her life to make this even more poignant – if you can imagine anything worse than losing your only child. Clinical trials on the use of a hormone have been halted and Victoria, a vet, together with her father-in-law Frank, is determined to try this to give her baby the only chance of life. Would you commit a crime to give your child life?The story is well told and I enjoyed it, but I didn’t find it at all credible. However, as someone who likes sci-fi and fantasy, I can suspend my disbelief to an extent. I didn’t find it likely that Vic and Frank would switch character so suddenly. Having said that, I read it in a day – that’s how the author pulls you into the story. A very good read and a solid four stars from me.

Edward Stanton is 39 years old and lives with Asperger’s Syndrome and obsessive compulsive disorder. His life is only bearable because he has established a routine of collecting data about the weather and his waking times and the familiarity of it allows him to cope. Any deviation from this sets him worrying and makes him frantic. He sees a therapist once a week and likes her because she is logical. He loves logic and facts. The darker part of his life is his relationship with his father, a character I couldn’t warm to either. A new neighbour with a nine year-old son changes his life and he has to make some decisions.I really enjoyed this book. I see others have labelled it repetitive which it is but this highlights Edward’s condition and the fact that the slightest variation from the routine he has established for himself renders him unable to cope. He manages his condition but knows it isolates him. This is a very difficult concept to explain but here the author has shown us the mind of Edward. He is frighteningly literal and a character I could feel very fond of. A great read.

Newly born Rebecca is the product of a short-lived relationship between Sarah and Cal, both due to go to college. Sarah has qualified for Yale but with the birth of her baby, won't be able to go. At the start of the book, Sarah hasn't bonded with Rebecca and refers to her baby as 'it'. The author brilliantly captures the tedium and despair of days and nights spent with a restless, crying newborn. The problem for me was that the book became a bit tedious at that point too. I think that early part would have been better edited down.It’s spot-on with post-partum depression and it also covers homosexual feelings and the way people can make a young person feel ‘evil’. We learn about Sarah's sexuality, her mother's deep and fundamentalist religious faith and Sarah's own attempts, through her relationship with Cal, to try to be 'normal’. Her friend Tiff is her saviour and we see relationships coming to fruition in spite of a couple of blazing rows and some violence. I thought, at about 30%, that the story was too slow with insufficient action but I have to say, the author pulled it all out of the hat and by the second half I was totally hooked. A very good read.

Ted, retired from the police force, works as a private detective. He has some regrets. If he had killed a child-molester who got off through the incompetence of one of his colleagues, he knows he could have saved further harm to children but his conscience wouldn't let him kill. He's called in to look into a murder in a remote hotel. Heavy snow traps him there and we find out more about him - and the occasion on which he actually did take a life.David Haynes has created a claustrophobic story which works very well as a horror novel at surface level. It's as creepy and spooky as you could want. It works as a metaphor too, of the cages in our minds where we hide our secrets or our fears. The literal and metaphorical cages in this novel make you shudder. There are hauntings of different types here and the slow crumbling of a mind. This is a modern classic horror story by a man who has made the genre his own.

Tom Markland is rescued from Canary Wharf after almost drowning. He loses his memory as a result but when it begins to return he recalls the strangling of four young women - apparently by himself. Gradually his memory returns and he finds he is a journalist who was engaged in investigating a company's huge financial irregularity. He is in danger from the company boss and his enforcer and also from the real killer of the girls.The story is an exciting one with a tangled web of characters and motives which the investigative journalist teases apart, only to find he's still not at the end of the journey. I too found I jumped to erroneous conclusions and the swift changes kept me on my toes. This is an action-packed thriller in which, although the story unfolds and results are achieved, there is a slightly unsettling ending. I loved it!

Dexter and Emma meet at their graduation and the story follows them on that day each year (St Swithin’s). It’s so compelling because it takes the hopes and enthusiasms of the young people and we watch the dreams unfold. As with all of us, life never really turns out as we expected, whether for good or ill. Emma is rather earnest but I liked her. She’s true to herself. Dexter seems fairly shallow and sybaritic and, to me, much harder to like. I loved the story throughout, with its up and its, sometimes very low, downs. Each takes a partner but there’s always that pull between them. I was on edge wondering how it would end and I was nowhere near in my guesses.I loved this story and although my university experience was long before theirs, I recognised the idealism, the aspirations, and enjoyed following their careers. I also felt the class and north/south divisions hadn’t changed. I was the prickly, working-class northern girl! This is a memorable story and feels real. I recommend it to anyone who enjoys contemporary fiction at its best.

This story of the man who leads a paedophile ring is both bleak and gripping. Dr David Galbraith is that suave, educated and plausible man who, in the guise of a saviour to children in crisis, causes them further, unimaginable pain. There is little graphic child abuse described so don't be afraid to read it. It's the story of a troubled family; a weak father who leaves home to move in with a younger woman, a dominant mother who is a rather unpleasant and manipulative person, much though she loves her children, and those children themselves, the younger of whom suffers badly at the family breakdown. The referral to the doctor is meant to help.It's a grim and exciting story as we follow the family's troubles and the police and child protection workers trying to help them. The author has considerable professional expertise in this field and the authenticity shines through. I have issues with the dialogue however. People don't use one another's name all the time in conversations. They really don't. It's a tactic to avoid using 'said so-and-so' but once the characters in the conversation are established (and this happened even in phone calls where there were only two) then they speak alternately. No need to keep adding Trevor. It was infuriatingly distracting.This niggle aside, it's a powerful story and I hope people read it and take care who they trust with their children.

Almost the entirety of this novel takes place around a dining table where a number of disparate characters discuss, argue and flirt over a long meal. Naturally, much is said and even more is intimated by allowing us to be privy to the thoughts of those whose point of view we are currently reading. It makes for a most unusual book. Initially I admit I found some of the conversation stilted. Later I tried reading it to myself in my version of a South African accent (that’s where it’s set) and it began to feel more alive. I felt that the author got into his stride in the second half of the book which flowed much better for me.The author admits to a quirky sense of humour. Much is based on puns which are not my thing at all so it wasn’t a rib-tickler for me but its strength lies in its illumination of the workings of the South African political scene and the lawlessness and police corruption which accompany it. That’s not to say it was a heavy-handed political diatribe – not a bit of it. Wry observation was interspersed with details of the personal lives of the diners. The denoument was a bold exploration of the following eighteen months. I don’t want to spoil it by saying how but I’ve not seen a story wrapped up in this way before. A good sneaky peek through a window on South Africa.

I found this a really good read. I enjoy a complex thriller with good characters and I found that here. The police are investigating a series of murders in which roman numerals are left at the scene. There’s a connection; they just have to find it. Investigation throws up earlier deaths which also had the roman numeral connection. Investigating officers are sent an extra man to help on the team but he causes more problems than he solves. Woods and Barnes are a fantastic duo and worked well together in this story. Barnes has hidden depths and we’ve obviously not totally plumbed them yet.I loved the involvement of the establishment figures who were just as shady as I’d expect them to be. It’s a conspiracy-theorist’s delight, this story! It was an exciting ride all the way through. Just be aware that it stops rather than ends as it’s the first of a series. I would have liked an ending rather than a sudden halt.

Short Story. Shop owner Morgan tried to sell Tony a carpet. A magic one. And he proves it. With a little twist of his hand he’s able to grab the night and make things happen. He has recognised the same skill in Tony though he’s a novice and his efforts aren’t so successful.This is a funny little romp which takes place in the course of a single night. It’s a great piece of imagination and I enjoyed it a lot. It’s only its shortness and lack of substance which prevents it from being a five star read for me. I’d love to see an idea like this expanded.

The story is told by a man remembering his childhood and events which happened when he was seven years old. The memories are triggered by revisiting the place where they happened. I started it with an open mind, aware that it was being referred to as a modern fantasy and a fable. Its strength for me was that it was told simply and I genuinely felt the effect of seeing through a child’s eyes. By a third of the way through, I was completely hooked. It takes a lot to keep me up beyond my bedtime but this book did.I could feel the helplessness of a child at the hands of adults. Children have no power of their own and here, the boy has put himself in danger and his friendship with the three women who live near the pond, the ocean of the title, come to his help. One blames herself for putting him in that danger initially. They reminded me of The Muses – the maiden, the mother, the crone – with their wisdom and antiquity. I found the whole story, with its strong mythical qualities, very compelling and attractive and I read till my eyes ached. This will be a favourite!

Alice (code-named Halo) is ex-military and now works for an organisation for which, in essence, she’s a contract killer. Shard is a man pursuing revenge for the killing of his brothers and comrades-in-arms in the Kosovo liberation army. Alice kills in a vigilante style, executing those who have escaped or evaded justice. He follows her and exacts punishment on her few friends and family. It’s a real cat-and-mouse game with two people who are not afraid to go to extremes.There are some great characters in this book, although most of them are of dubious morality. The men running a club with eastern European girls held as prisoners to be used as prostitutes, with no rights and no defence, are utterly despicable. The girls, one in particular whom we get to know, are sad and without hope. Both Alice and Shard take her plight to heart and it adds a richness to the book. The story is very fast-paced and the ending is harsh but satisfying. I’ll be very happy to read more by this writing duo.Thanks to Marble City, the publisher, for a review copy of this book.

The title is the name of a 1970s rock band and after a come-back they die one by one under inexplicable circumstances. You can only believe in so much coincidence. Danny Lancaster Investigates! Danny seems superficially to be a bit of a Jack-the-lad but his charisma and character are such that his friends willingly put themselves in danger to help him. In this case, he finds he’s been invited to investigate a case which then sets him up as the major suspect in a multiple murder. How is he going to get out of this one?Bill Todd’s stories are always complex and, if you pay attention, they are a gripping read. They move fast, there are many characters and nasty things happen to people. If you’re a devotee of the murder, mystery, detective and/or thriller categories, these books will really hook you.

Andrew meets Charlotte and his life changes in an instant. When we fall in love we almost want to consume and be consumed by the beloved. Andrew realises that he's seeing Charlie to the exclusion of all others - his best friend, his sister. Is this more than a natural desire to be always together? Then Charlie shows him her jealous side and bad things, even death, happen to his previous girlfriends.This is a tense story where we begin to feel almost as involved with Andrew and Charlie as they are with each other. The clues we are given throughout the book don't lead in a single direction. This is a clever and tangled web and I enjoyed its unravelling a great deal.

What a lovely book this is. It's coincidentally the second book set in Crete that I've read in the last month though their themes are substantially different. The half Greek girl Ariadne (Ria), after suffering a tragic loss, finds herself relegated to writing obituaries on the paper she works for. She throws it all up to go to Crete, finds a job and realised she's been wasting her life. She hears the story of a local family tragedy and the rebuilding of a ruined vineyard. She's drawn to Tom who's starting over.This story has several deep themes. There's tragedy and hope reborn. There's family honour and friendships. There's a love of place - the place your family is tied to for generations. There's also the light touch of humour here. Ria's a caring person, a natural journalist (nosy person!) and a good friend. Lily Rose Graham has written a lovely, contemporary romance and I very much enjoyed it.

Cathy is one of four sisters whose parents died in a car accident when she was eight years old. She developed the habit of writing to her dead mother and continued right until she left home, in desperate circumstances. She eventually set up a business in New Zealand – about as far away from her Irish home as she could. She has deliberately concealed her whereabouts for fifteen years but her son is encouraging her to resume contact and invite his aunts to her forthcoming wedding. None of the sisters has had an easy ride through life and I enjoyed this story. It’s a light read but you really want to keep reading!The sisters each had a very different attitude to life and, due to their marriage choices – though one felt she really hadn’t had a choice – they appear to be very different people. We see two personal viewpoints in this story, through Cathy’s letters to her mother and through her oldest sister Rebecca’s journal. There didn’t seem to be a huge amount of sisterly love between them but then, with the death of their parents and one of the sisters always blaming herself, they didn’t have a ‘normal’ childhood. It’s quite gripping in places and I enjoyed reading it a lot, much as I wanted to shake some of them!

Benor is a cartographer and he's come to Port Naain to produce a handbook. He makes a home with Tallis, a professional poet and his wife Shena. She's a mud-jobber or as we might say, a beachcomber. Some of her combings include bodies. Everything has a price and families will pay for the privilege of burying their dead and, if possible, finding who caused it. Benor is a natural. He's a nosy person and, with the aid of the wonderful Mutt, a ten year-old wise beyond his years, he sorts out the villains from the corpses. This first short story from The Port Naain Intelligencer bodes well for the rest of the series. A really great Whodunit.

Louisa is currently standing in for her boss at a conference on Fiji. She arrives just as a political coup has taken place and can’t get to her hotel. She and a fellow passenger are picked up by two men and offered rooms for the night. One of the two kind souls is found murdered the next day and the other, after being seen speaking to one of the shoeshine boys in the town, is also later found to have been murdered. Louise and a local policewoman become drawn in to trying to solve the case, which puts Louise herself in great danger. All isn’t entirely happy on the love-life front, either. Things get complicated.This is a story in which the threads of the murder mystery become entangled with Louisa’s personal life. Her OCD makes life very hard for her when she has to share a hotel room. This story is set on a different island from the first book, Food of Ghosts and I somehow felt a greater sense of place in the first. There was much dashing about here, to different hotels, and even for a day, back to Kiribati where she was living. I like the character of Louisa. She’s earnest and hard-working and, situated where she is, she doesn’t have the might of modern forensics at her command. It’s almost as if Marianne Wheelehan has taken a modern girl and given her an Agatha Christie set-up to work with. The relationships she creates are always multi-dimensional too. A great series and very different.

Danny Lancaster, newly fledged Private Investigator, takes on a number of cases, augmenting his meagre income with a job driving a minicab for a friend. The book introduces us early on to a strong cast of characters and only as the story progresses do we find the connection. He and a couple of mates take advantage of a wreck along the coast, ‘liberating’ a few things which turn out to be hot potatoes. Things soon get deep, dangerous and complex. Danny Lancaster is an engaging character; attractive and enigmatic he is popular with the ladies. We learn about his military service in this first book of the series, and though he's not had an easy life to date, he is determined and has a strong sense of justice.I was introduced to the character in the recently published collection Gargoyle Pixie Dog and this first Danny Lancaster volume has given me a taste for the complicated, interweaving sub plots employed by the author. I really enjoyed this story, seeing it from different characters' viewpoints. The end of the story brought all the threads together in a very satisfying manner. A really good read.

I know that all lovers of the first book in this fantasy series, Alloria, will leap on this with delight. It’s been a while coming. However, all the great characters are there. David Staniforth can create the most evil baddies, the most delightful children – while not making them emetic – and the most trustworthy friends and colleagues. Once again we meet Alloria and her brother, who is under the influence of the most repulsive villain of all time, Glebester. I felt sorry for her brother, Yrion, who was tempted by power before he realised the price he would pay. Alloria and Nat become a little closer as they grow up together. And Bane is just big, irrepressible Bane. Got to love him! They travel the Labyrinth and are instrumental in bringing justice where Yrion and Gleberster have wrought evil. Ymarid, her father, at times seems like a feeble old man but we witness his power and above all, his love.The author is particularly skilled at drawing a fantasy world the reader can almost see, smell and touch. He’s a gifted descriptive writer but doesn’t use it to pad out a floppy plot. The writing lifts and carries a complex stories with all the traditional themes you’d expect in a book of fantasy. A new world, new creatures but above all, compassion and friendship. I love it!

This is the second DI Kim Stone book. I enjoyed the first very much though I found the character hard to believe in. This time she’s more real, more believable and though she’s apparently a cold, unapproachable person totally lacking in people skills, she’s got loyalty – and even a little affection – from her team. There’s more than one evil game going on in this story and the repercussions echo Kim’s own, very nasty, childhood experiences. It could give her strength or it could overwhelm her.In between a father who’s been abusing two very young daughters and a young, successful and intelligent psychiatrist, Kim confronts fears of her own as well as fears for the people for whom she, as a police officer, swore to find justice. This book is the sort you read to the exclusion of other things (except eating in my case!) and it takes you over. It had moments of great, heart-pumping excitement. I really loved it.

This is a collection of stories written for Valentine's Day over a number of years. They are all, naturally, concerned with the beginnings of relationships. David Levithan writes for teens and I really loved Two Boys Kissing. This didn’t hit the spot for me quite so much. After two stories I moved on to another book; they felt too similar. I went back and very much enjoyed some of those in the middle of the book. Then I lost the fire again. I felt that some of them were added to make weight.One thing these stories have in common is that they deal with those things young people – and older, for that matter – struggle with – early relationships. It matters not if they are gay or straight, old or young but naturally, most of these are young. We all love in the same, deep and insecure way and his writing captures this so well. I want to give this three and a half stars. It was definitely better than okay.

This excellent story takes place on the island of Crete. Kirsty is a Scottish woman who left home to run a kafenion on the island following a divorce. A beautiful girl, Eleni, and her new husband, Patrick, come for their honeymoon and old memories are stirred up. Memories and enmities. Treachery and betrayal during WWII echo down the years and Eleni, with a half-Greek mother, is drawn in. Kirsty is determined to find the couple when they disappear in strange circumstances.This is a tightly-written and exciting thriller which saw me carrying my kindle around for two days unable to let go. There is some breathtaking writing and some thoughtful comment on the concept of vendetta and how family honour can seem to overtake and overwhelm a whole life. It's not something we and Kirsty understand but by seeing it through Cretan eyes we find an inevitable struggle and a final acceptance. Highly recommended.

This short book really amused me. If you’re familiar with the stories of Benor the Cartographer from the author’s Land of the Three Seas then you will have some idea of what to expect. Tallis Steelyard is a poet. He makes his living that way. Lambent Dreams is a collection of some of his works and his friend Benor comments on them to give some historical or geographical insight. Then there is the commentary from fellow poet and critic Lancet Foredeck. These remind me of the notes you get on wines from some of the ‘experts’ and I chuckled along with them. Perhaps funniest of all was the fact that, somehow, the footnotes inserted by one of the typesetters were left in by accident; a much more refreshing view is revealed!This won’t take you long to read but I guarantee you’ll smile a lot while you do. A little gem!

Sometimes you find a series which you think you will enjoy but you missed out on the start. Do you go to the beginning and hope you’ll get chance to read them all or do you dive in and feel lost? This book, which is full novel length, is a really good way to get a taster of the author’s Danny Lancaster stories. Danny is a private investigator, an ex-soldier who lost a leg in Afghanistan, and, if these stories are typical, he’s never going to get rich. He makes enough to get by but he’s got a soft heart, in spite of some of the things he becomes involved with.I admit to being seduced by the title, though the reason for it becomes obvious when Danny is trying to trace a missing street girl. This is the main story, although there are shorter stories in the collection. I didn’t find a dud in there and I like the author’s style of writing. He comes up with some excellent phrases and isn’t a slave to cliché. I really hope I’ll find the time to read more Danny Lancaster before too long. A great collection and a lesson to series authors in how to give potential new readers a way in.

If you enjoy fast-paced action adventures, this is the book for you. It hits the ground running and barely lets up. Holly phones her ex-husband Gabriel for help when she finds her life is in danger. She has in her possession a mysterious vessel which two factions want and will kill to get. She herself was working for one of them as part of a team analysing it. Her boss tells an incredible tale, naming the vessel the Holy Grail though it bears no resemblance to the Last Supper cup of legend. It’s very old but appears super-modern and seems to employ nanotechnology.The story takes place both in the present day and in historic times and is well written. The ex-husband and wife are nicely drawn characters and I felt they still held considerable attraction for one another. The finale is fast and exciting and, having made my mind up right at the end what the denouement should be, I really enjoyed the ending. Highly recommended for action/thriller fans.
Melissa and Doug toys are such high quality, and that's the case with this sturdy alphabet toy. It's a great way for kids to practice their letters. Highly recommend.

Nice watch; seems to be good quality. As others have mentioned, the background color of the face is a bit darker than it appears online, making it just a tad bit difficult to see the numbers. Overall, it's nice but there is nothing spectacular about it.

I am such a fan of Sloane Crosley's nonfiction and looked forward to the release of her first novel all year. I was sorely disappointed by it as it was such an unpleasant read. While Crosley's dry sense of humor and quick wit are evident throughout, it doesn't even begin to make up for the actual story, which falls flat right from the beginning. The plot is uneven, the characters are vapid and boring, and the entire book drags and drags. Nothing compelled me to keep going and it took me forever to finish because it was so uninteresting. I am so bummed! Truly, don't let this turn you off of Crosley's other books, which are fan-freaking-tastic, but "The Clasp" is a major dud.
Such a great toy. Toddlers can play with and sort the blocks, and also enjoy walking with the wagon. My nephew was mesmerized with it as soon as it came out of the box. It's an excellent value, too b
Such a cute remote control toy for little ones! My 3-year-old niece loves this super cute pony. It's not as big as I hoped it would be, but it's still a lot of fun.

Very fun kit for little girls who love nail art! The designs are easy to use and really encourage creativity. It's also not super messy, which is nice. I don't know how long the materials will last, but for now it's fun! My 11- and 3-year-old nieces love it.

Another wonderful toy from Kiddopotamus. This is a high quality toy with various activities that will keep your little one engaged for a long time. It's also soft and chew-friendly! Highly recommended.

This is a fantastic work of non-fiction that reads like a novel. If you're interested in learning more about this period in history, I highly recommend "Last Call." It's an extremely well-researched and engaging book about the history of Prohibition, and it depicts the many colorful characters who made names for themselves during this crazy era in our nation's history. The book is informative, incredibly detailed, and also pretty funny in places as well. It was one of those great reads that I couldn't put down once I started it. I highly recommend it!

This is a very cool educational shape-sorter toy for infants. The toy is of good quality and the pieces are perfect to introduce little ones to shapes and colors. It's also very sturdy and versatile, and can easily be used as a water toy as well. Highly recommended.
This is a good, basic soft book for babies, but it is not worth $16 at all. There are many other books that are more fun and engaging for infants.

This is a fun, cautionary tale about the madness that is the Ivy League college admission process. As a higher educational professional myself, I was attracted to the plot of the story, although the story turned out to be a bit disjointed at times. Still, it's a light and fun read.

Petty fans will love this. It's not a traditional biography, but really captures the essence and spirit of his music and its impact on modern culture. Certain things are glossed over, but the focus is on the music, as it should be.

I laughed a lot when I read this book. You've never really experienced a truly dysfunctional family like this. Author Jenny Lawson describes her ultra-untraditional upbringing in rural Texas and her completely unbelievable and hilarious adult life. Her stories are so out there that I seriously have to wonder how many of them have been drastically embellished, but who could make this stuff up?! So funny. I look forward to the new book Lawson has coming out this fall.

This is such an odd little movie, and it's much more depressing than I thought it would be. Still, mad props for innovation. In a nutshell, a lonely man who is going through a divorce begins a relationship with his operating system, which is a pretty widely accepted thing. The film is very interesting but also really, really depressing. I enjoyed it but don't recommend it for even mildly depressed or lonely people.

This is not brilliant literature by any sense of the imagination. It's fun, light reading that George Clooney super-fans like myself will get a kick out of. My biggest beef (I mean chicken?) with this book is that we don't actually get to meet George! Oh well. Save it for the sequel, which can be titled "Melissa Niksic will Marry George Clooney by New Year's." (Sorry Amal, but your time is limited."

In theory, this is a pretty cool device: a portable night-light that kids can hold. The two things that kind of such about it are that it's hard to get the battery cover on and off, and younger children want to put it in their mouths, which doesn't seem safe. For slightly older children, though, it's a great option.

"Lily Love" wasn't what I expected. It began as an extremely thoughtful story about a single mother and her special-needs child, but then developed into just another cheesy and somewhat predictable love story. Not a bad book, but nothing special, either.

Great writing, great character development, but SOOOOOOOOOOOOO LOOOOOOOOOOOOONG. Seriously. If you want a great character study novel, then this is it. If you are like me and cannot deal with 500 pages of rich character development and not a whole lot of action, then be warned: this book will DRAG.
This book really disappointed me. I wasn't expecting brilliant literature or anything, but I was hoping for a fun summer read. I found most of the book boring and extremely predictable. Skip it.

Interesting story, perhaps a bit disjointed. This is a story about race, and it's also very satirical, so keep that in mind and realize that info don't possess a certain sense of humor, this probably won't be the book for you.

I have naturally curly hair, and back in the 1980's I used to use hot oil treatments on my hair because there weren't many products on the market at that time for my hair type. I thought I would use this macadamia oil as a hot oil treatment, and I am glad I did. I warmed the oil and then distributed it through my hair and allowed it to penetrate for 15 minutes. I then washed my hair with the Luseta Argan oil shampoo, and lightly conditioned. I noticed my hair was shinier and had less frizz. It also works well on my hair as a leave in serum, but I only use a small amount because it can weigh the hair down and give it a greasy appearance. It has a light fragrance and comes packaged in a decorative bottle that displays nicely.Sample provided at no cost. This is my unbiased review based on using this product over the past couple of weeks.

My skin tend to get very dry when the fall weather begins to approach, so I am always looking for good moisturizing products. This olive and jojoba oil by SFR Products absorbs into my skin quickly and leaves it nicely moisturized. It does leave a slightly greasy feel, but the dissipates rather quickly. A small amount of this oil goes a long way, so this bottle will last me for quite a while. This jojoba oil does have fragrance added, unlike other oils I've used. It's a light fragrance though, and does linger for long. This oil comes a bottle that resembles a whiskey bottle, and displays nicely in my bathroom.Sample provided by SFR Products at no charge. This is my honest review based on my usage of this oil.

I have naturally curly hair and I am always looking for new hair care products to bring some life back to my hair. This argan oil shampoo and conditioner by Luseta does just that. I've been using it for just over a week, and my hair is softer, more manageable and has a nice shine to it. The shampoo has a rich lather and rinses out easily, leaving my hair with clean feel to it. The conditioner is a creamy consistency and doesn't leave my hair feeling greasy. The products are sulfate free, which is perfect for my color treated hair. They are packaged in pump bottles, so dispensing is easy and there's not waste. A little of both of these products got a long way. It has a nice fragrance that lasts throughout the day.Full size sample provided at no charge. This in my honest review based on my use of this product.

This hair masque by Herbalosophy works great on my naturally curly hair. My hair gets dry very quickly, so I am always trying to add moisture to it. This masque allows me to that in just 5 minutes. I've been using this masque for a few weeks now, and after shampooing, I apply to my hair and leave it on for about five minutes. It's rinses out easily and leaves my hair soft and more manageable. The product has a creamy consistency and is has a light, pleasant fragrance. Overall, I am pleased with this product, but I do want to point out that I received the product in a tube, and not in a jar like the picture shows.Sample provided at no cost. This is my honest review based on my usage over the past few weeks.

This toothbrush by PRO-SYS is has a smaller head than other toothbrushes I've used, but it does a great job of cleaning my teeth. Although the head is small it's packed with bristles. This toothbrush isn't to hard on my teeth, but not too soft either. I prefer a brush somewhere in the middle, so I am happy it's not an very soft bristled brush. I am glad to know that PRO-SYS provides antimicrobial toothbrushes. I've never put much thought into, but since toothbrushes are typically stored in the bathroom where germs run rampant. Overall, a very satisfied with this toothbrush.Sample provided at no cost. This is my honest review based on my usage of this toothbrush.

This lavender foot and body soak by Eden & Farrow has added true relaxation to my bath time routine. It's not often that I get to enjoy a bath, but when I do I like to get the most out of it. I usually set the bathroom up with nicely scented candles and dim the lights. I like to take a detox bath at least once a week, and this product really works great. I add a few tablespoons to my bath along with some of my favorite essential oils. The product dissolves quickly into the bath water.  The scent of this soak is comforting and relaxing. Lavender is known for it's relaxing benefits, so it's no wonder why I enjoy this soak so much. It comes in a very pretty jar, decorated with butterflies. I keep it on the shelf in my bathroom because it looks so pretty. I am very pleased with this product and plan to order more.Sample provided by Eden & Farrow at no charge. This is my honest review based on my use of this product.

This is a nicely made piece of costume jewelry, although I am not sure who it is sized for. I am petite, but I also had my girlfriend try it on, and it seems to hang to low on the foot. The bottom chain hung under my foot making it a bit uncomfortable to wear. It is pretty though, and has a nice look to it. It has two turquoise stones which add to it's beauty.Sample provided by BeOne free of charge. This is my unbiased review based on me trying this product.

This bohemia two piece flower anklet by BeOne is easy to put on, nicely made and quite pretty. The anklet is gold tone with turquoise colored stones. It is two pieces and hangs nicely on my ankle. It's a lovely accessory when wearing a sun dress or capri pants. Overall, I am pleased with this anklet, but think the quality could be better. It also comes packaged in a baggy, instead of a jewelry box. I often purchase jewelry for gifts, and would prefer not having to buy a box.Sample provided by BeOne at no charge. This is my unbiased review based on my usage of this product.

These handmade angel earrings by QT are nicely made, dainty and are comfortable to wear. They are nicely and the angels are very cute. These earrings are very dainty, and delicate looking. They are easy to put in my ears and lightweight making the very comfortable to wear. They are white, so they go nicely with anything I'm wearing. The come in a small gift box making them perfect for gift giving.Sample provided by QT at no cost. This is my unbiased review based on my usage of this product.

This microfiber travel towel by Wanderluxe is different than any towel I've ever used. The towel is much larger than your typical bath towel, measuring a full 60" by 28". A smaller hand towel is also included. The towel is thinner than other towels, but it's super absorbent. I don't go to the gym, but this towel would be perfect for camping, hiking or the beach. My favorite use for this towel is drying my hair after showering. I have naturally curly hair, and try to stay away from the blow dryer. This towel is lightweight and very absorbent, so it's perfect for wrapping my hair. The towel absorbs the water from my hair quickly, and doesn't weigh my head down. It comes in a mesh bag with a drawstring, so it easy to toss in my purse or glove compartment when on the go. It's a high quality towel and washes nicely. This towel is machine washable, but air drying is recommended. I have washed it once since ordering, and it dried within a few hours.Sample provided at no charge. This is my unbiased review based on my usage of this towel.

This is my review of Tomameri Blue Portable MP4 Player MP3 Player Video Player with Photo Viewer , E-Book Reader , Voice Recorder with 32 GB Micro SD Card.This player arrived in perfect shape and is exactly as described. It is very portable making it easy to take with me when I'm on the go. It's very easy to use, and that's coming from someone that's not at all tech savvy. The sound quality is very good.  A 32 GB SD card is included, so it stores a lot of music. The sound quality is very good.  It is a very pretty teal blue color and quite stylish.Overall, I am very pleased with this MP4 player, but can't justify the price on it. It is good quality, but a overpriced compared to others I've seen on the market.Sample provided by Tomameri. This is my unbiased review based on my use of this product.

I have been experimenting with a variety of oils for the past year, but this is my first time trying castor oil. I've been applying a few drops to my face before bed, and have noticed my overall skin health has improved. I often get dry spots on my cheeks, but applying this castor oil by Renewalize has eliminated that problem.This oil is thicker than other oils I've used, but it absorbs quickly and doesn't leave my skin oily.This castor oil is 100% pure and unrefined, so it contains no additives. It is packaged in a 4 oz. dark amber glass bottle to protect it from light and rancidity. It includes a glass dropper for easy dispensing and no mess or waste.A sample was provided at no cost. This is my unbiased review based on my use of this oil.

I ordered this socks for a male friend of mine, and they are now his favorite socks. He had never tried bamboo socks before, but is pleased at how comfortable they are and his feet don't sweat as they do with other socks. The material is soft and lightweight.  The socks are well made, stitched tightly and machine washable. This is a pack of 3 and a great value, compared to other bamboo socks I've seen on the market.Provided at no charge. This is my unbiased review of the product.

This Amazing Singing Birthday Candle by Thunder added a nice touch to my nieces birthday cake. The candle is very colorful and shaped like a flower. It lit easily and was pretty simple to blow out. It is constructed of plastic, but well made. The kids really enjoyed that the candle is also musical. This candle is nicer than similar ones I've found at local party stores.Product provided at no cost. This is my unbiased review based on my experience with this item.

I've never tried a tea like this before, but was very impressed by the flavor. This tea is actually dried flowers, and has a nice fragrance to it. I can't compare the flavor of this tea to any other tea I've tried before, so I will do my best. It has definitely has floral notes, but not over powering. I allowed it to steep for about 5 minutes, and added a little bit of sweetener, and it was quite enjoyable.The tea is packaged in a sealed bag, and a pretty metal tin is included for storage after opening. This would make the perfect gift for that tea lover in your life.Product provided at no charge. This is my unbiased review based on my experience with this tea.

This premium double hinged waiter's corkscrew by DMC Innovation is very well crafted. The handle wooden and has a very nice finish. The knife on the backside does a fabulous job of cutting the foil off of the bottle before removing the cork. The screw shaft easily threads into the cork, without damaged the cork, and the entire cork popped out of both bottles I tried this. This corkscrew is high quality and built to last. It comes in a nice box, so it would make the perfect gift for the wine lover in your life. The company offers an unconditional money back guarantee.Sample sent at no cost. This is my honest and unbiased review.

Raw shea butter is an all natural product that really helps improve my skin.  This shea butter from  Beauty By Shea  is 100% organic and unrefined. I've stopped using commercial moisturizers because of all the chemicals they contain. This raw shea butter is great for making homemade moisturizers, whipped butters and soaps. There are many recipes that can be found online. I like to add some my favorite essential oils to the butter, since I'm not real fond of the scent alone. It is nicely packaged in a sealed bag to keep it fresh. This is a high quality, all natural product that I am very pleased with.Sample received at no cost. This is my honest and unbiased review.

I am pleased with the cleaning power of this all natural laundry detergent by Natural HomeLogic. I usually use one of the brand name laundry detergents on the market that are full of chemicals, and would say that this natural detergent cleaned just as well. I've been using it for just over a week now, and noticed my skin doesn't feel itchy like it does with other detergents, so I am very pleased with that. The only reason I didn't give this product 5 stars is because the fragrance is very faint. I am a fragrance addict, and prefer a stronger scented detergent.Overall, I am pleased with the way this detergent performed, and would purchase it again.I purchased this product at a discounted price. This is my honest and unbiased review.

Ocean Spray is my favorite brand when it comes to cranberry juice. Most other brands only product cranberry juice cocktail, and it's loaded with sugar. I am very happy that Ocean Spray has the 100% juice as an option. The juice is not too sweet, or too tart.  This was a definite bargain at less that $2 per bottle. I usually pay almost $4 per bottle at my local supermarket. I am very pleased with this purchase, and am now well stocked up on cranberry juice.

I know these razors are designed with a man in mind, but these are the only razors I use for shaving my legs. They give me a nice close shave without nicking my skin. They are a bit pricey, but I feel they are well worth it because of the results I get. I've tried many other brands, but Gilette Fusion is my all time favorite.

I purchased this as a Christmas present for a male friend of mine. He is a big fan of Bvlgari, but had never tried this particular scent before. He was very pleased with it, and is still wearing it today. It is a nice masculine scent, but no overpowering like some other scent I've smelled. It comes in a very nice bottle and is nicely gift boxed. I compared prices before making the purchase, and thought this was a bargain compared to some other sites I found it for sale. I am very pleased with this purchase, and will be ordering more this year.

This wine chiller stick by Unique Effects has made drinking wine more enjoyable. The product is very easy to use, by just placing the stainless steel stick in the freezer for 2 hours. Once the stick is chilled, the foil cutter that is included can be used to prepare the bottle of wine for opening. After opening the bottle, I poured a small amount of wine out to allow room for the stick. Insert the stick into the bottle with the pouring spout attached. It pours nice with no dripping. This wine chiller stick is well made and very easy to use. It keeps the bottle of wine cold for about an hour, doesn't dilute the wine like ice cubes do. There are very clear instruction listed on the bottom of the box. It comes in a lovely gift box, so it would make the perfect gift for that wine lover in your life.I received this item at no cost from Unique Effects. This is my honest and unbiased review based on my experience with this Wine Chiller Stick.

This Coolife 4-way Garden Hose to Hose Connector has really made watering my lawn so much easier. I can now use the hose and the sprinkler at the same time. The splitter is easy to connect by just screwing it onto the outdoor spigot. The splitter is heavy duty and built much more durable than ones I've seen at local hardware stores. All of the valves and fittings are high quality and built to last. I've only been using this for a short time, but am confident it will last for many seasons because of the quality.I received this product at no cost from Waying Direct. This is my honest and unbiased review based on my experience in using this product.

I had never tried Clif Energy Bars before ordering these from The Pantry. The bars taste great, are well sealed and have a nice texture. The white chocolate and macadamia compliment each other well. They are perfect for a quick snack on the go.  I think they are a little over priced, but would buy again if I found them on sale.

McCormick is my go to brand for most spices, so I thought I'd give the taco seasoning a try, since it was offered in the pantry. I like the taco seasoning, but I prefer other brands over this one. I don't feel it flavored my taco meat as well as other taco seasonings I've used. It just tastes like something is missing. It's a good product, but not one of my favorites.

I've been using Palmolive for many years now, and it's still my favorite dish detergent on the market. I like that it cuts through grease, but is gentle on my hands. Some other dish detergents are much more harsh, and dry out my hands. I like the light scent of original Palmolive. I do wish they would go back to the pull up top because it was much easier to dispense. I love the convenience of Prime Pantry and happy that Palmolive is one of the products offered there.

Folgers has been my favorite brand of coffee for many years. I like the smooth taste. It's comes in a nice resealable container to retain freshness. The price was fair for this size container. I am glad this is offered in Prime Pantry, and will definitely order it again.

This French Coffee Press by Brillante is well made and makes a fabulous cup of coffee. The is constructed of glass and stainless and definitely is built to last. This french press is smaller than other I've owned, but that's just fine because I am the only one who drinks coffee in my house. It's easy to use, and makes one large cup of coffee or two small cups. It's also perfect for brewing tea too. I am very pleased with the coffee maker, and think it makes a better cup of coffee, than an electric brewer.I received this french press at no cost. This is my unbiased review based on my experience with this product.

I am very pleased with this high quality aromatherapy essential oil set by Calily. My three favorite things about this set are the classy packaging, the variety of oils included, and the potency and consistency of each scent.The oils come packaged in a very nice box, and is sealed with a band with the Calily logo. This is great because it allows me to keep all the oils organized and neatly stored...all in one box. The packaging also makes this perfect for gift giving.There are 14 scents included in this scent, which makes it great for anyone who is new to oils, or if just want replenish your supply. My favorite scents are the orange and lavender. The scent of the oils are potent, but not overbearing. The consistency indicates a good quality oil, but it's not so thick that it clogs my diffuser. I've had some other oils that clog my diffuser after just a few uses. I haven't had that experience with these oils from Calily.I received this product free of charge. This is an unbiased and honest review based on my experience with these oils.

This 100' expandable garden hose by Gorilla Hose sturdy, lightweight and very easy to install to water outlet. The hose is made of a cloth material, but is still very durable, and the fittings are brass. I like that this hose is lightweight, because it doesn't making watering the garden and lawn feel like a chore. My other 100' hose is very heavy, and it makes it difficult to pull around, but this hose by Gorilla Hose makes watering a breeze. The fittings are strong and very easy to screw onto my outdoor water outlet. Overall, I am very pleased with this hose and would recommend it.I received at no charge for my honest and unbiased review.

This 100% Pure Peppermint Oil by Essentially KateS has a sweet, minty scent that I am very fond of. There are so many uses for peppermint, but my favorite use is mixing it with a carrier oil, and applying to my chest and back before bed. It has a soothing affect, and also helps to loosen congestion.The oil comes in a dark brown glass bottle to protect from light and preserve freshness. It is sealed very well, and there was no leakage like I have experienced with some other oils I've received. A glass dropper is included which can be used to replace the cap for easy dispensing. Overall, I am very pleased with the quality and scent of this peppermint oil.I did receive this oil at no charge for my honest and unbiased review.

This Blackhead and Blemish Remover Extractor Tool Kit by EZGO is a very nice set. There are 5 tools included in this set, and the come in a nice zippered case. The are a well made and easy to use. I don't suffer from blackheads, but my daughter does, so she has been using this set, and is pleased with the results. It works great to remove blackheads in crevices that are almost impossible to get to otherwise.I purchased this set at a discounted price for my honest review.

This Filament Light Bulb by MadKing has a very nostalgic look to it, and provides a nice soft light. I recently received an antique lamp for a gift, so this light bulb came at the perfect time. When it is lit up all of the internal workings of the bulb are visible, which makes it very attractive. The light bulb will fit any standard lighting fixture. It is 60 watts, but seems brighter than most 60 watt bulbs I've used, although it is a nice soft light, and easy on the eyes. I am very pleased with this light bulb and will be purchasing more for other light fixtures in my home.I received at no cost for my honest review.

I have several diffusers and love experimenting with different essential oils. What I love most about this diffuser by VicTsing the variety of light settings. It's very easy to set-up and operate. I add just a few drops of essential oil into the water in the tank, and turn it on. It fills the room with the scent of the oil. The diffuser also lights up adding a nice ambiance to the room. There are 4 misting timer settings and 8 light settings, (4 colors - high and low setting for each), so this model offers lots of options.There is a very detailed instruction manual included...it's well written and easy to understand. A handy measuring cup is included too, so there's no guessing on the amount of water to add to the unit.I received this product at a discounted price for my honest review

These candles by Old Factory Candles are high quality and burn well. They are made of soy, and are have a nice, strong scent. They come in nice glass jars with a screw on lid. I received these as a gift, and would certainly purchase them to give to others as a gift. They come in a nice box, so they would make the perfect gift. I am very pleased with these candles.

This bath toy organizer from Tidy Toys is perfect for keeping the bathroom clutter free. I gave this to my girlfriend because her son has more bath toys, than she knows what to do with. She was able to easily install this on the shower wall with the suction cups that are included. All of her son's toys are nicely stored in this organizer and no more mess. It is a netted bag, so they are able to air dry.I received this at no cost for my honest review.

My daughter has been using this in conjunction with the Retseliney Acne Face Mask and Moisturizer. She has noticed a big improvement in the over look of her skin. The breakouts are much less and her skin appears almost blemish free. The products are all natural and benzoyl peroxide free, so they don't dry out the skin like other acne products. The cleanser is deep cleaning, but gentle on the skin. She has tried many of the more expensive acne treatments, but is happier with the results the Retseliney are providing. These products are great for anyone looking for a more natural way to treat acne breakouts and overall skin health.I received at no cost for my honest review.

My daughter has been using this in conjunction with the Retseliney Acne Face Mask and Cleanser. She has noticed a big improvement in the over look of her skin. The breakouts are much less and her skin appears almost blemish free. The products are all natural and benzoyl peroxide free, so they don't dry out the skin like other acne products. The moisturizer doesn't leave her skin shiny, which is great because most other moisturizers do. These products are great for anyone looking for a more natural way to treat acne breakouts and overall skin health.I received at no cost for my honest review.

My daughter is in her 20's and still suffers from acne breakouts, so I was glad to find this Acne Face Mask by Retseliney. She has been using it everyday for a couple of weeks now, and the breakouts are less frequent and her skin has began to clear up greatly. It doesn't dry out her skin like some other acne products she has tried, so she is very pleased with the results and will continue to use.I received this product at no cost for my honest review.

I live in an apartment that doesn't have a doorbell, so this wireless door bell by Tektalk is perfect for me. It is very easy to use, and has easy to understand instructions on the back of the box. An instruction manual is included inside the box, as well. It does require batteries, and they are included, so that's a plus for sure. The doorbell receiver doesn't require any mounting, so it just needs to be plugged into any standard electrical outlet. The doorbell unit requires no hardware, and mounts with the adhesive on the back of it. I am very happy with this doorbell and its ease of use.I received this product at no cost for my honest review.

The NEW Charge HR is working great and working as it should. I am upping my review to 5 stars again due to FitBit's awesome customer service and their lack of argument with my troubleshooting after talking for 5 minutes with them they agreed to send a new one right away. I did not have to discuss its issues with their Tech Support. I AM a E-tech and they knew it! So, 5 days after contacting them, on Aug 18th, I got the new one in the mail via USPS Priority Mail. I AM HAPPY!UPDATE 8/14/15: It died, so I hated it. I hate things that don't work. Especially techy things that I can't take apart and fix for myself as this is microscopic work that uses Ultrasonic wire bonding methods, something I don't have available to use for micro repairs. This Charge HR stopped connecting via its internal BlueTooth, from inside the thing itself to either the phone app or the PC site via the BT dongle. I had to jump through only a FEW hoops to do the processes to attempt to re-pair the Bluetooth of the Charge HR to the PC and Smartphone app. Last thing to do to prove the device itself was defective in pairing was to disconnect the Charge HR from my account entirely, and reconnect it as if it was new. THAT was the final test to determine IF it was, in fact, the device itself, or the phone app, or the PC website or BT dongle. WHEN I tried to set it up as a NEW Charge HR device, it would not connect. Problem solved, device broken. I called FitBit, told them all that, and Customer Service, I gotta give them credit, they are immediately sending me out a new Charge HR as I did what they would have told me to do before they told me to do it (I dislike working on tech things and troubleshooting via phone with any tech support and there is a reason for that). It's elementary troubleshooting for anything electrical or electronic, to me.AFTER, I receive the new device, I will again update my review. Until then. I hate the freaking thing that IS broken!ORIGINAL REVIEW 5/18/15: I have used the FitBit One model for about 3 years and it was functional and reliable, never had a problem at all. It's motivating to get my 15,000 steps, or more, in daily.I upgraded to this Charge HR for advanced features. I have had no issues with the strap coming off, the strap is just like a watch strap with a buckle style closure.It is reliable, and using FitBit Premium service is cool and also motivating. I like having the multiple alarms for reminders.The Tap feature is good. Tap twice and see what you programmed it to show. I have mine set to heart rate, tap twice during exercise and see heart rate immediately. GOOD feature.Easy to set up for a newb, esp easy if you have used any other models of FitBit.Premium is good, at ~50 annually, and has many features. The FitBit website has a tutorial on each model of the FitBit, which makes it easy for you to decide what features you need.All the tutorials to use any FitBit is user friendly.Works with both SparkPeople and MyFitnessPal.com. I love that!I do recommend FitBit as a motivational tool to maintain, increase fitness. Like all things electronic or otherwise, if you do not see an update, then the product is continuing to work as it did when new.

Please don't diss my review because music taste is subjective. THIS IS Baroque music from the 15 to 16th Century from Latin America, and played on Lute and other instruments. There are 22 songs on this CD.I enjoy instrumental music, especially Latin Baroque. It's lovely, relaxing, and a style of music which you would have listened to IF you had lived in those centuries in Latin America. It does have some Early Latin Rhythms.I love it, enjoy listening to this while I do my work esp while traveling.

I thought I was purchasing an LG. It was not, but instead a cheap version knock off of the LG Tone headset.I will not buy this again. Sound is terrible. I hate it.Returned.I cannot recommend this headset.

Although I did purchase this BWV 180p bodycam from an outside vendor a few months ago, it does work very well and I have used it during my frequent travels out of town. My only issue with this BWV bodycam is that it did not do real time uploading as the video/audio is being recorded, which I have since resolved by purchasing the Wolfcom brand of bodycam widely used by police throughout the USA, because it is a Police Body Cam, which does have real time uploading of video to an undisclosed server at any time video is being recorded which is unalterable and can be used in any court of law anywhere in the USA. My DH uses it, is a police officer, and because of that, I was able to get the actual Wolfcom brand of bodycam which does do this uploading of all video recorded during real time. That is powerful.I really like the BWV, and it's 1080p recording in HD is tremendously powerful for voice and clarity of HD video and for the average person, I would recommend it. However, I did want real time uploading of video, just as all Police have and it is fully admissible in any court of law for a civilian as well as any Police Personnel. The court cannot say that MY bodycam cannot be used and is inadmissible in court as they are now doing when civilians use cell recorded audio and video.That said, for most people, this BWV bodycam is powerful and will do the job you need it do do, and the quality of recording is that of HD quality, and also does record very clear audio, with date and time stamp which in unalterable and WILL hold up for you in any court of law. I did deduct one star, since it does not have the capability of real time uploading into a server for storage long term.I also have 4 vehicle cams, 2 in each vehicle for 340 degree recordings, which I did write a review on a while back, and they are also powerful with both audio and HD video with unalterable date and time stamp. If you are interested in vehicle cams, I suggest looking up those brands.

This is the wall mount I used for the 70" Sony TV, although I purchased the mount from the seller where I purchased the TV. My DH installed it, and due to the 100 lb weight of the TV he did find and use the wall studs to anchor the mount as the sales Tech advised him to do. He did. The good thing about this mount, is the way the holes allow you to put the lag bolts into any hole to allow you to match up the holed to the stud distance of your walls. Ours is the typical 16".  It took DH about an hour to get it mounted properly and safely to support the weight of the TV.I like that I can tilt the TV screen downwards fairly well for the smaller kids to see better while they play video games.A year later, there have been no issues with the TV mount. I did put a bit of machine oil a few months ago onto the swiveling area of the mount as it was getting harder to move it's position. Not a deal breaker, just maintenance.As with all things I review, if the product stops working or malfunctions in any way, I will always update my reviews.

I purchased this 70" Sony 3D HDTV last mid-year. It is amazing and I've only purchased a few 3D movies for the kids. The color is adjustable using the preselected programs preset for choosing Movies, TV, and other types of watching and the choice automatically sets the proper screen settings for that type of watching. It does have Netflix, HuluPlus, and music such as Pandora and iHeart Radio and YouTube built in into it's remote and on-screen programming which allows you to search for particular YT videos, since I follow a lot of musicians there such as Camille & Kennerly harpists and Paul O'Dette harpist, and others. I had a good sized Sony products coupon so my buying was spontaneous.It has probably the best quality picture of any TV I have ever owned, and now, a year later it continues to work as it did when newly purchased. The color is vibrant and lifelike and having the ability to quickly set the TV for whatever you are watching. I like that it has the USB slot Flash Drives for watching family photographs or home made traveling movies over the big screen (I use Sony Movie Studio programming to make nicely done and edited movies with titles and credits). Overall, the TV is simply Plug n Play. I have Xbox 360 and PS 4 and also a Wii hooked up for fun and games for the kids who spend time with me often when I am home. The  kids love playing the games with this huge screen with the Sound System. Several of the games they play is 3D. My Surround Sound System, which I also reviewed, quickly hooked up and works flawlessly with this set.CONS: None, other than it's so heavy you need help to set it up and mount it on the wall.I replaced my LG 65" with this, and gave the old set to friends. The Sony has a remarkable LED screen. It's design and sturdy build quality is not flimsy built either. In fact, it weighs about 125 lbs packaged. The TV itself weighs 100 lbs. I did purchase a huge wall mount with swivel. It was a lot of work but worthwhile to do so. Tilting the TV downward for the kids while playing games was key, since they are smaller kids.As with all things electronic or otherwise, if the product stops working correctly or malfunctions in any way, I will always update my reviews.

I purchased this axe in early 2013. Since then, I have purchased 9 more, a couple here and there since buying the first one because they are that good. I have 10 now, and I keep them in strategic places to use for whatever I need to chop up or down. They are amazing axes, very razor sharp, all one piece strong metal which extends all the way to the end of the handle, which means the handle won't break off during use. They are the sharpest little axe/hatchet blade I have ever used. I cut paper with it as you would using a razor blade. NICE!It chops wood very well. Of course this is a hand axe to be used for certain tasks when a large axe is not needed. I have several large axes as well, but this is my go to for smaller axing chores. I keep a couple in my miniMH for traveling. You never know when you will need one.I have many Gerber knives and sharp tools for various uses, and I've never been dissatisfied with anything Gerber.I do recommend this Gerber axe/hatchet and I have one wherever I go, many places. It is a fine piece of equipment and a necessary item to have in your bag, or as some would call it, a BOB.

I've read all of Virginia Woolf novels over the years and enjoyed reading the Orlando tale. In finding that Tilda Swinton was main character in Orlando I had to rent it last month via Amazon via phone hooked up to TV in a hotel, and watched the movie there. I do this all the time. The movie follows the book quite well. I will always say that the reading of a book is always going to be better than passively watching a movie, this is true with the book versus the movie with Tilda. Reading is a requirement to think and comprehend. Watching a movie which is designed to do the thinking for you is passive and the mind has most of the thinking done for the watcher. That said, I still enjoyed watching the movie Orlando. It was well done, the costumes were correct and relevant for the different eras as was the locations chosen for the movie, such as Russian outskirts and England.I am partial to reading versus TV, music versus passively watching TV. IF you liked the book, the movie Orlando was well enough produced and character developed well to make the movie watchable and entertaining. I didn't even consider having DH watch this movie with me, since it will not be too many men's style of movie preferred. Most men wouldn't consider reading Woolf's novels either.Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?  Remember what is behind that question? I do.

I purchased this transceiver early last year for my miniMH. Love it, love it, love it for traveling and rags. It DXs beautifully. I did purchase the ADMS-4BU programming software for this Transceiver. It is easy to program channels and repeaters. I've programmed mine for 4 Western states and printed out a channel guide so I know which channel is which. I have not "named" each channel YET, that is for another day, but I will get there soon. I tried using CHIRP, but the cable with the software is different than that that comes in the software ADMS program. To use CHIRP, you have to purchase a different cable for programming. I use this transceiver with a Lil Tarheel 2 computer controlled and channel programmed antenna and I am having good results from 10 to 80 m. It can be spotty or 3/2 in you are out in the boonies. Repeater line of sight and it is a good experience. Get the fold flat Repeater book from ARRL, especially if you travel a lot like I do.It was time consuming in the beginning to learn all the many bells and whistles, lots of multi functional buttons as well, but over time I learned. This was one of the reasons I did not review the 857 sooner.I also have the VX8DR HT, and I have not reviewed it yet for the same reasons.The 2 Yaesus are better than my Alinco base stn which is older, but functions well for 2 & 10 m.Fun transceiver, reliable, good mic, could be used as a base with a good PS. I do use the QJE PS if I choose to play with the 857 indoors. I need more antennas, and I am building a yagi with stanley measuring tape now, and cannot wait to play with that while on the road at the beach in Los Angeles! THAT is going to be some good fun!73 and "see" you in thin air maybe?

I love to workout at home or out and about when I travel. The 30 day shred is challenging in the beginning, but is doable. I like the results for my body, after several months of doing the workout regularly and now able to really push myself by getting "into" that groove of great movement and lots of sweat! Precise exercise for precise body areas. Jillian could be, and probably has, the reputation to being the hardest workout Queen ever. I believe she is a tough act to follow in the exercise world. I do like the other Dance Workouts which I had reviewed a while back. Since I travel, I must workout wherever I am, and using these DVDs I can do that easily in a hotel room.I highly recommend this Jillian shred workout. It does get results fast!  But IF you are an absolute beginner and have never worked out before, you can still do this DVD, just tone down a bit and workout at your pace and physical condition level.
