I jumped out on a limb buying this, when I usually only need one size but having the entire set of shrink tubing is handy.The quality of the tubing is very good and the same as bought at tech supply stores, and shrinks well as you'd expect.Use a too small size, when you shrink it, it will likely split.Using a size twice the size of what you are needing to use the tubing for and all will be golden.Love the case for storing the different sized tubing. I've never had a set like this, and I know I'm going to enjoy it.(the typical regular little tubing bags are annoying)Love having these at my anytime disposal for my techy electronics projects.

Very good.Compact, holds my 9 cards. Nice design and I like the slots that hold the credit or other ID cards in the order you want so you know which is where, and makes it easier to find.I have no real way to test this for the RFID blocking, without the use of advanced equipment.I do know that the SS will prevent the passing of the RFID CC information by any reader, according to the research I've done on RFID blocking CC holders. SEE UPDATE BELOW.I also like the fact that my CC RFID cannot be tracked by any agency who has a desire to do so. Conspiracy theories abound these days, and many are plausible too. I'm not paranoid, but I find it disheartening that regular people are being tracked by these silly little RFID chips. There are videos which show how to determine if your CC has the RFID chip, and also how to remove it without damaging the CC. I have done this to 3 cards and it works. No one is the wiser either.If they, whoever they is, want to track my purchase, then that is fine. To track my whereabouts, that's just wrong. Hopefully, this will prevent that tracking from occurring to begin with as people begin to refuse to be tracked. Nothing like a Police State. My DH is a Police Officer, so even he is having a difficult time with the tracking card issues.UPDATE 3/19/15: After going through the metal detector line at the International Airport in Los Angeles in early May, as I put my bag onto the X-Ray conveyor belt, the attendant could not see through the SS card case. I was asked to show them the case and then open the case to show them what was in it. No problem, and then the same thing happened at the Phoenix Int'l Airport. My educated guess is that if the X-Ray cannot see through the case, then it's obvious that any card readers or RFID chip trackers cannot read them either. SO, I feel that I can recommend this case for protecting your cards or IDs from theft or tracking.

Gorgeous lighting and no electricity needed! Very easy to work with and put where you want them for safety or pleasure lighting needs. These are LEDs which last for approx 10,000 hours before burning out.These twinkling multi-colored LED solar string lights are lovely! I have the cool white, and the warm white styles of these solar lights, and I love them all! The colors are bright and very visible and they are so easy to set up too! The wires are coated copper and are fine wires, enough to blend into the surroundings so only the lights are seen. I only wove the lights through my patio enclosures. Very simple to just place them and they stay put easily.The solar panels themselves come with a ground stake, and a metal mounting bracket. I only used the bracket for the skylight, and for mounting on corner of roof soffit edge. So I cannot speak for the ground stake. It does look to be of a good length and sturdy to stay put wherever placed if in an out of the way area.I live part time in dreadfully sunny Arizona, and I placed these colored lights on my patio, with the solar panel mounted onto the edge of patio where they do receive all day sun. They automatically come on at dark and provide pretty twinkling lighting and a pleasant ambience for outdoor patio entertainment. There is also a switch for turning off the lights on the solar panel but I leave mine on at all times. It's just one less thing to do, and the auto turn on at dark saves me money by not having to use my own electricity. I love all of the Brightech lighting products. I did receive samples to use and review.The cool white, I placed in my living room skylight. Mounting the solar panel up against the skylight and tacking the wiring in a circular fashion in and around the skylight shaft. I spend no dollars on night lighting within my house now and this set provides great safety lighting during the night time if anyone is up roaming.The warm white, I placed under the covered driveway park strip near the house's back door along the wall up high.  Husband leaves for work around 4am and the lights are still on and this is safe lighting and does light his path nicely as he loads his truck for work. He really likes them because he always forgot to turn off the porch light and with these solar lighting he has one less thing to do too. Then I don't have to say "Dear, you forgot....."I've had all 3 sets of the solar lights up for over 90 days now and they are reliable and useful to light the areas you need for safe foot traffic. I have stayed up until 1am and the lights remain on long past that time of night. I do not know how many hours they do stay on which also depends upon how much direct sun the solar panel receives during the day. As I said, the lights are on at 4am according to the husband.OTHER USES: Before I mounted the solar lights, I took 2 white light sets with us on 3 separate traveling trips. I am considering buying a couple sets to take on future trips as they do light up the area nicely for safety and are sedate enough to not disturb other people nearby by overly bright lights during the night. Our neighbors were interested in the lighting too and are considering purchasing a set for themselves. They are easier to use and cheaper than the typical battery operated camp lighting.As with all my reviews of all things, and especially electrical or electronic, if the product malfunctions at any time, I will always update my reviews to describe the problems found. IF you do not see an update, then the product is still working as it should. I've a 40 year history of electronics technician so I know how these things work and what is wrong when they don't work as they should.EDIT: The price has gone up considerably since I wrote my review. Please take that into account as I don't have the time to edit all the reviews after prices change. I apologize, but the price was lower then.

They are good sleeves. I like the colors. I can tell what category a DVD or CD is by the colors. Helps to stay organized. They seem thin, but they work well. With normal use, they hold up well and if you are like me, you take care of these things. I buy them repeatedly because they work well for me and my needs.To use on the go or in the car, buy the plastic style sleeves. These are for home use mainly.I do recommend these. Lot of value for the cost.

Great quality DVD-R. I have not had one fail, I have used 16 so far. I am happy with the quality of playback as well. I make movies for family. These did not disappoint anyone.Due to the nature of some things I do, I also wear a same as police brand of bodycam. It is the same one police use, and holds up in court. Mine will too. I store some of the cam video onto these DVDs. I also store some dashcam video on these DVDs as well.I do recommend this brand of DVD-R.

I DO NOT LIKE THIS NEW THING OF THE DROP DOWN BOXES FOR DESCRIPTIONS OF BOOKS. IT IS TERRIBLE. I had to pick the 4 categories and for a complex book, they are not correct. I plan on discussing this with Amazon because I feel it is a terrible disservice to both authors and readers and forces the reader to try to narrow down a book style/whatever using one word. That is distasteful of Amazon to do this. I hope others speak up and out and against this terrible issue so that Amazon stops doing this.Ada, or Ardor, is a wonderfully complex but readable story. This is not a book that does your thinking for you, instead, it causes you to think and awareness is heightened as you read but that is the glory of Nabokov, as reading his stories turns any story into a long mental movie because of the quality of his writings.  It is about family, people and their interconnectedness and disconnectedness and about every think known to man is within this book. Yes, every emotion is here. It has psychology of all people. The 4 category method does NOT do justice for this book. This story has everything within, each of the choices given are ALL within this book, and more, much more. The words, and skillful use of them, tickles all your senses and your brain too will be humming faster than your computer processor ever could. You'll be happily surprised and hopefully delighted with Nabokov's masterful style of writing.I enjoy anything Nabokov has written. The complexity of his novels is what draws me into his web of story, having all characters so well developed you feel you know them personally and you know what they even look like. Yet, as the book unfolds, the characters continue to develop which takes away the predictability and keeps me reading on into daybreak. I finally gave up reading at 8am today, slept til 2pm and now I am going back for more story and hours of enjoyment. Scenes described and shows the scene so well you can see it in your mind's eye. This keeps me entertained and engrossed for hours and I leisurely read every word, savoring their meanings when used together to paint a picture. It is not simple writing, it is masterful writing and a complement to the English language. Nabokov does with words what writers can only dream of doing. He was a talented writer, authored many books including that very well known classic and at the time highly controversial book "Lolita" which is better, hugely better than the movie could ever be.If you have only SEEN the movie Lolita, and are also a reader, I highly suggest you purchase a copy of Lolita and read it. You will be surprised.I have read many of Nabokov's books and I have not been disappointed even once. I know, that when I sit down with any of his books, I will be there for hours and days, and I will never be bored. Great writers can do that for you as compared to much of the drivel of today.

I like it. I have had finer mesh cheesecloth in the past. But this brand is good for most of my cooking uses. It works well, is a large size. I cut the size down for the job and have plenty left over. It washed well, by hand using dish dawn soap, so it's reusable. This size will probably last a few years.I have, in the past also used thinnest muslin for the finer straining needs. (I make a couple dozen coffee filters out of muslin and wash in machine or in a bowl soapy water)

I do like these fish oil caps just for the sake of no burps. I take 2 daily, one with each meal.Occasionally I do get maybe one small but very mild fish oil burp from these caps and so mild that it is not disagreeable at all. But they  are NOTHING like those numerous and horrible fishy burps and occasional indigestion that I get from the spring valley brand I normally buy even when I take them before or during a meal, I still got those nasty flavored burps and they are somewhat smelly burps. I dreaded taking those, and I often didn't take them because of the nasty burps and the unpleasantness of the smell my husband complains of when I burp.At least I am taking these.I have taken them on an empty stomach, and they passed the test. No burps or indigestion.With these, I did not get the burps or indigestion and that is great. For me, I'd buy these just for the sake of no fishy burps or the uncomfortable indigestion which the other brand causes me to have fun with.I did receive this bottle of Omega 3 fish oil caps to use, and review. I like them a lot compared to my regular brand and at least I am now taking them regularly, daily.The ingredients what they stated? I can't determine that with absolute certainty, but they do have the GMP seal so their facility has been inspected before product is sold. GMP is good manufacturing practice for quality and purity of products. I would never buy without GMP. (husband works in supplement factory, so GMP is important seal a company could pass)It is my thoughts that the brand name is selling you what they say they are, otherwise they wouldn't be in business long.These are made in the USA and has a 100% Quality seal.The label says Molecularly Distilled fish oil. You can read more about that here omegavia.com/molecularly-distilled-fish-oil/If you want to read about the rankings of fish oil brands, read here labdoor.com/rankings/fish-oilI never realized that fish oil had GUNK in it! My old brand does say 99.99% purified fish oil. That begs the question, which is better?I also read that the molecularly distilled fish oils are how it's now widely done.It comes down to purified versus molecularly distilled and your choice to buy whichever type you are comfortable with.The caps are made of gelatin, glycerin, and a soy based tocopherol (vitamin E from soybeans)1 1/16" long gel caps as measured w a ruler. They are very large as far as pill size go, but only slightly larger than my old brand, but they are easy to swallow since the gelatin makes them very slippery when wet.I would probably buy these once my supply runs out,  just for the fact that they are burpless.

Amazon lost my original post. The page deleted all I had written. I'll do my best though. Next review I will write using Word and then just copy paste onto the review block.My very long gray haired cat, has very very thick hair as well. Her nickname has been "hairball maker" and also called FurBall, for over a decade. Not anymore.The 3 brushes are well made and does the job and has a fair price and a few price cutting deals at times. Watch for thoe deals.She had a few mats when I began, and now has none.I've seen significantly less hairballs after 2 months of using the 3 piece set and her coat is soft smooth and shiny. Especially since that was the beginning of the seasonal warmup in sunny Los Angeles.Cat loves the daily brushing and groomingThe wide two rowed brush removes a lot of undercoat, as does the shedder tool. It also works well on any mats found and within a few days, She had no more mats.I have been unable to do regular grooming for her because she didn't like it. Now she does. She, the cat, decided, and keeps coming back demanding more. All I have to do is call her and rattle the brushes together. She hears that and comes running to get her grooming. A win win since I now get the self relaxation by grooming her. I had never felt that before with an animal/pet, and felt akin to a exercise endorphin high.This is one of the few truly great products I have been offered to try and then write my review.They are well made and should last many years. I really like the larger and ergonomically designed handles. I have wrist pain and finger pain so the larger grips can prevent aggravating that pain.Quality--I can't find a visible or unseen flaw in the brushes anywhere. They are strong and well built overall. They look nice, are affordable, and any long haired animal will love them. Myra does love this grooming time too.My doggie, also likes the bristle brush and then the bristle brush for polishing his hair. He's always laid still for grooming.I was given the 3 brush set product to try out and then give a honest unbiased review and like all my reviews, I update them when the quality or function changes. If you don't see an update, then the product is still working as designed. This is the one product, that I felt the many benefits of using, so I love to do a 5 star review on a great and well made product that does what it is supposed to do and also does it well. .

I've used these headphones while out and about for over a month.I treat them carefully as I do all electronics (I am electronics person not just a user)They are nice, attractive wood, and have a comparable sound quality to other sets which I have purchased for myself. I have bought many headsets from cheap, up to Sennheiser high quality. Of course they don't compare to Sennheiser but to other typical headphones, they are comparable.I enjoy using these, and keep them in my bag for travels. I am a music aficionado so I'm fairly OCD and extremely picky about sound.I am happy with them, and I did receive them to use freely and review.EDIT: the price was around $20 to $25 when I posted my original review, I would not pay 50 for these. Originally I said [For the price, I would not hesitate to purchase these] and with that in mind, it must be considered that of all things electronic, these headphones are made small and with small wiring. Without treating them carefully, like anything else, they could break.I don't think of the wood as being the selling point for me, and I would not consider buying them just for the wood feature, but they do look nice however the music sound is most important. After I put the headphones on, I am not caring for what they look like to others.I dislike glaring white/pink/orange/red or glittery headsets. The darker the better so they fade into the background and aren't noticed by others. That is my goal when choosing color of any headset.

I love music. I have Bluetooth stereo headset and my laptop was not Bluetooth.Now it is with this little BT gizmo. This Bluetooth dongle was a simple plug and play. I use it on both my laptop and desktop. It goes where I go.My desktop and laptop OS recognized it immediately and I was up and running and privately listening to my music within a few minutes.Starbucks is much more fun as I sit and do my writing and editing.I've used this Plugable BT dongle for over a month without any problems pairing or staying paired. I use a LG 830 stereo headset.

I've bought many Stanley tools over the years and have never been disappointed. Some, I've had over 35 years and still going strong.It's a Nice little set of the smaller screwdrivers for working on very small electronics assemblies, or eyeglasses/watch or jewelry parts.The phillips heads are sharp and precise as advertized, the flats are as well. I had no stripped phillips head screws from the drivers not being precise.I liked the rubberized easy grips being larger than most small screwdriver sets, and the shapes of the handles are somewhat ergonomic and easier to grip push and turn.I like the bright yellow color and the case itself to hold the screwdrivers together securely in toolbox.The yellow color of the case is good when you want to grab this set in particular from the small tools box.I do love me my tools to get a small job done.
Cable is good. Shipping cost is way too high. Simply put.

I originally posted an initial opinion of the Health Detective, and soon deleted it, as I wanted to USE the detailed analysis worksheets on real people. This review, although the review date says March 18, 2015, my review here was posted today on October 22, 2015.Explanation, on why I feel this is the best book ever written for sick people; it is a rational, concise yet detailed and highly organized step by step analysis of all of your symptoms and possible causes that you have that defies doctors, and that leads to either the wrong diagnosis or no diagnosis at all and this leaves people suffering. It is a fast question system and by answering the questions fully, it will get you quickly to the goal of finding the true causes of your illness(es). The highly concise and organized steps of analysis of cause(s) found there in the worksheets will enable anyone for doing an easy and quick self-analysis of the symptoms they're having and helps tremendously in recognizing their cause(s) of their symptoms. It is the next best thing to empower anyone to do this self-sickness analysis on their own, other than finding a doctor who would agree to spend the necessary time in analyzing your symptoms and causes completely to find the correct diagnosis for you, as the patient. The doctors usually require the patient to voice only one complaint during any single visit and this leads to the patient having to pay for and go for multiple doctor office visits, and even then it might not give a correct diagnosis. Then, going to your doctor, with this information which is easily gained from this book's Health Detective worksheet analysis, can help the doctor in finding the right diagnosis and treatments or possibly medications to help you on the path in getting you well again.This Health Detective book tells you how to figure out the real reasons why you are sick or are not feeling well all the time! Other books, only drone on endlessly and tells you about diseases, symptoms and treatments! They never teach you how to quickly figure out for yourselves of THE REAL CAUSES of your specific illness(es). Some books have tried, but most books have failed too many people in finding out their causes of their disease. This is probably the most important book ever written for anyone who desperately wants to find out how to get well, and possibly stop taking pharmaceutical drugs that treat only symptoms. Those people who soon learn that those treatment drugs don’t often help their symptoms much and they continue to suffer from numerous troubling symptoms, but now are suffering with those common and often terrible side effects of the drugs themselves. Those side effects can be far worse than the disease and symptoms itself that the drugs are used to treat!If you truly want to get well, I would highly recommend buying and following the guides and doing the worksheets found this "Health Detective" book. I’m always the skeptical one in any group, as that skepticism is my true nature. I have had his book, and was given it freely nearly a year ago by the author for me to evaluate and possibly write a review. How could I write an honest review based only on what I read but did not put into practice? I simply could not. I knew these diagnostic processes already due to my background education of BSN nursing uni @ MSMU. I also know by experience that to tell a person simply why they were sick does not always work, in fact it rarely works, until the persons' themselves actively work through and DO the processes and think through for themselves the causes of why they are so sick, and now fearing becoming sicker. When the person is desperate and wants to be well, then they are more likely to change their thinking and habits and then will do what needs to be done to get themselves well. It is that process of thinking and getting a grip on reality and then decisions that allows people to overcome their habits or environments.I did this, for almost a year privately and individually with each of my 4 family members who were already in dis-eased states and suffering from pain or from the debilitating side effects of drugs they had been taking. There is not a person alive who will escape from the Human Condition, usually coming in the form of pain and agonizing body symptoms, often those people, nearly all of those people alive who never found the true causes of their troubling illnesses will likely be suffering excruciating pain each and every day for the rest of their lives. Daily living, and enjoying a vibrant life, yet suffering those symptoms of sicknesses simply doesn’t have to BE that way. I know personally of many people living in my town who are now in their mid-90s who are active and vibrant elders who are still independent and out in society still doing paid jobs or volunteering their time. In my curiosity of examining their lifestyles, I find out they are practicing truly healthful living and are quite rigorous in doing so. One man is a fit strong 95 year old who actively works a full time paid job! My family wants to be like those 90 somethings too!I do realize this turned out to be quite a long review but suffer with me through it as it might help you live the pain free and vibrant life you desire to live too. A life which my family members are now living, along with me. During the near year I’ve had this book and shared it several times weekly in the beginning weeks, for my 4 family members, there were many diseases in which I used this book’s teachings and the easy worksheets and guided questions (I printed out several copies) to help me guide my family members’ who were suffering bad and painful symptoms daily and some had already suffered for months and one had suffered for many years.Using the book’s worksheets caused each of them (4 members) to think through for themselves of the things that might be keeping them suffering with agonies of sicknesses, and over and over as time went on, I heard from each of my family members, “Okay, now I realize and I know what I have to do to get well.” It is so often that people find making healthy changes is difficult because they have a rigid routine in their lives that for them seems to be working, when the reality is it is not working at all, but it is keeping them sick and eventually they will likely become sicker and possibly disabled too.They are not suffering these days. They likely won't suffer ever again either. According to statistics from the World Health Organization, of the 58 million people that died worldwide in 2005, 35 million deaths were attributed to chronic disease. That puts the death toll for chronic disease, 60% of all deaths that year, at double the number of deaths from infectious diseases (including HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria), maternal and perinatal conditions, and nutritional deficiencies combined. The principal known causes of premature death from “chronic disease” are tobacco use, poor diet, physical inactivity, obesity and alcohol consumption." http://2001-2009.state.gov/g/oes/id/index.htmI would truly recommend buying the Health Detective first. This is a very good tea according to my tea tastebuds. I was gifted this tea to use and review. I LOVE a nice cup of warm tea in the evening during winter, since my beloved espresso is too much caffeine for the hour.I was impressed at the large saucer shaped disk of compressed tea. About 6"across and 1" thick. A good size amount, about 9 ounces/250 grams weight.Easy to chip off enough for a cup or a teapot full. I have never used this style of tea, compressed/dried into disk form.Has a good clean tea flavor, milder and less bitter than the typical Lipton style orange pekoe teas. It's hard to describe.I tried it without sweetening, it was fair, but I liked it better with a spoon of sugar. Brought out the flavor of the tea with a bit of sweetness and toned down the tea "bite".The packaging is a conversation starter, with the wrapping and Asian lettering/colors. Someone spent some time designing it. It also came in a very nice Asian designed corded handle bag, reusable. Could be used as a gift bag for a special gift if you want the tea yourself. I have to admit, I do have a thing for saving bags like this from other countries and have many. I use them as a purse quite often. Easier on the body than a heavy purse. Not likely to be purse snatched either. Be unconventional, it's fun.Organic Pu-ehr Puer Diet tea. I do not use it for a diet, so I cannot speak for it as a diet aid, but as is, tea. But, Huzzah to the queen! This tea has a heavier body than the Earl Grey tea the queen probably drinks.I do drink tea daily before 2 or 3pm because like all dark teas, it DOES have a diuretic effect and you don't want to be getting up to go when trying to sleep. I had read in the past, that the English people, drink afternoon tea to prevent water retention. Tea is probably way more healthy than a prescribed drug for a diuretic/water pill. I choose tea over a pill.I did get a little lift in energy before beginning evening chores. YAH, I liked that.I like this tea and have enjoyed a cup each evening for the past couple weeks. I would recommend trying this tea if you are a tea drinker.

Easy to use to get messy cables under control and neaten up the wire jumbles. I received this pack of 4 Neoprene Zippered captive cables, to try and then write my review. It's a good product, appears it will last a long time, quality constructed, zippered and easy to help organize the dreaded wire/cable mess behind TVs and PCs. I may have reviewed this before. Please, musical tastes are subjective so please don't downvote my review because you don't like the music. I do love it. Many of the songs I already play on harp, so it's very nice to listen to the songs played on Lute. Lute music was played in castles but by poor people. Much of the harp Early & Renaissance music of today has been taken from Lute music manuscripts.Relaxing.Pretty to the ears.Nice to listen to when doing sit down chores.Nice dinner movies when you have guests.Nice to listen to when doing research as no voice to distract. Takes some brain pain out of researching endlessly for quality sources.Has a nice insert, ENGLISH and FRENCH language, giving an abridged history of the Lute music.Nearly 68 minutes of music.Quality of the recording is very good.Paul O'Dette is the Lutenist on this recording. Francesco da Milano is a renowned Early Music Lutemist and is author of these songs and he was held in a very high esteem and was considered equal to music as Michaelangelo is to sculpting. Both were named as Il Divino, the Divine. Most of da Milano's music was not transcribed until after his death.A  bit of history: Music played on the Lute that was actually transcribed onto paper, is mostly found from the early 16th century, but prior to that century, Lute songs were passed down via memorization by many Lute pupils and were not transcribed, and those songs also go back centuries as well. During those times and during the Renaissance, noblemen and noblewomen hired court musicians to play for their entertainment at any hour of the day or night. Wealthy families hired musicians for many years, sometimes for life. They were given land and money and held in high esteem and also held a high status in Court. Music and court dance was a favorite pastime during times before today's technology and it's what people did during the Renaissance for company gatherings. Lutenists were often found playing their music during intimate evenings.Musically, the fact was they used dissonance to gather the attention of the court attendees.In my house, TV takes a backstage from music. This CD is that good. I listen to it often and don't seem to tire of it.

Please note the title of this is "Casual Lightweight Backpack."I was provided this Casual Lightweight backpack to use and review. I like it for MY uses, which may be lesser than others' needs. For daytime trips to Starbucks to carry along a few books and a tablet or two and a few snacks it is great.As the title says, "Casual Lightweight I have done over 14 years of college and my backpack for college averaged 38 to 43 lbs daily. This backpack, I do not recommend to the full time student who carries more than 10 or so lbs in the backpack.WHY BAG IS NOT FOR STUDENTS?The straps are only an inch wide and unpadded. They will not last for the serious full time student. I cannot see how they would ease pressure on shoulders. I've been a student 14.5 years, so I know.The bag is not constructed as a normal heavy duty book backpack, in reinforced sections to prevent hardback book corner blowouts from wearouts, but is a simple flat construction.Full time students NEED quick release closures. However, they do have typical handbag style magnetic snaps for quick release. A good thing but IMHO not reliable for heavy book bag but is a yes for a casual backpack.The lining, in my best sewing/fabric opinion, would not likely hold up to taking large hard books in and out of bag past a semester or two.OTHERWISE:The medium brown silky but stiff lining, has two pockets, one is open and wide, the other is wide and zippered. A good thing.It has a locker hang loop.Straps are adjustable.Two outer pockets are roomy and hold the usual items, cell, brush, small wallet, money, etc. I like the pockets.Construction. Although it is a heavy canvas, it is also well stitched. As a experienced sewing person, it appears as if it will last many years with getting light usage daily. The straps, appear to be made of a upholstery grade of pleather (plastic leather) in the color brown. A very dark brown.My opinion on the brown and black???  I was taught that they simply do not go together as colors. However, the brown is so dark, that it looks like a light black at first glance. So, not really an issue for me.HOWEVER, for others, who carry only a few things, this backpack is attractive and works nicely. The straps are not padded, nor are they wide enough to use it as a heavy carry pack. I will enjoy using it on my day trips, which does not mean carrying a backpack for approximately 2 to 3 hours a day all between classes etc.I can recommend this backpack for Casual use only. I like it. I will probably use it frequently.I really like it for myself. I do carry a couple smaller books and my laptop/tablets (depends what I'm needing) to Starbucks or other places to do my research and writing solely to get myself out of the house. This bag, is nice, very nice, because it goes with everything I wear, and  I enjoy carrying it. The pattern of the canvas is nice. Tribal looking. Sort of an African print.It does need to lose that new car smell. That took a few days. Typical odor of fabric and pleather.

Okay, I received this BlueTooth speaker from Brightech to use and review. Brightech knows I am an electronics and music junky and they know I love Bluetooth speakers too. I play an instrument and I have a LOT of music playing devices and I am VERY picky about music sound quality. This BT speaker passes my I LOVE IT tests. I listen to music at all hours of the day and night. I am a very busy and high energy person and music feeds that quality in me. This speaker is a very nice addition to my bag of listening toys.The front of the speaker is metal with tiny holes in it. Using a bright flashlight, I can see TWO 1 3/4" speakers and the cones. It does give stereo sounding music.SOUND: Excellent bass, trebles and highs. I measured the bass using a Spectrum Analyzer and microphone. Bass was clear and deep at 248 Hertz. The high soprano, to measure quality, I used Celine Dion (she has very high voice) and also Monseurrat Caballe (soprano opera) and Freddy Mercury Barcelona album, my all time favorite album. Caballe sings high soprano and no loss of the highs on this great speaker! I also tested playing a few classical pieces that are noted to cover the music spectrum from the highest (Flower Duet) to the lowest frequencies (Yo Yo Ma cellist). It was ALL good and I use this speaker at my bedside the most.DISTORTION: Little to none. However, all speakers when overdriven will distort. That is normal, but this speaker handles high volume with little distortion. I've only turned it down a couple times for a small bit of distortion.Pairing was sooo easy for all my Bluetooth devices that have music on them: Galaxy S4, Droid 4, Galaxy S5, iPhone 6,  Kindle Fire, Verizon tablet, iPad, iPod 160GB Classic (Kokkio Bluetooth adapter for iPod). The NFC, or, Near Field Connection is said to work well for one button pairing, but I have a few NFC Bluetooth devices such as tablets and my phone, which has 7 different BT speaker devices paired with. This is nice, I just touch the NFC Bluetooth symbol and it pairs, not having to go into my phone menu's BT devices.All I do for first time pairing, is do a scan on my device, and then push pair Bluetooth icon on the speaker. They pair easily. I had no issues with pairing as I had with my Kinovo speaker which is similar BT speaker as this one, but this one is far more rugged and easier grip for outdoor and on the go use than the Kinovo (I reviewed the Kinovo I purchased and I like it too)It is of very sturdy construction, surrounded in a non-slip rubberized material and perfect for on the go use. Small enough to stuff in a purse or backpack, but large enough to put out some pretty loud and high quality sound. \It looks nice sitting on my side table or bedside table.It has a 3.5mm jack to manually connect a non BlueTooth device for sound, CD player maybe? I still have 3.It has a USB jack @5V 1 Amp to charge other devices, and can be used as a 1800 mAh storage battery bank also, to charge other devices such as a phone or iPod, etc.  It does not work for hands free phone calls. Music stops and phone takes over. Overall volume is controlled by the device you are using.Speaker does work while it is charging. You can also charge your playback device with it while it is paired.Hours of play, at high volume, I got about 6 to 7 hours of play time.The speaker volume is controlled by the music play device loudness control on the device and also by the plus and minus symbols on the speaker itself.The controls are molded into the thick rubber rugged coating that surrounds the speakers, they are indented so they will not wear down. The Bluetooth connect symbol, and >>| which forwards to the next song and then |<<  which goes back one song.The controls are somewhat hard to see if you have eye issues. They are not raised. But I wanted to SEE them. I did take silver tole paint, and a small brush and painted down into the control depressions with the silver paint. Now is very nice and easy to see. You could also use White Out and a brush, but it dries fast so you have to work fast. I have a habit of using White Out on certain common hard to see buttons of my electronics devices in my stereo/tv/SS systems for the On/Off and Play buttons. That works and no flashlight needed. A simple fix for a common problem.It uses a common smartphone charge USB cable to micro hdmi jack, and I use the Galaxy S4 auto charger in my van to charge this speaker. I use any 5Volt charger to micro hdmi that I have and all charge speaker well. I also charged it with my Anker 13K mAh auxilary backup battery.It has an On/Off switch, and the 3.5mm auxilary jack.The light is red when charging, and goes off when charge is complete, and is when I remove from charger. Takes about 3 hours to full charge from a dead battery state.POWER= 3W + 3W @ 4 Ohms Impedence.There is a light on the front of the speaker which tells the battery level. Blue is fully charged. White, means charge soon.I won't go into the size details since every other review and the product description already gives that information, but it is as it looks in the picture and fits in the hand. It is a good sized speaker and robustly built. It weighs 15 1/2 Oz, or, 442 grams. It has a 3 year Brightech warranty. It does have 2 speakers in it, just as my Kinovo does. The sound is actually better and louder than the Kinovo, and without distortion. (I like this speaker better than the Kinovo I paid for)I do recommend this Bluetooth Speaker because of it's quality of sound and durability of construction. I love this speaker! Brightech offers a 3 year warranty on all their products which for me says a lot about how they believe in the quality of their products. LIKE ALL of my reviews, if any item malfunctions, I always update my reviews. IF there is no update, then you know that the item is continuing to function as it should.

This is SO cute, was my first thought when I opened the package. I received this 3x3" cube BlueTooth speaker to use and review from Brightech. It has a 3 year Brightech warranty. You seldom see more than a year warranty for anything these days. For that, and my experience using this speaker, I would definitely recommend it. I have read many other reviews and a couple reviewers had contacted Brightech and their complaints were satisfied promptly. (Customer Service for my Sony products and other name brand products these days seem to be non-existent.)I have purchased several other BT speakers in the past, and also reviewed those purchases. One I purchased is a nice Kinovo BT speaker. I thought it was a 5 star too. So I am comparing this to that. BUT,THIS little ruggedly made BT speaker has a amazing sound that will fill a room considering it is 5 Watts and gives my Kinovo a run for the more money I paid for it. This is a tight well manufactured speaker and is said to be waterproof. I wouldn't be dunking it underwater though.It is loud enough that I did not hear my DH talking to me from my door and sound is without distortion either. I am sooo very horribly bothered by distortion of music via speakers. ALL speakers with enough power input coming from play device WILL overdrive any speaker. We try not to.This speaker, the volume is adjusted by the playback device, phone, kindle or mp3 player.It has a rubber outer shell that is easy to grip. There are 3 symbols, a + to advance to next song, a - to go back a song, and PLAY which simply pairs the speaker to whatever device chosen.Very good sound overall with no distortion. I LOVE good speakers! I love this little but powerful speaker!The bass response for it's size is very good, and I placed the booming speaker onto my chest as it was playing the drum solo on the Metallica CD track "The Thing That Should Not Be" and I could feel a nice thump within my chest for such a little speaker. It's a 5 Watts speaker, not 200 !!I did run the different music selection's sound output through an external microphone to the input of my spectrum analyzer, and I was able to see that the range of frequencies generated by this speaker met my expectations well for all music I played. I played Celine Dion for very high frequency (not my favorite shrill voice) and Tribal music for bass notes as low as 258 Hz. Metallica Chill Out sounds lovely too and has all ranges of frequencies.Good treble voice range is good for podcast listening too. Using Player.FM, I listened to several of my favorite podcasts. Nice.It pairs just so easy, just push the PLAY word on the outer case, paired just like that! I have paired it just as easily with my Kindle Fire, Galaxy S4 and my HP Elite PC laptop, just by sitting the speaker nearby and turning off other BT listening devices (my LG headset, other speakers). (My Kinovo is a absolute pain to pair!)I have used it for about 16 hours total, and it does perform well.It has a heavy duty wrist lanyard, easy to remove if not needed. It is red, as is the speaker cover.Speaker cover is metal and is coated with a gloss red coating/paint. Whatever it is, it would likely not scratch easily with the usual use.I am a music NUT-JUNKY, and if it does not sound GOOD then I will NOT like it, not even a little bit. I am also a harpist/musician, so I am picky-er with music than others may be. I use BOSE 200 Watt pair of computer speakers just for quality iTunes listening since my job is at home on my PC. Music is important to me.I also used a 3.5mm jack and attached it to DH computer. He liked it a lot too and wanted to keep it. It was an argument to get it back so I could finish using it for review purposes. I'm keeping it for myself~~for now at least.As I sit here and write, I decided to carry the speaker itself across my house, about 65 feet, into the kitchen to weigh it on my +/- 0.1 gram scale. It did NOT lose signal with my Galaxy S4 Googly Play app. I weighed it in at average of 252 grams. It did oscillate between 248 and 256 grams to the beat of the bass notes of the Metallica song, and LOL and surprisingly, I did not know bass notes would affect my gram scale, but it did. That was an interesting discovery, in that I'd never weighed music before! Well, I was playing Metallica, HEAVY metal! Duh!I don't feel at all like I am going out on a limb and saying YES I DO recommend this great little but powerful speaker. I do recommend this speaker especially for on the go functions, campouts, pic-nics. I also travel around and play with HAM radio, and sleep in my maxi-van, so I can see this as a nice small addition to my van-bed-side table. It has a nice echo inside my van too.Finishing up by listening to Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata. Soooo nice! And, like ALL of my reviews, if you do not see an update then you can be assured that any product I review, especially electronics, that they are continuing to operate as expected. If my views change on any review, I DO update ALL of my reviews when necessary.

I received this bathroom scale to use and review. I used it 2x daily for a bit over 2 months, morning and night. I found that it is a fairly accurate scale for body weight. ALL scales will vary a few tenths of a pound on each repeated weighing of a person, and whether this will bother a person will depend on the level of accuracy which they agree to pay for. That is not a deal breaker. It is relatively accurate for anyone who wishes to keep tabs on their weight and do not obsess over the minor reading differences. My old scale, would vary as much as 5 or 6 pounds from each weighing, not good.In the 2 months I've used it it has been reliableA nice uncluttered low profile designUltra modern detail for design, great for the minimalist people who like a clean uncluttered look.Unobtrusive footprint in the powder room.Glass plate to stand on and black upper and lower edges.Large digital readout even for those of us who cannot see the numbers on the typical analog scaleReads in tenths of a pound.Overall, if a good general scale of this style/design is what you are looking for, then consider this scale. I can recommend this scale. Like ALL my reviews, if a product stops working properly, I always update my reviews. No update, means the product continues to work as it should.

I've used this same remanufactured ink on my Epson XP-310 inkjet printer since I purchased it about a year ago. It continues to work as well as the cartridges that came with my printer. I have purchased this ink for my other printer, and Epson Stylus 835 for a couple years but now use a large volume tank system. I print a LOT because I have a small business that relies on very colorful copy/labels. I cannot agree to afford the Epson brand ink when this brand just works--great.Does print nice photographs. I cannot tell the difference in print quality from my 3 printers, one of which is an Epson 5530 that does use Epson brand ink. I printed out the same colorful photo on all 3 printers...No differences. I am not a professional photographer but I know a good photo when I see one.

It works very good. DOES come with HDMI cable and nothing else is needed except 2 AA batteries for the remote. Does NOT come with batteries. Out of the box and using within 10 minutes. I have a Roku, so I have no intentions of using a cable to my wifi modem for internet streaming of either Netflix or Prime shows. So I cannot speak for that function. This Blu-Ray player is a "Factory Refurbished" product. Normally I would purchase new. But for the price, and for my uses, it is perfect.I'd never watched a Blu-Ray dvd. It is just as awesome of a picture as they say it is. It almost appears like 3D. Vivid color on my 70" HDTV.The remote does everything you'd expect a dvd player's remote to do, including eject a disc. I was also able to use the remote to adjust the picture colors, as there was too much reds in my picture, which is not an issue for my TV itself.I have used it to play CDs and my recorded mp3 discs for music playback using my surround sound system. Great!I've had no issues with this unit and I am quite happy with it. Like with all electronics or any other product I've reviewed, if the product breaks or stops working correctly, I will always edit and update my reviews. IF there is no update then you can expect that the product is working as I stated in my review.

Great cutters for small things, component leads, wire snipping etc.Springs open nicely after cutting.They do not grip and hold what you cut. Some do, this does NOT.The stand off and 21 deg angle jaw is just enough to allow getting cutter blades down deeper into a circuit to snip a lead/wire close to board and in fact it can cut nearly flat to the board unless jammed with components.Good for removing a jumper wire or block MLCC caps when modding a circuit, or general rework.Very sharp and blades match up well and gives a clean smooth cut.I like the comfortable molded handles and they have a bit of a tacky grip, but not sticky feeling.I also like the finger stop design of the grips to prevent your fingers slipping down onto the cutting area.Just a nicely designed cutters.A useful addition to any electronics tool cabinet. Proper care, proper usage should keep these cutters in good shape. Don't go trying to cut larger than rated for 16 ga wires etc. Using it for what it is intended, cutting smaller things. I use a piece of beryllium microcircuit substrate board to sharpen blades on small cutting tools like these. No tool stays sharp forever, and maintenance is key to prolonging any tool's life. A little drop of machine oil every now and then on the pivot mate surfaces should keep these working smoothly for many years.

Small. Works great. Like having the weather channel. Does charge a phone enough to use it. Must turn crank slow to prevent burning out the brushes. AM and FM comes in nicely. NO it's not a stereo, but it gets the job done and done well. The flashlight is great too. I charge this about every two weeks as a safety measure so it's there when we need it for power failures or other emergencies.I also take it with us on camping trips and for other travels. The solar charger works to charge it enough for short periods of use to listen to radio, or give enough charge to a cell phone for limited use time. Then recharge by crank or solar if you have sun. For it's use as an emergency radio/flashlight/charger/AM*FM/weather uses it does the job.I can recommend it for the functions it has, price is reasonable. As with all things, if the product becomes defective in any way, I always UPDATE my reviews.

Amazing harp music. I do NOT know these harpists personally! Not affiliated in any way either. Please listen to samples of their song tracks. Music likes/taste IS subjective, please don't diss my review because I love ALL music, but especially harp music...I bought both their CDs, this, and Harp Attack. A fine purchase too. Will be excellent entertainment for many years to come. Amazingly talented and beautiful twin harpists, a joy to watch them play. As a duet, they play together, harmonizing, just so flawlessly! I've played harp 28 years, and I cannot hear a wrong note or a missed beat anywhere, not even one missed beat and I've listened hard for that. It makes me think they got perfect little stopwatches or timers in both their little heads.I Love all the tunes, many brought back memories of when they first came out on the big screen movies' theme songs. And also the newer songs, like the Game of Thrones theme song, are just so well written and done. I know they have studied music and practiced very hard for many years. It takes much work to get where they are. I do hope they become very successful, and in doing that, introduce even more people to the wondrous harp music. <3 <3If you haven't seen these two ladies play, their videos are amazing and entertaining and can be quickly found on YouTube by searching Camille and Kennerly.  64 videos that they have on their YT channel. The husband likes watching them perform on the videos. Many of the sites in which they have chosen for performance are both unique and gorgeous. I recommend viewing their videos, and I got the husband hooked on C&K by showing him the Disturbia rendition of Rihanna's song.If and when they produce a DVD of their videos, I'm going to buy it asap.

I've used this Ipow seller provided sample phone mount in my miniMH for a month daily for phone and GPS. The suction pad sticks very well to my windshield. It holds securely and has not popped off even once. The suction pad is a bit larger than most suction bases of other holders and I think that's why it holds better. A good thing. My Garmin suction pad could not hold the GPS Nuvi without popping off the windshield but this phone mount does work well, very well. The claw is said to fit up to 6"device and fits well and securely holds my Galaxy S4 and S5 and Garmin 5" Nuvi without wobble or slipping out of claw since it does have a rubber gripping surface on the claws.I plan on using it for my GPS unit and phone for music. Using a good Bluetooth headset you really don't need a holder like this for phone that is voice activated for phone calls, unless you're using phone frequently for playing pre-downloaded music such as Google Play library which you would need phone mounted for ease of music selection. My phone is like an iPod for me.Like all suction mounts, you need to keep the surface of sticky suction pad as well as your windshield clean so it will stick good.One thing I like is that I can mount this very high on windshield and have my devices at eye level. No looking away from the road. I always pull my van over if I have to mess with a device. It's just not worth an accident caused by distraction. Safety for all.Cons: None really, but I wish it came with a slick plastic Dash Disk for mounting onto dashboard. My dashboard on my Dodge MiniMH won't allow any type of suction pads to work and since I travel a LOT I use this daily.. :o(The arm IS FIRM but can be moved easily but I suggest moving it into the general position you want it in before attaching to windshield since trying to make a major adjustment will likely cause the suction to break loose easily.OVERALL, I really like it. I've never had one that worked, so we'll have to see how this one works long term. I always update my reviews, no update means product continues to work well.

Love these for on the go Cruzing 16 GB storage USB thumb drives. SanDisk is one of my favorite brands for all flash drives all sizes/styles and has never let me down. I like that the USB retracts.The red thumb slide area lights up when plugged into PC.I like SanDisk brands, they cost a little more, but IMHO, it is worth it to keep your data secure.I do recommend this product. And like all things I review, especially electrical or electronic, if it has any functional issues or my review changes, I will FIND my review and update. If no update, then it continues to function as it should.

Pretty nifty flashlight.Attractive classy design with some very nice features.Uses only 14500 batteries. NOT AA batteries.About 4 inches long and 1 inch outer diameter.Has orange on off push button with a rubbery surface.Very good grip, not slippery in the least.Machined surfaces and threads. Well machined.Nice bright flashlight. It is a good purchase.IT does have a light focus function which is unusual for the less expensive lights, by pulling out the end section, also feels as if it has some sort of a rubber O-ring inside that section to allow the focus to remain in place where you want it to stay.At 5 feet from wall, with end section pulled out, it will focus light into a 1 foot square pattern very bright with light rings around it like planet saturn, very good for catching sneaking snakes trying to escape.At the same distance, you can slide up the end section back up and light up about a 8 foot circle of bright light.Silvery hard aluminum knurled dull and shiny surfaces firm grip surface, appears sturdy, well made, and not too easily scratched up.Fits in palm nicely.Small enough for pocket or purse and only weighs a few ounces.Stands nicely, does not tip over easily if table moves a bit.It doesn't take up a lot of room so I can keep it at the ready on my bedside table for nighttime excursions through my darkened house since I have poor night time vision but my cats meow all the way as they help guide me to their food dish near my sink....Very bright. Seems to be made fairly tough.Has a belt clip that holds well on even thicker belts. I can see myself clipping it on my jammie bottoms when out camping. DH likes it too, we're going to either fight over it, or buy another one for him.One thing, which is not a deal breaker, is that you must get a feel for putting the end cap on over the battery because it is a bit fumbly at first. Push the lid all the way in and then back turn it til you feel the click, then tighten the cap down. That will prevent stripping the threads.I do recommend this small $10.00 flashlight, it does use 14500 batteries. NOT AA batteries.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:A window vacuum squeegee, seriously?  How could this be any better than Windex and paper towels, or better than a squeegee and a sponge?  Well, I didn't know I needed this until I tried it.It's just a blend of two tools, a rubber squeegee and a 'Dustbuster' type handheld vacuum.  They supply a microfiber cloth that fits on a holder.  I filled a bucket with some warm water and an ounce of dish detergent.  The cloth did tend to drip on the floor and window sill unless I squeezed it out before each use.  But it scrubbed the window nicely and picked up a lot of dirt I didn't know was on there.  Then the vacuum squeegee did its magic.  Just one swipe from top to bottom leaves the window sparkling clean, dry and streak-free.  There is no puddle of dirty water at the bottom to wipe up.  And the cool thing is if there's something in the way at the bottom (like the sill), you can squeegee from bottom to top with no drips or streaks - try that with a regular squeegee. They also supply an extension tube for higher windows (the tube makes it about 3' long, but top-heavy), which you can fill with a cleaning solution and use the built-in pump sprayer or attach the fiber cloth with it's own regular squeegee, or the vacuum unit.As I was testing on several windows, I thought of a bunch of other things I could clean with it.  So I cleaned the glass front of our oven, the bathroom mirror, then went outside and cleaned all the car windows!  I have to say though that the car windows were more of a challenge because the glass is curved.  But I still got them clean with a few more passes.  I can think of other things I could clean with this tool -- stone countertops, glass table tops, stainless steel appliances... anything flat and smooth.  Cool!Just a couple drawbacks... the water tank, motor and robber squeegee are all one unit.  This can get heavy if you have a lot of windows to clean.  Also, it's kind of bulky to try to maneuver on smaller areas.  It would be cool to have the squeegee part detachable with a hose down to the vacuum unit.  But other than that, if you like clean, streak free surfaces, try this!

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:There seem to be two different camp showers on Amazon.  There is the cheaper Coleman, Coghlans, Seattle Sports and Viking, and the more expensive Ivation, VN and Advanced Elements.  There are many complains on the cheaper ones about split seams and leaks, so don't buy those.  This Ivation one seems pretty rugged and sturdy.  I filled it up and it weighs roughly 40 lbs when full.  The water stream lasts for about 5 minutes if you leave the spray head open.  I liked the screw-on fill cap and the pockets for shampoo.A couple improvements would be a better hose -- the vinyl one kinked in shipping and restricts the water flow.  The spray head puts out enough water, but leaks around the threads when open and water is flowing.  Other than that, it seems like a durable and functional shower which holds enough water for a decent length shower.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:This is a study, aluminum headlight/flashlight and taillight combo.  The headlight is basically an LED flashlight that fits into a handlebar mount.  The headlight beam can be focused for a brighter/narrower or dimmer/wider light.  It does illuminate the road pretty well about 10-15' ahead.  The tail light is small, bright and visible from a good distance.  Both lights have four settings -- off, slow flash, fast flash and steady on.The battery in the headlight is a 3.7v rechargeable, and they supply a wall-charger for it.  The tail light uses two standard 2032CR button batteries.  There are spare batteries included for both the headlight and tail light.  You can also substitute 3 AAA batteries for the rechargeable with an included adapter.My tail light was defective and I wrote to the company -- they immediately sent me two replacement tail lights, so I recommend their customer service.  This set is one of several Chinese bike light sets you can find here on Amazon.  Most are very similar with an LED headlight with 'projector' type lens and the small red tail light.  One set I found has a USB-rechargeable battery instead of the wall charger in this set.  Others offer 2 tail lights.  I would shop around for the best bargain you can find.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I like peelers that are inline with the handle.  There are some that have the blades at 90 degrees to the handle, but I find those harder to use.  This peeler is comfortable to hold with a rubber insert on the handle.  It feels solid in the hand and has some weight to it which I think makes it easier to maneuver.  The blades are sharp and it works well for me.  This peeler has no hook or tool to remove the eyes of potatoes.  But it's simple and efficient - what's not to like?

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:These bulbs are a replacement for the 3157 and related types with a similar base (3057, 3156, 3056, etc).  The numbers with the 1 as the second digit are for brake lights that have two brightness levels.  The 0 in the second digit is for single brightness like running lights and turn signals.  This bulb will work for both.The light it gives off is a bluish tint, probably around 4500K, which will make your brake lights look more purple than with standard incandescent bulbs.  It appears to work fine in my car without an inline resistor.Unfortunately, my Highlander takes a 7443 bulb for brakes, backup and turn signals.  So while this bulb does go into the socket, the base it thinner and it wiggles around too much, so I can't use it.  Bummer, because I think it's brighter, cooler and uses less energy than the incandescent 7443.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I have always used a windshield-mount suction cup for my GPS and phone.  But it's a pain to reach the phone when it's on the windshield.  Dash-mounts require you to stick something permanent to the dash - no thanks.  So this air vent mount is a welcome change.What I like about this mount is that it clips easily and quickly with a spring onto the vent blade.  It was easier to attach than another air vent mount I tried, the Getron Multi-Angle Universal Cell Phone Air Vent Car Mount (Black).  I also liked the spring-loaded gripping arms, making it easy to mount and remove the phone.  But...There is no 'bottom' on this mount, so the phone could shake loose and drop down through it.  The mount itself was 'loose' on the vent and it swivels around with no ratchets or detent to keep it from turning.  The ball mount works OK and it does tighten down with a screw ring, but the whole mount still swivels freely, which makes it hard to swipe and push the phone while it's mounted unless you hold it with your other hand.If I had a choice, I would go with the Getron mount above.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I have always used a windshield-mount suction cup for my GPS and phone.  But it's a pain to reach the phone when it's on the windshield.  Dash-mounts require you to stick something permanent to the dash - no thanks.  So this air vent mount is a welcome change.What I really like about this mount is that it clips securely with a spring onto the vent blade - in fact it was somewhat difficult to get it attached.  But once attached, it really holds tight.  The whole mount will rotate 360 degrees but with a click every 30 degrees or so, so it doesn't swivel when you're trying to use it.  Also, the mount is on a ball swivel that you can lock in place with a plastic screw ring.  So this mount is steady and versatile.  The arms that hold the phone also ratchet inward, so you place the phone on the lip at the bottom and then push the sides in until snug.  There is a button on the side to release the ratchet and pull them apart to get the phone out.The only thing I might have wanted different is if the arms were spring-loaded instead of ratchet.  I think that might be a little more secure and easier to get the phone in and out.  Otherwise, it's sturdy and good quality.

I received this item to test and review. This is my opinion:I have reviewed a similar bulb, the Brite Innovations Energy Saving 7-Watt LED Filament Light Bulb Soft White 2700K - Exact Equivalent Replacement to Standard Incandescent A19 60W Classic Bulb This bulb also has a very nice, warm light. It's pretty close in color and brightness to a standard 60w incandescent bulb.  This bulb has 6 'filaments' in it, whereas the other one has 8, but I don't see a major difference in the light output perhaps just a bit less bright.The bulb is not dimmable, and it would be nice to have choices of a frosted or opaque glass so you don't see the filaments. But I think this is a great bulb with no warm-up time, longer life and does not dim as it ages like a CFL bulb.  I think a good use for this will be in 'rough' applications like a garage door opener, since the filaments seem pretty sturdy and will not vibrate and break like an incandescent bulb.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I attached a few pictures of how I fit the headset into my helmet.  The speakers have Velcro and come with a sticky patch that you are supposed to stick to the inside of your helmet to attach them to.  But just the Velcro on the speakers was enough to stick to the padding in my helmet, so I didn't need the sticky pad.  The fit is actually very nice... you can see that I routed the wiring behind the pads, so the speakers are microphone are in the right spot and are not intrusive.  The Bluetooth 2.1 receiver fits onto the outside shell of the helmet as shown, and you can remove it from its mount easily to charge or stow it.  The mount itself is just a clip which can be removed with a Phillips screwdriver as well.  The receiver has a knob that is simple to operate for both volume and changing modes from intercom to music player to FM radio.  I don't have a problem operating it with the helmet on.  If you can get your device to work hands-free to send/receive calls, play music or use the intercom, then this setup is ideal.Now, there are other well-known Bluetooth communicators out there, notably by Sena, Interphone, and U-Clear.  These generally are in the $150-$300 range.  Some have their own phone app to configure them, can intercom with multiple people daisy-chained up to 4 miles away, have auto-connect, and are waterproof.  This Chinese model has none of that (I don't see anything in the manual about being waterproof, just "water resistant"); but with an 800m range, 300 hrs standby and 10 hrs talk time it is hard to beat in a $45 package.The only complaint I have is that the sound quality is just so-so.  For voice it's fine, but for music it is just OK... no better than the cheap earphones you might get free with your phone.  Be careful with the volume because it can get too loud if both your player and the Bluetooth receiver are at full volume.  And make sure it's not too loud while riding so that it drowns out noises that you need to hear on the road.

I already have and use the Case Logic DCB-304 Compact System/Hybrid Camera Case (Black) for my Lumix FZ200 super zoom camera.  I tried this DSH-101 model because it mentioned "High Zoom" in the description.  So I took everything out of my DCB-304 case and tried to fit it into the DSH-101 case.  That includes the camera itself, a lens shade (detached and upside down on the bottom), a polarizing filter w/case, a cleaning cloth, and the Lumix battery wall-charger with extra battery.  Everything fit... except the wall charger!  I could not find a place in this case where I could comfortably fit the charger without cramming.  So if this case had just one more pocket it would be perfect.I like the DCB-304 because it has two zippered outside pockets where I store the battery and charger on one side and the polarizing filter on the other.  The one thing the 101 comes with that the 304 does not is a rain bonnet to slip over the case; which would be a nice accessory to have.

I received this item to test and review. This is my opinion:These are LED replacement bulbs for the standard 12v incandescent 1156 and 1003 bulb, usually found in automotive applications.  This LED bulb should fit in any fixture that will fit the standard bulbs, and put out more light for less energy as well.The only issue I has is the color of the light.  It's about 4000-4500K in color, which has a blueish tint.  I have attached a picture of the bulbs on for comparison: on the left is a larger 1156 LED bulb I have with about 3500K light, and on the right is a standard incandescent 1156 bulb.  I also attached a picture of them unlit for size comparison.

I plugged in the power strip and all of the 6 outlets worked and the Surge and Ground lights came on as they should.  It's basically a power strip that has an added cable connector to help protect your TV or cable box from power surges.  A power surge is not the same as a lightning strike, which this will not have any protection from.  Surges are usually caused locally by your fridge or A/C switching on and off, and remotely if there is a power disruption like a transformer or power line down.  Power surges are common and frequent, but are almost always non-damaging.  A surge protector may protect your equipment from that rare time when conditions are right and the surge is excessive.This Woods power strip has several caveats in its instructions that are somewhat bothersome.  One is that its surge protection eventually wears out and it becomes just an unprotected power strip.  They say in the enclosed sheet to replace it every 2-3 years.  Really?  Who is going to do that?  Apparently the "Surge" LED will go out when this happens and that's when you are supposed to replace it.  I have not heard of that before-- is it just a way for them to sell you a new power strip every 2-3 years?The right-angle plug is OK for when you want to move something close to the wall, but it does cover up whatever is below it -- so if you plug it into the top socket, the bottom socket will be unusable.  The outlets on the strip are pretty close together, so a 'wall wart' transformer plug will block at least two outlets.  And there are no 'always on' outlets in the strip so when you switch the strip off, all 6 of the outlets are off.  There is a cover on each outlet that you can slide over to cover the two slots (no need to cover the ground hole).

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:The construction of this light is very solid.  The solid magnetic base is heavy enough to offset the 24" gooseneck light so that it doesn't fall over.  The magnets are strong and will hold the light upright and even extended out fully from a flat surface and up to about a 45 degree angle.  The light is bright and a bit on the bluish side of the spectrum as you can see in the pictures.  The orange light in the background is actually a normal tungsten bulb, so the camera has reduced the blue in the picture to make the BBQ light look more "white".You can see the light attached both with the magnets on the right side and with the clamp on the left.  One problem I ran into was that with the long neck of the light, you have to bend the light away from the grill to be able to close and open the cover.  The best place on my grill to mount it was simply with the magnets on the right side.  I tried mounting to the grill cover handle, but it was just too awkward when opening and closing the cover with the 24" light whipping around.The light color makes the items on the grill look pale, so it's not easy to see how "done" it is just by sight.  I would prefer a more tungsten, or at least closer to about 4500K, colored light when looking at food.That said, this light is probably more useful around the house than on the BBQ.  I agree with another reviewer that it makes a good work light in the garage or workshop.  It could also be clamped to a desk for direct lighting in your craft or other workspace.  I did review another BBQ light which is OK -- I like how it attaches though:  HOMEAN Super Bright 10 LED BBQ Grill Light

BLU is not a household word in the phone industry, but they have been putting out some good offerings lately.  One problem they have had in the past is outdated software.  But this new (as of August 2015) Studio C Super Camera comes with the latest Android 5.0 Lollipop, which appears to be pretty close to stock.  There is very little bloatware, just a couple BLU apps for their manual and service information, which you can't delete, and a few Amazon apps.  The processor is still the MediaTek MT6582 Quad core, same as other Studio C models.The phone itself has a decent 5" 720p screen that is 294ppi, which is a marked improvement over their Studio C models last year, and is viewable from almost any angle.  It will take up to 2 micro-SIM cards for two different networks and/or two different phone numbers, but you can still use only one if that's all you need.  If you already have a standard SIM, you can cut it down to fit.  There is a micro-SD slot for up to 64GB of memory you can add, which would help its internal 1GB ROM and 8GB RAM capacity.  It will work on 2G and 3G AT&T or T-Mobile networks -- but it does not allow 4G or LTE.  It also does not include NFC, but that's understandable with an inexpensive phone.  The Li-Ion 2800 mAh battery supposedly supplies up to 35 hours of talk time, which I find hard to believe given its smaller capacity from the 3000 mAh battery in other Studio C models.  I would plan on maybe 12-15 hrs.  You can use the phone as a WiFi hotspot.So this offering by BLU is the "Super Camera" model, which suggests that its camera is better than other Studio C models have had.  The rear camera is a 8MP with Sony IMX 179 sensor, 2448 x 3264 pixels.  The front selfie camera is an upgraded 5MP with Largan Lens.  Largan is a Taiwanese company that manufactures plastic aspherical lenses - I assume this is an upgraded lens from previous models, but the difference is likely minimal.  I compared pictures from the 8MP lens with my Lumix superzoom camera and the BLU was impressive in daylight shots.  There is some fisheye effect with the (assumed) 35mm focal length, but the photos are clear and crisp.  Video is 1080p at 30fps in daylight.  I took the phone to a Steve Miller Band concert and pushed limits of the the video by filming at night at the stage and trying to zoom in to the maximum 4.0x zoom.  It had a hard time focusing and the zoom is stepped and not smooth.  That's not surprising for a cell phone camera - I filmed the same scene with my Lumix and it handled the scene much better.  But otherwise, video and pictures are very good for a phone camera.One last note -- I got this phone to see if it was possible to go completely WiFi with the phone and bypass the monthly bill for voice and data plans.  Since I work from home and when I travel, there seems to always be WiFi available somewhere, I thought this might be a viable idea.  Of course, you would still need a plan to use 2G/3G network when WiFi is not available, but I have no Sim card in the phone yet and it's working great -- I got a Google Voice number for free, then got the Google Hangouts Dialer app.  I set up the app to use my Google Voice number and voila -- free phone and data when connected to WiFi.  As a backup or basic phone, this is a good option for me and saves a boatload of money.

This item is basically a P2P video cam that has an added laser pointer that you can control remotely.  I had no trouble installing the PetCube app on Android 5.0, connecting the PetCube to my network via WiFi and connecting to the PetCube from the phone.  I am able to hear and speak through the cube and also control the pointer.  There is some delay in moving the pointer from when you swipe the screen to when the laser moves, but that's just normal network lag.I contacted PetCube about having streaming video running all the time even when you are not connected to the camera with their app and even if you don't share the video.  They assured me that the video is encrypted, and that they own the servers where the video is hosted.  I was just concerned about security and who can see the video, and especially if it can be hacked.  I would still just turn it off when not in use.You can of course use any remote video camera to watch your pets while away, but I think this one is the only one with a laser pointer on it.  The PetCube app allows you to "Explore" other live video that people have chosen to share.  It was fun to connect to a couple cat shelters and move the laser around the room -- too bad the cats are pretty bored with it.  I'm sure they get more laser play opportunities than they want.  :-)  All of the remote cameras had disabled sound, so you can't speak to or hear them, which is understandable considering what some people might say.There is also a still photo sharing page in the app, which it appears is not only for PetCube photos, as I saw many photos of pets outside, at the park, at the beach, etc.  But you can 'Like' and share others photos, as well as post and share your own.  I wonder if anyone is monitoring the photo sharing just to keep it on topic.  It's a fun idea and one that was funded by Kickstarter, so more power to the inventors and investors!  :-)

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:First, the light color on this is very blue/purple.  It does not look "white" to me, even when compared with other LED lights.  We took it on a camping trip with us to see if it might come in handy for the camp site.  There is one mounting hole at the top, so I nailed it to a tree about 3 feet up from the ground.  There is a tiny hole and they provide a pin to push into the hole and turn it on.  Once on, it will only light up at night and when something triggers it.  Then it shuts off in about 30 seconds.It was somewhat useful while camping, to provide light if walking to the bathrooms or whatever.  The next day we camped it was cloudy and we were under some trees, so it didn't get a full charge and only worked for about 1/2 hour the next night.  It really needs to be in full sunlight to recharge fully.  Other than the awful color though, it worked well and I think will be useful in the future.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:This solar LED light worked OK for me.  I took it camping with us, thinking it might be a nice night-light for the camp site.  The battery was charged when I received it, and it worked the first night for about 6 hours.  The next day was cloudy and we were under some trees, so it did not charge fully and only worked about a half hour after dark.There is an on/off switch that you have to use a pin or small wire to poke through a hole.  I would just leave it on so it just goes on at dark and off at dawn.  The mount for this is pretty flimsy though.  It's two aluminum rods that thread together and then thread into a small bracket that you can screw into a wall or post with the screws provided.  But if you grab or happen to hit the light somehow, I am sure the aluminum would bend or the plastic light housing would break off.
