It really must be mounted in a place that is out of the way and unlikely to be handled or hit.  And of course it must be mounted somewhere that the sun can hit it for most of the day to charge the battery.  So I think its uses are limited mostly because of the mount.  You could figure out your own way to mount it, of course.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:First, the images from this camera are good and sharp.  The pan/tilt works well with just a little delay as the commands are sent over the internet.  It will also do night-vision as well and is handy as a remote viewing device if you want to watch, say, your pets while away from home.  You can move the camera to see around the room if the animals are not in view.  The camera uses a 5v USB power cord with a DC cylindrical connector.  It comes with a USB AC plug for power, or you can connect it to a laptop or other 5V USB device.When power is connected, the camera is 'on', there is no power switch.  The instructions say it can be connected via wireless, and I was able to connect it using a Q code on my phone.  I also tested a connection it to my router with an ethernet cable and the network delay was just slightly less.  Using the free 2CU app recommended, I was able to then connect to the camera and use its features.  You can pan/tilt the camera by swiping the screen.  The camera has a limited viewing angle and there is no zoom.  You can also use a desktop application (from a cotapp web site) to access the camera, although you cannot pan/tilt the camera with it.I have some hesitation just leaving the camera 'on' all the time.  The reason is that it is constantly streaming video to a third party on the internet (presumably to the 2CU site) even when the app is not connected.  That opens up the possibility that your video stream could be hacked, although I am told by the manufacturer that this one is encrypted.  I would use this camera sparingly when needed and don't just leave it plugged in all the time unless you don't mind the possibility of the video stream becoming accidentally public.

I was given this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:We are tea drinkers, with both of my sons having worked at Teavana.  I have to admit I have never tried Chrysanthemum tea before though.  The tea arrives in a vacuum pack, and is whole dried flowers as the picture shows.  The flowers are have a light scent when the pack is opened and appear to be is good condition.  We brewed 8 flowers in 1 cup of boiling water for about 5 minutes and some honey was added for sweetness.  The tea has a very light, floral aroma and taste.  It was not bitter or sour at all -- very nice.Chrysanthemum tea has been used in Asia for over 2000 years and has several claimed medicinal properties.  Most of the properties focus around helping the eyes, cardiovascular system and liver.  It also is often used as a 'coolant' for when you have a fever, as it can reduce body temperature.  Japanese also use this tea as an 'alertness' aid, although it contains no caffeine.

I gave this 5 stars mostly because our cat gobbled it up with no hesitation.  He liked it even more than another brand we tried, The Nutro Company Adult Cat Chunky Loaf Chicken Dinner for Adult Cats, 3-Ounce.  It does have real chicken and fish in it, although the ingredient list (compared with the Nutro) seems to have extra 'fillers' as well:  Potato Starch, Carrots, Broccoli.  It also includes vitamins and minerals, which is good.The nutritional profile is: Protein 5.5%, Fat 5%, Fiber 0.5%, Moisture 85%, Ash 2.5%.  If your cat has hairballs or loose stool, you will certainly need to supplement with a higher fiber food.  The recommended amount for a typical 8 lb. cat is 3 containers, about 8.5 oz.  This works out to about $18 per day.  I would say that's a little pricey.  Use sparingly as a treat.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion.I rate earphone and earbuds mainly based on how they sound to me.  Comfort and quality come next, then style.  So these over-the-ear earphones sound OK... the large speaker allows them to put out lower and louder bass than in-ear phones.  The higher end of the sound is somewhat muffled mostly because they fit over the ear.  Stereo separation is good.  They do block outside sounds somewhat, although not as well as in-ear phones or full-surround headphones.  So I think these sound OK for active use - I would not use them for critical listening.The ear pads are comfortable with a faux-leather feel.  The stiff cord does hold them pretty securely against your ears even while moving.  I did find the buttons a little finicky to use - it's easy to push the wrong button and rewind instead of fast forward.  The volume buttons are on the edge of the earphone, so it's a little tricky pushing the up/down volume without pushing it off your ear and without pushing any of the other buttons by mistake.Bluetooth pairing was easy - just hold the "phone" button down for about 6-8 seconds and when it flashes blue/red it's ready to pair.  I did not have a problem with the sound cutting in/out with these; although I did check and stopped any unneeded background programs that were running, which may be a cause of jittery sound.  Overall, it's nice to have a set of earphones without a cord dangling down to get in the way while you are moving around.  This set fits the bill and sounds OK for on-ear headphones as well.

I was given this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I am an audiophile and am pretty picky about how I want my music to sound.  With that in mind, I tried these earbuds with some jazz and rock music.  I was not impressed.  Think of listening to your music through your phone speaker and that is what they sounded like to me -- very little bass, tinny high end, indistinct sound with a muddled sound stage.  I compared them to my favorite (albeit more expensive) earbuds, the Brainwavz S1 In Ear Noise Isolating Headphones and there is just no comparison.  That said, these earbuds would be OK for voice-only applications, like as a phone headset or listening to talk radio or other voice applications.  The microphone works fine.Build quality is so-so, with very little strain-relief at the plug and earbud ends of the cord.  The flat cord is OK and long enough; its surface is smooth and does not tangle easily.  Cord noise is minimal.  The earbuds fit OK in the ear and their metal cases seem rugged enough.  It comes with three different sizes of silicon tips for proper fit.  The "R" and "L" designation on each earbud is almost invisible as a raised letter on the cord relief.  There is no storage case included.If you are shopping for style and you like the looks of these earbuds, then by all mean buy them.  If you are shopping for sound quality, even in this price range, I would look elsewhere.  You could take a look at the similar-priced Brainwavz Delta that I reviewed here:  http://www.amazon.com/review/R1J84AYLEG1CTQ/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm

I was given this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I own several pairs of Brainwavz earbuds and cans, so I have a pretty good idea of what Brainwavz is capable of.  I'd say that their first offering in the wireless earbud market is a winner.  These earbuds come with the usual Brainwavz complement of silicone and Comply foam tips, as well some small plastic attachments the hold the earbuds in your ear.  The cord is a typical earbud cord, which also has the Rew/Pause/FF buttons and microphone on it.  The quality of the buttons is good, with a positive click when pressed.  The micro USB charging port is in the right earbud and it fully charges in a max of about 1-2 hrs.  You get about 4-6 hours of play time from them.Overall, they are quite comfortable to wear, although I think the cord can get annoying if you are jogging or moving around, as it tends to bounce around.  The earbuds are straight and not angled, so they tend to stick out a bit and can be shaken loose if you don't use the tips that fit you best.  The sound is good, somewhat weak in the upper end, but plenty of bass.  As far as the spectrum balance, I still prefer their Brainwavz S1 In Ear Noise Isolating Headphones with just a little boost in the vocal range.  Noise isolation with the BLU-100 is similar to any other in-ear earphones, which depends on which tips you are using and how far they are in your ear canal.  The Comply foam tips provide the best sound isolation.If you are looking for wireless earbuds, at this price point I would not hesitate to recommend the BLU-100 from a company that knows how to make quality headphones and earbuds.

I was given this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I have a collection of essential oils that I want to use, but have not found a way to use them that doesn't take some kind of maintenance every day or two.  I have put the oils into a potpourri mix, which does work for a week or so before the smell is mostly gone.  I have also tried putting the oils into a heating diffuser, which gives a strong scent at first that diminishes over about a week's time.  This humidifier is another method I am trying.  It actually works nicely, since you need humidity in the air anyway in order to smell things.  Filling the container with about 110 ml of water and a few drops of essential oils lasts for about 36 hours.The scent is very light in a larger room (I have it in the kitchen/living/sunroom), so it works much better in a smaller, enclosed room like a bathroom or bedroom.  The light is a soft glow and is OK, and the wood-like plastic looks pretty good as a decorative object.  I think the only thing I would change about this is to have a larger reservoir so that it held up to a week's worth of water.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I was skeptical at first about this bulb because I thought the light color would the typical blue-white of many LED bulbs.  But I was pleased to find that the bulb actually has a very nice, warm light.  At 700 lumens, it's pretty close in color and brightness to a standard 60w incandescent bulb.  I have attached a couple pictures of it in my Art Deco table lamp, which would not look good with a blueish light - but this bulb looks great.The bulb is not dimmable, and it would be nice to have choices of a frosted or opaque glass so you don't see the filaments.  But I think this is a great bulb with no warm-up time, longer life and does not dim as it ages like a CFL bulb.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:This microscope is basically a video/photo camera that is set up for only macro photography. I think this microscope would work OK as a teaching aid, for doing delicate work on small objects, for exploring nature, for realtime video demonstrations, for cataloging collections of small objects.  A few months ago, I reviewed another microscope from this company, the DBPOWER 3inches TFT Hd 5MP 500x Portable Digital Mobile Microscope which did not have a base and focus knob like this one, but did have a LCD screen.  This microscope does not have a screen attached; you must use it while connected to a computer via USB.The claim of 300X seems to be pretty accurate, although it's hard to tell.  You increase and decrease 'zoom' by moving the camera up and down on the stand, then focus with the knob on front.  The max 'zoom' is when you have it all the way down with the clear plastic against the base.  The 5MP max resolution is OK for casual photos and video you can take with it.  The only format it saves in is JPG, which is compressed and so you do lose some detail.  The iris in the camera auto-adjusts for brightness and white balance, so the ability to adjust the LED brightness is kind of moot, since the camera adjusts automatically to light changes.  White balance is OK, sometimes off a little, which you can correct in your photo software on pictures you take.Overall, this is a fun toy that is good for teaching and exploring the world from a macro point of view.  I have attached a photo of a kidney stone that shows how you can capture measurements in the photo with the included MicroCapture Pro 2.2 software.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I already have a USB charging port that I can plug into my car's 12v receptacle.  But this one adds a couple features that I have not seen before.  It contains 3-LED white lights to use an a small flashlight (which works even when unplugged from the 12v socket), has a rapidly flashing 3-LED red lights for... who knows what,  a car window breaker, and a couple rare-earth magnets on top.  The magnets are a nice touch, since you can stick it to your fender while changing a tire, for example.The instructions don't mention anything about an internal battery for the lights or how it charges, but I assume it charges when plugged into the 12v socket.  The two USB ports are a 1A and a 2.1A port.  So this is a handy item you can put in your glove box to use when needed.

I received this item for testing and review - this is my opinion:This is a 13,000 mAh backup battery and comes with a carry bag.  You charge it using the supplied micro USB connector and your laptop or USB wall charger outlet.  It has 4 blue lights that show the current charge -- 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%. There's a small white LED light that you can turn on/off by pushing the power button twice.  Otherwise, it's a somewhat heavy and unremarkable backup power source with 2 USB ports to charge up to 2 devices at the same time.  I bring backup batteries with me when I use my phone as a GPS while playing golf or traveling.  The backup comes in handy when away from a power source while traveling, hiking, camping, etc.  At 13,000mAh, you should be able to fully charge your phone a couple times before the backup needs to be recharged.Note that the micro USB charging cable that comes with this has an extra long micro connector.  A standard micro USB cable will not work to charge this - or may work if you hold it tight in the socket.

I was given this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I have several portable bluetooth speakers (which I have reviewed on Amazon).  I have to say that this is the best one I have tried yet.First, the sound is excellent for such small (30mm) speakers.  The bass port in the back really does work well as you can feel the unit vibrate with bass when playing music even at the lowest level.  There are no frequency specs in the manual, but I would guess it's about 120Hz - 20kHz.  The speaker is a bit 'directional', meaning that it must be pointing right at you for the best high frequency sound, but it still sounds good and clear when pointed in a different direction.  Volume is a bit on the loud side even at the lowest setting, and it get VERY loud at the highest setting - I would say even good enough for a party.Many bluetooth speakers have FM radio, which I like, but this one includes a display to tell you the station frequencies, which many do not.  You can also store up to 10 station presets as well.  Radio reception is excellent with no external antenna needed, although I am within 20 miles of radio towers, so your mileage may vary.Bluetooth reception is the standard up to 10 meters and works fine.  When paired with your phone, it will ring when the phone rings and has a microphone to allow you to keep your phone stashed away and take the call completely with the speaker.  You can even receive a second call and put the first on hold.  Caller ID is shown in the display.Finally, you can connect a wire from your player/computer right to the aux port on this for a direction connection, although you don't get the functionality of the play/pause/search buttons that way.  The 2500mAh battery is charged via a micro USB port with included USB cable and USB wall plug (or computer USB port).  Also included is a short lanyard with carabiner.All of the above, AND this unit is completely waterproof.  In fact, you can even submerge it up to 1m under water!  It's great for any outdoor activities and sounds fantastic.  Thumbs up!

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:This scratching post is a plastic post about 2" in diameter and wrapped with sisal rope, and it's 15" tall.  The ball is sisal as well, and is 2" in diameter.  The base is a synthetic fur material.  I have another homemade scratch post that my two cat use all the time, which is also wrapped in sisal, but is 3.5" square and 20" tall.  The cats prefer this one over the smaller one because I think they like to stretch out, and taller is better.But, the cats can be enticed to use the smaller post if you rub catnip into the rope and the ball.  They did rub against it when we did this and used it occasionally, but still prefer the larger, taller post to stretch on.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:Peppermint essential oil is mainly used for aromatherapy and medicinal uses.  This oil has a strong scent and only a few drops are needed.  The dark bottle has a nice, glass dropper for dispensing the oil.  I used it as an air freshener in our trash can and it works great, although doesn't last more than a day or so.  Its scent is said to help with nausea, coughs and congestion.  I just like the fresh smell and use it as a general air freshener and mood lifter.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:Rosehip Oil is made from pressing the seeds of Rosa moschata or Rosa rubiginosa that grow in the southern Andes, and from Rosa canina.  It contains essential fatty acids and some provitamin A.  It does not contain vitamin C, which is water-soluble; nor does it contain retinol.  It has some astringent properties and absorbs quickly into the skin.  We tried it on our hands and it did not feel greasy and seemed to smooth the skin.  The oil has no scent. The pump on the bottle was handy to dispense the oil, although the astringent oil seems to make the pump a little sticky.  I was surprised the oil did not come in a darker bottle because its properties can degrade in bright light.  Overall it's a nice oil for softening and slightly tightening the skin.Peppermint essential oil is mainly used for aromatherapy and medicinal uses.  This oil has a strong scent and only a few drops are needed.  The dark bottle has a nice, glass dropper for dispensing the oil.  I used it as an air freshener in our trash can and it works great, although doesn't last more than a day or so.  Its scent is said to help with nausea, coughs and congestion.  I just like the fresh smell and use it as a general air freshener and mood lifter.

I received this item to test and review.  This is my opinion.This BQ2 model is a step up from Nationite's other bluetooth model Nationite BQ1.  The BQ2 is a stereo speaker with the same functionality as the BQ1 - speaker with mic, bluetooth and wired connection, FM receiver, slot for memory card.  The BQ2 is heavier and larger and has better bass range (down to 28Hz, although realistically don't expect booming bass notes from 45mm speakers).  S/N ratio is good at >95dB with <0.5% distortion.A few minor issues I have with it are the function of the buttons (press for one function, hold for another), although the buttons are labeled much better than the BQ1.  The voice that says "Enter to Bluetooth" is badly transliterated from Chinese to Engrish.  I still don't understand what it says when switching to FM mode.  Oddly, the base of this unit is rounded, so it doesn't sit solid on a flat surface... it rocks on the rounded bottom.  I don't get it.  The only instructions are printed on the back of the box, so don't throw that out.  One last thing -- and this was the same on the BQ1 - this has an FM radio tuner, but there is no way to tell which station you are tuning to nor any way to store stations in memory.  It's functional, but not very practical.Otherwise, the sound is crisp and clear and the Bluetooth functions fine.

I was given this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:This is a small, light backup battery for your portable USB-powered devices.  There's a switch that toggles ON, OFF/CHARGE and LIGHT.  You can turn the light on at the same time it's charging as well.  2600mAh should give you enough energy for an emergency charge when you're away from a power source.What I like about this it easily fits into a pocket or purse and the 1-LED flashlight is on the end of it like a normal flashlight.  I would probably use it most while camping/hiking as a mini flashlight with the benefit of charging a portable if needed.  Nice!

I do not do hydroponics.  I grow vegetables and flowers outdoors in soil that I amend.  While this product does say that it can be used in 'soil' systems, it really is designed for use with a hydroponics system only.  This booster product is 0-4-4, which is a low concentration of phosphorus and potassium.  These nutrients help your plants flower and produce fruit, and well as stimulate root growth.  It will not significantly make the vegetative part of the plants grow faster, larger or turn greener.  You need a fertilizer with nitrogen in it for that.If you are experimenting with hydroponics, I recommend the complete system:  CleanGrow Pro PackOtherwise, this 1 gal size booster is an economical way to replace the FertMax booster you ran out of.  If you are looking for bloom or fruiting fertilizers for outdoor use, I would look at other products for that, like Miracle-Gro 100885 Shake 'n Feed Continuous Release Bloom Booster  or Scotts Super Bloom

I received this item for test and review.  This is my opinion:Solar chargers of this size really are not much more than a novelty.  The trickle charge of 200mAh that the battery gets while in the sun will only charge about 1/8 capacity for a one full day.  If you are truly going to use this for emergencies only, then I would charge it via the USB cord provided and then you can keep it in a bright location to keep the battery topped off.Otherwise, it's a handy and rugged spare charger for your smaller 5v USB devices - phone, GPS, camera, etc. although it will also charge larger devices as well with its 2.1A output.  The 5300mAh capacity LiPo battery should be able to charge your device enough to use until you can properly charge it with its A/C or USB charging cable.  The rubberized case and covered ports will protect from spills and dirt and shock.  The case measures about 5 1/2" x 3".  The included clip makes it easy to attach to your bag or backpack and not worry about the weather ruining it.  This should be real handy on our camping and hiking trips!

I received this item in to test and review.  This is my opinion:This is a compact and very clear sounding stereo Bluetooth speaker.  I think what differentiates this one from many other Bluetooth speakers is that it's water and shock resistant.  The rugged rubber ends and covered buttons and switches means you can take this outdoors without worrying about dirt or rain getting into it.  I would not dip it directly in water, and I would dry it off as soon as possible though.The sound is clear and seems to be louder at the same phone volume level than other Bluetooth speakers I have.  The 1.5" speakers are not going to produce any thumping bass (the frequency range says 80Hz-20kHz but I would put the low end closer to 150Hz or so), but the highs and mids are clean and clear.  S/N ratio says 60dB, which really is not very good, but I didn't not notice a lot of noise while playing music.  The 1500mAh LiPo battery charges via micro USB in about 2 hours and plays for 12+ hours depending on volume level.I think I will take this speaker with me on my motorcycle, where earbuds are a pain to keep in (and in some cases illegal).  And I think the first time I ride with it I'll play the Music From The Soundtrack: Easy Rider.  :-)

This 'air fryer' is basically an electric, counter-top convection oven.  There is a heating element that looks like the old coil burners from an electric stove.  This is placed above the basket that you slide into the unit.  There is a fan that circulates the air inside the unit while the heater is on.  The basket and the bowl it sits in are coated with a non-stick coating and so cleanup is easy.  The temperature and timer/power knobs are simple and easy to operate - you can reduce or cancel the timer by turning it counter-clockwise.  It functions like our toaster oven - you set the temperature and then turn the timer past 20 and then to whatever time you want it to stay on (up to 60 mins).  The temperature knob goes up to 400F.I made some french fries with fresh potatoes with it, following the instructions that came with it.  You cut up the potato into even stick, coat with 1/2 T. oil, add a pinch of salt and put them in the basket.  Note that the recipe calls for no more than 8 oz. of fries at a time, which is about 1 russet potato at a time.  After 10 mins at 400F, you pull the basket out and mix the fries by shaking, then put it back in for another 10 mins.  The fries came out actually quite crispy on the edges and cooked throughout.  For 4 of us, I cooked fries from 3 potatoes, which took about 1 hr. and 15 mins total.We commented on it afterward - how useful an appliance it is and whether it's something that should remain on the counter and be used often.  The answer was no for a few reasons:  1) For a family of four, the basket size is too small to make enough for everyone in one or two batches.  2) We have a deep fryer, and the difference in the amount of oil in/on the food is negligible.  3) Our oven can accommodate the full size of what we need to cook and does just as good a job.  One advantage of this appliance over a deep fryer however is the food is coated in clean oil and then baked, whereas deep fryer oil gets smelly and loaded with bits of coating after a few uses and needs to be changed.What I think this appliance might be best for is heating up small batches of pre-cooked foods like fish sticks, tater tots, frozen french fries, frozen onion rings, and making them crispy.  A toaster oven could do the same thing, although perhaps not as quickly.  For the amount of space this takes up and the cost to operate, if you already have a toaster oven or a full size oven or a deep fryer, I would pass on this.(By the way -- the photoshopped ad photo of this appliance with a basket loaded to the top with french fries is incorrect.  Loaded like this they would never cook through.  The recommended batch size is 8 oz, which barely covers the bottom of the basket.)

I always run dehumidifiers in my basement in the summer to keep black mold from forming.  I like the humidity to be between 40-50%, so the dehumidifier runs from about May to October.  In the winter with the furnace running, the air is drier and I unplug the dehumidifier.I have had a GE dehumidifier for about 5 years and it seems to work OK, but GE got into an arrangement with a flaky Chinese company named Cree who let a lot of their dehumidifiers go to market with problems.  There is even a recall on some of them and if you have certain GE models made from 2008-2012, you should look it up and see if yours is included and get a refund.This Honeywell dehumidifier runs quietly and is working great so far.  The hose connection that I use to run a hose to my sump seems more sturdy than the GE one.  Also, the filter on this one is easier to get out to clean than the GE.  The only negative compared to my GE is if you use the water tank, the GE model has a red floating ball to show the water level and the Honeywell just has the plain window to see the water.  But that's a minor issue and irrelevant in my case.I look forward to many dry years to come!  :-)

I was given this item to test and review.  This is my opinion:I have several pairs of Brainwavz earphones and headphones.  I will compare this ProAlpha pair to another Brainwavz pair that is almost identical in price, specs and features, the Brainwavz M1 In-Ear Headphones.  I listened to some Eagles music and some classical 1812 Overture, so I could hear any differences in bass response and in clarity of the highs.  The only major difference I could pick out was that the ProAlphas were louder than the M1s at the same volume setting, and this is likely due to the difference in impedence - the ProAlphas are 20 ohms and the M1s are 32 ohms.  Other than that though, the differences were very minor -- the ProAlphas seem to have a slight edge in 500Hz to 1500Hz range, boosting this range just slightly over the M1.  The spectrum balance is what I like to listen to -- it's got a flat to slightly de-emphasized range from around 700-1200Hz, which you can boost with your equalizer if you like.  I prefer this "dry" sound though.Regarding accessories, they both come with the Comply foam tips, which are the most comfortable and best sealing tips around.  Both come with the same hard case and have the same no-tangle and somewhat stiffer cord, which has no cord noise.  The one thing I disliked about both models is that the earbuds tend to not stay in as well as some other models (like my favorite S1).  The earbud is small and light, and the stiffer cord tends to pull on them as you move a little more than more flexible cords.But in this price range, the Brainwaves earphones give good value for your money, and I would not hesitate to choose either of them for great, balanced sound.

Hate to be a non-raver - it's a nice enough water bottle, though not life changing, and who knows if it's worth the money. I know I drink more with a straw, so I got the classic stainless one with straw top, which comes with 2 straws.  The vendor, Heart Rate Monitors, got it to me in a single day, impressive. I have not yet put it up against serious temperatures, but my water stays cold all day around the house without ice.In all the current reviews of this product, only ONE mentions the dishwasher, and the writer says s/he loves that it can be thrown in the dishwasher.  Mine came with a band around that product with some information and one of the points was NOT to put it in the dishwasher, explaining roughly that the temp reached by many dishwashers is too much for the insulation layer. That's kind of a bummer, as I really didn't see myself getting a bottle brush to clean this daily.  (The plastic/rubber tops and straws are dishwasher safe though.)Further (and I may be spoiled by my old bottle's nice wide straw) the draw on the straw top is not particularly smooth.  I feel I really have to put some oomph into getting the liquid up, and I have visions of all this leading to old lady wrinkles around the mouth.I got this because I recently had a kidney stone and was advised to keep my water intake up.  My smaller insulated bottle held less and thus when it ran out I'd tend to stop drinking til it was time for a logical break from whatever I was doing and go get a refill.  I figured that with a larger bottle I'd be drinking more steadily, and that has been true.Time will tell more about the durability of this water bottle, and I will update if it shows any undue wear or problems. For now, I'm drinking more water and it stays cold, so mission accomplished.

Simple and cute, not a combat style, more of an ankle boot. On my pair, from the bottom of the heel to the very top of the boot, it's only just over 8 inches. The grey is pleasantly darker than the picture and thankfully not metallic. The laces are stiff and round so unless you double knot they come undone easily, and they are stupid long for these boots. I hope to find shorter flat laces to replace them. The footbed's not much padded. Other reviews about how these boots popped off hooks and split soles or heels make me nervous, so even though they're amazingly cheap, I'm going to go easy on them.

Reasonably convincing faux leather with a nice matte finish and bumpy ossie texture, soft, not plasticky or vinylish. Essentially two-toned so it's bound to go with some of your brown boots or shoes.The only slight negative is that the short handles, because they are sewn on, are in a constant "up" position, which is kind of funky when you choose to use the extra shoulder strap (which attaches to small rings under where the short handles meet the body of the bag).  If you're looking to simulate a certain designer dome satchel, this won't play the part as it is larger, longer, not as high, the zipper pulls are different, and there's no padlock, but this bag is pretty and functional on its own.Because of the two browns in it, this goes with my dressy boots as well as my combats, so it will see a lot of action this fall and winter.

If you're looking for a bag similar to the LV Alma, this purse does have the profile... But the cheap-looking material ruins the effect on the brown, which appears to have a different finish than other colors. It has to be just that this color is differently made - it is not soft or good looking as others describe theirs.I got the brown because I could find no other vendor offering brown. The exterior is terrible and screams plastic. No effort was made to create a leather-like finish, or even the woodgrain finish used on the leather of the original. Instead, the vinylish, plasticky material has some random, stamped diagonal lines for texture. Bizarre. The trim on the bottom and at the base of the handles and the handles themselves is a very shiny faux patent. Mine did not come with a lock and key or fob.I sent it back. Really didn't think I could carry this around this winter without feeling sheepish. It just looks like "Hi, I know I'm really not carrying an Alma, but I was so desperate I settled for this."

Glad to be able to get affordable combat boots that look good, gold eyelets and all. The construction's cheap and there's not much padding in the footbed. Mine are the new shiny black, and they are not overly so.I'm glad I went up a size. I'm at the outer limits on fitting these, you may be too. Be aware... even going up a size isn't going to buy you more toe box room, it is low. I tend to buy wides even though I'm not a true wide-width person, and these are a tad tight. Plus, my arch is a bit high, and again, it's a close fit and can't be fixed with loosening the laces since your arch hits below them. I am ok with this, but if you have toes or toe knuckles that stick up, a very high arch or a truly wide foot, caution.

Decent shoe, not sturdy but workable for everyday stuff. Rather thin sole, but you don't feel the pavement, zero arch support or padding. Nice basic design, the toe not too rounded or pointy. Thin heel carved out of the rubber bottom.I got three pairs, 2 "suede" (more like velvet or microfiber) and one PU. The suede ones seem a little more generous in size.Most of the reviews on here suggest the sizing on these runs a bit large and wide. Maybe mine are from a different batch, but mine were just a little shorter than expected. Plus, I am not a true wide, more likely slightly wide, but generally get wides for a little more room, a choice not available here so I had to get regular width. I found these just barely wearable, and am hoping they'll loosen with wear. A person with a real "wide" foot would not have luck with these.The blue suede is not a navy, its more like a royal blue, nice. The pale beige suede is very nice, close to nude.Pay attention when you get your shoes. Mine were jammed tightly into their boxes, and the heel of one left an impression mark on the top of the other, and I am hoping the suede will bounce back up now that it's unpacked.Overall these are not remarkable, just basic flats that won't last your lifetime but will go with a lot of your stuff.

I ordered these from a local department store that had them on sale, and I had a coupon too... and then I held my breath til they got here.My feet went "ahhh" as soon as I put them on.  I often sacrifice some comfort for style, so for me to notice a truly comfy shoe is not my norm.  Wore them all day, felt great. The padding is not thick or invasive, but it sure is soft and comfortable.I found the sizing to be pretty true. The length was exactly as expected. The width is a bit different - I have a somewhat wide foot and often buy wide just to be safe (if buying online) or for extra space.  In this shoe I am glad I got the wide, for sure. The only funny thing is that the "wide" was across the base of the toes, but did not seem to extend to the tip of the toes.  This resulted in a comfy fit for me, but the difference in width means the leather pulls slightly diagonally across the foot as I walk. Not a comfort issue, more of a momentary aesthetic thing.The toebox in these is not high, so if you have a big toe that curls upward or if you have high toe knuckles, I would steer clear. My one big toe is pressing up on the toebox and due to the softness of the leather it is slightly visible and likely going to wear on that spot.  Odds are good I'll be putting some sticky moleskin in there to try to prevent that wear. Again, not a comfort issue, but I like these shoes a lot and don't want to rub through or make a big dent in them over time.I got the off white and it's a great color because it is subtle, goes with a lot and isn't bright and loud. The color goes with the casual vibe of the shoe and the string trim. I can wear it with any color purse, including an off white one.There's a part of me shallowly wondering if these are a little dowdy, and thinking "Hush Puppies? Do I wear Hush Puppies?" To be honest, these feel so good, I'm kind of not caring.  And I hope Hush Puppies can keep the comfort going while coming up with even more contemporary shoes.

It's scary to realize that not that long ago gay people in the US had few rights and suffered a lot of harassment, and had to live amazingly closeted lives. This documentary brings it home clearly by telling a cohesive narrative while weaving in firsthand accounts of living people and teaching us about one night when everyone had had enough.I wasn't alive then and you can bet the Stonewall wasn't mentioned in school. It should have been, as it is as important today as any civil rights event. Anyway, my point is that like me, you might not know a lot about that time period, and I was really glad to find this production that covered it in a very human way. Yes, it tells the Stonewall's story, but it excels at giving you the atmosphere of the times as well.It's funny too, to watch it in the context of today. There's one man, a purported expert on homosexuality, who claims to have tried it and realized it was not for him, but who advocated for gay acceptance anyway. At one point he talks about having enough mainstream acceptance of gays to allow them to have real relationships and not be driven underground.  He follows that up with a chuckle, saying something to the effect of "After all, it's not like they want to get married, or adopt children." What a time capsule! You begin to understand the circular logic of the times - how forcing relationships to occur "in the dark" brought about the very behavior that made outsiders despise many gay people, and how fear led to many misconceptions as well.A terrific story very well told. I appreciated it enough that when my first disc broke while popping it out of the box that I got another one.

I bought a bunch of these for friends overseas when my husband was making a trip and got one for myself too. These trim little bags boast beautiful colors and a nice finish.  No, not leather, but these are clearly fun bags, not high end bags, though they are well-made and nicely styled. The sizing is perfect so you can choose whether to make it work as a handbag or a tote.And one last heads up - the prices on these are all over the place varying at any given time, sometimes based on color. I happily paid about $18 for each of the six I got and thought it very fair but no way is it worth the $30 or more it sometimes goes for. It's a nice little well made vinyl bag and has no pretensions, and $20 is the top you should consider. But at that pricepoint, worth it.

I wanted to have one orange purse and was not willing to spend a lot since I'm not sure it'll see much use, so that's what's prompted this purchase. For $20, it didn't have to be love.It's not love, but it's okay. Overall, between the color and the studs, the bag has a little edge to it. The orange I got doesn't scream fake leather, and to the touch it's not bad, just maybe a tad rubbery. The things that give away the low-end craftsmanship are the lack of attention to detail... the studs are kind of big and not aligned perfectly.  And the trim around where the handles meet the bag?  It's not tiny metal beading like I thought. It actually looks like one half of a zipper encircling it as trim.  It's little zipper teeth. Maybe some would see that as a witty designer move, but to me it was kind of like "What?"Anyhow, it's all right, it'll work for trips to the store and casual wear which is about what I expected, and I'm glad my expectations were no higher. It seems like a reasonably sturdy purse for everyday hauling, and the looks are passable.And Patzino?  You'd probably sell more items if you didn't plaster your name on most of your bags. I saw some others I liked but passed by because of your insistence on branding them. This one was the one I got since it was clean.

This started as a 5 star review when I wrote it. After a month of using the second one I purchased, I need to revise my rating. Additional comments toward the end of this review.I like a structured purse, and this delivers, standing up even when empty. Yes, it's close to the LV Alma with Epi leather, so the leather is firm, sturdy and substantial.  It is close to the PM size, meaning in inches it's about 11 wide by 9 1/2 and 6 front to back.  That size of the designer-make with the shoulder strap would set you back about two grand.LV need not worry - they didn't lose a sale, as I'd never pay that for a purse, and people who really know the original won't be fooled.  There's no monogram on the exterior or the zipper handles, and this doesn't have the microfiber lining. Still, this purse stands on its own merits.If you have strong feelings about hardware color, look carefully at the pictures, as some come with silver, some with gold.  Mine came with gold which I normally don't like, but it is a soft gold, not blazing yellow, tasteful, and is also used on the zipper. The matching padlock (wrapped in clear plastic I'm going to leave on for scuff protection) comes on the handle loop but can be moved to the zipper if you plan to use it.  The key is inside the hanging leather key bell and mine worked fine. There was a bonus key fob that I'm going to throw away, as I don't need it, and it's got a fold mark on it, and it is only finished leather on one side, raw on the other, and my raw side has blotches on it. No biggie.  The bottom of the bag has two leather straps, each with two little feet on it to keep the bottom from wearing.The short handles are big enough to hand-carry or drape over your forearm, but won't go past your elbow. The extra shoulder strap comes inside the bag, and attaches to metal loops on the short handles.  The shoulder strap is about an inch wide, and has 6 holes and a buckle so you can choose your length.Because the leather has the wood grain embossing, it doesn't look like traditional leather with a natural grain, which is why some reviews question if it's real.  If you look closely, you can see some of the leather grain within the wood grain texturing. The strip at the bottom is patent leather. My purse had no strong smell, just a slight smell that did smell like leather to me.  I would have found it reassuring if the purse had come with an inner tag stating materials, country of origin and manufacturer, but mine had NO inner tag.  I choose the "milky white" color which is close to ivory, maybe a shade darker than the LV ivory, bordering on very light tan.The interior of my bag is a dark brown satiny fabric.  The one side has a small zipper pocket that would hold cards or small items.  The other side has two open pockets, one would hold a cell phone or a pack of smokes, the other is bigger.  The center portion is open, undivided.I wanted a purse that had class with an edge, and am very pleased. The color I got will be perfect for spring through summer and into early fall.  After that, yeah, I might be back for another bag in a different color.Added Dec. 5, 2014 - As planned, I again bought this bag in late August -this time in black- planning on using it for fall and winter.  After 1 month of light wear (I don't work outside the home, so this bag has only gone out maybe twice weekly for shopping) the handle has come off. It tore where the ring inserts for the shoulder strap. (The key bell had already ripped before the month was up.) As of today, my review is the second most helpful review on this item, probably because I spent a lot of time trying to describe it to assist others. I would hate to have to leave this review online as a much-seen warning to others. It's my intent to contact the seller and see if they will make this right.  If they do, I will add praise for their integrity and revise accordingly.Added January 13, 2014 - Amazing.  This is proof the system can work.With the Christmas buying rush over (most of my presents bought here on Amazon) I got back on dealing with the purse. This was sold directly by Amazon and not a third party seller, so I called Amazon and had the pleasure of dealing with an excellent Amazon rep named Thomas. He understood that it was frustrating to have a bag that was basically in new condition, though not recently bought, having sat on the shelf until it was the season to use black accessories. Because it was well past the 30 day return period, I couldn't get an exchange, but was given a small credit on future purchases. This was as much as the rep could do within his discretion. I appreciated the gesture, grudgingly understood the return policy. It was indeed past 30 days since purchase, but the purse was essentially new, so I was still a little rankled.When I received the credit, I was also sent a survey link. The first question asked is if you were satisfied. You are also asked to rate the rep (which I did highly because he was really good, not just because he made a concession, but his listening and phone skills and empathy were outstanding). The link asked how easy it was to deal with Amazon (I gave 5 stars), the rep's skills (5 stars) and the Amazon policy (3 stars).If you answer the question asking if you were satisfied with "Yes" you get a text box to add anything else. If you say "No" the screen says basically to please give Amazon another chance and contact them after completing the review.I hesitated because my rep Thomas had been very good and I did not want my lack of satisfaction to reflect badly on him... but on the other hand, I was still in possession of a new but broken purse, the sting slightly removed by a credit... so no, I wasn't really satisfied.The system then said "May we call you?" - I said yes, and my phone rang, and I had been sent to a department that essentially handles escalated issues.  Again, I had a fabulous rep, Robert, with excellent listening skills, empathy, ability to make judgement calls, but with a little more latitude. He heard me out, was totally understanding, and issued a full refund.I was very impressed.  I had had two excellent representatives with top notch skills AND because of the Amazon online system of asking about my satisfaction, I actually was finally completely satisfied.  At that point, I asked if I could give my positive feedback to a superior, and was passed along to one, with whom I shared my feedback about the reps, and the system working.  And she, Janet, was very good too. Said she would share my feedback with the direct superiors of Thomas and Robert. Happy to hear that everything worked, that the reps were good and I was happy. Who would've thought a purse breaking could show me how decent and professional Amazon can be?

Really wanted to like this product because of the various health benefits of ginger.  Unfortunately, I wasn't able to tolerate these capsules, as they produced burning sour burps and some diarrhea for me no matter when or with what I took them.

3.5 stars. I got this shirt for my nephew at the suggestion of his mom. He was delighted with it as a big Phils fan, so that's to the good.  Also to the good is that the shirt seems true to size, though it feels very plasticky, artificial and potentially warm for the wearer.My biggest dislike of this item is the price. No way it's worth $45-50. Probably the cost is driven by licensing. It just seems stupid to spend this much on a shirt, particularly on a shirt meant for a youth who will likely outgrow it soon. A serious Phillies enthusiast will probably love it as he did, but otherwise, not worth it.

Upfront, I should say we don't use this comb for fleas, but for daily grooming, so I can't comment on the flea-catching qualities of the comb.What I can say however, is that we have several cats and this comb is their favorite of many. It does an effective job of getting out loose, fine undercoat without making anybody squeal in pain, and leaves them all looking good.From a human standpoint, this comb is easier to use than many; it has an actual handle rather than teeth the whole length of the comb, so you have greater directional control. There's also a little divot to rest your thumb in, which surprisingly helps steer the comb well.We'd first hit on this comb at our vet's office, and she gave us hers.  Over time, some of the teeth have gone crooked or come out, so we recently bought two more- one for upstairs and downstairs, so there's always one nearby.

I need to stop trying BB creams and stick with one I already know works well. Instead I was at Walgreens feeling spendy and saw this.It was from L'Oreal, a decent brand, which has other products I have used and been satisfied with. How could I not try a tube of the light/medium? I snuck a little onto the back of my hand and it looked good, plus it was marked way down.While it wasn't a huge loss, I wish I hadn't bothered. If you want to know about L'Oreal BB creams, I'm your girl and this is your review.A true BB cream will give you "glow", minimize skin imperfections, and if good, can even take the place of your foundation. I had found all these assets in a different L'Oreal' product, their Skin Beautifier BB Cream, and thought perhaps their Age Perfect BB Cream Instant Radiance version would be even better. Not even close.This stuff evolves on your skin. When I first put it on, it was alarming - very orangy and greasy-looking (though it was not greasy, just shiny). Maybe 15 minutes later it had settled down with less shine, but a few hours later (maybe 3) it was just gone. Zero tint, zero coverage. I know not to expect major coverage from a BB cream, but this was ridiculous. Nothing was left.As for the possibility of using it as a semi-foundation... nope. I tried applying a second coat in case more was required for results or staying power, but still nada. It is not buildable and a heavier coating doesn't last longer or look better.I have also tried the L'Oreal Paris Youth Code BB Cream Illuminator (Medium) and it was as useless as this Age Perfect one, except the Youth Code one did not disappear, it just never appeared, period. Nothing. A glorified colored sunscreen calling itself a BB cream because BB creams are hot right now.The other, superior Skin Beautifier BB Cream (now also being called "Studio Secrets") leaves my skin tone even with a subtle pearly finish, minimizes pores, and makes my face look flawless. This is the one that works for me and from which I should not stray. It's light, non-greasy, gives no greasy appearance, provides some light coverage and looks natural.If you are experimenting with BB Creams and not looking to fork out a wad of cash for a premium one, I'd suggest trying the L'Oreal Magic Skin Beautifier BB Cream. You might even try the Maybelline (which was ok but too shiny for my taste). But don't let this Age Perfect Instant Radiance product be your only try of BB creams because there's better stuff out there, honest.

I used to make silver jewelry but still love buying it. I learned a bit about craftsmanship, though not about stones, so that's the way I look at this ring.This is a very pretty ring on a glance. My stone's a bit darker than it appears on the picture here, but deep and lovely. If you order this ring and know yourself to be between sizes, consider going down. I have a lot of rings all the same size, and this one is a tiny bit more generous.I'd been having difficulty finding an amethyst ring that had a larger stone that wasn't gaudy, and this one nailed it for me. The stone is not quite half an inch long, and a bit less wide than that. I have larger hands, wear a 9. It shows up, but doesn't scream. There's a ton of tiny clear cz's circling the stone and trailing down each y-shaped side. They're actually a little more than I was looking for but they are not too much.The center stone could have been set lower but I'm fine with the larger open bottom. The stone rises above the ring on a raised bezel, the rationale probably being to let in light to make the center stone sparkle more. The product picture does not give a sense of this, so please know the bezel lifts the top of the stone about 3/8 of an inch above the finger. It would not have stopped me from buying it in person. (If you'd like to get an idea, see the pictures I have uploaded.)My ring came with two flaws, and I am going to accept them because I don't want to mess around with sending it back for another. One flaw is a few tiny chips in the points of the cuts of the stone which was not very well cut. You would have to look for them. If you do, you will see that the edges of some cuts are a tad rough. The flat surface of the stone, which you would expect to have a perfect ovalled hexagon or octagon shape is irregular too. (See the second uploaded photo to see this irregular shape of the flat top. I was unable to get enough detail to show the tiny chips.)The other flaw is harder to describe, but here goes - probably to let in more light, on each side of the raised bezel holding the stone, there is a machine-made cutout in the shape of an inverted triangle. (It is not visible on the product picture, but is somewhat visible in my uploaded pictures.) On my ring, on one side there is indeed the inverted triangle, cleanly punched, and on the other side is a gloppy, mis-shapen hole. It is not observable to the casual viewer, but it's a bummer. Someone should have caught this while packaging it. Probably it's not on every ring, but just saying- inspect yours carefully.  The description says this ring is made of sterling and I do not doubt that, but I swear it looks like it was dipped in something or coated with something, so I have concern that due to the rough shape of the cutout this possible coating may not cling and hold up as well as the rest of the ring.I'd hoped to make this an everyday ring but don't think I will. I'm concerned for the tiny cz's potentially falling out, and the wear on the rough cutout. Since it arrived chipped, it seems the stone won't take much knocking around either. I'll probably play it safe and keep this ring for occasional wear. However, I have wanted an amethyst ring for some time to go with some earrings, so in that respect I'm satisfied. If you are looking for a fun ring that's pretty and are not picky on details, you may like this very much.

Got this for a friend getting married overseas, where the brides wear a lot of jewelry. It's pretty big, but I know she will be able to wear it again when dressing up.  You can see this is not work jewelry, but spiffy, event jewelry. Out of the box, I adore this ring. As it is gold vermeil, I don't know how it's going to wear over time, and I might come back to tell about that later, but for now, I could not be happier.My husband isn't from this country, and didn't know about the engagement ring custom, and frankly, I didn't care much about it myself because I was just delighted to know I'd have him the rest of my life. I also didn't want to make him wade through the whole diamond industry and the ethics questions. As time has gone on though, I (perhaps shallowly) felt the lack of an engagement ring when dressed up. There I am with bracelets, good earrings, something nice on my right hand, and then my plain left hand with just a band. It felt like the lack of balance was actually calling attention to rather unadorned left hand. I did not want to take off my wedding band just to put something dressy on, so the only answer I could come up with was to get myself an engagement style ring to wear with my wedding band.What can 2.75 carats look like? Carats is weight, not size. I don't know diamonds, and the product description didn't fully answer my concern, which basically was "Is this going to be too blingy, or too small?" I have larger hands and wear a size 9, so anything too conservative would look tiny, but I didn't want to look cheesy either. I wanted something not too large that it looked fake but enough to show up. So if you are wondering, as I was, "How big is that CZ stone?" the answer is "About a 1/4 inch across." That's about the diameter of a cigarette, a teensy bigger. On my size 9 finger, that means that of the part of my finger that is visible, the stone covers about 1/3.It's not a flat CZ either, it's about as high as it is across, so it stands up on your finger a bit. The setting is relatively open to let in the light, with just four simple prongs to hold the stone. It's like a Tiffany setting only four prongs instead of six, designed to put the diamond front and center. No frou-frou.  No busy bezel or added baguettes.  It's classic, clean, and timeless.Yes, it sparkles.  In natural light you get a very few light pinks and blues, not a cold white that screams "glass" but not quite the greyish reflective light you get off a real diamond.The nice coincidence: The gold vermeil is exactly the same shade of gold as my (real gold) wedding band (and not as yellow as it appears in the product photo). Also cool - it is the exact same band width. They couldn't look more like they were meant to be together.Gaudy? I don't think so, just enough to be noticed I think. If you want to compare it to "celebrity" stuff, don't bother, it's too small for that fight. But if you want to see what carat variations are out there among the wealthy go to the Hollywood Reporter site and look for Dec. 17th, 2011 - "How Britney Spears' 3.5-Carat Engagement Ring Stacks Up To Beyonce, Katy Perry, Mariah Carey, and Christina Aguilera's". Brit's 3.5 carats was considered very conservative. On Nov. 11, 2013, People magazine had an item in their "Scoop" section stating Lauren Conrad's engagement ring was 1.5 carats, Katie Couric's 2, Kaley Cuoco's 2.5, Hayden Panetiere's 6, Ciara's 15 and Kim Kardashian's 15.And this ring for sale here is 2.75 carats. Works for me.I ordered this ring from Eve's Addiction on November 20, and it got to me by the 23rd, so that was prompt.

Deceptively generous - this bag looks relatively small due to its shape, but it is deep. I recently traveled with it and could get my iPad in there along with a lot of other goodies (makeup bag, 3 pairs of glasses, a paperback, etc) and still zip it nicely.Appearance-wise, I like a structured bag that can stand up on its own, but hate a boxy profile- this bag answered those issues by being semi-cylindrical and firm. The faux croc is decent with no shininess that screams fake. The grey I got has enough shading in color to go with various grey shoes and boots I own. Too often, Relic's bags have the brand name or a huge "R" plastered all over them, but this one has only tiny "R" marks on the rivets at the bottom of the handles where they attach to the bag, and the name itself is on the thin side of the buckles so you have to look for it. I was really glad, because so often I like Relic stuff but reject it for the over-branding.Functionally, there are two inner pockets, both on interior walls, one zips open/shut, the other might hold a small phone and is an open pouch. There is also one small exterior pocket between the handles. Only the inner zippered pocket has any size to it, but all will allow you to segregate small stuff that could get lost at the bottom of a bag. The liner in mine is a rich brown satin-finish fabric with a repeating "R" insignia that is not overwhelming.The handle drop from the top of the handles to the top of the bag is about 9 1/2 inches. I have a pretty big upper arm and had no issues with having to squeeze it on, even over a heavy coat.I had a department store coupon plus found this on sale and jumped on it, because I'd been admiring it from afar for a few weeks. Really glad to have gotten it for the looks, function and ability to match with a lot of stuff. Definitely recommend.

Our family has been trying different sweeteners, and this was one in our trials.  We liked it and will repurchase.As much as we have liked Splenda powder, it comes along with dextrose and maltodextrin - the actual sweet stuff you want - sucralose - is the last ingredient, and we thought we could do without the filler, except for some baking.These tablets have a base of plant cellulose to carry the stevia, so unlike bulk stevia powders there's hardly any filler.  We make a lot of big pitchers of cold drinks for the fridge, and this stuff dissolves nicely with a little stirring, and even faster in hot drinks.  It does leave a tiny residue at the bottom but it's harmless and not distasteful.The tablets are about the diameter of a standard aspirin and maybe half as thick.  They are not scored, but break easily if you want to scale up or down.  Straight stevia is intense and can leave an aftertaste, but we had no issues like that and liked "the sweet" very much.  If you're looking to get out of the bulky Splenda or Nutrasweet rut, these are very worth a try.

Buying this product represented another attempt on my part to get some fiber into my kitties, and in particular to help our one cat who seems consistently constipated.  The food looks and smells very good to me, but I'm not the one eating it... or not.  None of our four would eat it, even after multiple offerings.We took it to the neighboring park where there's a feral cat colony, certain one of those less well fed felines would appreciate it.  The paper plates were clean the next day, so glad somebody liked it.

Many years ago, I purchased cheap parsley tablets that did an amazing job of neutralizing body odors from your pits to your tush.  Working out, hot days, I always smelled great.  I'd been advised the effect was from the chlorophyll in the parsley, and is why parsley is offered with meals as well- to neutralize breath odor.With that in mind, I bought these, and while chlorophyll might do other great things, it did not do what I was looking for.  It also turned my, uh, by-products a scary green.  I'm finishing this bottle to not waste it, but have since gotten true parsley caplets... and those aren't working either, so the search continues.

If you're like me, you've been around the block on conditioners for curly hair.  Frankly, every time I have found a good one, it disappears after a few years or switches the formula.  I'm hoping this one isn't on the way out too because I can't easily find it in stores now... don't know if that's a manufacturing issue or if it's just that so many people are wearing their hair straight right now that the demand isn't there so stores aren't stocking.Whatever, this conditioner smells nice without lingering, is silky so you can run your fingers through your hair to detangle in the shower, and it leaves my curls shiny and defined.  (The shampoo is good too, but I've found I can use almost any shampoo as long as I chase it with this conditioner.)  There's no "weigh down" effect either.A few years ago Pantene switched their curly conditioner formula and thus began my latest replacement search, and I was thrilled to find this product worked every bit as well for less money.  And speaking of money, I am quite sure this product retails for less than $3 for an 12.6 oz bottle, and I hope to see fairer pricing on this on Amazon soon - better than what I'm paying for my six pack today, about $4/bottle.  Still worth it, but don't play us.

Honey got this for me since my old Sony has been acting up.  This one is noisy, and you can hear the tape and spools rattling around, even with music at moderate levels.  Will be taking it back to Best Buy.

There's a lot of mixed reviews on here, many from about 2010-11 bemoaning receipt of a "fake" curler.  That problem seems to be past now going by most recent reviews.My curler came from vendor "effective shop japan" and I'd say I got the real deal.  The curler itself was an insane $4 and change, while the shipping brought the total up to $21.  It arrived well packaged- the small inner box was packed in another heavier cardboard box with newspaper for padding.  The newspaper was in Japanese, and the mailing stickers on the box indicated shipment from Japan.The white inner box was stylish and looked authentic.  The bag inside held the curler, and another tiny ziplock bag with an extra replacement black silicone pad.  Directions for use were on the inner box, along with a few tips.  The silver curler had an authentic looking Shu Uemura engraving on it and seemed tight and well sprung.  The replacement pad was similarly stamped.Straight to the mirror I went.  I have very fine lashes on deep-set eyes.  In the past my problem with curlers was that they were hard to get in deep and close enough to grasp the lashes at the base, and even when maneuvering as best as possible, at least three attempts per eye were needed to get all the lashes (not just the majority at the center) by doing center, inner, and then outer lashes.This baby was a different story.  It must be how the product is angled away from the face, and the curve of the pad.  I could get the curler right in close to the base of my lashes, and I didn't need to make multiple attempts to get it lined up - before squeezing down, I could see ALL my lashes sticking through the curler.  One gentle, sustained squeeze later, ALL my lashes were curled from corner to corner.  Beautiful!  The other eye went as well.  I did not need to do as suggested, by pulling back and doing a second squeeze at the middle of the lashes, and another at the tips, because one good line up did enough, and very well.One funny bonus... I had stopped using curlers because they were such a hassle, and now that I have one that works simply, and I use it regularly, I can actually SEE better!  I had not realized how much my drooping lashes had been cutting into my field of view.I had really wondered if I was buying into a myth by paying $20 for an eyelash curler that might be got at a drugstore for far less, but I am wondering no more.  Very glad I took a chance and shelled out for this.

If you are desperately searching for something to make an ill or very finicky cat eat, by all means try this in your efforts.  There are other reviews here that say it helped such kitties.Mine are healthy and normal and have decent appetites.  None of our four liked this stuff, which was a bummer because they all get intermittent hairball problems and could use the pumpkin.  I gave this food a 3 star rating because it could be a fine food in its own right, but it was not well received in our house.The chicken is finely stringy and the broth is very watery.  Aesthetics aside, nobody went for it, not even our gravy-lapping monster.  It seemed like they were not tempted to give it a try (after 6 introductions of it), and I wonder if this smells funny to them, because no one was even curious.We're moving on now to the BFF tuna and pumpkin, and will see if that works for our hairball-prone clan.

My hair did not respond well to this product.  It was not shiny at all.  My permed curls were nullified as well, coming out straighter and dry looking.  I have not seen any noticeable "fluffing" to create an illusion of greater volume either.There may be benefits that emerge from use of this product over time, perhaps helping the scalp, or increasing growth.  The problem is whether I can live with lousy looking hair long enough for those benefits to happen. I will try to use it for the bottle's worth and see if anything changes, and will update this review if there are changes... but I am seriously wondering if I can make it that long.

I ripped through this book very fast because it was compelling and well-written.  Harriet (nee Tendler) Bronson has written about her own life, as well as coming to grips with a failing marriage.  Having bought into the "what's good for hubby is good for me" mentality of her time, she puts her career on hold to help build his... only to find that "her turn", as had been agreed upon, never comes, due to her detection of Charlie's infidelity and the end of their marriage.The lady has spunk and spirit, and clearly she wasn't out for revenge.  She talks about her larger life, not dwelling on her hurt or anger.  You enjoy being with her as she gathers her strength to build a new life.  Harriet's a good storyteller, and shrewd observer of human behavior.You appreciate her perspective as well; she was a nice Jewish girl from Philadelphia who took a chance on an evil-looking, monosyllabic guy from the coal regions going to acting school on the GI bill, able to see through his bluntness to the charm and thoughtfulness within.  She alienates much of her family by her choice, moves with him to California, has two children with him, and focuses on helping him hit the big time... only to find out he's begun an affair with Jill Ireland, the then-wife of David McCallum.  Ireland and Bronson would later marry.  Still, Harriet's able to finally absorb and understand what happened, and move on brilliantly.As a sidenote, I feel compelled to mention that I've read and loved both books by Jill Ireland that focus on her battle with cancer and on her family.  Jill, like Harriet, learned to take negatives and make them into learning experiences.  The funny thing is, I have almost no interest in Bronson himself, and just find he had excellent taste in choosing wives who were smart, strong and reflective.  When you finish this book, you want to meet Harriet for coffee and tell her "well done".

The title says it all.  Nobody cared for this toy.  Tossed it, rattled it, only to be met by bored stares.  Little mousies get a better reception than this thing.I'd watched the price on this go waaay up and waaay down.  It's available in pet supply catalogues for under four bucks.  That's still too much.A local pet columnist had this on her list of best pet toys back around Christmas, so between her words and many of the reviews here, there must be something to this toy... but my crew just doesn't see it.

I got a red Asics t-shirt for Christmas. Asics? What's that? Is it a person? I had no idea. But I did know that the shirt was awesome, soft, comfortable, form fitting. So, I bought this one as well. These are literally the best shirts I have owned!

Great game. Not like others out there where you have to purchase coins to keep playing. This one gives you enough to play for a while without having to make any purchases.

I don't understand the science behind it (nor do I care to), but I do understand that this stuff works. Makes almost anything water proof (okay, really, really water resistant). Seriously, do your coat, your tent, your cat, anything!
Good price on an above average router. Good range, no excessive restarts needed. Would recommend to friends. Nothing flashy, but works.
This is an excellent spill kit! At the price too, you can't beat it. The carry case is nicer than I expected and hangs perfectly on the wall. Hoping we never have to use it...

I am always trying to put more muscle on my body and keeping adequate protein in my diet is essential.  These help me with that as they have 11g of protein per can..  They are smoked oysters after all so they are quite smelly.  Otherwise I'd put them in my gym bag for a snack.  I'd probably drive everybody out of the gym.  Same problem for sardines.  Oh well, great for home!I like that they are solid and not mushy.  The smoke flavor isn't over powering and the oysters have a fresh taste (as fresh as a canned product can get).Love them!

Physician's Formula is the only mascara product I've used that doesn't cause my eyes to burn.  It also doesn't flake, and as a contact lens wearer I really appreciate that.  The brush also works for me as I like to use the tip to do each bottom lash individually.  It usually doesn't come out all clumpy and on the few occasions where it does I just dab it on a tissue.  I get a nice clean application every time.  Another thing I like is that is lasts all day until I take it off.  Then it comes off easily without breaking my lashes.  It doesn't hurt that the tube is really pretty and comfortable to hold in the hand.

These pulls are absolutely gorgeous!  I put 26 in my kitchen.  They are a rich deep amber and the color of the pull on Amazon (on my monitor) matches the actual pull.  They are made of glass and easily wipe clean.  The oil rubbed bronze part looks well made and is a very dark bronze.The pulls were a bit long for our cabinets so we went to the hardware store and bought a beveled ring to put on the inside of the cabinet.  They come with two size screws.  They both were too long for our cabinet doors.  The threads and screws are metric.

12 shorts for $24.99 is a great buy.  The product is made in Bangladesh.  I found they fit very snug and if I had the shape of a young girl versus a woman, they would have been a keeper.  I will order the XL to wear as pajama bottoms, but I won't be going out in them.  Other reviewers noted the crotch was just a cross seam.  When I tried them on the crotch seam didn't bother me.  The waist elastic is nice as it isn't too wide to roll, isn't too thin to be cutting or uncomfortable, it's just right.  The colors are bright.  I don't know how colorfast they are in washing or if they shrink even on a low dryer setting.  When I get my next set, if they fade or shrink I'll edit this review.Update:Size: I received my XL order and they are just a little bit larger than the L.  Enough for comfort.  Here are some comparison sizes to give you an idea of what size I wear and that this product required me to buy an XL.  I wear a women's medium, can on occasion wear a juniors size 10 if cut generously, and usually wear a medium in Nike shorts, size 10 Lucky brand jeans, and Levis.Color/Shrinkage:  Anyway, I washed them and the brilliant colors stayed bright with no signs of fading.  I washed the dark colors separately from the light so was able to match the finished size against the unwashed for shrinkage.  I matched 6 and found they were all a bit different in size regardless of having been washed or not.  So I'm uncertain if I had shrinkage.  At least there isn't a dramatic difference.  I washed them on cold wash/cold rinse and dried them in an electric dryer set on the "low/less dry" setting selected.  So when finished they were just slightly damp.  I did this in case drying them made them shrink a lot.  I really don't want to hang them as I already hang so many clothes.Final stars:  I left it at 5 stars since the price is so good, they mostly fit, I'm just using them for PJ bottoms and maybe under short skirts.  Happy to have found the product.

We bought this charging station to replace a 12" x 6" power strip in our entryway.  The Anker looks so much better than the power strip!  It also gave us more usable space to clutter up with keys, wallet, etc.In going to buy another one for the kitchen so I can plug in my tablet and phone if I need to.

I got the bright green color which is so pretty.I purchased the pad to protect my knees from hard tile flooring while organizing bottom cabinets.  So nice!  It worked so well that I keep it under the kitchen sink now, just to have it handy when retrieving items from the back of my newly organized cabinets.It's also great for protecting the knees when spot cleaning tiles from spills.

I loved the bra, I just didn't like the seams and it ran a bit large.  From the moment I tried it on the seams were poking me.  Maybe I'm overly sensitive right now and it wouldn't bother most people.

This is so good and I love that it is organic.  To increase the protein I sometimes add wild caught tuna, no preservative all natural hot dogs, or pea protein powder (adjusting more liquid into the mix).

I put this light in the laundry room outlet so when I walk in with arms full of laundry the light comes on for me.  Very nice!It isn't bright enough to do laundry by, but does let me see where I'm going until I can put the laundry down and turn on the normal light.

Update: 7 months and still going strong!  I still remove this cover daily and it remains flexible and with no signs of splitting at the corners.  The clear plastic remains quite clear with no unsightly scratches.  Very happy with this cover!I have this same case in black on my Note 3. I never plug my phone in, instead I take off the cover and back of the phone to swap out the battery.  Taking off the cover requires pushing a corner hard off the edge of the phone.  Some covers don't hold up and split.  This cover has remained flexible and retained a perfect fit.I also like that it has a slight grip feel to it so it doesn't want to slip out of my hand.

Hmm… this was a waste of 4.99 and not a romance at all. The book doesn’t have an ending so the cover saying it’s a complete novel is a lie in my opinion. I can get down with some captive romances but this just didn’t work at all and you end up not really liking anyone.
Virgin alpha hero.... need I say more?
I really enjoyed this. Quick, dirty and had a plot. A good read before bed that didn't such a ton of time. Definitely will read the next....and the hero was not a big wh0re like most MC books.

Loved how fast the hero fell for the heroine and that there was no other women drama but the book ended out of nowhere and the hero was a jerk a lot of the book. Sometimes is was funny but it just made me mad the heroine would end up being okay with it.
Virgin hero! I always love those. This one really pulls on your heart strings and you can't help but love him so much. He doesn't even know what sex is! It's cute.

God I loved the hero in the book! He was sooooo freaking sweet and good with the heroine and her issues. He is truly swoon worthy. He was just all around perfect. The stuff he does to get her close to him is adorable.
I loved how the hero handled the heroine. It was cute and funny. I loved even more that while he watched her he wasn't hooking up with other women... he was just waiting for her. *swoons*
I really liked the hero... just a little boring in spots. I went on to buy the next in the series.

The heroines job was a little silly but I didn't care because the hero was perfection. I LOVED that he wasn't with another women after meeting her and all the stuff he did to get her.I hope there is more from this series but I'm worried the other books may not be safe since it looks like some of the couples might have known each other already for years. So it's likely they've been with other people but I'm crossing my fingers that's not the case.
